review_body: We have just spent 3 nights at Marina Bay Sands. It’s like a city within a city. People people people. Rude people, ignorant people, some courteous people, and a few smiles from staff.The rooms are OK. The bed is hard! Bathrooms are clean and well stocked. The internet in the room and hotel is woeful!! Constantly drops out.The top deck pool is unique and easy to get a lounge. Just beware the photographer in the pool......they want from S$140 up......The food in the restaurants is quite good, coffee is excessively expensive and drinks are even worse. Forget about the Sands Rewards as it is a pain in the arse to register and then they want your passport to pick up the card!!!
hotelName:
0    Marina Bay Sands
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with family in June, and had a nice stay. The hotel is large, consisting of three towers with over 40 floors in each, so the number of guests is very high. Most of the facilities have been designed for these numbers, so things worked mostly OK.This is a nice luxury hotel, but most of the (very high) price of stay is for the infinity polls on the roof of the hotel, and the views to Singapore and views/access to the Marina Bay gardens. For those things one could pay that money (once), but for other (or longer) stays there are better luxury options in Singapore, and for (far?) less money. Rooms higher up are more expensive, and rooms lower are less expensive.Rooms are nice and modern, with the kind of decoration and facilities you would expect from a 5-star hotel (see some comments on this later though...)Breakfast can be had in any of 3 restaurants. We got in right away, but it seemed that this restaurant had prepared for having people queue to get to breakfast (signs or indicating waiting times like 12 minutes.) The breakfast options were quite good, what one would expect.Access to the pools and the bar/observation deck is controlled by swipe cards. We went swimming in the pools, and also took some selfies and other photos (as did most of the crowd in the pools: very few were there for swimming/relaxing.)The hotel is connected to the neighboring upscale shopping mall, with lots of luxury stores, as well as restaurants and a food court. The food court is with normal Singapore pricing, but it was very full and the problem was finding a vacant table. The other restaurants there are a bit more expensive, but not too much so.The Marina Bay gardens are right next to the hotel, with a 5+ minute walk to the central areas with the artificial trees. They looked nice also in the evening from the room window. The views also otherwise are interesting: sea, cargo ships, possibly cruise ship or two, and some of the suburbs to the east.Some things to whine about:Getting to the hotel with MRT on the (not yet complete) circle line requires a train change at Promenade, as (most, all?) trains on that line continue to Dhoby Ghaut. A small nuisance (which may disappear when the circle line will be completed in the future.) Also the downtown line has a station at the hotel/mall, thus giving more direct access.We could not adjust the room temperature, except by turning off the air-conditioning completely (and keeping the balcony door ajar). With aircon on the temperature did not get higher than 21.5 C no matter what the setting was, 24 C or 27 C. There was a sign on the wall telling that temperature change will take time. But several hours was not enough. (And in other hotels temperature would change in 1 or 2 hours at the latest.) 20 C is too cold, and we prefer a bit more than 22 C.In a luxury hotel one would expect a bidet or a fancy toilet seat with washing features. Did not exist here, which is unusual for a high-end hotel. The hotel should fix this for all rooms.
hotelName:
0    Marina Bay Sands
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our Group of 7 paid a visit to the bar at the top of Marina Bay Sands. The view is undoubtedly spectacular! Although each ticket holder was given $20 to spend at the bar, after purchasing 3 cocktails, 1 whiskey and 3 bowls of fries. We were still out of pocket $70! You can view the pool from the bar and be tantalised by the fact you can’t enter. We did not pay extra for the viewing platform and am not unhappy we didn’t! I’m not sure the view is that much better?! Definitely worth a visit!! Grab a drink and soak up the scenery, you’ll feel like you’re on top of the world!
hotelName:
0    Marina Bay Sands
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For the best that singapore hotel can offer, it does live up to its standard. Its got great view and big space, view is amazing however, they restrict your entry for infinity pool for not more than what amount of access cards you hold. With it being this expensive to live here and limitation to accessibility. i think its not very worth unless your budget is high.
hotelName:
0    Marina Bay Sands
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I guess everything has been said in the earlier reviews already. The hotel is located a bit outside the actual "hotspot" in Singapore (but all the shopping destinations etc. are still within walking distance), but the hotel itself is full of all kinds of experiences, the world-famous infinity pool being the highlight for us. The rooms were flawless in all regards.The staff really goes the extra mile to make sure that you as a customer are happy. We even got a complimentary upgrade to a bigger room and a nice chocolate cake served in our room since we had an anniversary.This isn't the most budget-friendly accomodation in Singapore, but as a once-in-a-lifetime experience it was really great. We were staying for just one night when travelling from Batam (Indonesia) to Johor Bahru (Malaysia) through Singapore.
hotelName:
0    Marina Bay Sands
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my 4th time staying at MBS and I always enjoyed it. I always request high floor 11th floor up facing the gardens. This time my family got room 3116. When you are going to the infinity pool make sure to catch sunrise and sunset (wait for the buildings to open their lights up). The pool gets crowded at peak hours like 5-8pm so i advise to go early. Free towels are provided and you can bring it back to your rooms.There’s a free observation deck visit on your stay so make sure to use them. There’s a pamphlet that they will give during the check in explore everything on it for free. There are lots of restaurants to choose from within the hotel and nearby.There’s an Express check out and it saves your time! A deposit fee of S$200 is required upon check in on top if your room fees. Check in is smooth with little nuisances because a trainee staff assisted by a senior processed my check in. What I don’t like. The quality of the water in the pool. It’s just me, Because imagine lots of people are in and out of it. The lavatory in the rooms is shallow that when you open the faucet the water will be all over the place because of the strong flow.All in all its a wonderful tourist experience. Having your beer while watching the sunset from the infinity pool and enjoying the views of the skyline.
hotelName:
0    Marina Bay Sands
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived here at dawn hours after a major flight delay. The door was closed but after making some noise someone came out to open the door for us. The staff recognized us as the last customer to check in for that day and immediately check us in for us to rest. The beds were small but doable I guess. The room was good size with a nice size bathroom. We got two usb charging ports by the bed, but the charge for an iPhone was super slow. So a plug in outlet for the charge would be better. Anyways, the rooftop pool was neat. They have a supply of towels and free water bottles to drink. Also, there was a small whirlpool but it was under maintenance when we went. The housekeeping was on top of things, they were there at 9am in the morning to start cleaning. Though I wish they would stock more towels, still they clean our rooms daily. The checkout process was smooth and released our $200 deposit right away. The location was perfect. We basically walk to the places we wanted to visit. Bus and MTR stations nearby. 7-11 and a food court downstairs. We will definitely stay here again if we visit Singapore again.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Would highly recommend this hotel! Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of June. The location was central (right beside an MRT station as well as within walking distance to other places). The staff were all very accommodating and gave us advice whenever it was needed. As well as this, they would always top up the rooms with bottles of water, which were extremely helpful when walking about in the heat. Thank you for a great stay!
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in early June and early July for a couple of days each time as stop overs between Australia and Europe. Thoroughly enjoyed the hotel - location good for getting around via public transport, quite a bit within easy walking distance, amenities as advertised, staff friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is all the things that the previous reviews have said. Good location, clean, comfortable nice breakfast. The staff are very professional and helpful and even recommended one of the best Japanese restaurants we have ever been too just around the corner. My only hesitation on a 5 star review is lack of late departure facilities. We had to shower in the pool bathrooms and there is just not enough room to do this, access to a departure room for an hour would have been much better.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice and quite hotel, located in good neighborhood and easy to access metros to get around. Rooms are pretty small but it wasn't any problem for us, they have small pool on rooftop and small gym hat you can chill off or workout a bit.We will stay there again in case to visit singapore again.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've inspected a great deal of articles about Dubai, which says that the spot is splendid and I given it a chance to out. This nation is reach in culture and has shrouded pearls. We remained for a couple of evening times in 30 Bencoolen and we were satisfied by all the association's exertion in making our stay additional astounding. We welcome the pool confronting the straight such a decent view and releasing up then. Our room was all around lit and to an incredible degree pleasing, venerate it! In what limit may I confine remaining in this radiant inn? We were vivacious and fulfilled visitors.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel, very helpful staff, great location, excellent value for money. Would be lovely to have a lounge downstairs in the evenings, otherwise, it was excellent. The reception staff were especially helpful with everything.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The stay at the hotel cost me an extra $700.While the location of the hotel is fine and the design is great, the hotel staff do not have the proper training to return forgotten things in the room.I wear retainers, and if you do as well, you know that you can have them only in two places: either in a cup by the sink or in a retainer box.You can't really misplace them, cause they are relatively fragile and expensive.Yes, it was my fault for leaving the retainers in a cup by the sink, but the cleaning staff needed to realize that this belongs to the hotel guest.I came back to the hotel after a few hours, but everything was cleaned up and cleaners "didn't find anything".Well, next day i had to go for the replacement and had to pay 700 dollars for them.I wonder if this could have happened in a better hotel. I would urge people to reconsider staying at this hotel.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is excellent with access to 2 MRT lines and 2 bus stops within steps from front door. Close to shopping and Chinatown.Room was nice especially the terrace. Staff were helpful, breakfast was good. Pool deck is lovely but busy. Cons: strange light switches, fridge that was not cold and could not be adjusted and slowish lifts. Overall these things were minor and wouldn’t stop me staying again.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a pretty no-nonsense hotel. It is as everyone notes in a great spot, so for that alone I'd recommend going there - it's kind of halfway between the Orchard Rd shopping stuff and the marina/ Clarke Quay areas.The room is very neat, minimalist and functional. We had everything we needed, including a kettle and tea but not much more. Bathroom is pretty small so best to take turns. We got the balcony room - there's no view really and it's too hot to spend much time out there but would do it again as it adds a little sense of space to the room. The pool on the roof is small but quite lovely, a good view and not many chairs but we found we usually got one. The 7-11 next door does make up for the lack of a bar up there, just get yourself some drinks and chips and off you go... Breakfast totally fine for us but not a full big hotel spread. There is, most importantly perhaps, a Din Tai Fung around the corner. Mmmm, dumplings.So it is not an exciting hotel but there's also nothing upsetting about it and it's not badly priced. Only complaint at all isn't really their fault as most Asian hotels do it - but putting the full price of your room on hold, then charging you again for the final bill - the pending charges take a week to 10 days to clear, which affects your balance on a debit card (or a credit card you may have run rather close to the limit...) But otherwise, a perfectly nice place to stay and we'll probably be back.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What can I say. This hotel has everything. Check in process was smooth and we were escorted to our room on the 10th floor, a king deluxe room. The room was small although we expected this given it was a city hotel. However, the room was well arranged to allow us to hide our suitcases and make the most of the limited space. Room was tastefully decorated and immaculately clean. Room was cleaned regularly while we were having breakfast (which by the way was excellent, extensive and tasty). It was really nice to come back upstairs after breakfast to a cleaned room which was only left vacant for around 30mins for breakfast. Room service was very very speedy when asking for things like extra towels and an iron. The hotel is excellently located, under 2 minutes walk to Bencoolen and Bras Basah stations, and a 5 min walk to Dhoby Ghat Station. This means that with the excellent transport links Singapore offer, you rarely will need to interchange to go anywhere. It is also close to some bus stops. 5-7min from Orchard Road and Plaza Singapura. Hotel also had an excellent rooftop pool and Jacuzzi which we wish we had made more use of. No complaints whatsoever with this hotel, highly recommended and would always book again. I read somewhere that this was a 3 star hotel, it is better than most 5 star hotels i've stayed in.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first trip to Singapore and we chose to stay 7 nights at 30 Bencoolen in a Junior suite....and we're glad we did. The location is perfect, in fact we walked to many places. Raffles and Cjimes are literally just around the corner. MRT only steps away. So easy to get around this wonderful clean city. Our room was spacious and had 2 bathrooms which was great. We also utilized the guest laundry facilities which is situated on the same floor as the Gym. $8 SGD per wash and the same if you wish to dry your load (we dried ours in our room).The pool is clean, but refreshing! Sadly, we only used it once as we were busy exploring.Our son also loved the skatepark at Somerset. A great free activity (he had his skateboard from home) and we spent several (hot) hours there. It took us around 20 mins to walk there from the hotel.Orchard rd is also a short stroll away.Breakfast was sufficient and the cappuccino machine was great. Breakfast staff were friendly and helpful. A special thanks to Honey ad Neetha on reception who were super pleasant and extremely helpful!Room and hotel overall was very clean and I totally would recommend 30 Bencoolen for your Singapore holiday. It is reasonably priced, compared to others and we will most definitely stay there again when we return to Singapore.Thanks 30 Bencoolen for making our Singapore break a great one!
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a very friendly, contemporary, modern and very well located hotel, close to everything.The rooms are not very large, they are very comfortable and very clean. Good restaurant and bar.The staff is very friendly and professional.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is at a super convenient location -- directly outside an MRT. Clean rooms and breakfast had a nice variety of local food. The ample sized pool and jacuzzi was a nice respite from the heat! Staff were very pleasant and always around with a nice greeting and helping to open the door.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in 30 Bencoolen for 2 nights with my parents and kids and we are very satisfied with its facilities, conveniences and staffs' excellent services. The staffs there are very friendly and offered great support during our stay. We will definitely stay here again if we have chance and will recommend the hotel to everyone who travel to Singapore.Thank you all staffs of 30 Bencoolen!
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for about two weeks in a Deluxe King room. It was a thoughtfully put together room, with spacious and convenient storage areas so that I could stash away luggage and clothing unobtrusively keeping the room uncluttered. The room also included a mini-fridge, kettle with coffee/tea and safe all easily accessible, but "hidden" so you can move unhindered around the room. A really good use of space.The bathroom facilites are flawless; all the amenities are modern and top notch.Wifi was speedy and without problems, and there are numerous, conveniently placed power outlets, and even USB chargers available. Copious desk space as well to lay out laptop, shopping etc.The breakfast selection is decent, with good variety. Always a plus as it allows you to get a head start on your daily activities.The location is itself fantastic, a really great base for exploring the city either on foot, or further afield via the MRT. It's about a minute from the MRT Station on the Downtown line which connects to Bayfront, Downtown, Chinatown and other stops of interest. Also about 5-10 minutes away from the Dhoby Ghout MRT station on the NE line. Within easy walking distance is the National Museum, Fort Canning,(the Battlebox Museum tour is quite interesting) and even Clark Quay via an overpass from Fort Canning. All the staff were I interacted with during my stay were exceptional, from the cleaning ladies to the front desk and restaurant. Really professional, pleasant and genuinely friendly.All in all, a great place to say at a reasonable price.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check-in was great - except the Stopover Bus dropped us at the wrong hotel (similar name) but quickly sorted. Reception staff were excellent in every encounter - this is the only reason I'm not giving this place a "poor" rating. Rooms are tight as always in Singapore - but asked about a luggage rack and there isn't one. So put your case on the floor and you suddenly restrict your ability to move around. Room amenities were all as expected for the price. Shower was one of those that washed the bathroom floor as well ..After 28 days of travel, this was the second worst breakfast we encountered (the other in Namibia - so really no comparison). No egg station & eggs in the warmer were luke warm & rubbery. Bacon was also only tepid. Cereal selection a huge fail - no muesli or anything not filled with sugar. Asked for decaf coffee where elsewhere was given a sachet & hot water - "not available" was the response here.Location is great & I was using this stopover to gauge if this was the right place for my husband & I next year. A good breakfast is a must for us and tepid meat is a disaster waiting to happen so the answer is no.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a week with my husband, mother and 3 year old. Can't commend the front office staff enough for their kindness and attentiveness during our stay. From allowing early access to our rooms after an overnight flight, to going out of their way to personalise service throughout our stay, management of this hotel should be very proud of their team. Great pool area we used every day with our little water baby, nice serviceable and clean rooms and a fantastic location close to the MRT. We were in walking distance of several amazing hawkers centres as well as big ticket tourist locations like Gardens By the Bay, Orchard Road etc. Definitely recommend this hotel for its affordability and quality. Special thankyou to Honey for going above and beyond. Traveling with a 3 year old isn't always easy but the hotel certainly helped ease the way. Only slight issue would be that the water pressure in the shower was a little low and the amount for deposit was a little surprising but no issue, had my credit card there, just waiting for the refund to come through. Thanks for a great stay!!
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location! Bencoolen MRT is right next door. Hotel is also very near the National Museum, and is walking distance to Chijmes and Orchard Road. Rooms are spacious and clean, with terrace. Staff is very friendly and attentive. They have a good breakfast buffet in the hotel. There is also a nearby food court and convenience store. Wifi connectivity is strong. Enjoyed my stay here and will definitely return.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We didn't get to the hotel until after midnight, but were met with smiling faces. The room was clean and very quiet, although the bed was not comfortable (too hard for us). The location was great, we walked to a lot of places (Bugis Mall, Little India, etc). The MRT is right by the hotel, which makes for easy transport all over the city. We didn't enjoy the breakfast buffet, but there are plenty of other options near by. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1st time to Singapore so have no base to compare it with but the hotel was clean, room was very suitable for a family with 2 kids & the location seemed central to just about everything. Couldn't fault the staff, the breakfast was good, pool was nice & the rooms were quiet so no issues sleeping.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is good and just 1 Min. to subway.Room is small but clean. But the hotel will be locked after midnight so you only can use room key to get into hotel . I really don’t know how the people to check in after midnight.Staff are friendly and helpful before midnight ! Cheap and Good! If the price is up, it is not worth it.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was a little dubious of this hotel from the reviews, however we thought it was nice. Yes the room isn’t the most spacious but more than ample room for 2 larges suitcases. Bed was comfortable and shower was good. Pool area only had a handful of beds but was always quiet when we were up there. The downside is the breakfast. It was ‘adequate’, barely. There may be a variety of choice, but nothing that would be a good choice. Ended up with toast and jam. Would still recommend, just don’t count on breakfast.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all, the front desk and lobby staff were perfect, always friendly and helpful and personable, on every shift, night or day. (perhaps even better than the 5 star Marriott Tang hotel).This complement about the staff includes the cafe/bar staff, and the housekeeping staff for the room. They made you feel very happy about staying there.The hotel appears very new, and is hi-tech (for example, they have an app that tells them when you turn on the "make-up room" sign). The rooftop pool is excellent, and with great views due to the acrylic paneling that lets you see through the top floor railing. The price value was excellent, especially for Singapore, and the hotel was perfectly located for easy food, taxi, MRT, bus, tourism.The room and bathroom design were very well done, and very comfortable, making it all feel bigger that it was. The bedding was great and we slept well. The showerhead and water temperature/pressure were excellent. Really liked having a mini-fridge in the room, instead of a mini-bar.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There is nothing particularly wrong with the hotel. The rooms aren't great for the price paid (some basics such as moisturising cream are expected at this price tag) and the service leaves room for improvement.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed three nights at 30 Bencoolen and the hotel exceeded all expectations. The staff are friendly helpful and welcoming. The rooms are clean comfortable and quiet. We used the gym and although small adequate to maintain a training regime. The rooftop pool is just perfect and after a day in the Singapore humidity, a god send. We also had breakfast included and the range and tasty foods were great. Singapore has such an efficient and easy train network, from the airport you need only jump on the downtown (blue) line and the Bencoolen station is opposite the hotel. On our checkout day they stored our bags and provided access to the pool and changing areas late into the afternoon so we could freshen up before heading to airport.... we will definitely recommend and stay there again. Fantastic!!
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent five nights there with my father on a family trip. We had a spacious double bed room with enough space. The room was clean and the AC not too loud so it was usable at night.The location is really great as two metro stations are just around the corner. Within 15-20min you can make it to China Town, Marina Bay or even Bayfront. Fort Canning and some historical buildings can be reached by feed. If you don’t want to book the hotel breakfast (which offers a wide choice of Western and Asian food), restaurants with a good breakfast are just next to it.The pool on the roof is great when the temperature is climbing over 32 degrees Celsius. The staff was always friendly and helpful. We left our luggage in the hotel after check out as we had a very late flight. When picking up the luggage we even could take a shower at the pool to refresh after the heat of the day.To sum it up: Great stay and would be our choice again.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a night between international flights - the hotel and staff were fantastic. Able to check in early and for a small additional fee we arranged a late check out at 6pm - which was a god send when travelling. Breakfast was tasty and again the staff serving were really nice. Will stay again - great value for money.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 19th-26th April. This hotel was lovely, clean and staff very helpful. We had a room with a balcony but probably a bit of a waste as when it rains there is no cover so you cannot sit outside but was still nice to open door for fresh air. The only thing I would say was not good is there is only one draw to put clothes in as the other one has the safe in it so we just kept clothes in our case. We did try to order poached eggs for breakfast but they didn't understand us, other than that this is a great hotel in a perfect location with train and bus stops very close, great restaurants around it also.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Location is perfect. Right next to Bencoolen MRT station, 7-11 next door and a few places to eat and drink on your doorstep. Rooms and public areas always clean but you barely notice the staff. All staff we did encounter were great. Breakfast selection is decent and will set you up for a day of exploring SIN. $30 dollars to the hotel from airport journey time is around 25-30 mins. MRT would also be fine if you were on a budget and was only a few dollars each for a single trip. Rooftop pool is excellent and great for an afternoon dip to cool down. Gym and Laundry on level 5 were also great facilities to have. $8 for washer and $8 for drying. Saved travelling home and having to do it all.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had an enjoyable stay at 30 Bencoolen.The only gripe I have is the breakfast needs improvement. All in all the stay was very enjoyable. We chose a room with a balcony so I could have the door open which was very nice.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is lovely. Everything is clean and organized. Check-in was simple. The rooms are comfortable. The pool is lovely. The breakfast is great. The staff are friendly and accommodating. The location is great close to some museums and two different MRT stops. There is a food court just down the street on the corner and a Din Tai Fung around the corner. The price was right.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed two days berore or cruise ship left for a tour of Asia. Centerally located in Singapore for about $150 U.S. per night while most hotels in this area charged two to three times as much. It is rated 4.5 stars by those who stay there and it is an excellent, modern, and very clean hotel. They have very high standards for cleanliness and it is a high crime to litter in any public area. In addition, it is illegal to buy or sell gum in Singapore so not black spots on the sidewalks or pavement. It is also near several local hawker centers (think food court). Went out about 5 AM to get coffee and found most restaurants and coffee shops closed but an adjacent 7-11 covenience store was open 24/7. Even at this early hour, I felt very safe on the streets. You will probably save a lot, if you use this hotel.Everyone we saw dressed very well and probably better than most Americans. I was very impressed with this city and its people.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights, check in check out was smooth and quick. Nice new hotel with comfy bed and plenty of room. Only feedback is if 3 people staying in the room, please provide 3 sets of towels, toothbrush and bottles of drinking water as only 2 were provided most of the time. Also tissue paper were never filled up when box is empty. Price also a bit pricey compared to what I paid at a 4 star hotel a few days after.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family of four stayed for 7 nights over the Easter period. I cannot fault this modern, pristine hotel, its facilities, or the service. We checked in at 3am and despite the hour the service was professional and efficient. The location is prime, and it’s close to many eateries. The buffet breakfast was varied and the food from the restaurant delicious! My only recommendation to the management (although it doesn’t take away from the rating) is to make the kids menu available for room service.The pool was an absolute relief after a day out exploring. Laundry, Gym -all good! Well done and THANK YOU to all the staff! For a fabulous stay!
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable room and convenient location! All Staffs (inclusive of restaurant & Bell boys) were friendly and helpful. Definitely will recommend local or overseas friends .This hotel always my first choice selection.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the family room, double and a twin connecting rooms and it was spacious and comfortable. The rooms were quiet but just lacked a bit of warmth. They could do with a few pictures on the walls to give it some life, otherwise it is a great three star hotel. It is close to cheap food eats as well as the subway. A taxicab is inexpensive from the airport and cost around 16SGD. Breakfast was good with a lot to choose from and was free if you are a member, so it does pay to ask.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 3 nights with family. Location of the Hotel is excellent with an MRT station just opposite the hotel and quite a few places around to grab something to eat as well as a 7/11 close-by. Rooms are small but above average compared to other hotels in Singapore. Rooms were clean and were stocked with all the required amenities. Bed was comfortable. Wifi in the hotel premises was really good with great connectivity and speed. Staff were courteous and friendly. Overall we had a great stay and have no issues recommending 30 Bencoolen for your stay in Singapore as you get good value for money.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was very average, only complaint really was the cleaning on day 2 was not very thorough and our view was literally of an air con unit. The rooms are very compact but functional, probably not practical with a family but fine for a couple or on your own. The pool on the roof is nice. We really liked the location with lots of good restaurants and activities nearby.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a few days on a business trip.Rooms are quite small, however perfectly fine, clean and tidy, everything worked as expected.Buffet breakfast was good, woth a good selection of Western and Local options.Dinner was a bit hit and miss, ate here twice, one meal was good, one not so, although to be fair to the staff they did not charge for the second.Taxi rank just over the road at to the right, which is fairly well serviced.Also plenty of food options close by
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited Singapore on business and stayed for the weekend.Chose Bencoolen Hotel due to it's convenient downtown location.There's an MRT (metro) station outside the hotel.The National Museum of Singapore is 5 minutes walk.Behind the museum is Fort Canning Park.And behind that is Clarke Quay (bars & restaurants).The hotel itself is modern, clean.The rooms have comfortable beds and are quiet for a good night's rest.Breakfast is acceptable.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed with the 30 Bencoolen when it was the Bayview. The revamp they have undertaken has worked wonders. The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. Breakfast is comprehensive and what a change to have bacon (albeit american style)
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve been traveling to Singapore on business for quite a few years now. I’ve finally settled on this hotel & made it my regular. It’s new, affordable, not too small (the shower is double size), good bed, 2 MRT stations on the doorstep, and a Food Republic & 7 11 next door.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We appreciated the location of the hotel.It is very close to 2 subway stations (Bencoolen and Bras Basah) and near Dhoby Gaut. The reception was very friendly and efficient. The rooms are modern but on the small side as were the twin beds. We had a generous breakfast buffet included in our rate.There is a Food Republic, Din Tai Fung and a Starbucks located around the corner.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I spent 7 nights at 30 Bencoolen and highly recommend it. The room was clean and well equipped, the staff was extremely friendly, helpful and was able to assist us in all our needs, including helping on Shabbat. The location is just great, next to MRT and buses, a National Museum is right next to it , as well as the park.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It has a great location. A soon as you step out of the subway its there.There is a food court right next to it as well.The pool area could be a bit better, but its clean and nice.Its in the vicinity of university so a lot of young people and food shops.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 2days on the way to Bali.My room was immaculate with a large comfort bed, great view and wonderful hot shower,easy to get around city.Breakfast was included and staff were most helpful in accessing a cab for my ride to the airport transfer.RegardIvonne
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern and stylish hotel with very good location close to center of the city. Location close to two MTR-stations was fine. Short walk almost to anywhere. Rooms are clean and well taken care of. Bathroom is good. Pool on the roof was excellent. Small gym was good. Self-service laundry was easy to use. Staff is very friendly and polite. Breakfast was mostly Asian style, but quite plentiful.The room should need more closet space and stand for the luggage.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel has been quite recently fully renovated. Rooms are quite spacious with Singapore standards and clean. Good firm beds. Small but empty minibar/fridge. Basic ameneties. Towels could be better. Basic english/continental/asian style breakfast which is pretty much the same every day with small asian part variations. Not so good coffee from coffee machines. Pool area is ok with too few sun beds. Jacuzzi next to pool worked only once and was a bit dirty. We did not find separate pool towels anywhere so bring your own from the room. Pool is otherwise ok. Very tiny gym. Minimally equipped. Restaurant (same where breakfast is served) service average compared to what you can find close by. Therefore restaurant almost always totally empty during evening. Reception service very good. Location excellent due to being next to Bras Basah and Bencoolen MRT stations. Both within 100m walk. Good wifi at least in 8th floor. Overall quality is excellent when you consider price per night in the same area. I fully recommend this hotel with background of staying in wide range of different price range hotels from luxury to budget.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 30 Bencoolen is in a great, central location on a lovely tree lined street. There is an MRT station across the road, dining options nearby, walking distance from several attractions and just down the road from Orchard Rd shopping precinct. It is a great modern design, the rooftop pool is fabulous and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The coffee is great too! We had a late night flight so they were happy to store our bags, which we had access to at any time and we were able to use the pool and shower facilities up until we needed to leave for the airport. The only thing that you could do to improve my stay was supply robes in the room. Overall a wonderful hotel which I would definitely stay at again!
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a two-night visit to Singapore. It’s a really nice and very new hotel. Very well decorated. The rooms are small but plenty of room for a short stay. Very nice bathroom. We used the pool once which was great. The breakfast is tasty and sets you up for the day. It’s in a really convenient location near two MRT stations. The best thing about the hotel was how accommodating they were. They allowed us early check in to our room, which was really great after we arrived in the morning on no sleep after a long flight. They also gave us late check out and stored our luggage until we left for our onward flight. I took a while trying to decide between a lot of similar priced hotels but very glad we picked 30 Bencoolen.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was beautifully renovated, staff were extremely helpful from a tourist perspective and always polite. Food in the restaurant was amazing. Roof top pool was a nice refreshing end to a hot day. Rooms were a nice size with lovely bathrooms.Very happy and would stay again happily.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have just spent 11 days at 30 Bencoolen and honestly could not fault anything. Room was impeccably clean and spacious. Towels and bins were done daily and the beds made. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast covered all tastes and the rooftop pool was fantastic. 30 Bencoolen is central and a 2 minute walk to the MRT and also a taxi rank across the road. Raffles is within walking distance as well as food outlets, restaurants and shopping centres. I would have no hesitation staying there again.
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Take advantage of my days of research of accommodation in Singapore, this hotel is in a prime location, minutes walk from the MRT. The rooms are modern and well equipped, staff are fantastic, the roof top pool is a definite bonus after a long day of site seeing, can’t wait to return,. Breakfast was a feast of western and Asian flavors and nothing was too much trouble,
hotelName:
1    30 Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had to cancel our holiday 18hrs before travel on medical instructions. Despite all 4 hotels on our trip having the same booking conditions, 3 of them immediately refunded our money due to the exceptional nature of the cancellation. This hotel however, demanded to see personal medical documents to prove our case and then completely disregarded them. We felt humiliated having to provide such private information to a hotel which didn't need them and their subsequent attitude was completely dismissive. We even asked, not unreasonably, if they could issue a credit to enable us to rebook at a later date, but they still said no. To a chain as big as the Holiday Inn this refund would have been pennies but to us it's a lot of money to lose. A little goodwill here would have gone a long way but they took the opposite path and humiliated us before stubbornly refusing any assistance.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found our stay completely worth it. Since we were 4 of us and staying for a week, we got two connected rooms which were very comfortable. The hotel has got a self service laundromat which was very convenient, considering the Singapore weather. It is located in the Katong neighbourhood which is abundant with eateries of various cuisines. Staying in this part of Singapore will give one a glimpse of the non touristy part of the city, yet conveniently located with respect to the main attractions of Singapore. All the parts of the hotel were sparkling clean and the staff were very prompt.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in katong this hotel is approx 15 minutes from Changi airport. Hotel reception is on 7th floor. Rooms are small but very clean and tidy.Average breakfast. It's a basic hotel mainly for short or business stays. No pool. Close to parkway Parade and katong mall where you have outlets like Burger king, KFC and McDonald's.A decent value for money. Rated 3 as some staff are good and some not bothered.Overall a decent stay.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The cleaning can be better, because the bed was not totally clean. The breakfast was okay, the gym was bit to small and unfortunately there is not a swimming pool. The area of the hotel is a nice place.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a week while visiting family and friends in Singapore. Room is smallish but functional which is the aim of the holiday inn express. Good bed and bathroom, only downside is the glass wall of the shower is next to the bed so when the bathroom light is on it lights the whole bedroom! Mini fridge is really mini! Doesn’t fit a lot of things. Usual kettle and iron and ironing board are all provided and the room is neat. Breakfast is not a full buffet range, but there is enough to cater for western and eastern palates.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel but what makes me satisfied to say brilliant is because of an individual stuff with name Ms. Yashani a bit sr.than my daughter.I'm sure she'll be delivering good results, TKS. Murtuza KARIM
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my husband for 7 nights at this lovely reasonably priced hotel. The rooms are not very large but not too small also as reviewed by others. The AC worked very well which is extremely important for me. A free phone and a laundraumat was a nice touch. The power outlets are well designed to take any plug so no need to carry universal adaptor. The location is super with superb eating joints all around, a number of shopping malls and well connected to the entire island with several bus stops all around the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel for a short stay in Singapore.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Second time I've stayed at the express hotel, the other was in Adelaide. I love the cafe breakfast concept and being able to have stir fried rice for breakfast when I wasn't hungover! Room is smallish but sufficient. I prefer to think of it as space conscious and minimalist. Being able to borrow the mobile ph was awesome and a surprise. I've booked for my layover on the way home too...I don't need to pay $600 a nite to be satisfied. Thank you!
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel for an overnight stop in Singapore and were not disappointed. We did not need to be in the city so Katong was not too far from the airport but with a good neighborhood of restaurants and shops. The room was clean and new - well set up and the bed nice and comfortable. Staff were friendly and efficient. Great choice for stopover.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in transit through Singapore Changi airport and through our own poor planning, forgot to book accommodation for the overnight transit. The Changi airport lounges were all full booked but luckily, the airport staff directed us to Holiday Inn Express in Katong, which was a 10-15 minute cab ride from the airport. The staff were extremely helpful on the phone, considering it was 1am in the morning and we told them we would be arriving in 20 minutes at their hotel.They checked us in, without fuss and very friendly front desk staff. Our room was small but had everything we needed to freshen up and have a good nights sleep before our travels the next morning. Breakfast was included the next morning, and the food was standard breakfast buffet. The restaurant was VERY busy as it looked like there was a school trip happening at the same time. However the staff managed the chaos very well, and were very quick to accommodate our requests when we needed something.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room is quite small but clean.Breakfast is nice. Lots of food and drinks.Breakfast is between 6:30am to 10:30am Nice location.Bathroom door is kind of wired.To access to MRT, you have to take a bus.Located next door Katong plaza.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Holiday Inn Express Katong (HIEK) isn't cheap. But it is functional and will meet your basic needs.HIEK is for those travellers who want assurances of a clean room, with availability of the usual hotel services like Wifi, a cafe, laundry services etc.Upon arrival,you will need to take the elevator/lift to the reception/check-in desk. Do not expect porter services. There is none. Expect to queue up before you are served at check-in area. The room is small. There is hardly any space for you to store your luggage. This is not your standard deluxe room in hotels where you can lounge in the room. But, there is in room wifi and a TV, a,common self-service laundry room located on the same floor as the cafe. I paid for a package which included breakfast. The cafe is crowded in the morning peak hours but I found the food served not worth queuing up for. HIEK plus point is its proximity to eating choices i.e. local casual food or Katong 112 Mall which offers air conditioned shopping, eating and banking services. Parkway Parade nearby is much bigger and has a good food court in the basement. There is also much more shopping options here.Stay at this hotel if you want to be in the Eastern part of SGP and you have budget constraints. Otherwise, there are other Holiday Inns to choose from downtown or other options to choose from.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived in Singapore after midnight and had to leave at 10 am the next day. I figured that the price and location would suit our needs. Check in was okay even at 1:30 am but the rooms are tiny! The reception is on Floor 7 which I find extremely odd but what’s even worse - is the breakfast. We went at 9:30 am as recommended but what chaos! I have never seen anything like this at any hotel anywhere in the world!!! It was like a feeding frenzy! Nowhere to sit and there was even a cordoned off area for a group. If we were not so hungry, we would have skipped it. Try and find an alternative for the same price, you’d be much better off for it!
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a lovely stay at this hotel. Small room but it was clean and quiet. Lots of restaurants and pubs to explore nearby. It's close to the seaside and it only takes a few minutes by taxi to East Coast Park. Last but not least, the price is very attractive comparing to those city center hotels.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small but clean room with very comfortable bed - very good value for price. The western breakfast has an excellent selection. The location is in the heart of Katong close to pubs and a variety of excellent restaurants. From the hotel, it's also easy to get to the coast line for a morning run - 8 miles out and back to the financial district.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were friendly and helpful. They provided me with a free breakfast and early check-in, which I appreciate very much. The in-room facilities were clean and adequate. The bed to me was very comfortable. Sound-proof is something that one should note if quietness is of your primary concern. It doesn't have a pool and the gym is small. Eateries are around with so much choice. It's not near the MRT station but is connected by feeder bus.On the whole, it's a very good hotel in particular if you are price conscious.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely Location, clean, friendly staff and beautiful view from the higher floors. Enjoyed the stay. The location is surrounded with many restaurants, pubs and malls. The restaurant is pocket friendly and the breakfast has a good spread.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is beside Katong Square Food. mall. So if you need a place that easy food. accessible then choose this hotel. Its far from MRT access. bus access. is good. Wallk along joo chiat road for night life. Breakfast served in this hotel free but not fancy me
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, fast check in, good buffet breakfast, very comfortable bed, sea view, a very amazing idea to provide a free WiFi phone that the guests can use to have an idea how to plan their days! Definitely coming back!
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Holiday Inn Express hotels are there to provide clean and comfortable rooms and breakfasts at a low to mid range price. Once again IHG have exceeded my expectations. As a Platinum member I was checked in quickly, greeted warmly and professionally, and I appreciated my 16th floor room with a view. The bed was extremely comfortable, the universal plugs very helpful, and the room very clean and comfortable, as well as larger than expected.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To start, this review is basing on the understanding that this is a Holiday Inn Express hotel. My expectations are very basic . However, this hotel exceeded all my expectations during my 1 night staycation. Firstly, hotel is very new . Although basic, the front desk is welcoming enough. Staff are friendly . As I’m an IHG member I was given a high floor with a decent enough view. Room is nice, basic and simple, you get all you need without the luxurious stuff. Breakfast is included, again simple fare but good enough for me. Hotel is conveniently located to some nice restaurants nearby. All in , a very Happy stay.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A pity that I won’t be entitled to the birthday bonus as we stayed for only one night. However, the efficiency of the staff (who kindly accommodated early check in and late check out), cleanliness of the place, simple but tasty breakfast, more than make up for it. This is probably our 4th or 5th stay in 2 years and we’ll definitely be back again. If hotel guests are allowed usage of the pool at Indigo next door, will be a huge bonus.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfectly clean room when checked-in. Room size is ok for a short stay and small family. the breakfast was super compared to the price you are paying in Singapore. Amenities provided were great, especially hand wash and Shower gel, which were in liquid dispensers beside the shower...so basically was unlimited and refilled by housekeeping. The best part was the Juice and Ice cream vending machines in the lobby, very useful in the night time. Katong area is a great area to live, lots of eateries around the hotel, 7/11 and bus stop very close by. I dont know why most people complain about the distance to MRT, its just 2 stops away by Bus 10, 12 or 14. The best part was the pick and go breakfast packs, we would pack some light fruits and muffins after breakfast and eat them as snacks before lunch. Also, one great thing is their water bottle supply, the executives at the reception will happily provide you one or two bottles when leaving the hotel for a city tour. Will I return...ofcourse. Will I recommend...Hell ya !!
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good hotel located just outside of the main central city area. We chose to stay here for the included breakfast. No hotels in the CBD offered breakfast for a similar price. The breakfast was good, variety of hot and cold options. The room is compact but sufficient for our stay. Plenty of power points which was helpful. The location of the hotel was actually pretty good. There is no MRT nearby but there are two bus stops just near the hotel with easy transport into the main city area. We had no issues navigating the public transport systems, they are very efficient. The staff were friendly and offered good recommendations for local restaurants. We would happily stay here again.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location – situated in the east side of Singapore and not near by MRT stations, this property attracts tourists who are looking for something different to do in Singapore. A couple of peranakan / heritage stuff to check out nearby as well as cafes and limited shopping stuff. Also a good choice for short layovers and you need a place to rest but don’t want to be too far from the airport.Price – Your Rate Advanced Purchase @ $112++ ($130) which is only applicable if you are an IHG Rewards Club member. For the targeted promotion of 1 night to Gold, 3,000 bonus points (I have no idea why they called it “birthday bonus”), plus 1,000 additional points for making the booking in-app, it was fair value for what I paid.Check In – Painlessly completed at the main hotel lobby (7th foor) at 3pm but thereafter a queue formed behind me so get here early if you can.Room – my non-smoking Queen Deluxe 1338 was fair space at 19SqM and actually it didn’t feel too tight for 1pax due to the clever design. Bathroom was adequately fitted out and had a dispenser for the 3-in-1 shampoo / body soap liquid. No issues with cleanliness. My TV was not working due to some connection issues – but within 30mins a technician came up to my room and fixed it. They even have an Adriod (they call it handy?) to bring out if you wish to – nice!Breakfast – The Great Room on level 7 was seriously packed at 9:30am on a Sunday. Food was a let-down being bland and uninspiring. Also feels very chaotic and the cleaning crew were absolutely drowning. I know its a HIE and I shouldnt be expecting much but I remembered better breakfast at HIE in Bangkok.Facilities – I didn’t manage to chek out the 24hr gym which was also on level 7. Beside the main reception was a small-ish pantry with snacks and drinks available for purchase. Also a fresh orange juicer for $2 a cup.Service – Polite and efficient although I can see that the staff sometimes struggled with an influx of guests checking in / out.Check Out – I dropped my key card into the Express Checkout and went off. Still waiting for my points to post at the time of writing (2 days later).
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Used this as our stop-/layover hotel when travelling through Singapore and didn’t have a lot of time and rather wanted to have something closer to the airport.Hotel is relatively new, rooms typically Singaporean, small and compact but offer all you need.Definitely would come back / recommend. Good pricing point, all rates incl. of breakfast.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have not stayed in the Katong area for years and it was a surprise that the whole area has been transform into something more chic ( in the old days Choo Jiat Road was a little seedy with lots of CHINESE STYLE KTV ). Now there are modern shopping centres and lots of restaurants. DECENT hotel but house KEEPING slightly careless ( room cleaner left her cleaning towels behind! )....
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my fourth or fifth stay in this hotel since their opening. Check in process is speedy and with good service. Breakfast is included and served from 06:30am to 10:30am daily with wide range of food selection (bakery, salad, hot food such as chicken congee, mee siam etc and cereal). Breakfast area is large and spacious however it is quite crowded all the time and noisy even i sat outdoor area (outdoor area is way better than indoor if you would like to have a more quite breakfast time). I would like to point out the housekeeping standard is so different every time during my whole stay in the hotel. The towels in bathroom are fully equipped only on my arrival day. Day after, hand towel missed 1. Second day after, face towel all missed. Last day, floor mat was gone and suddenly 4 dental kit were placed and the housekeeper took away the toothpaste that my friend and I were using. And I got to open a new dental kit just for the toothpaste. This is quite weird and I doubt is there anyone check the room status first before the guest is back to the room? Overall, the hotel is well-maintained, location is good (just next to I12 shopping mall and Katong Square) and tons of restaurant nearby along East Coast Road and Joo Chiat Road.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice, modern and well located hotel, if you are interested in exploring East Coast. A very decent breakfast to start the day was also appreciated. We spent a day there and didn’t really use many other facilities, and i can’t think of anything we didn’t like. Shopping and dining all within a few minute walk. I would say that our stay was an excellent value.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfy mattresses and pillows - they even have soft and firm pillows labeled for your information. Breakfast buffet is good, you can request for takeaway bags if you’re on the go. They also have “Handy”, a mobile phone with unlimited internet access that you can bring with you anywhere you go, very useful. Location wise is also okay, lots of nearby restaurants and malls. Hotel is really recommendable.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here before a cruise. It was a little farther from the port than we thought so we planned to change hotels after one night. But the staff was so friendly and helpful and the breakfast was absolutely AWESOME. We decided to stay an additional night. The hot breakfast was so much more than the traditional ‘complimentary breakfast’ other places tend to offer. Thanks!!
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is really very nice, but the beds are hard and the AC blows down over the bed. Both of those are very uncomfortable for us. Also did not like that you have to take two different elevators - one to lobby and one to room. Staff were great! Everything was very well maintained. And breakfast was good. MRT is a bit far to walk, but bus stop is very close and #10 and #32 take you right to the station. If you hate hard beds, do not stay here, otherwise you'll likely love it.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was travelling for the official purpose. Location is great. They have very nice breakfast and which is included in the room rates. There is Katong Square where in small shops are present and hotel is attached to that. During my stay they were having some shopping festival going on and hence had many street shops arranged in the corridore of Katong Sqaure premises. The super market and other shops are present in the next building Katong 112 which is sort of mini mall having food court and other shops.For Indian who are looking for Indian food, just on the opposite side of the road you will get few options. For food enthusiast you have option to try different cuisine on the same street as many restuarants are avaiable.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are bit small but tidy and clean. Staffs were helpful. Breakfast was good. Bus stop Roxy square is next to the hotel making it well connected with the main attractions. They have hand phones for the guests but are not available in all rooms. good value for money!
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for about 3 weeks. The Hotel is almost brand new. A no-frill, DIY hotel. Generally clean. No concierge service, you have to carry your baggage on arrival and during departure. Check-in and breakfast at Level 7. Front desk staff are alert, attentive and helpful. Breakfast traffic could be heavy. The breakfast selection includes fresh fruit and bakery. The staff clear your used cutleries fast when you are finished. If you don't have time for a sit-down breakfast, you can grab muffins or fruits on the go and the Hotel provides paper bags for it. Cleaning staff work hard to keep rooms clean. Room is of standard size, fitting 2 adults per room adequately. Water shower pressure is excellent. The hotel is located next to a mid-sized shopping mall, i12 Katong Mall. Another bigger mall, Parkway Parade, is 10 mins if you take the "shortcut" lane between this Hotel and Roxy Square. Plenty of eateries nearby - 328 Katong Laksa, Mufiz, Mookota, Sin Heng Claypot Bak Kut Teh, Sinpopo, Brotzeit Katong, AlibabaR Hawker Bar East Coast, Glory Catering, to name a few. If you drive, the Hotel offers a compliment ticket for an entry once a day. Plan your trip well. You have to remove your cash card when exiting. Worthed visiting this Hotel again.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a 3d2n stay, the place rather far from mrt station and more convenient If take either taxi or grab. The hotel have no swimming pool but do provide a gym and self laundry. The breakfast is more on continental breakfast but still taste good. How ever as I wasn’t feeling well on the that day, I couldn’t check on if there’s any interesting places around. The room are clean but small. Suitable for maximum of 2 occupied. The stuff are friendly and the rooms are clean. Definitely will come again in future I give 10/10 marks.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our last night in Singapore was in room 828 of the Holiday Inn – Kiting. I am Glad we only spent one night. The room was clean but small. There was almost no room to open our cases. This hotel is suitable for the business person who is travelling light. Breakfast was minimal. I would not choose to stay here again. Perhaps the one good thing about this hotel is that it is only 20mins by taxi from the airport and the fare was only S $ 19.00.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice place to stay in, conveniently located, Happening surrounding. New property with good comfortable rooms. nice friendly staff. Good breakfast spread. surrounded by the malls this place has easy access to banks, money exchange, food courts, & shopping this place is ideal stay. Good value for money.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice new hotel with a very helpful staff. Very clean with just a few problems. My very comfortable bed is sagging. The AC is excellent as well the TV. Nice carpet and the shower are nice, with great water pressure. Plenty of counter top at the desk. Underground grocery store is near as well the bus stop. Simple bus trip to the "Lion " and Gardens by the Bay and Marina Bay Sands. The biggest disappointment breakfast buffet. It was excellent 2 yrs ago....now its terrible. Fake eggs, butter, bad coffee, pancakes, jumbo silverware and with strictly Asian food. All Westerners beware your breakfast........ Instant coffee in your room is by far the best to be enjoyed.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights in Holiday Inn Express Katong. Location wise is great with convenient bus stop and soon there will be MRT. Lobby is on level 7 and check in was great and efficient and welcome with smiles. Price already included breakfast which was ok with normal bread spread, yoghurt, fruit, egg, infian and chinese food. Room is modern but the bed is slightly on the small size for two person. Lots of cafe and marine parade mall is close by, so it is easy to get food. Besides singapore is small so taxi is also not too expensive to go to orchard road
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great staff & overall hospitality experience. No major concerns in terms of stay quality during my 3 day visit. The only thing which the management can improve is providing better options for toiletries. However I do like the fact that shampoo & handwash were fixed which definitely saves the wastage & the TV channel options could have been better as well. Overall happy with my stay.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has met my expectation in a recent stay with them. From friendly staff, the cleanliness of the room and the accessibility of the location. If this hotel would have a swimming pool, i would come back over and over again :) Thank you for making my stay warmth ...
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They have very high quality staff for sure, I love the way check in & check out done. Also all possible support they provide promptly. Room was good enough, although small in size. Very near to east coast park, walk-able around 20 min Max. Breakfast is just OK. as far as Indian Breakfast is concern the food is not that good. All other options are good other than Indian Breakfast and I enjoyed it. last day i need to keep my luggage in hotel for few hours and they have specific luggage room with proper security available. I would love to stay in Holiday Inn again in future. Best of luck Few Suggestion: In Room there must be lunch and dinner menu must available for food order.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have always been satisfied with the service of Holiday Inn Express and ever since I first stayed there for my bday in 2017, everytime I need to be in SG either for leisure, work, or something else, My first choice is this hotel. Close to everything and they have great staffs!
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 4 nights in this hotel as a couple. It was a 10 minutes ride from Changi airport ( we arrived early in the morning) and as the name says it is an express hotel and the services was provided accordingly..Our check inn was smooth though we arrived early around 8 in the morning..all the staff spoke good level of English ( this was expected of Singapore) and helped us in every way they could..The breakfast spread was good and it has all the things that should be there in a hotel chain. The hotel itself is above the Singapore's oldest shopping mall which has also a food court in it..the nearby areas are full with little food joints and restaurants which are not so hard on your pocket.The only minus would be the location.. Not near metro and the nearest bus station is a 10 minutes walk. There is a taxi (i think its GRAB) kiosk in the hotel itself which can be used to get to the nearest metro or anywhere else..It does not have a swimming pool, the beds were comfortable and all the necessary in-room amenities was there..Overall it was a nice experience with the hotel keeping the price in mind as Singapore itself is pretty expensive.. Will love to visit again!!
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is modern. Sky lobby. Provides comfy bed and pillows of 2 types, soft and firm. Has Bluetooth alarm clock with speakers to play your own favorite tunes. Iron and board is upon request. TV channels have both local and international such as HBO, CNN...However, you would need to pay for parking. Breakfast is decent with mixture of American and Asian varieties. There is a nice ramen at Ground floor. And a nice ice cream shop across the road.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great bed and p illows,very clean and nice ambiance.The rooms are spotless and Reception is on the 7 th floor,where we were treated with quick check in ,area information and smiles. ITt is an Interesting area to get around.Lovely bathroom really looking forward to returning.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Available for an excellent price in a city like Singapore with a breakfast included: quite unlike most hotels that we found within that budget. The hotel has a minimalistic appeal to it with all essentials: a trolley to help you carry heavy baggage, swift check-in and checkout, a clean and warm room which is very well kept. Further, the hotel has focused on keeping themselves environmentally conscious and minimally reduce human effort: for example - soap dispenser is fixed with liquid soap to avoid regular refilling. So is the case with the shower and body gel: they are two in one. You would witness many such points including the placement of light switches in the room, the reading light, so on and so forth.Lastly, the breakfast is quite lavish, so do manage to catch it between 6.30-10.30 am! And yes, many good restaurants and malls are walking distance from this hotel. So, the location will always be a true winner! Don't forget to check out "Zaffron Restaurant: A Michelin Star" one at a stone throw's distance :)
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived late at night, reception very quiet was issued our entry keys to our room (non smoking) as all rooms are, on entering our rooms there was a strong smell of smoke and room deodoriser, we went back to reception, after a few minutes another room was founded for us. As an Express Hotel, rooms are not big, we were staying a week, we managed missed a lounge or Balcony, but accept for the rate it served its purpose. Location is great no MRT but it is coming, but regular bus service into the central city, and tourist locations. Breakfast was adequate very clean area, and staff friendly. Check out was quick and efficient.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is very clean and near to alot of eateries and bar for chill out. A shopping mall is just 2mins walk away and city centre is 10-15mins away by taxi. The only minus point is there is no porter or hotel staff to assist you when you arrive at the driveway of the hotel. Security guard present is rude and not helpful and flexible. Hotel should do something about it.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service attitude is very bad and never try to accommodate customer's needs, we are a family of 4 with the youngest only 2 year old and the staff wanted to refuse us to stay because their policy is maximum 3 people and threatened us to vacate us if we don't leave the next day, the worst experience of my life in any hotel won't come back again!
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Katong is a nice area and hotel is surrounded by shops (mall) bars and restaurants. The HI concept is simple but good. You get a good bed, good shower, good breakfast buffet at a descent price. Oh yeah, the wifi worked very well too. Easy, just connect without difficult codes and/or room numbers with last names etc. Really enjoyed the stay here!
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Close to the airport and easy to stay for a night or two stop over in Singapore. The rooms are a little small once two travellers have their baggage open and their isn’t very much privacy for the bathroom, but is perfect for what it is - an express hotel. There are lots of eating options located close by and the included breakfast was good. The gym was tiny, with most of it outdoors so prepare to sweat a lot, or get wet if it rains! Friendly staff.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My second stay within a year, the hotel is conveniently close to the airport and not far from the main attractions of the city.Rooms are tiny but good enough, if you are spending most of your day out. This time the breakfast menu has changed dramatically, I salute them for that, this time I was able to eat from their hot dishes as they had Halal food, well done.Their staff is always efficient and helpful, whether at the front desk , waiters or the cleaners.Will definitely consider staying again.
hotelName:
2    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel location is good (very close to the Buona Vista MRT station, large mall nearby with supermarket and dining options). Staff are friendly and helpful.I wish to point out that the superior room was advertised as having amenities including a bathtub on the hotel's own website. However, on checking in I was notified that it's not available in all the rooms and only upon special request. I would suggest the hotel not to advertise as such if the amenity is not available in every room.

3    Park Avenue Rochester Hotel

review_body: Very comfortable stay, proximity to Buona Vista MRT station provides so much convenience, staff always makes you feel as if you are very special. Comfortable rooms. Handy phone is an excellent facility that makes calling so convenient.

review_body: everything is goodthe people service is quite good but breakfast have to be upgrade with king of food and quality of food.if compare with others hotel breakfast is not good. it's soso both quality and kind of food.

review_body: Great hotel and never disappoints. The wifi needs work and should be a little stronger. The breakfast buffet i would rate as average. Overall i would say the Park Hotel is one of the better hotel to stay in Singapore because of its simplicity and location. Samantha from the reception is very kind, attentive and and courteous. review_body: Absolutely loved my stay. A beautiful hotel, incredibly friendly and attentive staff, delicious food, a gorgeous pool, room service robots etc. Was there for a week for business, and now that I’m home I miss it already.
