review_body: The front office staff,especially Ram,Ruben and Nava were very kind,helpful and always had a smile.Not forgetting Samantha the Duty Manager who checked me in.Definitely recommended for a business trip stay.

review_body: It was my first time to check in and i appreciate the accommodation you have. I surely recommend it to anyone who would like to stay there. I suggest that the hotel offer free shuttle service for airport as it is far. The guests would love that. Samantha from the front desk is very service-oriented. The papers piled up on her desk and the loads of people in the queue did not stop her from being so interactive and welcoming. She was kind and humble which is very rare among managers nowadays. Thank you Samantha for your great hospitality. We hope to return to Park Avenue again.

review_body: Room with greenery scene, clean and good internet connection too. Good location, easy to get food in the surrounding area, close to mall as well. For business trip, it is fine and suitable. Friendly staffs as well.

review_body: Pleased to say that I enjoyed another excellent stay at Rochester Park Avenue between 9-14 June 2019 inclusive. As always I found the staff welcoming, polite, friendly and courteous. The room-suite was clean and tidy at all times. the service from all colleagues at Reception - starting from from office Manager Lynn, supervisors Samantha & Sabrina, staff members Astrud, Gina, Suh Fang, Kimberley, Crystal, Jessne, Iswaran, Song and also Bellmen Ruben (ever smiling and prompt to help) Ram, Nava - all made me feel like i was at a home away from home ... thank you to each and every one of them!

review_body: Great service. Very helpful and kind bellman Mr. Ram.Near to MRT lines and hightech companies.Nice american breakfast.Caring and welcoming staff.Would recommend to anyone in for a holiday or business trip

review_body: The visit to Singapore was AWE Inspiring, Its the Cleanest Country i have ever visited. Lots of Greenery to enjoy, a true Natures Paradise.The Park Avenue Rochester is ideally located near major attractions, the Out Campus of the Nanyang University and about 30 minutes drive from the Changi Airport. The rooms were small but had all the amenities to suit the business traveler. Robots provided guests with room service. Each room is equipped with a cell phone for guests to use to make local calls during their stay. Service was quite good with friendly staff at the front desk and restaurant areas. Shopping areas are in close walking distance while the larger shopping Malls can be accessed via Taxi or Rail transportation. A Singapore visit should be on everyone's to do list.
hotelName:
3    Park Avenue Rochester Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, spacious room. Pleasant surprise of having the room upgrade. The room amenities are nice with the kitchenette and washer/dryer. Downside is very very poor soundproofing, can hear next door guests partying. Overall, nice stay.
hotelName:
3    Park Avenue Rochester Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Given that it’s s a 4star hotel you should expect more especially in Singapore. Poor customer service, no smiles and greetings coming back to hotel. Don’t feel welcome at all. Staff are working for the sake of working. First time encountered hotel staff to see all of my family pink ic for check in. Weird. Stayed in the executive deluxe suites, room were dusty especially the lamp and bed frame. No ventilation in the toilet. Queued 10mins just for check out. Definitely will not stay again, even some 3stars are better than here. This hotel don’t deserve 4stars.
hotelName:
3    Park Avenue Rochester Hotel

review_body: The hotel offered excellent value for money and the location was perfect for my purposes as I had business in nearby university (could walk there every day).The staff (reception, restaurant, cleaning and other services) was kind and polite, I could not hope for better service.My special thanks goes to the restaurant staff as I worked there a lot with my laptop. Flexible and kind service - many thanks!!! I travel a lot around the world due to my work, this hotel is my top stay in Singapore when I travel in business purposes.

review_body: Park Avenue is a great place to stay if you are in Singapore and you want a quieter ambience to escape the stress of the city. From the moment of checked in until I have checked out I knew i will have one of the most pleasant memories here. I have the young manager Samantha to thank for that. She was very genuine, smart, kind and very pretty too. She assisted me with landmarks to look out for while navigating through google maps as she was very familiar with the locations I will be visiting. It was truly helpful for me to have the confidence that i am on the right track. No matter how busy she was with her work she never fails to either smile at me or greet me whenever im in the lobby. There is no doubt that she is a good leader and her colleagues could learn a great deal from her. On a side note, the rooms are spacious and cozy and great housekeeping too.
hotelName:
3    Park Avenue Rochester Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Astrud Ong and Tan Suh Fah we’re upright and honest staff of the hotel. Upon discovering my wallet stashed with cash, my iPhone and passport, not only did they alert me immediately, they also took the tedious effort in counting every single dollar of various country’s currency and listing them down on a formal report form.Great hotel location for its price, walking distance to Buona Vista mrt station, it’s close to all restaurants, cafes and convenience stores. Love this hotel.
hotelName:

review_body: My name is Dr. Sandile Phillip Koko. I used Park Avenue Rochester hotel for three nights during the conference meeting in Singapore. I enjoyed my stay and was offered the best service I've ever received. Ruben, Suh feng, Kimberly, and Raizal allowed me to accomplish all my needs during my entire stay. I wish all the hotels were offering such service. Regards.

I would like to personal acknowledge Samantha's service during my stay. She was always available to assist me with all my questions and she notes my requests and ensure they were attended promptly. She was so full of positive energy and it was always so nice to get her assistance before starting my day. Two thumbs up for Samantha and team.

review_body: Staff was real friendly, rooms really clean, facilities work well. In other words was really a pleasant stay I had. What impressed me was the free smart phone that was available for use in the rooms. That's the first time I have seen service like that provided.
hotelName:
3    Park Avenue Rochester Hotel

review_body: I stayed a week for work and this hotel provided all we needed. Breakfast was crowded and it was annoying not to be served water with meals but the rooms were great. We were also able to get a conference room for meetings which accommodated all our needs. Providing a shower after check out was very considerate.
hotelName:
3    Park Avenue Rochester Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All of the members of the hotel staff provided excellent service. They were proactive, helpful and kind, offering to get me and my companion a taxi, touring us around the hotel, and giving tips on how to get from one area to another most efficiently. At first, I thought the hotel was too far from the city centre (though a plus is its location in the business district). I soon realized, however, that it was still easily accessible not only via text but also by bus and train.I would definitely recommend this hotel especially to travelers who need to go about their work in the business district but also want the flexibility to check out the tourist spots in the city centre.
hotelName:
3    Park Avenue Rochester Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights to explore Singapore. The hotel is in a good position, can walk to Clarke Quay and train not too far to walk to. Taxis were easiest way round though. Hotel is a bit dated, the rooms were clean but in need of an upgrade. Beds were a little hard and there were rips in the sheets, not a major deal though. Staff were very helpful especially any staff on duty at the concierge. There is a little shop just outside the hotel for incidentals and also up the escalator near this shop a great little place to get cheap chicken rice and noodles. Our kids enjoyed the pool too. We opted not to have breakfast at the hotel, although it looked great, the price was ridiculous. $100 each morning!! Overall good stay.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed in Holiday Inn Atrium for 4 nights during our visit in Singapore. Hotel offers good comfort, has bus stop just net door and price was reasonable. We spent most of time outside so haven't much time to use many services, but it was very good choice for our needs.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here 5 nights with my senior parents , we enjoyed the panoramic views at dawn and at night . The room was big enough to hold 7 suitcases and yet not feel crowded. Comfy beds . The bathroom was spotlessly clean, however the tub/mat need an update. WiFi was uninterrupted during our stay. The gym could have been slightly bigger and modern , but served the purpose. Breakfast on the expensive side, but dining and shopping is less than a mile away and the hotel’s free shuttle orchard road is a big plus. Customer service was excellent during our stay . Very easy access to the Bay Sands and Quay . Highly recommend this Holiday Inn .
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room with a view, big room, good nice comfortable bed, lighting could be better, vegan alternative such as almond milk not available in room. In fact, Singapore has not much awareness of veganism in general, to my surprise. finding vegan good is a challenge and not many understand. It is considered as food capital.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel rooms are somewhat tired. Check in agent professional and well trained. Public areas clean. Lobby spacious. Minimal recognition for Spire members. Unlike many other hotels, the following are NOT offered:...upgrade...welcome drink...lounge...usable Internet (could not load email, req'd to upgrade)...breakfastWe know about the inconsistency in loyalty rewards as is well documented on travel blogs, but here they beat every other hotel in having no loyalty recognition. Singaporean IHG hotels solely benefit from loyalty members and have fully removed the perks. If SG hotels set the benchmark, there would be no members. Note that pointbreaks are not ever offered here either (ever). Next stop, Hilton Doubletree Penang.Tip... The Zion Food hawker area is 5 mins. away and great!!
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for a week here and it was okay... nothing amazing.The room was nice and clean and they had mobile devices you could take put with you to use the maps etc, that was handy.The pool was really warm it was just horrible, in that heat you would think they would put a cooler on it...The buffet was 40 pounds a head!!!!!!! I mean that is crazy, especially when not including drinks. Also we went to the Chinese restaurant their and our chicken was raw in the middle.Its not a cheap hotel so this shouldn't be happening.It was okay and served its purpose, but i wouldn't go back.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A convenient location away from the crowded CBD and Orchard Road. The lobby is spacious with plenty sofa to accommodate big groups check in. The LIVE band at the lounge is playing excellent songs. Room is clean and neat. Breakfast buffet is great. Staff is friendly and helpful. The male restroom at the lobby level, the team might need to check the cubicle sensor, it is over sensitive. Overall, it was an enjoyable stay.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really lovely hotel, close to centre yet within walking distance of Academia visiting - reasonable priced and good choice of food. Friendly and helpful staff. In House restaurant buffet excellent and superb breakfasts.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thinking of a short holiday break, just recently returned from Singapore which having had stop overs a couple of time we decided to make it a little longer especially after seeing the movie "Crazy Rich Asians" . We flew with Singapore Airlines which are one of the better carriers and upon arrival we decided to check out the latest creation Jewel which is next to the airport. You can't take your bag trolley in so get them stored. It's a walk to the dome but quite impressive inside. But in reality it's really a large shopping mall with a very impressive water feature & gardens. We stayed ate the Holiday Inn Atrium in Singapore which is very impressive with 27 floors with internal lifts that go up the wall & you can view out. The room was very good not small at all like most of the others I've organised but this time we booked the room at the same time as our flights thru Flight Centre who are always helpful. The hotel staff were very friendly & helpful organizing shuttle bus or taxis as required. The Holiday Inn offers a free shuttle bus to Orchard Road which has many shops to choose from. To get around especially for returning to hotel we used the Taxis which are very cheap, clean & readily available, given time I might have figured out the subway or buses. We also booked the hop on hop off buses which was the best way around to get to the main sights. We did the Gardens by the Bay, which is a massive area and takes in many other sites, the Merlion of course, Chinatown & Little India all in one day. The night bus for a tour is one you must do as seeing the Garden by the Bay show is very impressive. There are 2 shows with the second & less busy one at 8.45pm. Little India was a disappointment not very clean unlike Chinatown which had the best souvenir stalls. Food & drink is expensive as everything is imported. Singapore doesn't have a fishing industry or farms so expect to pay more & if you eat in a restaurant you may also have to pay 10% service Charge & 7% GST which pushes the price up. All in all the people are friendly the shopping is fun but watch out for the humidity can be a real drainer on your energy. Also a must do is breakfast with the Orangutans at the zoo. I would give Singapore 7 out of 10 as a destination.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I will write my review in Pros and Cons -Pros -1. Great Lobby.2. Good Swimming Pool3. MRT bus stop (ease of going anywhere and cost saving)4. Good Rooms.5. Taps in room have water that is safe for drinking. (less usage of single use plastic).Cons-1. Beds are not that comfortable.2. Except the hotel restaurants no eateries nearby.All and all a very good property, recommended always.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were invited to have dinner at Atrium where I have never heard of Holiday Inn Atrium has restaurant that offers buffet dinner...There are limited selection of food items to choose and my first choice was DIY Caesar salad which tasted very weird and Super sour. I tried Fried Rice and it was tasteless. Mash potatoes was Super salty. With all these, I dared not to try any others...service...walking pass by without even looking at table where there were dirty dishes...absolutely not my choice
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Holiday Inn Atrium is an excellent hotel with a very impressive lobby all amenities including a bit of shopping at the side and amazing and friendly staff. I would like to thank the front office manager Rachel for helping us transfer from the Holiday Inn Express with out any problem. She did also help with transport and making us feel very welcome. The hotel is not very close to MRT but does have a bus stop right opposite which will take you to any MRT station. The breakfast has a taste of all cuisine. Including Indian and Japanese. The rooms are a bit dated but very large and tidy. There is live entertainment in the bar next to the lobby, with happy hour daily. All in all a great stay. Would highly recommend. Althea and Jude. Melbourne
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: horrible rooms , bad service .. what to tell about the bathrooms ... broken taps , non tissues . the rooms are not as per good quality of 5 star hotel standards . the rooms should be of standard quality . the buttons of the ac was bad . I was in room 1121
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Holiday Inn Atrium is a great hotel offering superb value. Breakfast and meals are good. The rooms are clean and beds are comfy. An easy walk to Clark Quay. The hotel offers a free shuttle service to Clark Quay and Orchard Road. My favorite offering of the hotel is the free travel buddy. Its saves you time in finding places and you won't get lost. Thank you Holiday Inn and wish all hotels could offer this service.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We used this hotel as our Singapore stopover base. Location wise it’s an easy walk to china town and Clarke quay.Holiday inn is one of our preferred brand for a quick stay, usually.The first corner (level 22?) room we were given was small and old - although that wasn’t the problem. The room was musty and smelt damp, the wallpaper was peeling and there were mould patches on the wall and ceiling. Inconsistent with our expectations of the IHG brand and rather unhealthy Bring very tired we tried to ignore it - however after leaving the room for awhile and coming back in - there was no doubt this room had an unhealthy mould/damp issue and in our view should never have been given to anyone.Once bringing it to the attention of the front desk they promptly moved us - although it’s frustrating they felt it okay to put someone in there. This problem is identified in other reviews it seems.Breakfast was excellent and overall the service was quite good. The hotel is showing its age too, but apart from the musty room (s) it’s not too bad.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall stay is superb. with the super king size bed and nice view. One minor issue is the toilet floor leveling is not good, there is a pond of water not able to flow or dry. Need to use towel to wipe every single time.Breakfast is tasty. and it allow to take away coffee!! so far my 1st time experience.Currently undergo renovation, so, you might heard some minor noise during day time. But luckily I stay on weekend, so, does not trouble me at all.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A good business hotel, but you need to take a taxi everywhere as the nearest MRT OUTRAM is about 1.2 km away and in the heat or rain it becomes inconvenient. Breakfast has a lot of cusine options. No shopping center connected or nearly close. View is fantastic from top rooms
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The subjects says alot about this hotel. Painless check in process, room wonderfully prepared. Executive has one of the best views in Singapore. Only down side was the food. Lobster laksa is quite ordinary. Needs more improvement on the curry. Lobster and scallop were slightly over cooked. Disappointed with Soon Kuay served during Happy Hour. No seeet sauce or even chilli sauce. Speaks nothing about the "Singaporean" way of eating.. Special mention Ms Malai at the front desk. Excellent service. Great knowledge about the IHG points system. Always serve with a smile. Well done Malai! Wondeful stay. Will be back for more!
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a large room with a city view. Customer service was friendly and helpful.Location was busy. Distance away from MRT, if walking, however, there were bus stops near the hotel that would take you to the MRT.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s an old hotel, but well-maintained. What I mean “old hotel” also implies the rooms would be bigger than the average. The hotels built long time ago tend to be more generous with the room size. I’m quite satisfied with the room. That’s the good side.The bad side is the location. It is not close to any MRT station. Actually, a new station is under construction. After it’s done, I believe the transportation problem will be much improved. However, at this moment, you can only rely on Grab or taxi to go to other places.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a beautiful hotel with great facilities, great room and bed.However service is not their thing. Staff seemed to be not interested and it’s a little unfriendly. Breakfast was ok but wanted for some management to be present to ensure constant good presentation. All that said the general standard of the hotel is very good.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is well located in the city. You could walk to most places, although taking a taxi would be a better choice during the hot hours. The rooms are well furnished, but you have to check if your room has sufficient wardrobe space. Some rooms have only 2 drawers, and that is not enough for two people. The hotel is clean, and the staff are very friendly and professional. The cell phone, provided by the hotel at no charge, is very helpful. Breakfast is excellent, with a very large selection of multi-cultural dishes.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is old style but it is reasonably well maintained. The down side is the noise with an atrium design. Some inconsiderate people yell at night and it echoed the entire hotel corridor. Luckily, it only happened twice at night during our stay. Otherwise, no other issue with noise. The room is well equipped, except the chair needs to be replaced urgently. The synthetic leather is peeling off. Room is spacious for 2 adults and 1 child. The staff was very helpful and communication via email wasn't an issue. We had breakfast included and tried both lunch and dinner buffets. A lot of varieties and all were excellent. Hotel guests get 50% off for lunch and dinner. The price is steep without the discount but i assume this might be standard in all SG hotels.The main down side is the location. I don't find it convenient like others have commented. There are only a few buses go right in front of the hotel. The closest outram park MRT station is 17 mins walk. We were traveling with a toddler and pushing the stroller in the hot and humid weather was not ideal. We tried to catch a bus that went to outram park MRT station, which was also 10 mins walk and required carrying the stroller up and down a pedestrian bridge. Thus, our main mode of transportation was taxi. Another issue is food selection. It would have been convenient if it is near a shopping mall which one can just go out and eat there to save some money. Adjacent hotel restaurants are equally expensive. For the location, I think the room rate isn't value for money. I had stayed at somewhere in SG before with the same price tag but it was much more convenient for food and traveling around. There will be a new MRT station next to this hotel in 2021. I might give it a miss until then. Unless the price is really attractive in the future.Another thing that's worth mentioned. The hotel only provided us the complimentary "handy" phone on our last day. I wish it was provided earlier on. it could have been very helpful with the bus route and entrance tickets. The ticket offers were actually a lot better than what i got online so i felt a bit bummed. Overall. A good experience so a 4 stars rating.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was very clean, friendly, excellent customer service. They also had the best breakfast. They cook your eggs or omelette to order. The breakfast included choices for Americans, Asians, East India, and everything in between. Great location, close to the metro. Also has an amazing elevator with excellent views and great prices. I would go back here!
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hey - this is not a bad hotel at all. It will make you feel young again because the decor is from the 90s and hasn’t been updated. The rooms are clean, big for Singapore and the showers are really nice. The elevators (there are 6) run quickly and I Never had to wait for service. There is a lot in the area for eating - not too much shopping. One night we ate in the Xin restaurant and that was very good. Even my Chinese Singapore friends said it was authentic. My challenges came from a surly staff, ridiculously expensive buffets of marginal quality, and the overall ‘feel’ of the hotel. There are massage parlors next door and women with dubious backgrounds and professions could be seen arriving at late night hours. It is an interesting place and very, well, earthy at times. All that said, if I have a short stay I would consider this place, but only if the Park hotels were full - they really are better.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good modern hotel. Although away from the Waterfront free shuttle bus runs hourly.Good size rooms with bathrobes Good breakfast including a live noodle station (my favourite) Breakfast could be busy but then most hotels are at this time.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Holiday Inn in Singapore boasts: fine bedrooms and suites, including smoking rooms, a varied and exceptional buffet for breakfast, lunch and dinner comprising a special children's corner offering their favourite cereals, nutella and marshmallows. The Holiday Inn has a broad and inclusive employment policy; We have befriended in particular a young boy who takes charge of directing traffic and ordering taxis in the hotel forecourt. When our boy blows his whistle - you stop and listen - you move your car - you get out of the way. Our boy Owns the forecourt of the Holiday Inn. His work ethic is second to none, and he is greatly loved and indispensable to all the staff. When we arrive at the hotel, he drops his whistle to give me a hug.Down in the basement of the hotel you will find two shops that sell Everything: needles and thread, aka seltzer, sticking plasters, fresh sandwiches,T shirts, coffee, and any kind of alcohol your western heart might desire. The owner will often toss in a free banana with your purchases. On the day of my departure, the beautiful wife of the owner took me by the hand and led me around the shop to choose a packet of biscuits for my 10,000 Km journey home.A hotel is a community, a village that cares about its inhabitants. This is one such delightful village...
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel====The hotel was nice and clean but the location is a bit of annoyance as there is no metro station nearby so we had to travel by Grab (online taxi service like Uber) all the time. Breakfast=======Excellent buffet breakfast that caters to everyone's choice. Staff====Helping and smiling staff. River Walk========The hotel is near to river and I highly recommend everyone to take the river walk that goes all the way to Merlion park. Tip:===I bought a local Starhub sim for 13 SGD and it gave me 100 gb data for a week. The sim worked in Malaysia and Bangkok as well.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is 27 storeys hotel with good ambience. Room are spacious as per Singapore standards. I was allowed an early Checkin at 8am with SGD 117 fee. Breakfast buffet was good but spread and quality for Indian buffet breakfast can be improved. Handy phone is a good amenity for all tourists as it allows unlimited local and international calls, unlimited data. Handy should provide a decent sub-range handset. Nearest metro i.e. Tiong Bahru MRT or Outram Park is 1.2 kms from hotel. Clarke is 1.4 km and is walkable. People at reception should be more polite and approachable.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Yes, it is one of the older hotels in the city - you will find run down upholstery and a slightly 80ish feel in the lobby. But i give this a 4 star because it checked off on all other points. good and prompt service staff. large rooms and comfortable beds. clean toilets and lovely staff. So ignore the the little things that are sore to the eye, this place is value for money.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was there with my family for a group tour. The rooms were quite spacious. We were allotted 2 rooms and we had a very nice and comfortable stay. They had provided us with cellphones which were free for all international calls, and quite useful to be in touch with our relatives in INDIA
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here on a 3 day stopover on way to Australia. Good location very friendly and helpful staff, Bathroom could do with updating. Breakfast very enjoyable with lots of choices. Robertson key a few minutes walk with some good bars and restaurants also Clarke key 5 minutes further but pricey
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was what you would expect from Holiday Inn standards clean and functional. The staff were very helpful Mogan the concierge was extra helpful with a great personality. We were on the 21st floor and it was very quiet. Beds were very comfortable.Breakfast was ok but other guests made it like a bun fight. Again the staff were great and extremely polite.The hotel is well located near the river and will be ideally located when the MRT opens.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is nicely located in Singapore, a 10 mins taxi ride maximum from all the sights. Friendly welcome by the staff, and everyone was really friendly all along our stay. Rooms are clean, spacious, quiet, and have a relatively nice city view. The best part of the hotel is probably the view from the lifts as you go up and down from your room. Breakfast in the morning was really good, with great choice and quality food ! Would highly recommend and return to this hotel.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nice hotel, rooms were quite spacious and luxurious with the most comfortable bed. An impressive foyer and the atrium design is unique. Well located and providing very good service, it is worth a visit.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Atrium was quite nice and better than I expected. Breakfast buffet was large and had a lot to offer. Dinner was acceptable but not out of this world, and maybe a little pricey. There isn’t a lot of options right near the hotel so we used their restaurant quite a bit over the 4 days we stayed there. I appreciated them accommodating us with an early check in.Room condition was a 9/10.If I were to go to Singapore again, I would prefer to stay closer to the Marina area.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is centrally located and has easy access to all the city spots (Orchard Road, Bugis, Clarke Quay, et cetera). The design of the hotel is also very good. Rooms are small - we actually paid and upgraded to an executive suite since the original deluxe room was too small to be shared between a family of 3. Food was okay; we visited during the New Year Time when the hotel was running full and you could see the strain on the staff at the Buffet restaurant. That said, the staff was friendly and helpful and I am sure the service levels would have been much better had we visited during a less busy period.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is well located and near to CBD and Sentosa Island. Its bit far from MRT but they provide shuttle services to Orchard road. Check in was smooth. Rooms on the upper floors have nice view of the city. It's worthwhile paying SGD20 additionally for this view. Room is spacious and bathroom is well stocked. Food is good and so is room service. No complaint during our 5 night stay. Kids below 12 eat free which was good for us. Staff is friendly. Overall a nice and comfortable stay
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quick and efficient check in Great location for sightseeing Rooms very clean and all hotel staff friendly and helpful Very good breakfast great bar area Easy walk to Clarke Quay or taxi service which is reasonable we have used hotel on a number of occasions and will use again
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check in was a breeze & there was a lovely platter of fresh fruit for us in the room. Staff were always polite and friendly. Room was always clean and presentable. The door man - Kaibin - was a standout!! He was always smiling, accommodating, friendly and eager to please. He would have a bit of fun with us and he was also caring. We found the bed to be uncomfortable - rock hard. It is a little bit out of the way, with nearest MTR over 1km away, but the bus stop was close by. It is centrally located to parks / gardens / shopping centres and easy to get to by taxi. Breakfast was good with a wide variety of foods and always well stocked. With the MTR extensions being completed in next 2 years would be ideal place to stay.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spire elite members do not seem to be valued here. No benefits. Breakfast is total chaos if not present at the beginning (many food stations empty at 10:00). Not worth the price paid! Positive is the bar on ground floor attended by Excel. Location is ok.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very old property and looked completely un-prepared for the holiday season. We stayed here for 5 days during Christmas period and surprisingly the hotel operated just 2 out of their 6 reception counters. This shows how unprepared the property was for peak holiday season; long lines at check in and check out. Rooms have also not been upgraded for so many years. I was surprised to see the bar in this hotel offering just had 3 options for a single malt whiskey; even small roadside restaurants in Singapore offer more options than this. Internet speed on Wifi was 2-3 Mbps and that by any standards is by the lowest ever speed I have ever experienced anywhere in Singapore. No coming back to this hotel.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed two night at this hotel. Everything went well. Check in was fast and we got our room early. It was clean, a nice size and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast, which was included in the room price, included both western and Asian items and was very good. Our only complain was that our room was quite damp and the bed even felt wet when you got in it. The location was good. it was close to a Hop On Hop Off bus stop which was convenient for us. It was also close to several Hawkers buildings where we ate several times. I would recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1. House keeping was bad - I hanged the sign for no need to make up bed, then did not even to clean the trash 2. breakfast - took forever to refill even I asked, then finally I gave up and left3. the bill was wrongly printed - My mistake. I did not check the date of each item then the room service date was printed incorrectlyI am not even pointing the cleanness of the room ! I stayed in most of the Holiday Inn in Singapore, this one is really really bad
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this hotel; spectacular building and space; good location and if they ever finish the light rail project the transport situation will be even better. Staff were friendly and very helpful. The room was a good size and very clean. We ate in the restaurant and bar a few times but thought it was too expensive for what you got. The buffet meal would be worth it if you liked seafood (we don’t!). Overall we would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone staying in Singapore.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located near Clarke quay where there is a lot of activities for tourists to do. Will recommend this place for those who enjoy night life because Clarke quay is famous for it. The hotel is really clean and beautiful, will definitely book it again.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this via a booking site, without much thought! This is lovely place to stay; I was on the 25th floor and the views are amazing. The room was spacious, well appointed and the bed very comfortable with a choice of pillows. Breakfast was extensive and good quality and the breakfast area busy yet quiet. At the moment although the hotel is pretty central it doesn’t at present have an MRT station, but it’s currently being built, non the less the bus services are excellent and the bus stops are close by!All in all a good place to stay for a couple of nights on your way through Singapore
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was amazing. The decoration inside was beautiful and the atrium was an awesome feature. Customer service was great from start to finish. Taxis are always available and cheap to get to the local attractions. Would definitely recommend and would love to return.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Got late at night, there was only one receptionist discussing with another guest, several staff passed by to the back office door behind the reception, no one made the single attempt to great me or of course do the check in. After 10 minutes someone showed up. In my view this is not acceptable. The room was fine and everything else was average to what one could expect, although the price does not match the service.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The check-in was very quick, we were given a room on the 23rd floor with a good view of the city, the room on its own was very clean with good amenities and good in-room entertainment. The Air-conditioning was quiet, the bed was comfortable and the pillows were soft. The Breakfast was also very good with great variety, good coffee and some quality items. I also appreciated the quick service whether it was concierge or room service. The Hotel also has 6 lifts and a 24-hour currency exchange machine which was very convenient. The Hotel is centrally located and is near Clarke Quay.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel, not new but well keep in nice condition. Very good location to access the city and yet quiet and peaceful. Would go here again. Breakfast was good but a bit crowded during my visit. Would stay here again.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Being an elite member we had an upgrade to our room. 45th floor. Wow what views from our spacious room and massive bed. Great location for getting about and the hotel loaned us a brolly when it rained! Superb breakfasts, such a vast choice. It was a shame the pool was under renovations but despite the building works we still managed a dip. Room service brought us fresh milk each morning to make a coffee and a bucket of ice each evening for our G and T's. Thanks to all staff and management for making our visit to Singapore such a memorable one!
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are decent in terms of size and facilities, but definitely need some refurbishment works. It's not very accessible to town without transport, though can walk to Robertson Quay, where the bars and restaurants are.
hotelName:
4    Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was connected to Sheena, a great and prompt coordinator there is nothing she cant do, she always try to accomodate and if she can give me alternatives which makes me hepi cx she tries. Genuine service la. Love that she replies to a bride to be any time of the day u Whatsapp her, sometimes i find myself irritating but she is still abiding and good. Down point is, she was not there on my wedding day but she made a great handover but i felt her presence might be better cx she knew everything from start.My check in was great, we were given our rooms and enough linens in rooms and amenities even for my folks room and bridesmaids. Everybody was hepi. Rooms were clean and great. Esp bridal room for me was more than i expected. Their lunch set for the wedding couple is sandwish but i felt is gud enough because of its portion and accompaniment. Food for room service and breakfast is bravo. Rooms is a stayable and returnable experience... i recommend anyone to go there to stay...My wedding is a special one because i was met with a bad incident, my hubby could not be present so groom was not around and my wedding reception is to go on but there were so many that cud be done better. 1. Firstly, the bellboy whom sent my my pictures for my photography album table was gone, my box of pictures was sent to a room and sitting there and no info was told to my bride squad.2. The hotel promised dry ice effect but it was little and hosts were seen near our entrance and midst of the walk, lettinng the dry ice thru.3. Door from the kitchen was always opened and seen by guests4. When i was marching in with my dad from the entrance, there were so many of the team around but no one help to settle my train which was so long but clumped together for the entrance march in.5. I have requested for steamer before arrival to be ready in bridesroom was not there. So lots of time wasted. 6. There were so many empty seats but crew was pushing my squadteam to open another table as it is running out, feeling the pressure they opened another table when i felt there is no need for that.Overall experience is fine but not fab for a sad wedding.What i love is their set up was exactly and more than i wanted for the banquet tables, they gave me a third vip table as i specially want it for my sister... everything they did was fab but attention to smaller details would be terrific...Best thing on Holiday Atrium Singapore would be me winning their grand draw and a $5k off my wedding banquet... never won anything in my life but u all sure can try have ur weddings there.Still gotta say, this plce is worth the try for a holiday, service was great for rooms... fnb daily breakfast is awesooooome!!!Thank you
hotelName:

review_body: Good experienceNice to meet mr gill (reception) he is nice n love his nature....Gill was helpful guy...Easy location near MRT, buses,mall, safety,Many restaurants nearbyEverything is open 24 hoursExcellent love the place n hotel...Thanks Mr gill
hotelName:
5    Sandpiper Hotel Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked 6 rooms from the 1st of July until the 8th of July for a small family holiday... There is a definate variance in the rooms - from uber budget (smaller, no windows) to more spacious with heaps of light. I would recommend requesting a room on the third floor if you like quiet, however, if your like me (and can sleep through anything) the ground floor is super convenient.The location is phenomenal - honestly, it's so central. Awesome food everywhere, great shopping within walking distance, super easy to get transport (MRT / Taxi etc). If your looking for a more local feel, Little India can't be beaten.One thing I must mention the Sandpiper is the staff. Theyre all great, but Gill and Deneesh are absolutely fantastic. Deneesh was always super happy, genuinely helpful and nothing was too much trouble. He is a credit to this establishment. Gill - what can I say? Sir, you are hands down the best owner / manager I have ever encountered. You are a fountain of information, humour and we've already discussed your impecible psychic abilities. Honestly, you made our stay. I can't thank you enough. Thank you. Thank you thank you thank you!!!I personally would stay here again, in a heartbeat, and would DEFINATELY recommend The Sandpiper to other budget conscious travellers.

review_body: Absolute filth! Room smells and is foisty and mouldy. Didn't appear to have been cleaned from previous guest lipstick on pillow and dressing table. Bathroom mouldy and filthy. Floor covered in dust and dirt. Walls scratched and very worn. Beds ripped and uncomfortable. Wires exposed in room next to aircon unit which leaks water. Bedding damp and smelly. Communal areas of hotel are also foisty and not well kept. Staff are extremely rude and unhelpful. When asked for a clean room was advised I could upgrade for 40SD per night.

review_body: For the price we paid there was nothing wrong with sandpiper hotel, it was in a good location for little India and for keen walkers you could get to all locations, easy to get to from airport - get the mrt from terminal 2 it is cheap and efficient and only short walk to hotel. review_body: I enjoyed my stay at the Sandpiper Hotel. I found this hotel to be clean & comfortable with fresh toiletries supplied daily. I had a twin room with two single beds. I slept like a log! You can adjust the air conditioning to suit you too. I didn't encounter any problems with noise. The hotel staff were very professional but personable & helpful when I needed directions to particular place.

review_body: I stayed in this hotel for a family vacation last month. Its plus factor compared to other hotels in little india is its accessibility to MRT, easy to get taxi, many food, shopping, and massage establishments. Also, the hotel is well-maintained and clean. Of course, its front desk officer, Mr. Gil is very helpful to hotel guests, and even finds time to accommodate queries and exchange of information. On the other hand, Ms. Jasmin's way of communicating to hotel guests needs improvement. Her tone of speaking is not widely acceptable in the hospitality industry where Sandpiper is part of. Lastly, I hope other hotel employees can extend even very little help to guest's concerns especially when there are senior citizens in the group.

Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a good hotel for transiting in Singapore, about half way between the airport and the city.. Rooms are big, bed comfy and nice swimming pool. Things that may need improvement were: slow service at the bar/restaurant, 2 taxes on top of the menu prices (however there was a small discount on the food part), hotel charges for ordering a taxi and it took 10 days to receive our funds back that were blocked on our credit card as a check-in deposit. Also, there was some strange noise late evening behind the walls, maybe air conditioning system? but it wasn’t too loud and it didn’t keep us from sleeping..Overall good stay for us who were in transit for 15 hours.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the Hotel itself was clean and tidy. The service was slow and the prices with the facilities provided were insanely high that I could not believe it. Staff were sloppy at times but other things made up for it. Firstly, the lifts were extremely fast getting you to where ever you wanted in seconds. The gym was small but had everything you need. The pool was only about fifteen metres but had sections for all ages. There was a small pool next to the large one that I wasn’t sure what was for. It was extremely cold sand shallow. The water was warm in the big pool and had a water fountain on the side. There were many places to sit around the oil with a whole second story with pool chairs. Your room came with a smallish bathroom with a clothes line, toilet, shower/bath and sink. It provided you with free toiletries, robes, slippers and water not forgetting the very convenient spare room key. The television channels were delivered in a a small amount. It had a grand view from your bedroom window and had a wide range of lights throughout your room. The mattresses felt like lying on the floor though as they were very hard. I was impressed that they gave you a free phone to take travelling with you throughout the city. It said you could make free class but the hotel guide said something about cost per call. The hotel is located in a very convenient spot making it easy to access malls and has a large spot for taxis. The hotel also has a shuttle bus service but I personally didn’t get to try it. Overall, it was an average hotel but not bad at all.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good check in & comfortable room.Complimentary voucher for alcoholic beverages at 11pm at night after travelling for 30hours but No milk in the room for a cup of tea - had to pay S$3 for some milk to have with a cup of tea in our room at 11pm. Early checkout to catch a boat at 6.30am so didn’t have anything to eat or drink. Staff kind & welcoming.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our 4 day visit to Singapore, was magic, due in a large part to this great hotel. Good rooms, great staff, and a great location. Easy access from the airport, a good area around the hotel for relaxed dinning, good access to public transport to visiting the attractions around Singapore. A great coffee shop downstairs for a quick snack. Best of all, friendly staff.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is midway between downtown Singapore and the Airport. Nice sized room and very cold AirCon, thank you. Excellent value for the money. You will use the hotel shuttles or bus/taxi to get anywhere. MRT station is about 10-15 min away. East Coast Park is nearby but there is a lot of construction in the neighborhood so its not so easy to walk everywhere you might want. Nice pool, several restaurants. Buffet breakfast was extensive and reasonably priced, food OK. Again, excellent value for the money, just be prepared that walking to things in Singapore takes some extra time from this hotel.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The assistance rendered to my family was beyond the duty manager's duty of care. Thanks to all the duty managers, especially William and Iskander, for assisting with the early checkin and the late checkout
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The grand mercure is located ik a really nice neighbourhood in Katong. Close to the East Coast Park and with lots of nice restaurants and foodcourts around. There are some beautiful streets with old shophouses behind the hotel.However, the mercure is. Ot as hip & trendy as the rest of the neighboorhood. The lobby looks uograded, so does the pool area. The room definitely not. It is functional but still has carpet on the floor, no coffemaker, bathtub with a showercurtain, very old showerhead. And one major issue, rooms are superhumid. Nothing dries in the rooms. Bathtowels and swimming stuff is still wet after a day and night of drying.We were here for a sailing regatta so come home with a lot if wet clothes. There was a dehumidifier in our hallway which had not been in use for at least 24hrs. The water reservoir was full and no one emptied it. I brought it to our room, emptied it and seitched it back on: 88% humidity. After 1 hour we already had it on 80%.When we were in bed by 21.20, 2 men showed up ringing our doorbell and waking up my son to ask if we had the dehumidifier in our room. Every right to ask but maybe not at that time...Bathroom also had a sewage smell after it had not been used a few hours.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've been to this hotel many times and I know they have nice rooms, but this time they placed me in a horrible room that gave me upper respiratory infection with a fever that I'm still suffering from today. RoomSmells moldy, but I was too busy to change rooms and didn't realize it would affect me to this extent. Felt dirtyBathroomFoul smell after flushing the toilet Towel rack broke off and fell into bathtubShower drain cloggedShower curtains smell disgusting, I didn't even want it touching meServiceWhen I finally asked them to change rooms, they took me to a better room. Service is fine, but I'm giving 2 stars because I got very ill after staying in their room for 2 nights. LocationMRT will open in 2023We took a taxi/ grab every day because it's not convenient to the city centerFoodThere's a lot of food behind the hotel around Katong 112.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here twice over the past 2 months. The first time was in celebration of my daughter's 3-year-old birthday. I had requested for a small card with the words Happy Birthday just to wish her. The Front Office Team (special mention to Ditta) went above and beyond that to make a gorgeous hand-made card for her and also prepare a cake. Together with the Housekeeping team, they decorated the room so beautifully, making her day extra special and memorable!When we came back the second time, my daughter had remembered the little towel bunnies that were prepared the first time, so I made a request in the booking if she could have them again. When we entered the room, there were no bunnies and she was a little disappointed. It was evening time when I called the hotel reception to ask if I could request for them. The Housekeeping department called me soon after to apologise that they could not fulfill that request that day because the person who made them was not around. However, they set a time for the room to be made up the next morning, and for some towel bunnies to pop in. We brought my daughter out the next morning, and when we came back, not only was there a family of bunnies, but a family of elephants and a towel monkey too! And of course, my daughter (and her parents) was ecstatic.The hotel was clean and safe, with excellent service all round. This is certainly a place we would come back to again in the future!
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed here many times. This is my third review in 14 years. During this time most of the rooms have not be renewed, you can see wall paper lifting and water marks on the walls. The carpets need refreshing.They claim that you get a 10 % discount if you are a Le Club member. I am and it would not take when I tried to book on line. 4 weeks later, I am still trying to get a response from Accor. Their arrogance is palpable. The location of the hotel is good for me as I want to me on the East Coast. But there are newer hotels nearby that I will now try as the attitude of the hotel is too poor.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is close to major attractions and only a short taxi ride away. We had 2 rooms across our family for 6 nights and rooms were very clean and well maintained - staff were excellent. The concierge gave excellent advice and the room travel device was very useful when calling a taxi to return home. This was our second stay and is our preferred hotel in Singapore. Breakfast was excellent and the pool bar food was fantastic including the service. I would absolutely recommend this as a place to stay - there is a shopping centre opposite.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for three nights before boarding cruise ship very helpful and friendly staff, good sized room very close to shopping centre down side a bit far from Mrt station, although they do run a shuttle bus
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed twice within a week at this hotel. Mostly it is ok. It is close to the airport and reasonably priced. There is a shopping centre across the road that has most things. But there is no access to the MRT. They do have a shuttle bus every hour to the airport. However, the first stay was in a Club Room. The room was good and the lounge has a nice view. Sadly the evening canapés were mostly Tofu. If you like that, great. I don't. And a tip, eat breakfast in the restaurant it is much better than the lounge.On the second stay, the noise from the bathroom exhaust fan kept me awake and was most annoying. They do turn it off centrally at 11PM. So my sleep quality was poor.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed one night on my way to Kuala Lumpur. The complimentary shuttle bus makes it so easy to get from the airport to the hotel.I had received an offer of upgrade for a small amount of SGD which I requested. I got it approved and stayed my night in on the premium floor. As I checked in very early I could have a breakfast at the lounge. Nice cocktails and snacks in the evening. Great view overlooking the water.Decent gym.Will for sure stay here again.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We held our wedding lunch banquet at the East Coast Ballroom last Sunday, with the assistant of Mike, Gabriel & Haslinda. They've helped run the event so smoothly, all of our guests only have positive remarks about the food and service. As we had some guests who did not turn up last minute, Mike and Gabriel had advice us to split the food to other tables so that we can minimize wastage, which was really commendable.We would totally recommend other couples who are intending to get married, to consider holding their banquet at the hotel. Firstly I think it is really value for money given the overall experience we had, the total costs incurred and the services rendered to us. Secondly, we had a really comfortable stay in the bridal suite as well. The room size can accommodate the couple, makeup artists, photographer and even some of the wedding entourage. We didn't feel overwhelmed at all. We were also surprised with a bottle of sparkling juice, some fruits and snacks upon our check in, which we felt extremely touched. Lastly, we would like to send our warmest regards to the banquet team for making sure everything went according to our plan. We didn't have to worry much about the banquet, everything was coordinated well between our groomsmen & the banquet team. Thank you all once again! :)
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have been regular guests at this hotel for many years, as usual we always we found the staff friendly, and very knowledgeable in regard to the hotel and the goings on in the area etc.' just ask the concierge for a newspaper or some postage stamps and it will be made available.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great overnight stay - staff were very attentive - this hotel knows what customer service really means - visible signs everywhere - close to city and airport and free shuttle bus service which was excellent.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment of arrival to check out, all staff has been very warm and helpful. From Alan at the front lobby, Karen of the front desk, Grace at the cafe and Celine at breakfast and to the housekeeping staff! Very good and welcoming all! Feel very much at home!
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was really great. From arrival, check in, hotel facilities, amenities, room attendants servicing the room, staff, location up to check out, everything was amazing. We love to stay to this hotel again and its highly recommended. Our stay was great
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were flying in from Greece very early in the morning and decided to use the Grand Mercure Roxy as a transit hotel as our flight home to Australia wasn’t until one and a half days later. It is not located in Changi airport it is around 12 k away so you do have to clear immigration and customs but that was a breeze for us at 430am.We arrived by taxi at 445 am - the hotel does have a free shuttle to and from Changi Airport but it doesn’t operate between the hours of around 1030 to 7 am . We were greeted at the door and our luggage stowed in a trolley by the porter while we checked in. We had booked a room for the night previously to ensure early check in .Check in was quick and efficient . The porter accompanied us to our room with our bags .The room was spacious and clean . The bathroom was a good size with shower over bath . There was a good range of toiletries supplied .We slept until around noon then spent the afternoon by the gorgeous pool . We ate 3 meals at the Breezes Bistro served by the very professional and friendly Eddy. The food was delicious and the coffee and wine great .We obtained a late checkout so spent the following morning at the pool before getting ready to go to the airport to catch our flight home to Australia . The shuttle service delivered us to the airport in a timely and efficient manner .I really liked our stay at this hotel . The staff were very professional and helpful . I have booked to stay again in November when I next pass through . Thankyou to the staff we enjoyed our short stay and were sad to leave.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything in this hotel is at its best. The hospitality is very warm as the hotel staff will perform their best in order to make your stay a truly memorable one. The rooms are well appointed and the meal offerings at their different restaurants are at par with most hotels in the Orchard Road Area. This is a place to celebrate the Asian Culture, most specially the mix of Chinese and Malay race, and savor Perinakan cuisine. Try the fish and chips at the poolside bar, it is both English and Australian versions combines to come up with their own serving.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Looking for somewhere close to Changi Airport for an overnight stay or somewhere a bit cheaper outside the city centre of Singapore, then the Grand Mercure Roxy in historic Katong could be the place for you. It is about 15 minutes from the Aiport and the hotel provides a free hourly shuttle to and from the airport.The rooms are spacious and modern with a good sized bathroom and comfortable bedroom. Ours had a small fridge, safe and coffee/tea making facilities and two comfortable, mini-double beds (may be good for marital bonding.) The hotel has a nice swimming pool, fitness centre and a number of restaurants and bistros. We recommend the Japanese crockpot, a salmon dish, in the Breez Bistro and Bar, but go easy with the accompanying small dish of chilli sauce, although there are lots of local restaurants close by. The hotel provides a free one way shuttle to Marina Bay, the Esplanade and ION Orchard on Saturday and Sunday and a hourly one way shuttle to the MRT train station between 8.30 and 11.00 a.m. on weekdays.Hard to fault, reasonable price (although nothing is cheap in Singapore) so recommended.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great room, which was spacious and had enough closet space. Breakfast spread was good too.Only disappointment was we landed an hour early and got to the hotel 1 hour early at 6am and there was no room ready. We were told to "go away" and come back later. I'm not sure where one goes to after a 10 hour flight, being jetlagged and having luggage to carry around so we just sat in the reception. Thankfully at 7:30am we had a room.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check in was smooth and easy. Miss Adonchia welcomed me and got me my room ....16 floor with a fantastic view of the sea and a great sunrise to greet one. The room was comfortable. Ample lighting and space My nights stay was very restful.Location of the hotel is ideal with Parkway just in front .the food court offers a wide range of food at very reasonable prices....you are spoilt for choice...Mecure Roxy is the best of the all the Mecure hotels...it's the first so has larger rooms.All the newer mecures have rooms that are shoe boxes . Thanks to Wilson at the front desk who made my check easy and seem less...Thanks for making my day.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: that many hotels claim to be 4* but, when I compare them to the GM Roxy, they always fall short. Large comfortable rooms, a willing friendly staff that still provides a service to the traveller, air conditioning that really works, a great location halfway between the airport and the city and a desire amongst everyone to ensure that you have a great time all adds up to a really good hotel. OK, It’s not the Ritz, but of the several hotels I’ve stayed at in Singapore, it’s the only one that I’ll willingly come back too - and some supposedly score more highly in Trip Advisor, but I’ve been there, seen them and when I compare them to the GM Roxy I get the feeling some reviewers really have very little experience of what makes a good hotel. This hotel remains one of my all time favourites, it is a home away from home when I’m travelling and I cannot praise it enough. Please don’t change, in a world where everything is cheapening and dumbing down, the simple comfort of the GM Roxy is a stable point in my itinerary.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All our stays at the Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy have been nothing but pleasant, the most recent one in early May was just excellent from check in to departure. Some staff members went over and beyond to provide first class service which I feel is worthy of mention:George, our room attendant, not only did a wonderful job with the cleaning, he went through a lot of trouble to arrange our toiletries immaculately, tidied up the desk and coiled all our mobile phone cables with the wire ties and placed them very neatly. That to me shows that he takes great pride in his work which reflects a good image for Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy. We were so impressed, my husband called Housekeeping to thank him. Shortly after, there was a knock on the door and we were met by Regina Chin, Executive Housekeeper together with George with a "Get Well Soon" card wishing my husband a Speedy Recovery on his eye surgery which was very thoughtful and much appreciated. Many of the other staff like the Concierge were also very caring and concerned which meant a lot to us. We enjoyed a sumptuous dinner at the Feast@East Buffet Restaurant on Level 3 during our previous stays and have never been disappointed, in fact, it just keeps getting better with a great selection of Peranakan food as well as Western. Many of our friends and family members who dined at this restaurant have also enjoyed it immensely. There’s also the Breez Bistro Restaurant on Level 4 with equally good food.The rooms are a good size, very comfortable and clean, toiletries and beverages replenished daily as well as fresh clean towels. We were upgraded to a Deluxe Room with complimentary fruits which was a pleasant surprise.The location of the hotel is superb for more than one reason, firstly it is 15 minutes from Changi Airport with easy access to the city centre by public transport. There is a shopping mall directly across the street and many other shopping malls in the East Coast that you can get to by public transport. There are many restaurants & bars in Katong, most within walking distance so you will be spoilt for choice with lots of great food.Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy also provide guests with complimentary shuttle service to and from the airport as well as to the Paya Lebar MRT Station where you can ride the train to many different locations in Singapore. The friendly concierge and Reception staff would be more than happy to help you with directions. We had the pleasure of meeting Jennifer Narcis, Director of Sales & Marketing on our last trip and was happy to give her our feedback. For many years, we stayed at hotels in Orchard Road but that is now in the past as there's so much more happening in the East Coast which we don’t seem to have enough time to cover on every trip.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Through past years this hotel has become our favourite in Singapore. Usually [except when prices skyrocket due to some f1 or suchlike venue in town] price-quality of experience ratio is pretty good here. Good sleep quality and fairly comfortable rooms.I would even say that common areas have greatly improved compared to a few years ago. We enjoy the location that is less busy than more central parts of Singapore. Proximity to the sea allows for an odd breeze to come through and it feels less damp here compared to central Singapore. Pool area is a pleasant and relaxing spot that we enjoy during our stays.Airport shuttle included in room price makes it easy to access the hotel as long as you are not fussy and your flight is not at some ungodly hour.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Finished a cruise in Singapore and had booked the hotel for 6 nights. We arrived in a car organised by the hotel and were greeted at reception by a very nice young man who booked us in and we were then shown to the room on the Executive floor.The room was large and well maintained (NOT old and dim - they must have been in another hotel!!)We used the executive lounge for breakfast and nightly canapes and really enjoyed the view fro there across the harbour.On 2 nights we had dinner in the bistro on level 4 and the food was excellent - 1 meal was steak (yum) and the other spaghetti bolognese - delightful.The staff were very helpful and attentive and overall the hotel stay of 6 nights was very enjoyable. The location is great being just across from the Parkway Parade shopping centre.Would recommend.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very old. We book a deluxe room and the room is very small for its price. The room corridor lighting is very dim and has a moudly smell. Even they provide free shuttle bus to airport. I will not book this hotel again.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We often break up our flight from Australia to Europe and stay at the Roxy Mercure Hotel in Singapore. A free bus shuttle pickup at Changi and delivered to and from the hotel. Rooms are well appointed and comfortable with free wifi. Busy Katong area with shopping across the road and the relaxing East Coast Park within walking distance. Relaxing bar beside the hotel pool to finish the day of start the evening. Hotel staff went out of their way to help return some lost baggage and get it to us at the airport before our departure, much to our relief. We'll be back at the Roxy Mercure.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Most recent visit to Grand Mercure Roxy Singapore was from 5 to 16 May 2019. Stayed almost 30-room nights this year in this hotel on various visits with my wife. We are a retired couple. From the General Manager, Klaus Gottschalk to the youngest concierge staff, Nicholas, everyone in the team is trained to make sure your stay is pleasant and comfortable. If there is a problem, just call and the issue will be resolved immediately. The hotel is immaculate, the rooms (rather large) are clean and well maintained and more importantly, the staff is passionate about their work. There is a large shopping complex opposite the hotel and a new hawker centre (clean and inexpensive local foods) next door has just been opened. On the other side of the hotel, it is littered with lots of restaurants and cafes. Excellent bus services or taxis from hotel to any part of Singapore. You cannot go wrong staying in this hotel! .
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here after being in the city to be nearer the airport for an early flight the next day. Staff were so helpful, unloading our bags from our taxi and taking them up to our room for us. We were upgraded to a lovely big room too, which was so lovely when we were tired! Reception kindly gave me a map of local sights; its easy to walk to the beach (watch out for the brief heavy rain showers though - caught me out!) and to the beautiful old Peranakan buildings. Close walk to lots of food choices (even McD's!). Would thoroughly recommend, its a nice change from being in the centre of the city.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A stay over two periods, but interesting to see the difference. The first time I took the opportunity to upgrade (at my cost) but it was not worth it (no real benefit for the upgrade), so opted not to for the second stay. Rooms are a little tired now and possibly need some work. Neighbours can be very noisy in the middle of the night, not the hotel's fault but shows the lack of sound proofing in the hotel. Breez Bistro Bar has a happy hour but I am suspicious that the glass size does change for this, and the price was higher than advertised, and no attempt to refund to look after the customer, just complained that management had not changed the advertised price when they were asked to. An average stay, and a little disappointing as I have stayed in a number of Mercure hotels. The staff (concierge and floor staff) were excellent, so that was appreciated!
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family of 6 stayed here, including 3 little kids. We booked 2 adjoining rooms. They enjoyed the spacious pool. Buffet is good for the price. There is mall in front of the hotel but you have to cross a main road. The hotel is a bit far from city center but this is nearer the airport. Surrounding community is peaceful and quiet. But overall, we had a nice stay in this hotel.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a one night stop over. The hotel itself is fine for a quick stay, comfortable beds and quiet rooms but the food is dreadful. I was very disappointed with my meal, the seafood clay pot. The seafood was tough and the sauce unpalatable. I let the staff at the Breez bar and bistro as well as the check out staff know how unhappy I was with the meal but it fell on deaf ears. Breakfast the next morning wasn't any better, so if you decide to stay avoid eating.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are really big and well spaced. Staff are friendly and when I had an aircon issue at 2am, the technician arrived promptly and fixed the issue promptly. Amenities was good.I had breakfast, lunch and dinner in the restaurant. Nothing fancy but variety was good. The only dish I truly loved was the generous durian pengat.I ordered the fried rice via room service. The fried rice was good and the portion was generous. However for the price they charged, a glass of water was not included.Hotel is close to airport and location is good.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are generous and big, design needs a bit of a touch-up to move away from the 90's feel. Overall Great Location, The F&B Establishments Food and options are Superb, Staff Level are Great. I've stayed several times over the past 3 years. Had only 2 bad experiences. The first one is for another review. This review is more about the Management of the Hotel. They cannot account why I lost items in my room.They actually made me feel and covertly implied that I was not being truthful on my claim that the items that were lost in my room.They were note even able to write a report about it because in their opinion nothing happened. They left the weight on me as the guest to PROVIDE that the items were indeed lost while it was in my room. I wrote to ACCOR on the experience but it got routed back to the same management team and they their concessions as compensation but my feedback here is when you wish to claim that concession they say it was only valid during the month of the email or they just conveniently cant find a document that they even committed different.I have status, a regular guest staying almost monthly for at least a week at a time.Imagine how other guests that stayed and lost something then definitely those are incidents that just get thrown out as flukes but to be treated like this as a member with status and a frequent guest really is BAD. Management doesn't put premium on Member Status or Regular guests. JIt is quite a shame. I feel very happy staying at the hotel and most of the staff i already know by name and they also know I am a regular guest. It's the management of this property that has an issue how to take care of guests.To ensure that I dont loose sleep that something might get lost in my room again. I will wait until the management gets their act together before I consider. I'll stay other properties that I have status for now when in Singapore.
hotelName:
6    Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at 3 hotels during my Singapore visit and while this hotel wasn’t bad, it my least favourite of the three. This is mostly due to the location.
