11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 7 days, in late November 2018, at the hotel. Hawker markets and public transport are all in easy walking distance. My son and I had curry and roti bread nearly every morning which cost $1 Aus from just around the corner from the hotel. The rooms are small but adequate for a couple or single traveller. There are adjoining rooms that would suit a couple with 2 kids. Mr Hamid Haron, the duty manager was a stand out for the trip and made every effort to assist us in getting to know the area. The airport shuttle also stops at the here for $9 one way trip, the hotel also advertised a travellers SIM card which is $12 for 100gig and 1 week. The location is about 30 minutes on public transport to the heart of the city. Get a travel card ASAP if you plan to use public transport either ezlink or nets cardI also found the ATM's offered the best exchange rate and are everywhere. Happy traveling!
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recommend this lovely hotel very much. The staff was very corteous and helpful, the room very clean and comfortable. The hotel is located a bit outside of downtown, but easily reachabel by public transport in short time. I would return for sure.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All staff are pleasant, helpful and friendly Location is great close to shops, restaurants and bus/train. Room is clean, beddings and towels are changed daily.We spent 3 nights there and would love to book with them again in the future.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time travelers to Singapore and we decided on this property based on their ratings on tripadvisor. Initial interactions on booking rooms through emails which were promptly responded to by Louis and we also got bumped up to deluxe rooms complimentary. When we reached the property, we were greeted at the door by Mr. Hamid who quickly processed our check-in's considering we had long flights and were with kids. Overall the trip was fantastic, the hotel is extremely convenient to get around places to eat for different budgets and different cuisines. Mr. Hamid and the other staff were extremely helpful in pointing us out to things to do and ways to get there. We were even helped out with pointers on where to go due to a medical situation which was very convenient and well recommended.I'd stay here again, thanks once again to the entire team and staff.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mr. Hamid, the front desk manager offered great hospitality always with a smile. All the staff was very flexible, kind and helpful. Its great location, very centric and walking distance to the MRT station.I would recommend the Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat anytime.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cute little boutique style hotel. Within walking distance to street shops and food. We didn’t spend much time there so unfortunately I can’t give more of a review. They did have what looked like a fun bar area with darts.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: During my visit to Singapore in July I stayed at Aqueen Heritage. It was a great experience for me the staff is really supportive. Hotel is very clean and easy to access to the main markets, bus stops and malls. Very clean. The breakfast they offer was good. Worth staying.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The 1st time I stayed in this hotel was in August 2018. It was for 5 nights. At that time, it was purely a gamble and I had no idea if it was good or bad but I based my decision on the many positive reviews I had read about the hotel and staff. And I wasn't disappointed! I'm travelling with 3 kids and I highly recommend AQueen Heritage Joo Chiat for families. Efficient, clean rooms, service with a smile from all their front desk staffs. I stayed for 4 nights and had a peaceful and restful stay throughout. Mattress was perfect for me!Location wise it is awesome too with the many affordable eateries/cafes/restaurants around especially Halal ones as it is in the heart of Geylang. You can also easily flag down a cab or take a 10 mins walk to Paya Lebar MRT station. And there's plenty of convenient stores too!I would like to thank Mr Hamid the Duty Manager. I'm impressed that he could remember me & my children although it was only my 2nd visit to the hotel. He was also very attentive and kind. A gem to the hotel service field definitely. And to En Jun, Louis & Shawn. All you guys are simply amazing and AQueen is truly blessed to have you all fronting the desk. 2 thumbs up to a job well done. You definitely will see me again when I visit Singapore. From the bottom of my heart, Thank You! ❤-Nura MN Singaporean Living in KL
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My Cousin and I stayed at the Aqueen Heritage hotel and found it good value for money the staff where extremely accommodating. All questions answered and help given as I am disabled I found their assistance excellent. We had an overnight stopover an route to Oz but would definitely stay there again for a longer period. It was clean and well equipped
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose Aqueen Joo Chiat cause my wedding venue happened to be at the shopping complex next to it. It was out of convenience. We don’t expect much from a 3 star hotel but what we received was beyond 3 star. We were welcomed at the very start of checking in. The management has even thought through the best room to cater to the function as we had people coming in and out from our room to help us get ready for our wedding. They provided us with extra keys even helped us with our things, carrying them for us and keeping it safe too. They even allocated the room next door for our bridesmaid just so it would ease the process. They did whatever they can in helping us ensuring the event is smooth sailing. The beautiful interior too is above the average 3 star. We did not expect such professionalism and tip top customer service leaving us singing praises and fun loving memories for us to reminisce.Thank you soooo much Duty Manager Mr Hamid & the rest of Aqueen Joo Chiat staff! You guys made the start of this journey a beautiful moment to remember ❤️ We would certainly come back to relive these moments ☺️❤️❤️❤️❤️
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just transit 24 hours but wanted to visit a relative in the area. Would have caught the MRT (about 5-10 min walk) but due to time, caught a taxi which was only about S$16.00. Plenty of cheap eats around especially Vietnamese Cafes, convenient to supermarket plus smaller handy marts. Not a long walk to Katong Shopping Centre. Little pubs and karoke bars in the street as well if that's your thing. I had a Windowless room, on the small size but i already knew that when i booked and was only there 1 night. Great facilities - everything worked, cool air-con, bedside light switches, decent sized wall mounted remote controlled flat screen TV etc. Very comfortable bed, pillows, clean sheets and towels, usual toiletries plus a great hot shower.Nice clean hotel with friendly staff - would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms were neat and clean,though they are small. They are provided all basic facilities like, a c, tv, wifi, safety locker, boiler, small refrigerator, hair dryer, universal plug socket, good thick blanket. Cons: elevator smells bad.Windows of room were locked, room is bit congested but ok for two. Water bottles are provided only once.The reception staff were cordial and friendly. Hotel is five min away from bustop and 15 min away from paya lebar /eunos mrt. No indian food nearby.but have abundant fruit vendors, supermarkets and restaurants with local cuisine. If ur looking out for indian food opt room near little india/farrer rd.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were comfortable staying at this hotel, the rooms are a bit small however there is space for luggage and even a small fridge. We had tiny little flies in our room, not sure what they were but they were there throughout the entirety of our stay. In terms of location, pretty good, near restaurant and shopping. I would recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very good quality considering the price. The staff were really helpful and moved all of our really heavy bags in and were overall very friendly and accommodating. Would recommend, would come back the next time we're in Singapore.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel lobby is nice and smells great. Fast check-in and check-out. They require a S$100 deposit. Front desk staff are nice and helpful. The room I got is small, but for the price and given this is Sg, not bad. Quality of sleep is great, linens are crisp and clean. Bathrooms have rainshower set, with nice water pressure and hot/cold. Nice neighborhood, but could be a bit challenging if you’re checking-in with an elderly; especially if you’ll take public transpo, as MRT stations are quiet far. Overall, a pleasant stay.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My Brother and I arrived at the Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat to a nice warm welcome and an easy booking in process . We stayed for 3 nights and enjoyed the comfortable bedrooms with a nice bed , pillows and a wonderful hot shower with great water pressure . This was the best shower I experienced , in over a month of travelling . All the staff make the stay so enjoyable and are very willing to help with anything asked of them . A special mention to Mr Hamid (Duty Manager) who was so friendly , courteous and professional . I highly recommend this Hotel as we felt safe , comfortable and looked after . Delwyn Jenkins
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: That was our first visit to Singapore. We had a nice time in Aqueen Heritage hotel. Wow the scent in the lobby was excellent. So stress relieving......I feel the same scent in our rooms as well. Good room service. Clean bathrooms. Front desk staff so helpful, they arranged a vehicle for us for shopping within few minutes. Hmmm any negatives.......No bad memories in my mind to mention.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at the hotel late in the evening after a ridiculously long flight. We were booked in quickly and efficiently.The rooms were small, with a view of a carpark ramp - but the beds were comfy and the aircon worked well. We were so tired, lack of view was not a problem.They kindly kept our suitcases and rang us a taxi the next morning, so that we could make the most of the few hours we had in Singapore. (we were getting on a cruise ship at lunchtime)I can't really comment on the area or anything else, we really weren't there long enough! The hotel was booked by the cruise travel agent, it was part of the package, so i have no idea whether it was expensive or budget, and can't really comment on whether it was value for money...
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: room nice but you would not say that it was big but very good location in an historical street, great well appointed bathroom , nice hotel décor throughout, really good staff who try to help and go the extra yard and generally a nice safe ambiance about it
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my wife stayed in this hotel for 7 night's and I must say our stay was very pleasant and enjoyable . The hotel is well kept and near all amenities . Restaurants are plenty around the hotel and will only take 10 min train ride to the city center. The best part of our stay is the friendliness and service provided by hotel staff . We are extremely delighted with the service provided from the check-in till check out . Special mention to Mr Hamid at front desk whom always there to assist us with a smile . Overall , we would recommend this hotel for travelers looking for a simple yet clean hotel to stay.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Like the location of this hotel, convenient and many shops around. The room is very nice decorated, the tiles in the bathroom are beautiful. Very homely and comfy room to stay in for a short staycation. Mr Hamid has provided good hospitality and warmth welcome for us. Thank you.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 1 night en route to Australia staff were very friendly helpful and approachable. Room was clean and comfortable would definitely recommend it. The only problem if you can call it that was there was no music on the tv channels
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenience for foods, small shopping activities and a very accommodating Hotel Manager Mr Hamid. Just about 10 minutes walking distance to MRT Paya Lebar. Very helpful front desk with clean room and lobby.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came to Singapore for short visit and had a pleasant stay. Hotel is clean, comfortable room and near to Fair Price Supermarket also 2 bus stops away to Paya Lebar MRT. One small request to add more TV channel (just my own preferences). Overall great stay and advisable if you are looking for budget hotel.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely horrible hotel - bad experience starts at checkin that took hours. Another customer next to me who was a single lady was being terribly treated by the hotel staff. Save your money please and go somewhere else.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stay in this hotel from 5th to 8th March. It is in a very convenient location and closed to shophouses and eating places. The Malay food there are delicious and my favourite. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful especially the Hotel Manager Hamid. My stay in the hotel is relaxing and comfortable.  I wish to express my gratitude and appreciation to Hamid for his care and welcoming service and also for showing us the bus stand to Paya Lebar MRT. I was back home from holidays yesterday and am glad to be able to write this review.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I received a kid welcome and the room was clean and really comfortable. The position is also strategic if you need to go to mrt, just 5 minutes walking from Paya Lebar. Plus, breakfast is really good. Really recommended!
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at the hotel for 2 night in novembre 2017.The hotel room was quiet and clean. And the staff was inbetween the most helpful and friendly i have encoutered in a hotel. They also have a good bar downstair.Irecommentd the hotel to anyone stopping in Singapore. A+!
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed twice at this hotel – one night each time for between flight stopovers. It is a short taxi ride from the hotel – cost $16 (23 in Friday afternoon peak hour). The location is great with several food hawker food centers and small restaurants (great murtabak) nearby. There is also a large supermarket almost next door. It is easy to hail taxis outside. Rooms are small but really well appointed with lots of shelves and powerpoints. Good bathrooms with great showerheads. Free wifi. They also stored a suitcase for a week free of charge. Noise can be a problem. First room was opposite a carpark and market trolleys started at am and were incredibly noisy. However the second room had no window so was quiet – except for the party which arrived at 10pm and banged their room doors and chatted loudly for the next two hours. Staff are helpful.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was modern, clean, comfortable bed. It was quite near a metro station so good accessibility around the island. Unfortunately, there was no heating anywhere in the hotel and Hong Kong was very cold during our stay so we were very cold in the room. We were told this drop in temperature was most unusual. We had extra blankets which helped but no heater was available so we were very happy to leave Hong Kong for the heat of Perth.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want to experience a bit of Singapore other than Orchard Road or the central business district the Aqueen in Joo Chiat Road is a good choice. The surrounding area captures a feeling of what Singapore was in the past. The hotel is located in an area of colourful two storey shop-houses, on a street with plenty of food choices, including a great vegan restaurant, and laundromats if you need to freshen up your clothes. It is next to a supermarket, and is not far from the MRT. The rooms are spotless and the staff helpful. We were travelling with bicycles. The manager saw us arriving and came out to welcome us, and show us to the place they had found for storing them when we weren’t using them. The staff were always prompt and helpful when we need to get the bikes. The fundamental questions are: would we stay there again and would we recommend it to our friends. The answer to both is a definite yes.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mr Hamid and staff are very friendly and helpful. Hotel is clean and neat. Food is easy to find. Nice Vietnamese food and Singapore laksa around. There is a supermarket (Fairprice) beside at Joo Chiat Complex.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Found this really nice hotel. Warm welcome every day. Front office Hamid and Louis really showed they cared. Quality of facilities and cleaning very good. Nice quiet room as requested and really comfy beds. Tea / coffee making including small fridge were a bonus. Felt safe as well. Only mild criticism is the floor carpet was a bit well worn. The location was a bit betwixt and between Eunos and Paya Lebar metro stations, both a bit of a walk. Eating places abundant on Geylang Road, but only if you care for local fishy food. Being vegetarian was incredibly difficult, little if any choice, but thats Singapore rather than the hotel. Thanks Hamid & Louis we would stay again.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was ok. Room was fantastic and very clean. What that impressed me the most was the professional service that was provided by the duty manager Mr Hamid. To be frank i had never met any hotel staff that was more helpful through out my stays in hotels in the last 20 years. Thumps up.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We used this hotel for a one night stay over, before flying out to Thailand. The hotel is sedate and not particularly remarkable, but it does what it says on the tin. Comfortable rooms, adequate decor, friendly staff, wi-fi, nice bathroom. Plenty of places to eat nearby and not too far from the airport (20 mins by taxi). Would recommend.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stay- cation due to a nearby wedding, i would say, the hotel may be small but the service is 10 star quality. Thanks Hamid, for the hospitality given and keep it up!!!. Rooms are comfy and unique. Geylang seria as usual, the best place to walk around for gold and baju kurongs!!!
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a very frequent traveler to Singapore, normally 2-3 times per month. For the past year I have stayed at the Aqueen Heritage Joo Chiat. The hotel is comfortable, spacious for the price, great service and located in a great local neighborhood with many restaurants and shops at which to enjoy local cuisine and products. Its hard to find a better deal for the price, and I have never had a bad experience in over 20 stays.
hotelName:
11    Aqueen Heritage Hotel Joo Chiat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed from June 26 to june 30, 2019. My stay is still continuing (early morning of june 30, 2019 at 0030 hrs).We are in room 411, the ACs did not work on june 28,2019 night but we managed somehow. Again tonight (june29,2019) the ACs stopped working at about midnight. We called the reception and the guy at reception gave us an option to change the room to 211 and asked us to come and collect the keys from reception. Naturally I go down to collect the keys to 211. I asked the guy how can he be sure that the ACs are working in 211. The guy mr.mohd Jamir fired on me saying the following:1. Don't make fun of me2. I have only this information from the management that ACs hv a problem I can't help you more. 3. Say what you want and go away.Such language... I hv never ever heard in hospitality industry.I asked his name... he said go give my feedback.I told him may be something I said made u feel bad.. I am sorry..let's start from the beginning as we r probably from the same country.He said I hv some work... please go away and take the other room.Lastly if the management already knew that there was some problem with the AC why didn't they sort it out before hand.The worst experience ever. Lastly, there are ants in the room.Bathrooms are tinyThe worst 'security staff' ever.Do avoid for your own self respect. I consider myself an accommodating traveler but never before I hv experienced things I have experienced in here.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can’t fault the LK apartments. All works well. All staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is quaint but unique and friendly. Good pool as well. A surprise really. Would recommend if you are looking for short or long term stay.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock

review_body: Good value for money. Convenient location to access to main tourist attractions. Comfortable room size and amenities in simple kitchen. It is a good choice for a family of four. Their handy free phone is helpful to navigate around Singapore

12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock

review_body: Easy to find and spotted from main street with a great accommodation quality. The room is clean, the bathroom is clean, the kitchen is completed with cooking utensils and tableware. The environment is quiet and comfy to stay and rest.

12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock

review_body: We had very good stay. Every thing was in order and clean. Only issue we saw was the location not being close to MRT, but there was bus stop in shirt distance and hence worked. Would recommend for families.

review_body: All staffs are very helpful...the room was cleaned everyday n love the design...there are a halal restaurant near the apartment...so u guys dont have 2 worry if u r a moeslims...the MRT station that near the property is MRT station tiong bahru

review_body: Great place, great staff and and great location. My kids really glad and ask me if we come back to singapore we have to stay in here. Because the room was big and there are three big TV so the can choose one by one .

12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock

review_body: My kids love the place. I also think it is well designed. The only setback is that it is like 10 minutes from MRT or bus. Quite far if travelling with toddlers or seniors. But all and all, I think the rest are good. We would definitely come back again.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock

review_body: the area of the hotel is so peaceful as well the staff were helpful. many thanks and regards to all staff. For sure I will recommend this residence to my friends and family if they visit Singapore. also it will be in my prior choice for the next time visit to Singapore.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock

review_body: It is located in a quiet place but is easy to locate and get around. 10-min bus ride from the bus stop opposite Tiong Bahru Station and a 10-min walk by foot to Tiong Bahru Market and the whole stretch of the cafes. Can easily take bus to places like a Chinatown and Orchard. As for the facilities and condition of the apartment. I read that it's pretty new but was still shock to see some sign of un-fix wear and tear in the room; chipped wallpaint. The items in room was not properly checked and replenished when we check-in; forget to replenish some hand and bath towels, bathrobes and used shampoos were not removed. Dental kit are also upon request. Bottled water will only be replenished upon request and only once a day refill is allowed can be improved. Kitchen is really small and lack of things such as more cleaning towels. More could be provided for the kitchen. Water pressure and the bed is good; had quality sleep. Good for a short staycation!
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ideally located, great apartments, great rooftop pool, all ideal for family stay in Singapore, especially with smaller kids; staff was extremely friendly with perfect restaurant recommendations suiting our needs and helpful after-checkout regulation - thanks a lot for the perfect stay
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock

review_body: Excellent 2 bedroom apartment which was perfect for our family - parents and 2 kids. Rooms cleaned every day and good rooftop pool. Wonderful eating choices within walking distance and short taxi ride to all major tourist attractions. Will definitely stay again.

review_body: I really enjoyed staying at this property. The appartement is very spacious, clean and comfortable (2 bathrooms!) and the view from the swimming pool is amazing. Unfortunately the wifi was poor which was a major problem for me when on a business trip ...

review_body: It’s about a 5 minute walk to the nearest MRT, and a bus stop is right behind the place. They have a nice swimming pool, but it’s shallow, unfortunately. Out of all of the serviced residences I looked for, this was the best value in Singapore.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock

review_body: Our stay in Louis Kienne was great. Close to the market and easy to commute. The staff was very helpfull. I love its kitchenette. They not only clean the whole apartment but also clean all used kitchenware everyday.

12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock

review_body: we got the 2 bedroom apartment and it was clean, comfortable and has good view of the city. The location is a bit far from MRT, but other options were available. Close by within walking distance are restaurant, food court and convenient store.
hotelName:

review_body: Stayed at the apartment for around 10 days. Very impressed with their service. The rooms are cleaned every single day and the staff at the reception are very courteous and helpful. The location is also good, it’s in a quiet area. Definitely recommend this place for long stay!

review_body: Staying for a short weekend with a colleague we chose the two bedroom apartment. Pros:- Good location in a quiet area- Pool is shallow but refreshing- Shared living room a good size- Nice to have separate bathrooms per bedroomCons:- The walls are ridiculously thing between apartments. You can absolutely hear neighbours. So just hope they are quiet...
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place and wonderful staff. No complains. Maybe consider having a vendor machine for drinks so that we don’t have to walk far to get snacks or drinks. I see many people buying from outside including us.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at their 2 Bedroom Apartment. The room is larger than the average Singapore's hotels. The room it self was really clean, and they comes to clean it every day. Soundproofing insulation was great too. The only minus is, the kitchen. It's more in a small side, but it's fine for light cooking, they also provide microwave and a full size refrigerator. Room style looks modern and minimalist. 5-10 minutes walk from the property, you'll find a hawker center and if you walk for another 5 minutes, you'll find a supermarket called FairPrice. For transportation, there is a bus stop right at the back of property. For guest, there is a gate at the back of property, so you don't need to go around the block. If you're traveling with more than 3 persons, I recommend you to use Grab instead, it could be cheaper.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Far from MRT about 900 meters.There are many rooms there, two bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, 1 common room. There are 3 TVs, kitchen zone, a lot of facilities. Cleanliness, it's great for family or friends groups
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very satisfied with our stay in Louis Kienne (but it is not well know to taxi drivers possibly because the name is difficult to pronounce). The location is a bit far from any metro station. But it is still worth staying here because of the good sized room, the good and helpful management, the free 'Handy' mobile phone. However the kitchen unit is a bit small for serious cooking, we'd prefer a larger food preparation area.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: good staff and cleanliness room and the mineral water we ask for more staff give always to us no complaints.. the best hotel in singapore .beautiful room to stay at hotel . 5 star i give to this room.

12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock

review_body: was recommended by our nephew whom had to stay with you for a long time because of his son sickness that need to be cure in NUH Singapore. He and the whole family need to stay on a longterm basis (already been staying in Louis Kienne Service Residence - Havelock since November. Since then he recommend us to stay in your property and we did.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a month and am satisfied with the cleanliness and upkeep of the place. Staff are friendly and helpful.Location is about 10mins walk to tiong baru mrt.Area for improvement will be the breakfast spread and variety which was exactly the same for all 30days. Small spread is fine but add some variety then.Otherwise all else was pleasant.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brand new, clean & spacious serviced apartments in short walking distance to malls, hawker and MRT etc. Easy MRT/Cab ride into town. My room was very noisy as the walls are paper thin which was the only downside to my stay. Front desk staff were very polite & helpful.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 days, booking 2 rooms. This is actually a serviced residence which is relatively new. For each unit you will have one separate bedroom, one living room with TV and kitchen. It has fridge and ceramic-induced kitchen which will help for you if you plan for extended stay in Singapore. You can buy or cook food, which is always a good option to have. It is located in Old Havelock Road. It's actually quite nicely located, although you need to walk quite far to go to nearest MRT station. We were using Grab/Gojek online taxi every time, so we had no issues. Wait, there was one. But it's minor. The apartment location in GPS was not recorded correctly, so we frequently experienced taxi drivers had to call/text us to find the location. On the map it's located in "Havelock Road", where in fact it was not. Havelock Road is the big road, whereas this apartment's entrance was located in "Old Havelock Road" which is a small road branching out from the big one. Anyway, after the first confusion, we managed to direct the taxi. Since it is a relatively new apartment, many taxis might not know this place. But I reckon, this would be less and less problem in the future. Ok back to the unit. I found the place was clean and neatly organized. The aircon was cold, and the shower was hot (important!). It's also quite spacey, so we had no problem in storing our luggages or stuffs around. On the facilities, it has small swimming pool on the rooftop. It's only 12 m in length and 1 m in depth. It's located next to the guest lounge/restaurant, so you might not feel ease being watched by those having breakfast. For me, no problem. I had good time doing my weekly exercise and swam quite many laps in the morning. For the joggers, the apartment is actually located near to Clarke Quay. Where you can find nice jogging track along the river, and leading to Boat Quay, Fullerton and Merlion. Nice scenic track. Just look at your map and find the closest route to the track. It's about 500m walk going there. No big deal. You'll have fun afterwards. Just across the apartment, you'll also find a mini market. Very convenient for you to buy daily supplies. Outside the hotel they also have vending machine for snacks and beverages. I found it useful, as you might feel hungry on midnight and you had no mini bars in the room. Overall I feel very comfortable staying in this place. If you plan to go to Singapore for a extended days, and main objective is not for shopping, you can consider this apartment. As it's relatively new, the owner might give you good price/discount over Agoda (as I experienced). So all in all, I would recommend this place.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice, clean, spacious hotel room. About the only complaint is that the shower is a little compact and it is a little distance from the MRT. A really pleasant place to stay and I will stay here on my next visit to Singapore!
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We check out early tomorrow morning after a 9 night stay for our family of 5. I am delighted to give this accommodation a 5 star rating because of how lovely the staff are. The security gentleman is lovely, and the breakfast staff put a smile on our face everyday. They could not do enough for us. Jenny, Cecilia and the gentleman that cooks the eggs were so friendly. You made our stay a delightful one and have not experienced genuine friendly service like yours before. A big thankyou!The room is clean, spacious and close to mrt if you are okay with a short walk. This has food options and supermarket.The room also replaces complimentary water bottles everyday which is lovely. Rooms are spacious and perfect for larger families.Thankyou for a lovely stay!!
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place was well maintained and cleaned daily . Well furnished and nice peaceful location .. not so close to MTR but walkable (10 mins ) .. good decent swimming pool on the roof .. and special mention to the cordial and helpful front desk ...overall enjoyed the stay
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms where clean and felt new. Service was top class. Location is quiet with food and store nearby. Swimming pool with views is first class. two rooms we stayed in had its own bathroom and TV. Great for a family of Four
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well located, beautifully furnished with all the mod cons. Enough room for a family with kids to run around or equally with space for a business traveller to work. High quality new build place to stay in Singapore. Outstanding, knowledgeable service from the front desk.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great apartment to stay! Plenty of room with modern furnishings. The Airconditioner worked really well and considering how hot Singapore it was great to come home to a cool room. There is a pool on the rooftop. It was also pretty central to everywhere as cabs are pretty cheap.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was stay for 3 nite.. and my family is very happy with time in this hotel.. i am from Indonesia and i hope will comeback again with another happyness.. singapore with cleanly weather and good people
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family with 1 baby. The room is clean and the facilities provided is complete (for longer stay, it would be better if there is a washing machine inside). The nearest public transport available is the bus stop behind the apartment, 10mins walk to nearby Fairprice and 15mins walk to the MRT and famous Tiong Bahru market. In overall, we are happy with our stay at the apartment though it would be better if the room is on higher floor.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stay for one and half month, good location for travel around Singapore. Walking distance to MRT, Fair Price. Bus stop right outside hotel and bus can reach Chinatown, Clarke Quay, Raffles and etc. Comfortable stay for longer period.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock

review_body: This is not near train station but just behind it js a bus station (ganges ave). The front is not on a main road but the back is. Compared to most hotels in singapore this has space! Staff was ok there is no mote front desk after 1030pm. Just security. There is a short cut to tiong bahru through the hawker center but it aint easy to find for incoming guest. Someone has to teach you.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check in was quickStaffs are friendly. Azizah, The Assistant Director of Sales was very very helpfull (planning my other stay)I booked 2 bed room apartment for couple days and 1 bed room apartement for the other days. Both type of rooms were really nice. well equipped, clean and spaciousfor the 2 bedroom apartment, it has 3 bathrooms and for 1 bedroom apartment it has 2 bathrooms (its a very nice thing)Washer and Dryer also provided for common use (use token)Big Supermarket (Nina Fair Price) just 10 minutes walksome food stall also nearbyLocation : Not too much restaurant nor shops. located in a quite area.vending machine sells some snacks and drinks is located in front of the lobbyBus Stop just 5 minutes walkNo MRT station nearby

review_body: Caring, Composed, Helpful. Very fortunate to be placed and decided to stay in this serviced apartment. Would always recommend this residence for family and friends. Please do try before opting other serviced apartments.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The bathroom is tiny, but clean room, nice interior.In the breakfast restaurant, 2 staff are welcoming you with good hospitality and perfect fried egg.When you call grab car, it’s easy to go everywhere in central of the city.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Louis ki is perfect place for family, they provide all you need like toaster, big refrigerator, stove etc in apartment. Kids happy stays here. If you improve your service by add shuttle bus/ car to orchard every an hour it would be perfect !
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock

review_body: Will definitely book this again and again. I recommemd these for family. Near bus stop. But perfect to call grab or taxi. You can cook the utensils were complete. Near convenience store too.The breakfast were deliciohs and very friendly people will assist you.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Front desk service s good.We arrived at hotel two hours early,we put the luggages in the front desk,when we came back and checked in,the luggages have been in our room.The small swimming pool on the roof bring us a happy time.Although there was a construction work in process not far away,The noise was hardly to heard,The living envirnment is rather quiet, Last midnight at the LOUIS KIENNE,we were scared by the false fire alarm .
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment was very clean and the kitchen had plenty of supplies. The pool was nice. The apartment isn't super close to anything but the MRT station is an easy walk as is a grocery store and a few restaurants.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good place to stay in Singapore. Good place to stay in Singapore. Room with good facilities and is clean. Near bus station and 10 mins walk to a mall. Quiet neighbourhood. Highly recommend. Would stay here again next time
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was staying for 3 nights at the 2 bedrooms unit, it was good and furnished with modern stuffs with 3 TVs inside! Mini kitchen available if you want to cook.Nice pool is available at the rooftop. From the apartment, we need to take about 15mins walk to the Tiong Bahru station or about 5mins walk to the nearest bus stop. Recommended for family stay.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Please provide more towels. Should not have to use the same towel for showering and swimmingProvide written instructions on how to operate the combo microwave/grilling oven.Please provide more clothes hangars. There were very few (5 or 6) in the room.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easy to check in and check out. The room is clean and big enough With 2 bathrooms. And the kitchen hv complete equipment. The location just 5-8 minute to orchard by taxi. We will be back to stay at there again. Thank you.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed almost 4 months in this service apartment. This is not a premium or luxury service apartment as its advertising suggest.Pro:- Nice marbled entrance with uniformed staff (but no proper lobby)- Nice small rooftop pool- Plenty parking availableCons:- Location is not that close to any MRT at all. (min. 15 mins walk to MRT)- Terrible room construction, thin walls. You can hear everything next door.- Terrible facilities. The indoor "guest lounge" is only used as a breakfast area and is closed otherwise the entire day. The outdoor "guest lounge"/sitting area in the tropics is not even equipped with a fan...- Terrible breakfast selection. Really cheap and small selection with no change.- No service lift. Guests and hotel staff share 2 tiny lifts, so the lifts do get clogged up with maintenance workers and housekeeping during the day- The advertised "gym" is non-existent - a straight ad fraud.Service/Staff- Very friendly front desk staff- Very friendly breakfast servers- Below average room service (not vacuumed regularly)- Extremely rude security staff (there is an Indian lady who is extremely rude, i almost got into a fight with her - she should be trained in basic customer service)- Poor management. Feedback is met with silence and non-action. Seems like they only react when its made public on the internetSummary:Its an overpriced budget service apartment that advertises itself to be 4-star luxury. Nothing of that sort. Not recommended at all.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went on a week trip with baby. We really felt comfortable like being in home. Friendly and caring staff. Room facilities(+kitchen) were really good. The lil one loved the place. You can go for it if you need hotel+home environment.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family 2 adults and 1 ado ( 17 years) in the same apartment with 2 roomsVery good staff, little swimming pool on the floor but sufficient. We need a doctor and the staff helps us very quickly. All was very good!!!
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We’ve just spent 4 nights with my family with 3 children 5, 9 and 11 years old. Not very keen on the location but we downloaded Grab application on the phone and had no problem to get anywhere. Also, the hotel gives you a cortesy phone where you can use and call any taxi, so although you are not in the city centre we haven’t had any trouble.We had 2 bed apartment with 3 bathrooms, they were small but great (all with shower, not bath). The swimming pool is at the topfloor. It’s a narrow pool and shallow but it is great! My kids fully enjoyed it! You have nice views from there so it was great spending some time there until the end of the day (it closes at 11pm). Also, we used it 3 times and always we were the only ones! Great! The breakfast is basic, we tried once and decided to have breakfast at the apartment. There is a 7/11 store nearby for buying basic stuff.Overall, great experience! If you don’t mind taking taxi (they are not usually too expensive) it is a smart choice, specially travelling with kids.
hotelName:
12    Louis Kienne Serviced Residences - Havelock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been Singapore many times very glad to stay at four point night river view, many choices of restaurant. Just a bit point is pool a bit small coz my daughter like to swim. The location is good not far from town.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable stay in a good location in Singapore. Closest metro is China town which is a 5 minute bus ride away with a bus stop right outside the hotel. Rooms were clean but quite small and a little dated. Gym was also extremely small but overall a reasonably priced hotel in Singapore that serves your needs well.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is very attentive and helpful. I recommend one of the staffers, Huai Heng, who helped me with laundry. Generally, all the staff have been very attentive and knowledgeable. Would recommend for others to stay here.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I had an enjoyable night at four points story. Good food with good services. Thank you to Ms Joanne for her hospitality, making us feel relax & homed. Most importantly for going out of her way to serve us. We will definitely be back!
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has a nice view of the river - request a room on the high floor with a view but the only downturn is that their beds are not comfortable! Or maybe I was given a room with a view but with sagging worn-out beds!?
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check in was seamless as I have been to this hotel no less than 10 times. I like the no deposit part for the room since they already have our credit card in the member profile.Room was very "Four Points" and feel pretty much at home.Breakfast spread was pretty standardized and nothing amazing. Swimming pool was very deep and the floor was very slippery and as a result, my son fell down and got a bump on his head. Love the feeling at Best Brew and their local craft beer.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel and was little concerned about the location. It was my first visit to spore so I was unsure about he where to stay. I must now say that this is a great location, you have opposite of the river a huge choice of restaurants and walking distance to Clark Quay and downtown if you want. Also very happy with the hotel, clean, quite and everything works well.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Unfortunately I didn’t book this room as I was attending a business meeting so having my wife there made the room seem awfully small after the first day . Didn’t really cope with two suitcases that had already been on holidays for a week . Breakfast was ok but a little bit plain for western food and I’m hanging out for a decent cup of coffee . Staff were friendly and smiling and helpful so no complaints there and if the room was marginally bigger then I would have been very happy . Great shower and bathroom and it was peaceful to sleep . Location is pretty good and the shuttle bus (free) or close public transport is also a bonus
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mr. Prakash was very attentive in helping us with all our heavy luggages from the elevator and putting and tagging the luggages in storage. He was also very helpful in loading our luggages into the taxi. He was very geniue, friendly, and accomodating We really appreciate him. He is to be commended for a job well done!
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently had my 31st (!) stay at this hotel. There are plenty of reasons I keep coming back. The staff is awesome, and they are always helpful with any kind of extra support. The rooms are very comfortable and housekeeping does a nice job. The breakfast buffet is very complete, and the staff has made an extra effort over the last year to raise the standards to an even higher level. Location is great, whether you need something from Great World City nearby, are looking for restaurants just out the back door, or want to go for a run along the Singapore River. I've stayed for business and on trips for fun, and recommend it for both.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights and upon arrival, I was checked in by Mr Nelson at the front desk who allocated a perfect room with an amazing view for me. I later went to the concierge for recommendations and I found Mr Prakash & Farhan, these guys were super amazing and the best part of the hotel is the Sport Bar(Best Brew), the staff working at the bar names are as follow: Izar, Margarita, Farid, Apple and Hafiz, these staff have made my stay more comfortable and pleasant.Thank you guys and keep your head up cause you're doing an amazing job.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The entire staff was helpful and friendly. They all made my stay enjoyable. This is not my first trip to Singapore, but is my first time staying here at the Four Points.Because of the staff, I will come here for my next visit to Singapore.Though all staff were very gracious, the one who stands out is the person who took care of my room.Susila, from the 14th floor, was most gracious. She is competent, caring, and charismatic. She took the extra time to help me, teach me, and take care of me. Certainly my room was always clean and orderly, but more importantly, she treated me like family and made my day more enjoyable. She is a good hire; keep her. :)Cheers,db
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I last stayed here about three years ago after the hotel reopened following a complete refurbishment and rebranding. I just had a great return weekend so thought it deserves another review.This is probably the best value Marriott hotel in Singapore and you have to judge it by the standard it sets itself: the room rate and the Four Points brand. As such I thoroughly recommend it. They actually improved the offering since it reopened.Staff are excellent throughout from check in to check out. It feels like a good place to work. As a Titanium Bonvoy member I get a few benefits including a minor room upgrade to a riverview room (the hotel has a few suites and I got one last time), late checkout at 4pm, breakfast as the welcome gift, and - best of all - two hours of drinks in the bar from 6-8pm. This is new since my last stay and makes up somewhat for the lack of a lounge (though Four Points don’t generally have Executive Lounges).The room feels well maintained and has a coffee plunger for early mornings and the full range of bathroom amenities including shaver and toothbrushes.Breakfast buffet is excellent for a FP and reflects the diverse ethnic groups in Singapore with all Western and Asian tastes catered for. Snacks were served with bar drinks during happy hour but they wouldn’t make a meal. Some people complain that the hotel is not on the MRT. If it was then it would not go for S$160++ a night and give you two hours of beer/wine/spirits in this expensive country. I happily walked to both Chinatown and Clarke Quay in 15 minutes. If it was priced higher then you’d be comparing it to the Sheraton or the Vagabond but as it is this is now my go-to hotel in Singapore for a quick weekend away that doesn’t break the bank. I’m back for three nights in August.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only stayed here one night after a frustrating mess-up at the Quincy and weren't on the property long. We found the room a bit tight and the bed pretty firm. The bathroom was fine. We had dinner outside by the river, which was nice, and I could tell there were some things we could have explored across the river but we didn't have time. Overall I got the sense that this hotel wasn't situated beside a lot of things and that you'd need to make an effort to shop or see attractions. So while the hotel was fine and nothing really wrong with the room, other than the points I'd get, I didn't see much here that set it up as an advantageous location or that would cause me to come back.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived and booked in already. Room nice size, clean with kettle, coffee maker and fridge. Free water, slippers and toothbrushes each day. Bar prices par for the course. Cross River bridge outside hotel bar doors to other bars and restaurants. Robertson Quay around 7-8 minutes walk and Clarke quay around 15-20 minutes walk. 50 minutes walk to raffles bar or bay side area
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this hotel for 7 nights and let me tell you that is far from the main attractions, the MRT is a long walk especially with the excruciating heat of Singapore about 20-25 mins walk, the closest MRT is Chinatown, the buses stop in front of the hotel and you can manage to move around in the bus.One of the greatest amenities for me was the free cell phone in the room, I took it everywhere with me and it came with 4G which it was extremely useful, also the international phone calls to the USA were free, YES, free, which is unbelievable in today's world. The front desk people were not really nice but there was a young guy that made a BIG difference for me, PRAKASH, he was really helpful and gave amazing hints about the city, on top of that he helped me with my suitcases and every time he saw me he greeted me and told me if I needed anything just to let him know. Prakash thanks for being so kind, you made my trip in Singapore better.My room was not very nice as some of the pictures posted here but it was clean and every day I got 2 free bottles of water which I really appreciated.The breakfast come with lots of options it was good. Behind the hotel is Robertson Quay and there are tons of restaurants in the area so you can choose, the walk along the river is beautiful and very safe.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I went over for breakfast - and it was great! The spread was good, with a large of variety of food from different cuisines. Importantly, the staff was very polite and helpful! Will definitely go back for more meals soon.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is just beside Singapore reiver, many upstream restaurant on the other side of the river. You will enjoy breakfast next to the bridge. Staffs are friendly, room is quite small, but clean and tidy. Bus is just at hotel door so I did go around by taking bus very easily.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Planning to visit Singapore? Member of Marriott rewards? Suggest trying this hotel. Although our short 2 1/2 day visit was filled with lots of touring around, we found this property to be perfectly situated to mount our excursions. Within minutes you are by the Singapore River and numerous hotels and a great river boat excursion to see the wonderful skyline. The people at this Sheraton seemed genuinely caring and desiring to help you. I use "genuine" purposely as I have been in numerous hotel where the staff is quite "nice" and "polite" and helpful, but somehow you feel that is not how they are when they go home. The morning breakfast buffet was outstanding and plentiful and respectful of the many cultures that flock to this city. Yes Singapore is clean and seems safe - by sheer threat of penalty, but every Singaporean I spoke to said they gladly trade some freedoms to have what they have. I confess I found it appealing. So, if you go, consider the Sheraton. The rooms are nice, though a tad small, but the views were practically worth the stay alone!!
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this hotel during a business trip to Singapore. Location was good as its little away for the crowd of riverside but all good restaurants are within walking distance. Check in was breeze and I was allotted a room at higher floor as requested. However, they did not have any double bed room and was allotted a twin bed room which was little disappointing. Otherwise was very happy with the amenities. Adequate toiletries in bathroom, good size bath tub, enough drinking water bottle in room. Their vending machine can have better choices for some quick bites. Did not use the in hotel restaurants but they had enough choices. Breakfast was very good with various Asian, continental and bakery options. They were also helping us to get taxis for our daily commute to the office. Would definitely come back again.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We opted for a river view and the room was perfect. Our request for a high level room and was accommodated. The view was nice, and we could just see the Marina Bay Sands boat. Nice air-conditioning and a fridge to keep your refreshments cold. We investigated breakfast else where, but found the hotel price for the buffet pretty comparable to local eateries. Plus the variety of the food was amazing. The pool, steam room and gym area is really nice. You can order food to the pool via a phone by the water cooler. Across the bridge there are several places to eat/drink and a 7-eleven mini mart for refreshing beverages. No close by MRT station, but GRAB taxi's (similar to Uber) are a cheap alternative. 6 Singapore dollars to Satay Street, a bit more on the return, and 18 to the airport. Normal check out is 12, but if you ask you can extend it to 2pm for no extra charge. Staff were friendly at check in/out, and we found the breakfast buffet staff exceptional. We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stopped for one night in this hotel, the staff was very nice and friendly and allowed us to check in early. I was pleasantly surprised from entering the reception area, it's sparkling clean and it smells floral. The room was big enough for 2 people with plenty of facilities, charging points, storage space and all sorts of minis in the bathroom. Beds were comfortable and towels plenty. I would totally recommend for this price point
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I pick this hotel for my stay during biz trip (23-24 May) since it’s quite close to my SG office + I’m Marriott SPG Addict.. Whenever I travel, I’ll always pick SPG/Marriott affiliated hotel.. I have stayed in a lot of Four Points Hotel Chain and never had this “wow” experience like this one.. Wow in a “meh” way.. First I’m actually a titanium bonvoy member (supposed to be the highest tier) so of course i expect more.. No suite upgrade offered and when i asked, they just said “it’s full”.. Then i asked for room with 1 bed but they said that i need to wait for 30 mins - 1 hour.. how come? I have checked in online, they should have prepared the room already.. So i settled with twin bed one and go to office directly.. the surprise is at late night when i came back from the office and looking to have a bath then good sleep.. The towel is full of a dust (see pic) Oh wow.. then i asked for towel replacement, the staff (chinese guy) give me the towel with a “huh” not even a greeting plus he’a busy with his phone?!? Then i noted that the carpet near the bed have hardened puke + it’s smelly OMFG (see pic).. I’m super tired already, no energy to put a complaint and it’s almost midnight so i’m going directly to the bed.. and the biggest surprise of all is the bed SUCK.. so the bed is actually not flat, worn out and kinda sunk in some place.. 2 beds actually in the same condition + it’s dusty as well.. When I woke up in the morning, guess what??? I have backpain.. the reason i give this 2 stars are - breakfast is amazing (esp smiling auntie at omelette section) and shower is pretty great.. I did complain and show this picture when i checked out and they just said “sorry, we’ll investigate”.. I paid ++ SGD 200 for this stay, only to get backpain + bad sleep.. I pay around SGD 100 for four points Jakarta / Bali and they overdelivered.. definitely blacklisted this one!!
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am about to finish a 5 night stay at the Four Points Sheraton, Riverview, Singapore.It is a good hotel, well kept and maintained, with fantastic friendly staff. the room is a decent size, with very little outside noise (17th Floor). Straight out the back of the hotel and just across the bridge are half a dozen bars/restaurants. I can recommend "Toby's Estate Coffee" for breakfast. Decent portions and a proper cappuccino (similar to the great coffee we get in Melbourne) which is often hard to get in Singapore.My only suggestions for improvements are very minor gripes (1 - the bath/shower is smallish so the shower curtain ends up "sticking to your side when you are under the shower, and the water drains along the ridge and onto the floor, which then needs mopping up......2, there are no snacks in the fridge at all, 3, the gym looks pretty small and 4, the pool looks pretty small as well).I didn't check to see if there was an Exec Lounge here (I'm not yet Platinum!).Other than that, no issues at all.You can grab a free paper on every floor each day - a nice touch. Taxi's and Grab are easy t get and pretty quick to get. The hotel is close to a lot of the action.Overall, a very pleasant stay and I'd come back again.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My go to hotel when I am in Singapore. Rooms are clean and everything is very efficient. No problems in checking in making my business trip efficient.There's also a nice scenic walk near behind the hotel and a lot of good place to have great coffee and some.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I had have a very nice stay at the four points Sheridan. The staff was friendly and efficient. Susila the housekeeper on the 14th floor was excellent! My husband and I both agreed that when we come back we would request her floor. The hotel is in a good location and it was easy to get around too many of the wonderful sites in Singapore. We both recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed a night. Hotel is very central. Taxi costs about $17 from the airport. Hotel is clean and views are great. Bathroom a little small but perfect for 4 star. Staff are friendly and everything is clean and well organized
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good buffet spread.Excellent service from Chef Wilson, Aaron, Che Hean & Chuan Khiay.Service staff are very polite and they consistently clear the dirty plates promptly.Job well done.Thank you all for making our dining experience a pleasant one.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good evening out at 1 for 1 dinner buffet with Chope app. We had some impeccable table service from Chef Alan who served us laksa even though it was a self-service station. The evening manager was very helpful as well. And so was the Malay boy's service (he was in charge of the manning the phone). Special mention to the 3 (and also to Chef Calvin and Wan).
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros -The rooms are good, the toiletries are better than others. I found the people in housekeeping also friendly. The breakfast area is very good as you can seat on the riverfront to have your breakfast. Cons -They do not have Kids pool.The Beds are not very comfortable.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 2 nights and utilised the conference/meeting rooms, all in all the facilities and staff met my expectations. Easy walk to both Robertson and Clarke Quays. Room was comfortable and quite, cleanliness was excellent
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I have just returned to the UK from a 13 day holiday in Singapore, where we stayed at the Four Points by Sheraton Hotel for twelve nights. We had a wonderful Holiday, seeing a lot of changes from my previous trip to Singapore in 1978. Our stay at the Four Points played a big part in making our holiday so memorable. Before we arrived, I was able to have questions answered relating to our trip by Cindy, Guest Manager, who made sure everything was in place for our arrival. She also arranged some lovely touches to our room as this was our 25th Wedding Anniversary Trip. During our stay her colleague Khoo Huei Sim, made contact to check if there was any assistance we needed. Because everything was so good at the Hotel, we had no need for help, as all our needs were met by the friendly and professional staff. Our Room had a great view of the City and had everything we needed to make our stay comfortable. A couple of days, we had done a lot of walking and enjoyed a lovely light supper in our room, which was not overly priced. We had a number of meals in the Hotel, from breakfast, through lunch to evening meals, either in the ground floor restaurant or adjacent Bar. All were great value and very enjoyable and it was nice we didn’t have to eat out if we didn’t want to. If we did eat out we often went to one of the local Restaurants, across the river from the Hotel via a convenient bridge. These ranged from an Italian Restaurant, through to a Sports Bar and Restaurants serving local cuisine. The Hotel location was ideal for us. We were a short walk to two convenient Metro Stations, Clarke Quay and Chinatown. At the latter we could buy travel cards, which allowed us to use buses and Metro for either 1, 2 or 3 days unlimited travel. If we wanted, we could get the 51 Bus from right outside the Hotel which took us to Clarke Quay Metro Station. Staff assisted us with their knowledge of Singapore Transport and on occasion helped us get Taxis if public transport wasn’t convenient. We are not great Pool People, but had a number of lovely relaxing times by the Pool on the 5th Floor, the advantage of an extended stay. This stayed open late, so we could have a relaxing swim at pretty much any time of day. We had one night away at the Marina Bay Sands Hotel during our stay, but I thought my wife was right. When we came back after our night away, my wife said “well that was nice, but its nice to be home”. We did feel like Four Points was like our ‘Home’ for two weeks. We felt special and spoiled. We could fault nothing. Singapore has a huge number of top Hotels throughout the City, but if we ever come back, we will look no further than the Four Points.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I come here few times, the rate just increase more n more, yet the service is worsing everytime.Itvtakes almost 1 hr to ask house keeping to change to fresh towel, and the operator n room service Line, always NO ONE pick up.As a platinum ambasador, in here means nothing. Dun even thini abt room upgrade, they dun even acknoledge you as a highest loyalti status .becouse the hotel is high occupancy with business traveler whom paid by the company, the hotel seems no care whatsoever abt the quality, etc.As long ppl stay, thats all theyb matterThe only good point here is that free flow happy hour from 6-8pm.The rest is blah...If u pay by yourself, dun expect to much from this hotel property n staff conpare to other marriot group hotel.Summarry,Room 3/5 ( its four points after all)Service 2/5Staff 2/5Price 2/5Location 2/5 (must grab to everywhere)
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I come to Singapore every other month and found my home away from home. There are lots of nice hotels in Singapore, but the location and staff make this my favorite. Rosa in the restaurant is amazing, always makes my meal that much better. And my last trip the person cleaning my room, Chen Yue Huh, bent over backwards to make the stay enjoyable. You can walk across the bridge and have access to enough bars and restaurants to last a year. Highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 3 Ladies and We had two rooms stayed for 5 nights and had the best experience... from the moment we pulled up out the front concierge greeted us the reception staff were friendly and our rooms were comfortable they made sure we were on the same floor and had everything we needed (river view is nice!) The hotel has access to some great local restaurants but the buffet breakfast at the hotel is unbeatable!! the chef has obviously worked hard to make the food work for all visitors we really enjoyed the fresh baked goods that were offered around by staff. Our room cleaner Chen Yue Hua was absolutely amazing nothing was too much trouble she made sure we had enough of everything especially the shampoo and conditioner you know two ladies 1 room haha, even down to making sure we had the right pillows to make put stay comfortable what an experience (beds are comfortable). All the staff were friendly and treated us like family. There is a bus stop out the front which was super helpful, We did catch a few taxi’s as it was a cheap fast way to travel and never waited to long concierge called and ordered taxis for us and reception kindly exchanged notes to coins for the busses. this stay was a highlight and we were sad to leave! Thanks Four Points Singapore!!
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service by Chef Wan, Khiang & Mark were awesome. The food was good and nice! The price w Chope! was worth it. Wish there were more seafood selection and some cheese. But overall the food and service was worth the price.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent food with mix variety. DExclusive intro Chef Wan, Khiang, Seng ! Variety from chinese, Vietnamese, thai, western and great dessert to end of with. Staff were extremely friendly and plates were cleared very fast too
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All the staff that we dealt with gave excellent, friendly customer service. The amenities were excellent, the rooms very clean and I absolutely loved the food choices at breakfast. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Clark Quay along the river footpath. Our stay was very enjoyable. There was also a bus stop virtually outside the hotel which gave easy access to other parts of the city. I would definitely stay there again.We were also allowed early check in and a late check out and use of the facilities whilst waiting for our late flight out, at no extra cost. The pool was ok to cool off in, not too big but adequate size. My only issue , like in most hotels, is the cost of drinks at the bar.Overall a great stay, made by excellent helpful staff.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at 4Points in Jan 2017, which at that point of time was fairly new. Love the hotel, staff was nice and everything was new and fresh. This hotel however is not located in the city centre, but in Singapore, this is never a problem.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited Singapore for work purposes and then the family joined me for a long weekend. The management team did a great job with changing my room once due to a crying baby in the next room and then another day later to a suite that became available. Special thanks to Khoo Huei Sim with excellent Customer Service! Also the person, Santosh, that checked me in the hotel with remembering my name a day later.We ate dinner in the hotel restaurant the first night with excellent service. The next night, the server needs improvement as he quoted the price of my happy hour beer wrong (higher) by $2.00 and then charged me an adult pizza when we ordered the pizza off the kids menu for my 7 year old daughter. When I requested the change in price, he dismissed me.Regardless, i would highly recommend this hotel mainly because of Khoo Huei Sim.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a short stopover in Singapore and we were happy that we stayed at this hotel. Nice room, kind staff and beautiful view of the river. As a Bonvoy platinum member we had the buffet breakfast for free. It was good with many choices, There are several eateries nearby.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Chef Calvin + Yong Wan + Hsien are very friendly and attentive to our healthy diet request. They ensure we have good quality food and always checking on us whether is good for us. The food is good and the staff are very friendly.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for one night during a stopover in Singapore. We were very impressed with our checkin, where the staff were very friendly, considerate, and accommodating. Our room was lovely, with a nice view of the city surrounds. Lots of choices for dining in the hotel. Great pool area, with fitness equipment and steam room.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Writing this review while still in hotel. Satyed here for 6 days. Overall expeyis ok. Breakfast ia good. Location is ok. If you need to travel by tube its 1 km away. Taxis are available easily. Faced two issues. Room had quite some insects. Informed reception but nothing was done except an apology. Second in my room a nail was protruding from the carpet. Got hurt. They solved the issue but its hard to believe that no one noticed it before. Overall a ok experience.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location on the river In Clarke quay. Food was excellent and staff very accommodating. Special shout out to Sous Chef Alan Tan and his amazing chicken Karaage!! Get it at the breakfast buffet. Thank you all.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Superb service during Sunday Brunch. Chef Chong and Chef Anthony were extremely attentive to our needs and went the extra mile to deliver the food to our table from the buffet line. The prawns were big and extremely juicy, the spread
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love the food and ambiance!Chef Chong is friendly and helpful!Will recommend friends to this place . Had sushi, mussels, live prawns, Black Forrest cakes and free wine too. Fresh prawns with herbal soup is nice too! The people here are helpful and efficient too. They clear the plates quite immediately after you leave your seat. The place is clean! Love this place. Thanks for the wonderful time!
hotelName:
