13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Food was great but the most memorable was the incredible hospitality provided. Chef Chong, wan, Arron and ANT were particularly friendly and contributed significantly to my experience here. Will definitely return for such pleasant experience
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m staying here for the third time in the last three years. The hotel is conveniently located next to the Singapore river, so it’s easy to go for a walk to Robertson or Clarke Quay. I also enjoy sitting outside on the decked area for a drink or a meal. The staff are friendly and efficient. Susila, who cleaned my room on the fourteenth floor this visit, did a great job, and always said hello and asked how I was if I met her in the corridor in the morning. Once I returned, later in the day, the room had been cleaned with new towels and soap etc. as necessary.Alice in the restaurant remembered my name from a year ago, and always ensures that you have a good place to eat breakfast and that you can find what you want from the excellent and extensive open buffet. I’ll definitely return next time I’m in Singapore.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited Four Point Eatery on 07 Apr, I must compliment that the service provided to me and my friends were pleasant as well as going the extra miles by the service crew, Mr.Saravanan and Mr. Alex, the manager in charge.We were promptly being served when seated down and greeted by the staffs with a warm smile and hospitality. Throughout our dining experience there, they've never fail to provide their utmost service to me and my friends. They have extended their services beyond my expectation. We felt very pleasure and engaging to be able to serve by them and will definitely return to Four Point Eatery again.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely hotel that is well situated to explore SIngapore. The room was clean and a good size, the buffet breakfast had a good selection it appeared there was something for everyone. The staff where friendly and helpful from check in to leaving. It is a lovely walk along the river all the way to the marina. There are a several places close by to across the river to eat and drink if you fancy a change from the hotel. The closest underground (MRT) at Fort Canning is a bit of a walk, if mobility is an issue then check the taxis.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a wonderful stay at the Four Points Sheraton. Only negative is that it is not very close to MRT. For those that want to avoid the 20 minute walk, there is a bus line right in front or you can get a taxi or Grab very quickly.Being avid walkers in our own city, we didn’t mind it at all. Especially when the walk takes you down their beautiful river walk area. Rooms were clean and the breakfast was really good! Nice staff and decent pool. Would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a lovely relaxing place to stay beside the river. It was so pleasant to be able to exit from the lounge and immediately be wandering riverside, under the shelter of trees. Staff were extremely helpful, they went beyond expectations and were so accommodating when we had a very late flight departure.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly staffs, special thanks to Chef Alan, How, Aaron, Seng, Calvin, and Wan. Nice food with reasonable price! The service is very good. Seafood is fresh. Environment is clean and welcoming. Will definitely like to come back again in the future.
hotelName:
13    Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: WE recently stayed at The Novotel for 3 nights on our return from Thailand back to NZ. This hotel is situated right next to Clarke Quay and is fairly central in Singapore, its location is great with easy access to MRT just round the corner and taxis are cheap as chips too with taxis arriving regularly at the main door, so not long to wait to get out and about.The staff were excellent, very attentive and so helpful. We changed room 3 times when we first arrived due to the fact that we were unhappy with the 1st 2 as we were too close to the lifts with the 1st room and my partner would not have slept very well & the 2nd room had a bit of a musty smell to it & being on the 20th floor again my partner had abit of vertigo so we were given a room down on the 14th floor closer to other family members on our trip. I know we were abit fussy and I was very apologetic to the reception staff but they were fantastic, being understanding about our "issues" and they said it wasn't a problem so we were very appreciative of their professional attitude and demeanour and for their assistance to help their demanding clients and make us happy. With regard to the room we had I thought it does look a little dated in terms of decor and could probably do with an update as we've stayed at quite a few Novotel hotels and it's probably not quite as good as others we've stayed at (sorry) but it was ok. Our 1st room was looking towards the Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay Sands but the 2nd and our final room was overlooking the pool & city & despite the decor, the room was clean, tidy, quiet and the beds very comfortable. We had a great sleep (we had twin beds so had a bed each rather than a king bed but we were ok with that) and we had to thank the lovely lady who manned the desk opposite the check in as she helped us obtain a late check out which made a huge difference for us since we weren't due to fly out of Singapore till late and being able to depart the hotel at 4.30pm was such a big help. We were very grateful for the benefits that having a Gold Accor card can provide but I think the staff at this hotel will help all their guests the same way if possible, I cannot stress how impressed we were with the service from the staff here, they were excellent. We also ate food from the Le Rouge bar as well as had breakfast at the restaurant on our first morning and the food was lovely, very enjoyable, kids loved the pancakes! So would we stay here again? Yes Definitely!
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a lovely stay here. Fab pool and lovely room. Breakfast was excellent. Great location. Close to bars and restaurants and very lively at night. Great place to stay with children. Will visit again. Get the bus out the front of the hotel which you can hop on and off all day. The ticket is valid for 24 hrs. Air conditioned which is great as very muggy .
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location for central Singapore.Good quality hotel.I was on the club level and the lounge is a very good retreat when you get back to the hotel, warm and in need for a cold drink. Good service as well.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An above average point for the bedroom cleanliness. A Novotel standard for the breakfast services and bathroom amenities.Placed above the Liang Court Mall, easily you can find lot of restaurants in the ground floor. Or with a minute walk to the outside of the building, you can reach the complex of hangout neighborhood. Place of bars and restaurants that some of those are have the singapore river view position.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Novotel Clark Quay earlier this year , while on an official visit to Singapore. This was my 2nd stay and i chose it because of the great central location. Its a 2 minutes walk to Clark Quay and 15 to 30 minutes by taxi to all the major areas of Singapore. Commuting to and from this hotel is very convenient as taxis are easily available . The concierge stationed on the ground floor are always there to help. Check in was quick and hassle free after a full night flight and an early morning arrival. I was staying on the 21st floor and the city view from the room is stunning. Breakfast selection is good with a wide variety of Chinese , Western and Indian Dishes. Rooms are very very clean as is the whole of Singapore. I just found them to be a little too simple in decor but nothing to complain about. Over all the hotel staff is attentive and its was a pleasure staying at this property. Will come back again for sure.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Like all Novotels this one has great customer service. There are quite a few truly outstanding staff who made my stay memorable - Patricia the golden-aged waitress who smiles so sweetly and bows to every walk-in customer, Joana the restaurant usher who remembers my name and room number and not forgetting the Assistant Manager Sri who truly understands what a customer wants. Kindly thank them on my behalf. The front desk officer who checked me in is truly amazing too. Can't quite recall her name - Carrie (or Catherine)? There are annoyances which can be worked on to make the experience even better. (i) The token-operated washing machine broke down 3 times in my 4-week stay, each time taking 3 days to be fixed, and, (ii) Room service is anything but consistent - the number of items being replenished depends on luck.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel’s location is perfect. Situated on Clarke Quay means there are stacks of choices for eating especially our favourite, Violet Oon just around the corner. There are 2 MRT stations within easy walking distance. We purchased a card each and topped it up which meant using the train was very easy. If you have any money left on your card when it’s time to go then you can get a refund. Just remember to have some ID on you. The hotel has a pool and a couple of washing machines and dryers you can use yourself. Each cost $10 a load. The rooms are comfortable. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Right on the edge of clark quay so ideally situated for most areas Hotel basically starts on 7th floor so its 2 sets of elevators not the end of the world but a little inconvenient Overall nice place to stay and a fab breakfast
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location with short distances to eateries around the Quay. Warm reception from personnel on duties. Comfortable room with a good view too. Will be staying here more often in the future when coming into Singapore.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I felt like I was staying in a budget hotel. You have to pay for water, according to the staff, they do not provide more than the 2 bottles. (For tourist, please note that there is a 7-11 downstairs, go there and grab water if you need)There was a leak in toilet, and we had a wet floor, soaked floor towel. Not forgetting the cranky aircon. We had to pack up in the middle of the night and check out. Sad thing is I realised I left some of my stuff in the toilet. I called the hotel up twice and they gave no effort in helping me to check it out. Never try this hotel, with the price, there are many other awesome hotels around Clarke Quay- Swissotel Merchant Court, Park Hotel, Holiday In Clarke Quay, Park Regis, etc
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room nice and tidy. Shower area a bit mouldy, could do with a good scrub. Had two nights of hell with noisy children and parents in the corridors. One night had to yell at them to be quiet. This was 1am in the morning, children screaming and running up and down. Totally disrespectful to other guests. Perhaps the hotel should put parents and children on specific floors so they don’t disturb people that have had long flights. Food for thought. One particular day we had to cue to get into our room as there was a function on one of the floors, we used the shopping centre lifts to skip the cue, but if your not aware of those it’s a bit frustrating. Staff were very helpful and hotel pool was lovely. Very close to Clarke keys.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel and well located if you want to be close to the tourist stuff and convenient restaurants. The place is clean and nice. The staff is super. The room will need some maintenance soon, small stuff. The carpet in locations is pushed up or needs to be tucked. Lots of traffic, so time does this. Overall a nice place that I'd recommend.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upon arrival we were warmly welcomed by the friendly reception staff. They made our trip more interesting when they informed us that we were upgraded complimentary with bay view room.Clean and comfortable, supermarket, shops, restaurants bars are within walking distance. We will certainly recommend to friends and relatives. It really felt like home. Many thanks to the general manager and the whole team for such an amazing experience.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visit Singapore in between June and July 2018 to sail with 5 days cruise. This is the first time we stay in Novotel Clarke Quay. As we all know Clarke Quay is one of Singapore night life where took place. This hotel shares the same building with Liang Court shopping mal. The building itself surrounded by so many restaurants and eating places along the river. The MRT station is within walking distance. Orchard road is just at the corner (walk along clemenceau street and fort canning).The Concierge staffs are so friendly, helpful and pleasant! Thanks to all concierge staffs who have helped and assisted us during our staff. Good location hotel!
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Awesome hotel with extra generous staff special mention to the lady at the reception hazel She saw us having problem with early check in at 6 am in the morning and upgraded us to loungers at the top floor which was amazing The loungers had lot of facilities and the view was beautiful Thanks hazel She’s a gem
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As Accorplus gold member, I stayed there on May12-17, 2019. But for the first time I only got 1 welcome drink with reason hotel policy. I use to get 2 welcome drink whereever I stayed in Singapore (mercure bugis/steven, grand mercure, novotel steven, ibis). And also welcome fruit in the room.A day later guest relation assistant manager sent a letter into my room, She (Mera) recommended me to go to front desk to clarify the issue. So I went to front desk on the next following day, but I only got the explanation about the hotel policy. It was really embaracing experienced, for second times my query were rejected by front desk, maybe the front desk felt they were the winner by successfully rejected guest queries for 2 time.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff in the hotel take a special effort to look after guest comfort particularly the staff in the Executive Lounge. Management is approachable and caring, issues are followed up until resolved. The location is great and the higher floors offer a wonderful view. Most enjoyable overall.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel in a good location. I had a standard queen with breakfast , it was good size and the shower was very good. Breakfast was pretty good , something for everyone really. I would recommend this hotel if you want to be in the middle of the action. Walking distance to most of the night life scene. Plenty of bars and places to get some local cuisine. It was about $25 in a cap from the airport.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this property is superb right in heart of the entertainment area of clarke quay .the hotel reception staff were very warm .they are very rigid with breakfast timing and the staff in restaurant area were rude with the guest this area needs to be worked on by novotel
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a very good location of the Quays . An absolute abundance of restaurants , and just around the corner a shopping centre with a supermarket inside and more restaurants. Hotel has a swimming pool. Clean yes. The room balcony door does not open you have to make a request , guess this was for safety reason's
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed in plenty of Novotel hotels and they are all pretty standard. This is not a negative when all you need is a good bed, place to work and a shower that is hot.The location of this one is good if you like what Clarke Quay has to offer (poor food at a high price). I would suggest a walk to Boat Quay or taxi to some place else.I enjoyed swimming laps in the pool (25m) each morning. The gym has good basic equipment, but it is small holding a max of three people.I was with colleagues at a meeting. The internet was poor, some were unable to make Skype calls and I couldn’t stream my favourite sports shows at night.One colleague was forced to have cold showers on two occasions in the morning. My company keeps putting us there, I am not sure why.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the hotel is quite good but rooms and hotel lobby are quite old. Quite a disappointment.One thing everyone should know that none of the novotel hotels have a room service, so if u need plates or spoons in your room then you will have to pay 5 dollars. Same is applicable for this hotel. Quite a shocker for the price you paid.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I thx the entire team for making the stay hustle free , the reception, the room service people and the dining was all good not to forget the area one of the best with proximity to all . Thx once again to all the staff members keep it up
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had not been to Singapore for many years and found that the Novotel was in a good location . Close to MRT a supermarket in the basement of the building close to many tourist attractions. The staff were very helpful . The hotel room we stayed in and parts of the hotel were in need of and update things were looking a bit tired had expected better. Would try somewhere else next time.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Novotel is a part of the hospitality industry and the one thing where there was a lot left desired was well hospitality .novotel is my hotel of choice for my stay abroad but this was way below any other Novotel I have been to.the breakfast buffet as easily the worst I have seen .the food is not good at all(especially the Indian food it is inedible ).I had written atleast 20 emails and made countless phone calls over a span of 2 months to get the kids kingdom room but was always given the same reply : booked , upon reaching there I got to know that the room was vacant .being an Accor plus silver member and staying at Novotel so frequently made me think I would be given priority but instead it turned out they did not pay any heed to all my reuqests as simply did not boo the room.worst experience by the standards of Novotel strongly recommend to NOT stay here
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mera, Carla, Ani, Nazria and Felicia Chiam form a fantastic team in the executive lounge. Felicia needs to smile more. The lounge is overlooking Clarke Quay and Marina Bay, which is really beautiful when the sun sets. There are even balconies in the lounge! Accor elite status is recognized here. Some hotels I stayed at did not really care about elite status. As an Accor platinum member, I received a room upgrade and lounge access. The location is fantastic and very convenient too, just next to Fort Canning MRT station. Chinatown station is just 1 stop away, which is linked to Chinatown Point, as well as many other buildings in Chinatown, through underground walkways. The hotel itself is directly linked to Liang Court mall, through 3 hidden elevators just next to the restaurant on level 7. It would be good if front desk staff informed guests of these hidden elevators to save guests from the trouble of going all the way down to level 1, walk out the hotel, then into the mall. I found out about these elevators when I explored the hotel. There's a good Chinese restaurant, Shin Yeh, on level 2, and a Japanese supermarket, Meidiya, on the basement. There is also a laundry room with coin-operated washers and dryers just next to these elevators. There is, however, a bit of shortfall. There are too many fruit flies in the lounge. After my mother got diarrhoea on the second night of our stay, we never ate anything in the lounge anymore throughout our 7-night stay.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here on a business trip and loved it so much, I brought my family back for a Singapore vacation.A family of 4 (2 kids aged 9 and 8) stayed in the one room (fold out beds were provided) and the room was huge, with plenty of room to move - I was very impressed.The location cannot be beaten, with Clarke Quay on your doorstep, and two train stations within very short walk.You won't get bored of the selection of restaurants around the hotel.The 711 and shopping mall underneath the hotel is also a bonus.The hotel is neat and clean, the staff are friendly and the breakfast is first class.Highly recommend, and I will be coming back here!
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was located perfectly with easy access to Clarke Quay and only a $8 taxi ride away from the Marina area. The hotel itself was well but well equipped with knowledgeable and friendly staff. Breakfast buffet was plentiful and tasty. Dinner buffet looked amazing, unfortunately we didn't try it though. (commitments elsewhere). Special note to the concierge on the ground floor as he was very welcoming and helpful. An asset to the company. The swimming pool area was very nice and rooms were cleaned daily to a high standard.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If the hotel has a good location the rooms and rest of the building need a deep renovation. Rooms furniture are damaged and totally outdated.Service at the all day dining is slow and staff does not pay much attention to customers.Food average.And all prices not cheap
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I have stayed here for three nights very good staff in the premier lounge and the breakfast was very good and the staff so pleasant and great location to restaurant and bars but will need to take a taxi to orchard road
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were welcomed from the time we walked in the front door and shown to the lifts for checkin. Check in was quick and friendly. As Accor members we were acknowledge and given drink vouchers. When we entered our room I was amazed at the beautiful job the staff did in decorating our room for our 28th wedding anniversary. And also the upgrade. We were made to feel very special. We had a great view from our room of Marina Bay Sands. It was also in a great location. MRT close by. Great choices and variety for breakfast and dinner. Cleaners do a fantastic job keeping the Novotel lovely and clean. We will be back here again next time we are in Singapore.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We celebrated our 10th anniversary with three nights here following a cruise. We booked a premier room and were surprised and grateful to be upgraded to a suite...the celebration balloons and cake were also a wonderful touch to add to our occasion. I could imagine the extra personal touches they would add for other special events.The location has been described in plenty of reviews and to sum up, this is a perfect base for tourists.Our suite was spacious, the bed large and very comfortable as was the bathroom with double basin and jacuzzi. We had a great view over Clarke Quay and along the river to Marina Bay.The staff were all very friendly and went out of their way to check if everything was ok. The premier floors are definitely worth paying for for the drinks and nibbles of an evening and a quiet breakfast (although less variety) than the main restaurant. The pool is massive with a large deck area and plenty of space to move around. Probably the deepest hotel pool I have seen also. While we didn't utilise it, there is waiter service to the pool lounges from reasonable happy hour price drinks and snacks menu.The hotel has more of a business traveller vibe however is perfect for tourists also with its friendly staff and excellent location.Definitely would recommend Novotel Clarke Quay in particular the premier floor rooms.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time here for a staycation and choose this place for the location. Check in staff Gerald was really kind to give a complimentary upgrade to the superior room which is spacious with a bath tub. Responsiveness of the maintenance team was quick as we needed help with the HDMI in the room. Greatful to the staff of Novotel Clarke Quay and will definitely return again. Also, thank you Sri for being accommodating, extending late checkout to fit our schedule of the day. See you next time.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family visited Singapore over the week end at Novotel Clark Quay. Being a member of Accor Club, we have enjoyed a good and pleasant stay here in Singapore. The check in procedure is fast, we have pre booked the rooms in advance. The room facilities including the amnesities are great. Room is cleaned and taken care every day. The hotel staff hospitality are great. The hotel location is so center from many places, Clark Quay restorans and pubs are walking distance, Liang Court Mall is a step away from hotel. Plenty foods are available nearby. The scenery of Singapore river around Clark Quay is enjoyable from our bed room.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for five nights. We chose this place as one of our party was a Accor member and got a really good deal on the price. The location and service from staff was really good. Downsides were: WiFi was pretty weak in our room (1023), there was a strong smell of smoke on our floor and lastly I felt the hotel was looking a little tired. Would stay here again though if price was good again.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights from 7 May 2019.All staff were excellent and helpful.Buffet breakfast is very good.The pool also has great city views, the location of hotel close to 2 subway stations and overlooks the Clarke Quay dining / entertainment area.Stayed in room # 1615 with great views to the Marina Bay Sands and night light show plus overlooking Clarke Quay lights at night.Will return for 2 nights at the end of May before returning to Australia.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just had 4 nights at the Novotel Clarke Quay - a wonderful location - with many great restaurants and bars on your doorstep. Even traveling alone it was great to be able to wander around Clarke and Robinson Quay in a friendly and safe location.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travel to a lot of conferences throughout Asia and this has been my favorite stop thus far. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and the lunch buffet somehow even more expansive. I actually gained a kilogram each of the three days I stayed there.The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Clarke Quay. I had a nice view of the city from my room. Use of a smartphone was much appreciated. The pool was also welcome respite from the Singaporean heat.My only two minor complaints were the slow check in and patchy wifi. Other than that, this hotel came through.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is first time I stay at Novotel Clarke Quay Singapore. The location is perfect to walk to center and Marina Sands.The room was very practical, good A/C and the beds was perfect. Novotel have a huge pool area with nice city view.The Resturant was great, I recommend the Angus Beef.The room price was mybe a little stiff, but after all we are in Singapore.Will I be back: YES
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had room 1516 on the 15th floor. It was a Bay view with good views of Clarke Quay and we were able to see as far as the 'Garden in the Sky'. The river meanders below, overall a good view. There is a small balcony but no access for Health and Safety reasons although you can request it to be opened. The bathroom has a good sized shower and bath. There was plenty of hot water. TV had a good selection of channels, many of which were in English. Tea making facilities were good although there was no decaffeinated coffee. Lighting was subdued. It was difficult to read both the bedside controls for the lights etc and the ones by the door. In fact I had to use a small torch. As I am getting older this was perhaps also down to me.Housekeeping was excellent, prompt and efficient. The concierge desk was very helpful. My wife has a wheelchair and they were very quick to assist with ensuring we got an appropriate vehicle to and from the airport.Breakfast buffet was very good with plenty of choice. Whilst there was gluten free bread and gluten free muffins available there was no gluten free cereal. The pool is very large and whilst sitting having coffee near the pool after breakfast we met the Hotel General Manager, Alan Burrows, who was doing his morning check of the pool and surrounds. He was very approachable and said he would go and talk to the chef about the gluten free cereal. A big help to us at different times was a young man called Gerard who works at the reception desk. He was very polite and very patient. There is a supermarket, shops and eating places located below the hotel. This is very convenient if you forgot anything. The hotel is right on Clarke Quay and the location makes it ideal to visit many places, for example, if you walk through Clarke Quay central on the other side of the river it brings you out near China Town Central.most places are wheelchair accessible, especially the long walks alongside the river.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We decided to stay at the Novotel due to its location at Clarke Quay. Glad we did - it is a short walk to the main part of the CBD including the Colonial section, the Marina Bay, Boat Quay and CHinatown. There is an MRT station right behind the hotel as well as a good shopping / food mall. Hotel was very clean and comfortable. We are Accorplus members and got 50% off our meals which made the breakfast buffet very affordable. The swimming pool was a welcome retreat from the hot weather .
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenient if you are in the city to enjoy Clark quay. Rooms are ok. Nice view on the river. Swimming pool is on the 6th floor of the building with nice atmosphere. Fitness is too small and without window. Breakfast is full of choice and very good.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spend far too much time in hotel rooms! What makes an hotel different is the service levels offered by the staff. Here at the Novotel in Clark Quay, the service levels were fantastic.The staff are obviously well trained.They were all professional, friendly and very helpful, and made the stay very pleasant.The rooms are as usual with a great view of the harbour and the pool and poolside restaurant service..great.I had a choice of several hotels in Singapore, but decided to return here...with good reason!!
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for three nights and loved this hotel. I ate at the buffet for one lunch and two dinners and if you are staying at the hotel you get 30% off so makes it a pretty sweet deal. The Clarke Quay restaurants are just across from the hotel as is a river cruise outlet, so convenient at night time as I was a solo traveller. Always feel safe in Singapore though. The pool has two access areas, one through the restaurant and the other on the 6th level. Cabanas and pool beds were cool. I will definitely return and stay at this hotel. All service staff were very accommodating. There was a $5 charge for ice in an ice bucket which I found unusual but believe me was way cheaper having my duty free alcohol drinks in my room before heading out so was happy to pay (can’t have spirits without ice). Thank you Novotel Clarke Quay. I will be back and next time with some friends
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for one night breaking up a trip back to Australia. A taxi from Changi Terminal 2 took less than half an hour and was about SGD $20.On entering on the ground floor you'll find concierge. The hotel lobby is on level 7. The check-in experience was a little frustrating - we queued in the Le Club premium line but only one agent was serving those guests so folks in the standard line were seen to quicker so guests with status were made to wait longer. Go figure... Once we were served the agent tells us we could go to level 24 to do check in in the premium lounge. Given we had waited already we declined. I suggest they should have a front-of-house greeter or more obvious signage to prevent this annoyance.We accepted an email offer of a room upgrade for SGD $49 prior to arrival. As we had booked on points complementary Le Club upgrades were not offered. The room was large and clean but looking a little dated. The room was incredibly stuffy as the A/C does not function without a keycard in the wall. I appreciate this is an environmental initiative but to make for a positive first entrance the blinds should at least be closed to keep some of the heat out. Despite the A/C being set to 16C the room never got under 25C.The bathroom was very large and had both a shower over bath and an additional separate shower. No complaints about having two showers, but it was odd. Only 2 towels were provided.There was no Le Club Platinum welcome gift, but drink vouchers were supplied.We had breakfast in the premium lounge which was a fairly average buffet. Not a lot of choice and the space around the buffet was quite cramped.The gym was very small and not well ventilated making it very stuffy. There are two treadmills and an elliptical along with weights machines. The equipment was all in good condition.The pool area I believe is shared with a neighbouring hotel. Quite strangely for Singapore the water was very cold. It was also strangely very deep at over 3.5m at the deepest end - which I suspect is why it was so cold.The location is handy in Clarke Quay with easy access to the riverfront dining and entertainment options. Overall I was disappointed with Novotel Clarke Quay and I wouldn't stay again.Side note - on our departure day we were left a letter under the door explaining that the hotel's power would be shut off at midnight for 5 hours leaving guests without power, hot water and air conditioning (in Singapore!). Had we not been departing that day already we would have left early for another hotel. That kind of inconvenience without prior warning or compensation is unacceptable.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is awesome, good access to MRT and buses. Views from the room are great and its by the riverside. Rooms and bath are big and spacious, bed is good for comfortable sleep. Operations and room service needs great amount of improvement. They are slow and dont get the order right. Wait is over 1 hour for room service and i got just one glass of milk for 3 cornflakes i ordered! Customer service needs improvement
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall was good, right from the doorman to housekeeping. Staffs were knowledgeable and friendly. Rooms were spacious too compared to the other Novotel. Hope to have Halal food in future especially when you are a family and prefer to have breakfast at the hotel.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights. Great hotel very good location on Clarke Quayaround the corner from nearest station. Helpful staff both at entrance andcheck in reception. Lovely room very clean with nice view.Breakfast all you need with a good choice. A very good central hotel.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Balcony had a damage floor raised bump cemented in picture can be supplied a dirty bath , had staff and husband , gold member husband came 2 days in advance asked to leave room 10am instead of 12 am and then ask to wait till after 15:00 to get in the room unacceptable , only dealt with the problem when I complained so had to move room would not stay at hotel again will stay at Swiss Merchant I need a nice room not ACCOR points when working in Asian and this hotel has gone down in service (stayed before )
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very disappointing stay. Hotels in Singapore are usually great. This hotel is in a good location but that is really all it had going for it. Rude staff, below average food and decor is very dated. I was surprised as a Accor Platinum member how we were treated on our stay compared to other Accor Hotels. Definitely won’t be returning to this establishment.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Seeing as Novotel is a large international chain, I was expecting a great stay, however I was severely disappointed. It took a lengthy amount of time to check in and after 15 hours of travelling we just wanted to sleep. When we came down to the buffet for breakfast it was a mad house. A lot of food hadn’t been replenished and it seemed as if they were going for quantity rather than quality. When trying to organise something through the hotel such as pillows or our luggage to be moved, we had to ring multiple times before they actually came. I don’t want to put down the employees, as working in a large hotel can be a stressful job, I think poor management is at fault. This hotel felt quite impersonal and as if it was simply just for the masses, without concern for the individual. This hotel has good bones but it could signicantly be improved by hiring more staff, and implementing an extensive training regime to ensure that all staff can provide the best service. For example, at the buffet there was long queues and it was crowded. However, by simply hiring a few more staff for this sector, the plates could be cleared quicker and the whole system would be more efficient.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was very good & spacious & the bathroom was good, & the staff were very helpful, BUT the wifi for emails was abysmally slow & MUST be improved for a hotel in this class & expense. Also the speed of water flow from the hand basin taps was just more than a trickle. If this was intended to help the planet it failed because we used the shower a lot more & hence used more water.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just finished a 4 night stay with the Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay. Staff from check in were helpful and understanding. I had issues with my card and the young woman at reception was patient, understanding, and tried to assist any way she could. On arrival in our room, they had not only organised my room for a higher level ( as per my request) the staff had left my partner and I a welcome gift and card as we were celebrating our engagement. Room was large and spacious. Extra Large king bed was comfortable with great linen. Bathroom shower pressure fantastic and bath was large. Housekeeping stocked our room each day with water and toiletries. Buffet variety was fantastic. Location to MRT and attractions was brilliant. Everything was kept immaculately clean. Each encounter with staff was lovely and they went out of their way to be helpful and courteous. I would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Novotel is well located in Clarke Quay.The hotel is in need of a refurb especially the rooms.There is a lack of storage space and the rooms are small so if you are staying for a week you will be struggling.Also not enough sun beds around the pool.Breakfast buffet is good.
hotelName:
14    Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What an inconceivable spot! New World Millennium Hotel is a stunning lodge to remain while in Hong Kong. Its favorable position is past our needs. We were demolished and they enormously managed every single one of our mentioning. Especially regarded! Sustenances were magnificent, purposely cooked and served. We were exceptionally energetic and we are exploiting our it. Happy to be in Singapore particularly in M Social Singapore. We will restore no two ways about it.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An interesting hotel. It has got the design style going on but not for the purpose intended. There was little necessity for any interaction between staff and guests - which you may like! Check in efficient. Hotels rooms groovy but tiny! Think New York style. Bathrooms very small. Bed very comfortable and regular room servicing. We got the courtyard room which helped for a sense of more space. Get Aura the robot to deliver water and teabags - heaps of fun. Restaurant good but fairly expensive. Coffee very average. (Go round to the waterfront for Toby’s Estate coffee - great but about $8 a medium!).Location wise, it’s a quiet area. I found it a little dull - easy to find restaurants and drinks on the waterfront but they were touristy and expensive. Not a hawkers stand in sight! 7/11 close by for bits and pieces. No train station close by. Taxis very easy to call from Ipad in foyer. Taxis very reasonable and accept credit cards. Nice walk along the river towards Raffles etc. Chinatown about 20 minutes away. Next time I would stay in Kampong Glam area near Haji Lane and Arab street - much more character. Pool quite crowded and small. Often shaded from high rise. I found it too cold and a little bit squeezy to be relaxed. Gym reasonable. For smokers you can smoke at the rear of the carpark and a few people had a cheeky dart on their balconies at night - but not sure if totally OK.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ideal start by having a free upgrade to a loft. Room looks beautiful but can be slightly small. Staff are very friendly, shout out to Nuri! Room is cosy and comfortable and there’s a shuttle service to the city. Walk might be a bit far from the nearest station but it’s an easy walk along Robertson quay. Highly recommended! :)
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for one night. I think it’s a perfect location for a relaxing time in Singapore. If you want to visit all the tourist spots then I don’t think this is the best location. However if you’re wanting to relax, eat good food and walk along the river to Clark Quay then this is perfect.I stayed in a small room, alcove I think. It’s cosy, not a big space but it’s fine for one or a couple.I slept so so well in this bed. It’s so comfy and the bedding is like a cloud.If I come to Singapore again and just here for a night, I’d definitely book here.Nearby are so many great places to get food and if you love yoga you can even do a class at yoga movement which is 2 mins walk away.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Checked in on a Sunday for one night stay. Throughly enjoyable stay. Upgrade to the 10th floor "Loft Gallery" room was the ideal start. Great pool overlooking the river was another highlight. Dinner at the hotel restaurant was top notch. Likewise, the service
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: M Social Singapore made us feel warm and fuzzy. Weeks later, my husband and I can't help but look back at our relaxing staycation weekend. We miss the cozy room, the delicious breakfast (we miss you 60 seconds pancakes!) and the overall warm and friendly vibe of M Social. We're reminded that we have to treat ourselves once in awhile. See you next time, M Social!
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place is very relaxing, they got friendly staff and the food, its perfectly delicious! Thank you Armando for the recommendation, if you’re going to visit this place, just look for him. He’s so nice and easy to talk with.. ❤️❤️❤️
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Here to celebrate wife’s birthday. We received a free room upgrade. Which is fantastic. staff Desmond served us, Staff is friendly. Clean room. Definitely will stay here again! Smooth check in process.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Terrible room designs If your BMI is above standard don’t take the risk of entering their bath rooms .. you will get stuckThe wash basin is attached to bed side Room is so cramped you will not have any breathing space other than just sleeping ...Hotel situated at a posh location with good restaurants around Good staff, especially front deskUnique experience of Robotic egg maker and robotic room service
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very comfortable stay in M social. Staff is friendly and helpful. Location is good access to everywhere, walking distance to chinatown and clarke quay. Take cab is near to everywhere. Hotel room interior is modern and comfort. Will stay again once i back to singapore.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first time to stay in this hotel. Upon arrival I was surprised how receptionist Gretchen took care of me, from checked and bring luggage to my room, I feel like I am at home, Gretchen help me about information. where to visit places and nice restaurant in Singapore and I had amazing experienced! I will come back for sure.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed three nights, the hotel is different from the standard business hotels but in a nice way and the guests are on average younger.My room was a bit small but in line with the local standard and, again, furnished in a bizzarre but yet lovely way.Position is convenient, close to a nice walking path on the river and 15 minutes walk to Singapore downtown
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small and self contained rules but does the job for business.Very good restaurant and a robot makes you an omelette in the morning! Excellent breakfast and good facilities to meet clientsAlso a good gym and pool thereReasonable rates and would stay again!
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff are friendly, specially Armando... food are great... rooms are small but clean and have free wifi :) swimming pool and gym are accessible.. Also if you want to relax they have bar and billards...
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went there on a staycation with my friends, and the place was definitely worth the money we paid for!! A very cool hotel with its double floor concept, an amazing place to chill with your spouse, friends and even family!!!
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After I booked a 1night stay, I will like to Thanks Novelia A for the response message when I requested for a Birthday greeting card & reservation at their restaurant with no hassle. At the lobby, u can self help with the ice water while waiting. We was welcomed by Jasmitha & explains well information for my check in with her nice smile. We admire the sleek interior design of the room & take note of the standing shower bath. I enjoy coffee of Nespresso & the Long pool to swim to relax! Their in house dining is chio & cozy! It don’t have direct public transport to hotel, only Fort Canning mrt station needs 15mins walk towards.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my birthday weekend and my wife and I decided to go on staycation in this hotel which is near my previous workplace.My friend who used to visit Singapore last year stayed in this hotel which is very cosy and homey.We were warmly welcomed by Gretchen at the reception and after checking the availability of the rooms, we were advised that standard rooms are fully booked, however we are offered to get the loft room at the ninth floor. And since it’s my birthday, I was given a green coupon which I can get a bithday dessert from the resturant.The narrow hallway leading to the rooms is lined with red carpet and warmly lit.The sound-proofed room is a contemporary modern-industrial in design, with double glass panel walls separating the bath from the rest of the room and has blinds for privacy.The room is tiny, I would say, compared to the hotels I have been to, however this one is a representation of smart usage of space: open-concept wardrobe, compact vanity and fridge. Just essentials and surprisingly, sufficient for our stay. One thing that was missing in the toilet was the bidet. On the loft is where the leather sofa and tv as well as the study table and chair was. Breakfast is not included however Armando from the hotel’s restaurant Beast and Butterflies assured us that since we are hotel guests, we pay less, so we went. Breakfast buffet is at $23.54/person and is chargeable to the room. That made the experience convenient since I did not bring my wallet with me and instead of us going back to the room, Armando suggested to have our breakfast charged to the room instead. What an efficient service!For the amount of the breakfast, it’s worth it, compared to the plated breakfast in the nearby cafes which starts at $18++ not including drinks. The spread is a mix of selected local and international favourites. The focal point of the breakfast is the robotic egg station which has been queued for by the guests. The weather was gloomy so we did not get the chance to enjoy the pool at the fifth floor.That evening, after spending the whole day outside, we went to Beast and Butterflies for some drinks and we’re served by Carisa and was recommended to have the Mont Blanc as our dessert. The recommendation was excellent to our taste— not too rich and not too sweet. Check-out was smooth and overall is a great experience! Until the next time! Please help me inform your staff how great they’re doing their jobs! —Norbert
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern, comfortable at an affordable price. The area is really nice and about a 10 min walk to nearest MRT. Breakfast also good and changes each day. Very clean. Would stay again if ever in Singapore.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: M Social is located along the river in Singapore. It's a quiet residential area that requires a taxi or a 20 minute walk to get to an MRT station. The hotel itself was new enough, but it was small, oh so small. The rooms were so pokey that only one person could walk around the bed at once. The bathroom consisted of the toilet and shower only and the hand basin was in the bedroom. I don't like this concept. Hotel management will tell you that it was designed by Blah Blah (some wanky European designer), but I am not sure if Blah Blah has ever had to stay in this hotel. It is impractical and far too small. If you need room service, they send a little robot up with your toiletries or water or whatever you asked for - though this can take up to an hour. On the whole, I feel this place is just trying too hard. My other qualm is the hotel staff. Whilst all pleasant enough, they were all just going through the motions. None of them seem to have any passion for their country, Singapore. If I ask for local insight and hints, they should be keen to help. The most helpful staff member I encountered was a Taiwanese girl named Lily (who also had resigned and was leaving the hotel the week after our stay). For the same money, there are better options.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Refreshing hotel for the Singapore hotel scene. I've stayed in a large number of upper-mid end hotels in Singapore over the years and I think I found the one I want to stay in regularly. The concept was great, the rooms well appointed....location perfect for where I need to be in Singapore! Looking forward to staying again.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: M Social has always been my TOP choice, it is conveniently located. Transport to central is just stone throw away. Nightlife is just a minutes away! The most awesome part is the staff actually remember you.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4nights.Breakfast was good ,plenty of choice.Loved the novelty value of the robot cooking eggs,needs to be cleaned on a regular basis.Expected the room to be small,(it was).We are small people anyone larger would struggle in the room and bathroom.Lighting was poor.The good thing was the bed was super comfy and it was very quiet.Very close to lovely bars and restaurants.East to get to the MTR station.Overall was happy with this hotel
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Where do Jay Gatsby and Daisy Buchanan of the twenty-first century stay when Singapore is the destination? Swanky Pop Star Pad is what we walked into first time arriving at M Social. Instead of an unimaginative urban opulence, M Social’s exterior is an explosion of energy.What we discovered during the stay at M Social Singapore: The Guest is the Darling. Right from the Reservation I emailed that was responded in no time to the airport pick-up arrangement and personalized check-in done without delay upon arrival: every M-bassador at M Social strived to save not only our time, but also to ensure that the M-experience is world-class. Our pre-booked Premier Loft is a cocktail of incredible interior work: staged into two levels is the separate lounge to laze away and the upper mezzanine to bed down after a long day out browsing the bustling city. Definitely a to-die-for-design by the French Designer, Mr. Starck; successfully orchestrated quirkiness and maverick Millienialism.You know you are (treated like) a Pop Star when every detail is a dream comes true: it is incredibly important to me to mention that every M-bassador of M Social exceeds expectation by handling Health Concern carefully. Currently one of us is on a strict Diet Program that does not allow a large number of Food Items. I stepped into Beast & Butterflies—M Social’s super Instagramable restaurant, ordered Beef Tenderloin topped with the list of the spices and ingredients to be eliminated as per the doctor’s order. I waited with a worried face as I experienced extremely poor service previously at a river-side restaurant in the neighbourhood (which I will write about separately to warn travellers; as well as my best-of-the-best Beast & Butterflies experience).An M-bassador at Beast & Butterflies: first-class Fiona flawlessly handled the handful requests. She took time to tell me that “Absolutely! Allergies should never be taken lightly. We understand.” Instantly I was at ease. Effectively helpful, Fiona did not stop at making sure the Tenderloin order was well-handled; but also asked for the List of Allowed Food Items as we were staying for a full week at M Social. As a result, every Breakfast experience was never a frustration but a feast with friends. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts to the sweetest-smile Armando, (again) first-class Fiona, Keanney (for the tip of what’s hip in the city!), Sham and everyone at Beast & Butterflies for every specially set-aside fruits and food items prepared everyday (I’m not crying, you’re crying!). Though M Social is strategically city-centered, we ended up eating in almost everyday at Beast & Butterflies because everything is easier while what we want from the Asian Cuisine adventure is fulfilled; with taste to match the tongues of the Kings & Queens.Congratulations on the terrific teamwork (to William, where-to-go-when-in-Singapore Yasmin, detail-oriented Desmond at the Front Desk and Aura—the Best Bot there is!) and the legendary leadership that is a victory, Mr. Veerasamy! M Social is my true Great Gatsby experience; proof that we can have it all when we travel faraway from friends and family.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: my second stay at M Social ; a perfect choice for my three days in Singapore. Most welcoming and helpful staff on all levels..with ready smiles always a winner. My room was 205 and though quite small on floor space was quite compensated for by stunning design...a chapel ceiling, arched connecting doorway and clever double-glazed bathroom walls with fine gold venetian blinds between. Great lighting effect. The bed so very comfortable with the top quality white linen and everything I needed was there. Adding to the sense of space was the private garden terrace, trees and all....on the 2nd floor! Typical Singapore.....great design and gardens everywhere. Location is excellent Robertson Quays on the Singapore River a great place to spend time, walk ,dine or enjoy fine coffee. All the better for me as my travel plans had to be changed when I became unwell. Hotel staff very helpful with late check-out and time by the river very relaxing.Hope to return maybe one more time.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice and clean room, comfortable for 2 person. Perfect for staycation and holiday stay. Looking for something fresh, that’s here. Breakfast was standard, with an omelette cooking machine, that needs the staff to check on it time and time again, just to make sure it’s cleanliness and serviceability.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very modern, clean and funky hotel. Surrounded by great bars and restaurants at Robertson Quay and a neighbourhood of apartments, it was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of Singapore's shops - yet, Orchard Road was walkable. We loved the robot who served us eggs for breakfast (breakfast was great).The only slight issue was not much storage space for 2 suitcases. Our room had the bed downstairs and the living area upstairs - if that configuration was reversed, as other rooms are, that would have been much easier. If we were there for more than 2 nights next time, we will ask for a room with a living area downstairs for that reason.There was a great pool, which was nice to swim in and sit by to read - lovely pool towels and day beds.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Whilst the hotel was a 15 minute walk away from the nearest MRT station, it was in a great location for nightlife. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and our room was lovely. We particularly enjoyed using the Robot to request new towels and having our welcome drink down in the bar was also good fun. Overall a great nights stay on our trip!
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked a room here for my birthday celebration and was not disappointed! Although there was no birthday amenities prepared, but the ambience, design and service made up for it! Special thanks to Yasmin and Razi for providing such good service! Please extend my gratitude to them!
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A short 3 nights visit. Small hotel but quirky and charming. Staff is very friendly and do go out of their way to be helpful. Special mention for Emory and Nirmal. The breakfast area, both indoors and outdoors by the Riverside is inviting. The robot making the eggs... Both sunny side up and an omelette is fascinating. Can recommend.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: M Social is a reasonably priced hotel, very central for food and drinks down Robertson and Clarke Quay.Rooms are modern and the beds are comfy. Rooms are a bit on the smaller side, but if you're a solo traveler it fits the bill nicely as you won't spend much time except sleeping there anyway.Staff is friendly and check-in / check-out is usually very fast.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed there early April for a night over the weekend. There was a queue at reception for check in but generally, the staff were all quite efficient and friendly. We stayed in the Alcove room and it was quite tiny with a small balcony. Not too sure what you can really do with that small balcony. I found it served no purpose. The bed was quite small for a queen size. The sink is positioned outside beside the television, in front of the bed. The shower and toilet was quite tiny too. There weren’t much space to move around. I wouldn’t really recommend tourists with large suitcases.The pool was quite small but cosy. Luckily when we went, there were day beds available. Quite a handful of guests walked away due to the unavailability of day beds.Breakfast was alright. They had a robot egg maker which was cool. The variety at breakfast was average, nothing to shout about.What was upsetting is that upon check out, we realised that they don’t do complimentary parking unless you parked at their lobby (which is a first come first served basis and they had limited lots, maybe around 5?). When we drove towards the hotel, there was a sign that pointed to car park for M Social and we followed it. Turns out that we parked at the apartment that was linked to the hotel. It was misleading as the carpark where we parked had the lift that led us to the hotel directly. We only knew this at check out. We were not told of this during check in.During check out, there was no sign of service recovery as well when we were told that nobody told us this during check in. We wrote in to the hotel on after we checked out but have not received a response yet and it has been about a month already. It shows to me that this hotel doesn’t really care about their guest feedback after all. I will not be staying at this hotel again. For its price and the room and facilities, there are many better hotel options in Singapore with better location as well.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern hotel, nice decor, well located, very clean, small rooms but efficient, enjoyable rooftop pool, good service upon our arrival. Cell phone at your disposal in the room.I do not recommend the restaurant downstairs.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 4 nights in a standard Alcove Cosy Room. If I were not staying on my own, I would have mixed feelings about staying here again, mostly because I so treasure ample bed space and this was a real problem here (and all their rooms have the same “queen” sized bed – I felt it was smaller than a standard queen). We were 2 people of average Asian build and I felt the bed *just* barely fit us. It is a very comfortable bed, but I think they overcompensated with the humongous, billowy pillows. That aside, the room is pretty well designed to make full use of the tiny space. Sound proofing is amazing, shower pressure just right, no bidet though so a bit annoying. No eco-friendly toiletries, so I hope they start thinking about that. Room is dark, with most of the light coming from the astoundingly bright sink mirror lighting (the sole sink being in the bedroom area also a problem when 1 person wants to get ready and the other wants to sleep in). Regarding housekeeping, on my 9th floor room, it was only made up around 2-3pm every day, which seems a bit later than most other hotels. Wifi is fast and fuss-free. Location-wise, it was good for me as I enjoyed the peaceful surroundings and hip F&B outlets along the water. Plus I like walking, so the 20-min walk to Clarke Quay station was very doable. Not for everyone or every occasion though! There are shuttle buses from the hotel to some key spots, but they are infrequent so you have to plan to catch them. Cute robot which delivers things to your room if you need anything. Lap pool is ok, serviceable. Conclusion – if I were traveling on my own on a leisurely trip, I would stay here again.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having just returned from a short city break to Singapore, M Social provided a nice base to explore the city.A modern innovative hotel , rooms were clean with a comfy bed, staff obliging and overall nice facilities.The hotel has a quirky robot which cooks eggs at breakfast and also another called Aura which delivers room service. We didn’t use either ourselves but care across as a novelty.Housekeeping was the one point that let the hotel down . Each day we were there housekeeping didn’t reach our our room until 6/7 pm by which point we were back after a day exploring the city. On all occasions we were up and out of the hotel by 10am at the latest, so were disappointed to come back to the room as we had left it. As the rooms are small when housekeeping come to do basic cleaning it’s a little awkward as there is no where to go .Overall a pleasant stay.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Msocial from April 16-April 20, 2019I found a friendly atmosphere especially with Armand was around! We had a good tasty breakfast! I love Singapore and hope we can be back soon with my Family!
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were recently on a cruise from Dubai to Singapore, and had a few days at the end in this great hotel. The staff were excellent, and couldn't do enough for us. Extremely helpful, and always smiling, they made us feel right at home. The breakfast was great. They love gadgets and robots in this hotel, so we were not in the least surprised when a robot cooked our omlettes for us.There is another super little robot who delivers things to your room, like bottles of water and extra towels. The interior is full of Philippe Starck design features, and gives a young and trendy feel to the whole place. Ideally situated for transport and you will be spoilt for choice for places to eat along the river.The rooms are not large, but ours was quite adequate for our needs
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was interested to see how a Philip stark design hotel would be. Nice decor, funky interiors. Room is not big but i am fine as it was meant for sleeping. Room was on dim side . Pool was nice. Long with a great veiw of the river. breakfast area was packed on a sunday morning. There was a birthday celebration in the afternoon at the restaurant. Staff were fast and hurried to clear the plates during peak hours . I would suggest having a small place card that says “ i am still eating” ... my utensils and drink were cleared many times . I know they are efficient but it was a waste of food. The robot at the egg making station was the highlight. Overall a good a good stay.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Allover a very nice hotel with very nice staff. + modern and new+ good price+ good for young guests (walking distance to bus station 350m)+ clean+ compfy bed+ central+ washing machine to use (but for 1 wash it costs 7.-)+ smartphone for use- bad aeration in room. In our room 324, its always humid, towls couldnt dry (we needed everyday new towls)- because of the bad aeration, there was a smell in the room (or maybe because of the air-con)- light in badroom turns off, if you dont move for 4sec. - not enough light in the room, its alway littlebit too dark (hard to get my make up done )
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel at the beginning and end of our trip to Indonesia. Staff were excellent on reception and very efficient. Nuri (??) was a great help when booking our Night Safari trip. Razi also superb when sorting out luggage and taxis to airport. ( We will return with our grandchildren one day) !! Apologies for not remembering all staff names but you were all a credit to this super hotel. On meeting the new manager Darshan (Lionel) we were very impressed by his totally friendly but professional attitude. (Glad you enjoyed your recent trip to Edinburgh) !! When we do return to Singapore we look forward to staying here again. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel to other travellers.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a staycation here with my partner and the M Social did not disappoint! The hotel bed is comfortable and just nice, you get everything you need. The surrounding is also a plus for me. I managed to squeeze in a long run at the gym which is very helpful and had the pool to cool down. Breakfast spread was good enough although would have been great if there was fried rice & perhaps fish (I'm a pescaterian) for variety? I must say the Laksa and Matcha Lave are really to die-for! We finished ém til the very last drop. Armand from the restaurant was really pleasant and accommodating! Thank you for the hospitality! We will definitely come back for another stay. :)
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i booked this hotel because of the high ceiling so it looks so spacious. but kinda bummed because i forgot to see the closest public transport and realized that it's kinda far (700ish m from bus stop; 1,2ish km from nearest MRT station). i think it has a shuttle car/minibus from the hotel to some places like orchard etc, but only on weekdays.it's also not spacious, but nice enough. the breakfast has nice enough selection, and it also has an automatic/robotic egg maker which is quite a show itself, and a pancake maker machine with only one touch.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is superb and awesome! I love the rooms, the restobar and the pool! I love the pool, i got to unwind there. The staff are very hospitable, friendly and helpful! The food are delicious! And they have a robot who can assist and deliver your food! Super cool! I will definitely book here again for my next trip in SG! Special mention to Armando Placido, Cariza Tottoo and the whole team! Bravo guys! Great job! This hotel is worth the 5-star!
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently travelled to Singapore on a work trip and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at M Social. The location is great on Robertson Quay and the value was exceptional. The exterior Quay is pretty quiet during the day, however it comes alive at night with loads of great restaurant and bar options within 5-10 minutes walk from the hotel. Rooms are modern, neat and tidy. I wasn't completely sold on the loft style set up with the bed upstairs, however it was fine. My only one negative which is hardly a negative is that there's almost no waitstaff at breakfast. There's an automated omelette station and self serve coffee / everything. Although fascinating to see robot's taking over human roles and obviously an efficiency in terms of staff wages, however, there's something nice about being greeted with a friendly face as you start the day. Overall a great stay - very accommodating staff and cocktail hour was great whilst I wrapped up some unfinished business. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: M Social is well located along the River with restaurants/bars close by. Rooms small and compact but everything you needed for a short stay.Pool area can get over crowded as not many sun beds.Now for breakfast, what a let down, eggs badly secede by a machine complete with shell if it even managed to put it on your plate and so slow, the choice was also very poor, the pancake machine was also very slow and results were under cooked/doughy.Everything had a cheap budget brand taste so breakfast was dreaded. Just pay someone to cook eggs properly it would be so much more appreciated and people wouldn’t have to wait ages for a rubbery bland item that’s supposed to resemble an omelette. The tap style levers on the juice/milk were awkward and slow.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in an Alcove room which was small but totally fine. Could do with a book of information of the hotel and tours etc rather than just the phone that is provided as not the easiest to work. Hotel design is lovely and different from the normal. They offer an opt out of housekeeping where you can choose a welcome drink, late check out or snack which is good for short stays. Staff are friendly and really quick to help with any issues (our door battery died and was fixed instantly). Could do with some more loungers around the pool but it is lovely there with towels provided and water. Gym is also small but useable for a decent full body workout. The area is fantastic and would recommend going to the bar bar black sheep bar next door as prices are inclusive of tax and GST and are decent. The hotel bar is good too for a chilling drink. About 10 minutes walk to Clarke Quay which is really lively and its walking by the river thats lovely. Would stay at this hotel again and recommend to friends. Only issue ive had is i havent had my deposit returned to me nearly 2 weeks after staying but i have only just contacted the hotel regarding this and awaiting response.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in a loft room (aka a cupboard) for 4 nights.It was clean and lovely and quiet.But so dark and small.Made for one person only!The gym was tiny but adequate. The breakfast was appalling but dinner was good.The staff were lovely.Not my sort of place!
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: M social has the most ideal location for someone who wishes to stay at Roberston quay.All the restaurants and bars are around this property and if one wishes to head to Clarks Quay then you can get there by walking for about 10 mins along the riverside which is always buzzing in the evening
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at one of the best rooms according to the hotel - Loft Terrace Room. Room was small but guess that's what we get. We were extremely disappointed with the service. The aircond didn't work and although we complained several times, it took a long time before somebody came. However, the situation was not much improved and the room continued to be hot. The front desk was also very bad in answering calls. We called for a long time and the phone just rang and rang without anybody answering. The hotel had the robot delivery service. We called several times but the robot didn't deliver after we waited for a long time. One minute, they said the robot went home, then later they said it was charging, then another call, they said maybe it didn't want to deliver to the room. Quite ridiculous.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great spot...!Cool, funky hotel right in the heart of Robertson Quay.Check in and out was an absolute breeze, staff friendly, room quirky and clean, wifi outstanding.Highly recommend, will be sure to revisit if in Singapore in the future...!
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is good as location . But the rooms are so small and the breakfast is almost ZERO . They are not serving anything with 20 Dolar per person . You can’t sleep in room because there is no air . The carpets are dirty . The reception boys and girls are nice and they are doing their best .
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Checked in on 2nd March 2019. Was warmly welcomed from your very friendly staff Mr William. I was a little unsure of the way around, mr William was more than happy to direct me to the closest convenience stores and food outlets. He went an extra mile and took the time to answer my questions with a warm smile eventhough it was an extremely busy day. Thank you Mr William and M social for the great and memorable experience
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel for our 4 day stop over in Singapore. Great location on Robertson Quay - excellent for bars and beautiful walk along the quay. Staff very helpful and attention to detail good as I requested a lower floor room which is normally lost on hotel systems but was given one on the 2nd floor. Great pool especially for an evening swim after a hot and humid day sightseeing.
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
