review_body: Stayed for four nights in this hotel, it was one of the most amazing hotels. If you’re looking for ultra luxury then this is not for you if you’re looking for something that’s modern with a great vibe then this is your place.  Great coffee shops and restaurants nearby, little bit far away from the train station. The bus stop is about eight minutes walk  The room service is excellent and a robot gets your food! The rooms of a comfortable, quiet and clean.  Hotel has a gym and a pool, The restaurant kitchen closes very early, before 10 o’clock in the night so you better find a different place to eatOverall, highly recommended great fun
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i love the service provided by the robots and the staff friendliness and the place is convenient to get around to places and also i enjoy the breakfast at the restaurant and i love the interior and cleanliness
hotelName:
15    M Social Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good property. Very nice swimming pool area. Next to a shopping mall with a very convinient grocery store. The rooms offer to us was a two room connected set. It helped us so much for a family of four.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wish it was a longer stay, Ramada is always my choice for staycations. Some things I miss or could be improved are the first 2 hours free parking at Zhongshan mall, complimentary bottled water at the gym/ pool, complimentary newspaper sent to my room & more TV channels.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stuff! Warm hospitality, clean rooms, very touching welcome for a diamond member, love everything about the hotel. Attached to a nice shopping mall and beautiful gardens. I love the free trip from Wyndham rewards .
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel with fair price, location is not so in downtown but Singapore is not huge City. The room are very nice decorated and well equipped. The bed is fantastic very comfortable I suggest this Hotel
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had interconnecting rooms for the family. The rooms were great and so was breakfast. It's a modest walk to the subway and there's a free shuttle bus if you don't want to walk it. And only a few stops to either the old downtown or Marina Bay.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its good to be back at Singapore where the fun is.. the thrills .. where the people are warm & hospitable... Having the right choice of staying at Ramada Hotel by Wyndham was such a great experience , making your vacation wonderful & relaxing each time you go back at the hotel, tired from a day’s walk , going around the beautiful places in Singapore plus the cheap finds of shopping around .. The good food everywhere , the many choices that you would have ... Just right in the surroundings of Ramada Hotel , you wouldn’t need to go far for chow time because right there , good eats are available...if you forgot to bring some toiletries.. snacks ... a stones throw away is the supermarket.. oh how we loved Ramada , making our vacation just how wonderful it is ... very accessible to yoir rides wherever you wish to go.. All the bests
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel room well organised. Internet line connection speed from the room need improvement. The check In & check out speed & services from the Reception staffs are good.Overall, very satisfied with the services from Hotel staffs during my recent visit.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I would like to leave a commendation for Ramada Singapore for their wonderful services during my wedding dinner banquet on June 16th. We would like to thank the sales manager May Tai and her team, who coordinated the event and had been so helpful to all our queries throughout the whole process. She had been really sincere and tried her best to ensure that everything runs smoothly.Banquet food is undeniably good, backed by thumbs-up from our guests. In particular, salted egg popcorn during the cocktail, braised baby abalone and mushrooms with seasonal greens, Ramada signature herbal chicken, lotus leaf fried rice and cream of avocado with aloe vera and sago is just heavenly. Portions were good and ingredients were of high quality. The Balestier Ballroom is very well furnished, with no pillars and a high headroom. The outdoor solemnisation venue is beautiful with no extra charges. Highly recommended if you want your money's worth for both food and ambience!We had 2 nights' stay in their standard room with bathtub (Bridal suite was available as an option for a night's stay). The room is just fine for the couple to recuperate from a long and tiring day of events. A day use room was provided to us as well, on the actual day. Highly recommended as a wedding venue! 5 stars.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here during a conference. The venue was at Marina Bay Sands, not very close - but the hotel was among the recommended by orgs - so the morning shuttles were very useful. Novena MRT station is 1km away, but there is a free shuttle there going until 10pm or so. Can be reached by feet anyway, not a big deal. Going back (downhill) is easier. Good breakfasts - though beware of spicy dishes, sometimes they may surprise you. A small shopping mall with a cheap food court, a supermarket and a few more shoppes is in the same building, requiring only a few lazy steps to reach. Good rooms, though the climate control system is a bit too aggressive for those who's chilled easily, and ventilation lacks in effectiveness (you cannot leave the room with AC on; there is only one card that must be put in the slot in order to have power); when you're back it smells a bit of socks (is dispelled in no time with the AC on).
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are clean, small for family but perfect if you are going to be out all your day and then come back only for good night sleep. Hotel is in the mall and there is 7/11 next to it. They have shuttle to metro station. Breakfast buffet was good. Overall a good stay, though nothing particularly remarkable about it.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great value and great service, location is convenient to city center. bus service is just outside of the hotel and a few steps away.. would stay here again when in singapore..the staff was very helpful and the shopping mall next door was very convenient.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel service and facilities were good , but it was far from attractions and access to metro lines needs to take bus.I did not use food and beverages at hotel but restaurant looks good. Staying in hotel was good experience but not the best.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decent place to stay. convenient as there is shuttle buses and public buses to town area.There is a mini shopping mall with decent food selection and there is a NTUC. Overall, it is a pleasant stay. Just that housekeeping need to take note. Some corners are dusty. The headboard of the bed.. can see the dust.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This review is long overdue!A special shout out and thank you to Front Desk staff, Shamala for taking care of my family. Thank you to the Banquet team, Suresh and Dinesh for accommodating to requests!The rooms were clean and amazing! Level 12 room attendant was friendly as well. Apologies as I have forgotten her name. She was Filipino.Overall, thank you! Such beautiful memories were created her in this amazing HOTEL!
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good rooms, good breakfast, very fast internet, not far to Orchard road, in the near is a nice beer restaurent, a bus stop is directly at the hotel, to a MRT Station you have to work 7 min, the personal is friendly
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decent hotel to stay with family.Had a good indian food option for breakfast.The front desk executive was very kind and provided me an early check in upon request as i was travelling with an infant.A little away from the main city area the orchard road and little india,but they provide free drop to the nearest MRTOverall a nice hotel
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel, staff, service, breakfast, cleanliness all 10 out of 10. There is a shopping mall conveniently located adjacent to the hotel providing access to multiple shops and a supermarket. The pool area is fantastic and the gym fairly well stocked. Overall exceeded my expectations.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i stayed for 9days this hotel. its very good place to choose when you travel to Singapore. they have shuttle bus to novena . it is quiet , clean, and nice. the supermarket is next door. and bus station too.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very clean and has good amenities like a clean swimming pool, a cool gym, 7-eleven just near the lobby and shuttle buses to Orchard.Beds and toilets were wonderful with good showers and king size beds.Only issue was that mrt was quite a distance and only assessible by bus or taxi/grab or shuttle buses.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ramada not set up for long stays family or otherwise; high laundry piece price, pay for ice as not ice machines. Room all the same, small and no connecting rooms available. More than three people requires two rooms. Guest shuttle service available and on time to MRT. Seems to be a service charge if you have hotel arrange a cab. Best to us Grab, Singapore version of Uber. Hotel dining very pricy but nearby connected mall has a variety food court with much better prices. Nice pool and beds comfortable. Stayed 21 nights but hotel ot set up for long stays, 2 or 3 nights best, otherwise find a service apartment for comfort and convenience. Surprised Wyndham offered non in Singapore, only Days Inn and Ramada. Days does have ice machine and available laundry machines and is right next door and available to use by Ramada guest if you ask.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall experience is good, less options for vegetarians in lunch and dinner even menu of breakfast was same for 7 days of stay, rooms are small but properly maintained, pool is very good, handy phone is a life saver with data and free calls to many countries including India.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel with average sized rooms but beautiful beds! Lounge chair in room was a bit grubby and room's amenities were almost non-existent. Helpful staff, excellent breakfast, easy to get anywhere by MTR or taxi. We only had a 5th floor room but would guess that high floors would give a great view.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very bad experience. The rooms were small and the bathroom was stinking and wet all the time. The staff was very rude and incompetent. House keeping staff wanted us to make the bed linen by yourself because as per them this is not their job.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place needs a new administration. Rooms smell like smoke. Walls are.thin and you can hear your neighbor snoring. Cutlery for breakfast.is consistently dirty. We saw staff take used cutlery and out it down for next guests. Our towels which we put I side where to get changes as the hotel brochure suggested instead of getting changed were spread on our bed to dey wet. Beds are poorly made from one day to the next.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great time at Ramada. At vicinity of some of the best places for shopping at Singapore. Nice ambience of hotel. Handy phone for international calls is a jackpot. Cleanliness and hygiene at the best. Mr Kumar at concierge is of a great help and goes all the way out to assist you. Whether it be maps, locations, cabs, places to visit etc.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: staff are friendly and helpful, location is great, room is good size and well kept and the shower was great. supermarket, 7/11 and great food within the premises. great experience overall. has shuttle service to novena.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great room and staff are very friendly. They also supply a handy phone that you can take with you when you go out. You can use this for help with public transportation and also fir calling ahead. Great service.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although the hotel was a bit far, it was connected to a mall - which had a 7-11, where we could get our nick nacks to eat. The breakfast was very good. There was a lot of variety. The rooms were well done up and were quite spacious - as compared to other properties. The shuttle bus service was a boon - as we could travel to Novena MRT and to ORCHARD ROAD (Scotts Road). The people at the service desk - Check in, Concierge and all the other staff were really helpful and guided us well. Over all - will give 5 stars to the hotel - in terms of property and people. Thank you guys for making our stay such a wonderful one.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed wid my family for 5 nights and its Vry nice hotel breakfast was good and room service good everything was good room view was also good ...... next time also i will stay there again. Its. So stressfree stay
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 5 nights with family . Overall enjoyed our stay in this hotel and very high standards services by everyone thereRight from check in to checkout it was hassle free and we felt at home and very comfortable three
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ramada hotel is a good choice for a staycation for family or couples or business purpose. The pool was good and my kid enjoyed it. The staff were all very friendly and we felt welcome throughout our stay. Keep up the good work Ramada!
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Handy to all amenities eg shopping mall , good reliable shuttle service to train station & more shopping malls, restaurants also nearby, friendly & helpful staff, good size swimming pool. Very clean & tidy, comfortable bed
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent service during my long stay. Very helpful staff, particularly Kalai at Concierge who was lovely throughout and made me feel so welcome. Only positive things to say about this hotel. Would thoroughly recommend it. Thanks so much Kalai and everyone else.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location not good so far for everyone rooms very small just like a two star property breakfast only for south Indian and Chinese people breakfast not good for north indian people so so hotel for guests
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is convenient for me. A no. of various restaurants are nearby. Though not near to the MRT stations, there are a no. of bus stops around the hotel. Except the noise nuisance problem, I was satisfied with this hotel.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel room was good, but vegetarian options at the breakfast was terrible. The food was stale sometimes and was completely tasteless at other times. And the same food was repeated for 4 days at a stretch!
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a night to help out a wedding. Booked the hotel via Trip.com but realized that Trip.com provided wrong information about the hotel such as 2x double beds in the room but the hotel has only single or king-sized beds. The hotel manager promptly resolves our reservation issues, it was pretty good. The room we were great except that the air conditioning was like 25 / 26 deg C regardless of the temperature we set, seemed like centrally controlled. We had another room located at a different level, the air conditioning was the same. Breakfast had a decent spread, good enough choices for a hearty meal. I supposed the ratings will be better if the air conditioning could actually be controlled.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent stopover for 2 nights in family neighbourhood. Clean as. Comfortable beds. Pool area is fantastic. Easy transport. I took local buses. Taxis are easy. Shopping mall for all food and dining right within the complex. And the “travel buddy phone” they provide to take with you around Singapore had all the maps, tourist attractions on it and transport options. Wifi excellent in hotel. Travel buddy connected when you go out.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room is not cleaned in a timely manner. The towel paper is not fine, hair drier is out of dated, the space between two beds are too limited. Can also hear the voice from rooms besides. Tooth brush is quite low and the cup in restroom for booth brush is not glass.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were staying for 2 nights while traveling from Bali to return home. Was a great chance to see Singapore. Our room was very dusty, not what I would expect from a Wyndham property. Space was enough for my wife and I to rest from long flight.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent wonderful time during my stay.Every staffs (concierge, bell boy, service staff, dinning staff) are kind and friendly.Morning buffet is als good quality and quantity.In the next time, I would like to try swimming pool.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed one night after 15 day cruise to relax before returning to Australia. Hotel was great, staff friendly. An explanation of how the room keys operated the lifts would have been nice - lots of confusion from guests as to how it worked. The piece of birthday cake that appeared in my room was a total surprise but most welcome and appreciated.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice gym with great trainer audrey.Out of this world functional gym with very helpful trainer Audrey. Great outdoor pool and training area and beautiful greenery. Enjoyed myself to the fullest. Serious gymers this is great training facility
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed a few nights before returning to the UK.Very nice hotel conveniently located and connected to a shopping mall.Thanks Kenny for looking after us.The strawberries were s lovely welcome in our room.Pleasant staff and excellent room.I can definitely recommend this hotel
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 2 nights again at the familiar Ramada hotel. All the staff are consistently helpful and friendly, special mention to the young man at the front desk, Kenny. Always polite, smiling and willing to assist.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location and very polite front desk staff, but air conditioning is fixed at 21 degrees unless you call and complain. Hot water system is totally unstable. Max TV volume is too soft to hear anything - even for my teenage son, let alone anyone older! Fridge in room was extremely small and didn't work. Fruits we bought and placed in it were spoilt as a result - not helped by the fact that housekeeping left the fridge door open after checking it! They charged more for extra beds than advertised! Told them it was idshonest and illegal.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall, a pleasant stay, relatively convenient location, room was very clean and modern, room service was timely and the morning breakfast spread was good but could be better. TV channels was not good, very limited channels.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed there with my family for 4 nights. Location is very good. Cab is easily available. Supermarket is is just next door. Swimming pool is also very good and children enjoyed a lot. If you take a extra bed then the room becomes very congested. No space to move. The room is fine for a couple with a small child. There is also a small fridge.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poor services from hotel staff. Highly not recommended. Full of indians noisy and attitude of hotel staff. Check in/out counter is also packed, staff are slow and only 2 counter. Cleanliness is not there too, full of ants in room desk. Toilet tissue paper i only see less than 1/3. What is the room service staff doing? The price paid was considered cheap but services is unacceptable.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I must say property is located at a very convenient location and close to market areas. They have got shuttle service which is a big plus and beautiful rooms with delicious breakfast. What i didn’t like in this hotel is very unwelcoming front desk team. Trust me this is worst front desk team i have ever seen in a branded property. Please give them proper training about welcoming guests with greetings & smile. Restaurant staff was very good specially the sweet lady on an egg counter. Front office team have a pet line stating come to reception at 02 pm for check in for all guest. I can understand that due to season hotels are running full but they should instruct guests that rooms are not available in a proper way and guide one can use swimming pool or shuttle service to spend their time but they dont care informing all this.Management should seriously look into the training or better front desk team or stay as a guest to feel their cold welcomes. Always remember “if you dont take care of your customer, someone else will”CheersNitin
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel for very good price. Check in process was awesome. We reached the hotel by 7AM itself and our reservation was from 2PM only. However they gave early check in by 10 AM itself which was very helpful.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Ramada offers everything you want in a good hotel. Check-in and check-out is efficient with helpful friendly staff. Room attendants/housekeeping do a wonderful job. The hotel provides a free mobile phone to use - it is a fantastic idea. Great bar/lounge are near foyer. The pool area is terrific, plenty of lounges and very clean. Free shuttle to Novena station is so handy & Shopping mall next door makes this an ideal location to base yourself in Singapore.
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a wonderful neighborhood and the hotel property is located in a lovely oriental background which is most appealing! The staff are amazing and all our needs were taken care of very well. A world class experience indeed!
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hotel with top notch services. They not only checked us in early but also catered to our every need. The hotel has a mall with excellent food and daily needs things. Everything was perfect. Would highly recommend to families :)
hotelName:
16    Ramada by Wyndham Singapore at Zhongshan Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in central tourism area,Adler Hostel is very easy to find. The place is clean and the staff is friendly. The shower room is very small (for me) and no air conditioner near bath room area, so it was quite hot.But it is still recommend for you who are looking for nice place in China Town area.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Adler is the place I usually stay at in Singapore. Good value for money (it's expensive but everything in Singapore is expensive) - it's clean, comfortable and has a great location. Staff are friendly and helpful. Very nice having a locker actually in the 'pod' - makes organising stuff easy. Bathrooms were super clean as always. Thoroughly recommend it.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a great experience at this hostel. Perfect location to explore Singapore, right next to two mrt stations. The room were well air-conditioned and had a little balcony. Each cubicle was large enough so it didn't feel like a coffin. I had a good night sleep. I slept in the S chamber, I think, in the mixed dorm. I expected to hear some snoring, but did not. And everyone was very understanding and was quiet when entering and leaving the room. I was shown great service at reception. I could even store my luggage a good while before check-in and after check-out. And the wifi was free and fast. Everything was also nice and clean. Would book again
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first time travelling alone, and my first time in a hostel. I decided to go with Adler Hostel because of the great reviews and pictures. I got a Queen bed through Agoda.com and was charged when I booked it. I paid extra for early check-in since I arrived at 7AM, and was brought to my bed. I had minimal sleep during the flight and was pretty exhausted, and since it was my first time at a hostel, was not very aware that it was quiet hours. The staff did not remind me that it was still quiet hours and I wasn't aware of how me unpacking and settling in would affect others.Anyway, the next day the lady across from me gave me a talking to. Apparently she's been staying at the hostel for over half a year now, and has been cross with many of the hostel guests in the past. I didn't want anymore future altercations, so I asked the staff if something could be done. The owner waited for me one evening at the lobby when I came in and assured me that it would not happen again, and offered to switch me to another room with a king bed.I accepted, although I was a bit disappointed because:1) I was there for the hostel experience and the king bed room was basically completely empty. 2) The queen bed room was also females only, and the king bed was mixed, which to me was a disadvantage. 3) The king bed room is on the top floor, and the hostel has no elevator, so it was a trek up everytime.4) The king bed is basically two single beds put together, and it isn't very comfortable to sleep between the cracks.. so really I had less bed space than I did on the queen.Regardless, at least I no longer had to deal with the lady. The rest of the visit was fine. The only thing I wished could be better was the washroom - when I shower, there are a bunch of tiny little termite looking bugs along the window sill which was a bit icky. Otherwise, the whole place was clean and the rooms were air conditioned (not the washroom though).My biggest problem was that when I got home, I noticed that I was charged AGAIN for the my total stay on the day I switched rooms. I had not agreed to paying double to switch to a king bed, and I didn't even want to in the first place. It has now been 1 month since my stay and I have contacted both Agoda.com and Adler hostel multiple times via email, but other than both parties denying that they double charged, and that they would look further into it, I have had no resolution. I called my credit card company to dispute the charge, but now I am stuck with the double charge on my credit card statement. If I don't pay it, my credit score will be hit and I may have to pay interest and penalties.This has overall been more of a frustrating experience for me. I've never had to do a charge back and I've never had so many problems with booking a stay. I don't think I will ever do hostels again.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 8 nights at Adler. I can sincerely say that it was a great experience and choice.What I really highlight from the hostel is good smell there is everywhere. Actually they make their own perfumes and soaps. Besides, staff is absolutely welcoming, always up to advice about anything you need from the city. I felt they really care about details which surprise you.It is location is very central, next to a beautiful and alive area of cafés and restaurants, and walking distance of everywhere.So, if you're looking for something good value for money in Singapore, and feel confortable in your stay in Singapore, I would definately go for it.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Adler has always been my top choice when I’m in Singapore. The beds are very comfortable, the rooms are spacious, staff are accommodating, and the location is excellent. I have no problem going around since the train is so near it. Oh, and Adler cafe serves good coffee, too!
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall this is a really good place to stay in a city that's very expensive. The location is excellent, the wifi is fast, the coffee is good and the place is clean. We were able to leave our luggage and walk around as our flight arrived very early in the morning. We were also able to get discount tickets for Gardens by the Bay from Adler. Just to clarify the sleeping situation, these are bunk beds in a dorm room. It was difficult to tell that by looking at the images. That said, the beds were great, the room was quiet and there was enough space for our stuff in the cubby hole along with a small locking cabinet. Although there is not a great place to cook--and breakfast is not included, there are hawkers markets close by where you can get a meal for $5US. While their photos are accurate, they showcase the fancy parts of the hostel and not the dorm room look or shared bathrooms.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really liked it there. The staff was friendly, the guests as well, it was clean and calming. Other that that the location is perfect. I explored Singapore mainly by feet. Right infront of the hostel there is Chinatown and behind it the bar-quarter Ann Siang Hill.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location in Chinatown. Very friendly and helpful staff. It seems more like a hotel than a hostel and the reception, sleeping area and bathrooms are clean and well organized. I stayed in the women only sleeping area and the other guests were respectful even when I reminded a couple of people that were talking loudly after 10:00 to be quiet. The hostel staff informed me when I checked in that people were not to talk on their phones or make noise after 10:00 in the sleeping area, so I politely reminded people (one at 11:30pm who was talking in a normal voice on the phone) and they were cooperative. The hostel just needs to make sure when they check people in to tell everyone to be quiet after 10 as there are 16 people in one sleeping area and travelers need their sleep! A great experience and I will definitely go back when I return to Singapore. Thank you
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Adler is perfect for foodies like me. You can enjoy the many delicious food that Chinatown has to offer and Maxwell Food Centre is also short walk away. The place is clean, comfortable and well-maintained, plus it smells awesome, too! Will probably go back again when I am in Singapore. :)
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Interesting pod hostel in a great location. Pods were clean, staff were helpful and check in and out was really easy and straight forward. Bathrooms were clean, showers were great. Nice place to stop for a few nights in Singapore.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very convenient and very adequate.Staff are very friendly.there is a small issue of noise because everything is in wood and the slightest bump or knock carries.Overall it was a good experience and well worth a second visit.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the best time at the Adler hostel! The staff was amazing (especially Jane). She made our time in Singapore unforgettable and showed us all around while sharing the history of the city. The space itself was super clean and comfortable. They provide you with a towels, AC, fantastic wifi, and hot water! Not to mention the have the most delicious coffee stand right out front where you can order snacks and yummy drinks. We will definitely be back here next time we visit Singapore!
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, beautiful lounge, clean bed it would be perfect if it has cleaned bathrooms. The safety is good but it would be nice if the receptionist has more kind and willing to help. So far recommended to everyone especially solo women.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bed is Spacious and cleaned, the room was quiet at night.Location is good, near to many food centres and also easily access to MRT.Staff is friendly.You may ask them to help you keep the luggage after check out (Convenient for solo traveller like me)Toilet cleanliness need to be improve.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is close to MRT and city centre. Facilities and staff were helpful. 7eleven is just across the road. Amenities were clean and bed were comfortable (had the queen bed sharing room and its spacious enough). Also equipped with a locker for each bunk bed. Aircon is cold haha. Had a pleasant stay. Will visit again next time!
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I went to Singapore with my friend in Jan 15-17,2019. The dorms are nice. The roof is very wide. So you can sit and stretch you legs. But I think the water closets are not clean. Some foreigners threw toilet papers into the WC. Mostly in Asian's countries, the toilet papers cannot get through the water closet. You have to take it into the bin.Other than that It is such a nice hostel.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Will definitely come back to stay here again! Convinient location and lovely service! Definite recommend :)The rooms and toilets are clean as well, its good for newbie travellers who are planning to save money as well!
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked at Adler at the very last minute, and it was for New Years.I arrived there quite early (7am) because my flight landed early but I travelled heavy so I decided to head to the hostel first and I knew I wouldn't be able to check in so early.When I arrived, for sure I disturbed the night receptionist, she probably didn't expect someone to check in so early. She told me to come back at 3pm to check in, fine for me but she could had said it in a nicer way and she could also offer to store my bags there until 3pm. I walked around for about 2 hours but I was very sleepy and tired so I headed back to the hostel to wait and take advantage of their wifi.I got my bed at 2pm instead of 3pm, the receptionist (a different one) felt bad that I had to wait for so long, thanks for the gesture. She was very nice and helpful.The queen bed is comfy. The beds are in sort of cubicles which has curtains and give us a lot of privacy. It comes with several shelves to put our belongings and a big locker. For backpackers, you can easily have you backpack with you inside the cubicle because there was a lot space. My queen bed was more than enough for myself but for two, it might be a little tight. The shower rooms and toilets are very clean for a hostel. Shampoo, shower gel and bath towels are provided. The common areas are very nicely decorated and cosy. You don't feel like you're in a hostel when you come in.The location was great too, in Chinatown, just a few minutes walk to Clarke Quay and Marina Bay. Maxwell food court within walking distance. Bus stop right outside the hostel and quiet at night. I was lucky, the other roommates were quiet and respectful towards the other guests. On my last day, the receptionist assisted me to book a shuttle to the airport as my request was very last minute (again). Overall, this is the best experience I've ever had in a hostel, in shared room. It doesn't look and feel like classic hostel and Adler claims to be a luxury hostel which is true as the prices are slightly higher than the other hostels but still cheaper than many other accommodations in Singapore.I would recommend Adler to anyone looking for a nice and comfortable budget accommodation.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I visited here for a few days on our way back home to the UK from Fiji. We booked a king pod for the two of us, which was very reasonably priced. Our flights got changed by the airline, and so we had to book an extra night separately (it was cheaper) and the hostel were very helpful in keeping us in the same pod the whole time, not having to move around even though it was our fault really that we had 2 separate bookings. The bed was so roomy, with a locker for valuables and a little shelf with a charger. We also got water and towels which was a lovely addition (especially after our 11 hour flight!) There’s plenty of space to keep your luggage out of the way, and even though we were worried about there being so many people in the room it never felt crowded, it was very quiet and we barely saw or heard another soul! The WiFi is great and the Air con is a life saver! There’s free coffee, a nice seating area and the location is also amazing, in the heart of china town with loads of eateries and markets around. Also very close to the train so it’s very easy and cheap to get around Singapore and see the sights.I would definitely recommend here, the receptionists were helpful and informative and we had a very comfortable and enjoyable stay :)
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First, I want thank you for Adler Hostel Staff. You have a great hostel and staff.Fast check-in eventhou when you have problem with your system.The bed is so large and there's locker at every cabin.Ur bathroom is so clean. Love your body wash fragrance. There is bus station in front of hostel that can direct to harbour (vivo city)Only 5mnt walk from Chinatown MRT Station. Repeat stay? Of Course!!
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recommend this amazing place What you see in the pictures is exactly what greets you.Adler you made my stay a delight ❤️ Your in the heart of Chinatown, trendy eateries and bars mixed together with traditional no fuss food stalls.The hustle and bustle of this location is left outside once you enter the Adler doors, cool calm and smells amazing, Adlers own signature scent hits the nose and after a few days once smelt you know your home from home .. that and adlers coffee ☕️ Served in its own bar.. perfect Thank you to the staff for welcoming me into there little haven
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Actually I have quite high expectations to my first visit to Adler’s hostel. Especially I saw this is the first luxury hostel in SG. Front Desk is friendly especially Nora.The ambience of lobby is very warm and friendly. Exactly like the photos.The bed is quite comfortable but both of my pillow are quite flat ord. I have to fold it up many times during my sleep to make my head more comfortable. Bed with curtain is very good to let us have our own privacy, but I quite disappointed with the bedsheet. The quality of bedsheet is not so soft and comfortable.it will keep come out when I m moving, suggest maybe can change to more good quality bedsheet to provide guests a good experience .I m staying in Ivory room. Aircon is cold ,and there is enough bathroom for our room. So no need queue up for shower. There are no any fridge at my tower.and the front desk told me if I need to use fridge, I can go another tower which two shops distance with current where I am staying, there got two fridges there. I am wondering that will be very inconvenience for those who staying at the 1st tower if we need to stock up some drinks in fridge. We have to go out.why don’t just leave one fridge in this tower?And currently they are no provide breakfast and a bottle of mineral water anymore,but opposite got 7-11. And beside the hostel got maxwell food court. There got plenty of Singapore famous foods. Superb location, bus stop just in front of the door, mrt station also takes few minutes walking only.Overall this is good stay. But still got abit distance to luxury. Hope managements can consider about the suggestion of bedsheet and fridge.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Adler hostel is truly a luxury hostel oasis in the heart of bustling chinatown. From the moment of check-in you get a sense that this is more than just any hostel it’s blurring the lines between hotel & hostel. ROOMSI can honestly say that for me this was the best dorm rooms that i have ever stayed in. So let me explain... i stayed in the premium chamber dorm suite that had a balcony overlooking the nearby famous hindu temple & chinatown. The room was fully air-conditioned had spare luggage storage & even a clothing steamer for the digital nomads out there. My bed was like having my own room, the custom bed has its own curtain, locker, plenty of shelves for extra storage & two lights. It felt super cozy once i was all set up for the night. BATHROOMSTruly in terms of hostels these bathrooms would be classed as luxury. Super high quality finish with luxury shampoo & soap provided. Showers are super strong, hot & had plenty of space to put all your things. COMMON AREASThey have two common rooms as they have two buildings within a few meters of each other. Elegantly furnished with eclectic furniture from around the world. A widescreen tv, mac computer & espresso machine are free for you to use. The comfy sofa next to reception is a great place to unwind after a hard day exploring. SERVICES The staff at reception where there to help & answer all my questions / needs 24/7. They have luggage storage, laundry, espresso machine, purified water. The coffee shop located in the second building has a great selection of coffee, iced drinks & food.LOCATIONIts in the heart of chinatown in the downtown area of Singapore. The location is perfect for access to the metro & also for all the amazing restaurants & nightlife in nearby chinatown. I rented an electric pedestrian scooter to help me get around the city much quicker & i recommend to do the same..
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best hostel i have ever visited . Very clean and comfy, the staff were so friendly. There is quiet and peaceful at nights and Location was really good. I totally recommend this hostel for everyone!
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I moved here from really crappy hostel and could not have been more pleased. Staff just lovely. Fantastic public space with great decor. Clean accommodation. Thoroughly recommend. Near MRT and walking distance of river, etc.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister and I had stayed 4 nights at Adler. It was overall an awesome experience! The pods were sturdy, mattresses were fine, we were able to sleep through the night pretty well. What I love the most was that the pods were private enough (thick curtains with hooks on both ends to hold them, thick walls) to give us a sense of safety despite sharing the room with other people. The decor is so chic. The receptionist who worked the night shift were also very friendly. This will be the default choice for us in Singapore.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for one night on a long layover passing through Singapore. It was an easy journey from the airport on the metro system (about an hour). Great hostel experience. The check-in process was easy, and the place was tidy. Beds were comfortable and provided lockers contained within. Curtains allowed privacy and better sleeping conditions. No free breakfast but the coffee was nice. Right outside the door is Chinatown with lots of food and things to do nearby.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My first time stay at a really nice hostel, Comfortable bed and everything, staff all friendly with love.The only one thing I don't like is some guest not quiet in the dorm...but not everyone does the same.Hope can stay again when I back to Singapore:)
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ups:- Location in Chinatown which is always a great place to be in- Quirky seating areas to sit with the laptop, or use their Apple computer if you need to- Modern(ish) feel to rooms- Locker in the bed area with a lock to keep valuables- Lug socket and light in the bed area- Comfy enough bed- Clean bathroomsFYIs:- No locker for bags so have to keep them in an allocated space in the room (no issue if you have a lock on your bag as you have the small locker for valuables)- Although the rooms have signs for people to be quiet, this was not the case and we had several neighbours (different ones at different times) having no respect for noise levels both late at night and in the morning. Although this is not the fault of the Hostel it seems the signs have no effect- Baggage storage is by the stairs in the Hostel, not locked up but there are cameras in the area so didn't feel uncomfortable leaving bagsWould stay again
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in one of the cabins in the Ivory Suite (women only room). The bed was very comfortable, with the right height and level of privacy from the screen curtain and plenty of room (including locker) to store personal things without having to pack/unpack each time.The bathrooms are clean and the common room area is beautifully scented with ginger lily. The general decor is beautiful and lux, with hardwood furnishing that I would love to have at home. The only little thing I could critise is that the upholstery on the dining table chairs are threadbare with some of the filling coming out.The staff are also very helpful and friendly.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first time to travel alone. The staffs at Adler were so nice and kind to me. The location is very convenience,easy to go many place. Bed was clean and I felt very comfortable even it was a dorm. To compare with another hostel where I stayed in SG,Adler is much better.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super helpful staff, and lots of plus points would have me coming back here again and again.Whilst the room has many beds, they are very clever in their design; shelving and curtain for privacy and self containment.Within 5 mins of the Amoy Food Centre, which offers outstanding value food
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For me personally it is a good hostel compare with the other hostel, there is still something missing.so 1. toilet is clean and the capsule as well,2. apart from that, there is some goodness as well, the bed is comfortable, and the AC is cool, the toilet work just fine, and everything is in a good condition.3. walking distance to mrt station and there are bus stop as well around the hostel.however,4. there is no locker for luggage, but they compensate that with cabin size locker in the capsule which is acceptable.5. the worker not so friendly but helpful, they didn't smile or myb that is just their style, I don't know why but I just stay as friendly as possible.6. No lift and the room is at the 3rd floor which is ok for me because most of the capsule I stayed before don't have it either.for me it is good enough to stay in this hostel, recommended if you despite the negativity~
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dear god, where do I begin??? We. Booked and paid in full for a double female only to arrive at Midnight and be told they only had 2 singles (I had to climb up to top bunk as my mum is 69). You couldn't swing a cat in the room and I had to move some of our stuff in to the hallway!!We found out through the night we were in a mixed dorm with men!!!! Then at 6 am that morning some tourist who wanted to see the room comes in shouting!!! We decided we were out of there, used the dirty bathroom (shower hardly worked and was dirty including shower over toilet!) . So hungry, only to found out they don't include breakfast any more!!!!!! Called the nearest lovely hotel and booked next 2 nights at Parkroyal as I felt so bad for my mum. Who by the way is used to staying in "flash packers" as this one calls itself!! The gorgeous man on duty, Manesh was our only saving grace, he went over and above the call of duty and spoke to Manager to return our money. Thank you kind Sir, you were a God send❤️ What a start to our holiday!!!
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location. Well situated in Chinatown and just steps away from Ann Siang Hill (a stripe with nice bars) and less than 10min walk to CBD. Walking distance to 2 hawker centers with cheap local food.Nice bed and good privacy. Stayed in a 16-bed dorm yet to my surprise felt much privacy with the curtains for each bed area. Hostel is good value for money however agree the deco shown was simply the common area. The room I stayed in are functional yet simple.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good low budget option and in a good location. The bed was a bit uncomfortable but for the price I have no complaints. Toilets and showers were nice and clean. Staff were very helpful. If you are ok sharing a room then I would definitely give this place a go
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in the king bed mixed dorm - except the bed wasn’t so much a king as two twins put together. Moreover, it was very uncomfortable. I like a firm bed, but this was hard to the point that it was difficult to sleep. Aside from that, there was a nice view out the dorm windows, the a/c and WiFi worked well and it was nice location in Chinatown.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Adler felt like home. Super convenient location, super warm staff. It's a great place to stay at, for solo and group travelers alike. Real tidy and chic. I would love staying here again, miss you Adler!
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is as good as it can be: you have access to all of Singapore's fabulous Chinatown right outside the door, and only a few minutes walk to the bay marina. The Adler is located on South Bridge road, which passes through some of the most beautiful parts of the city and ends in the vicinity of Little India. The renown hindu "holy cow temple" is just opposite the Adler, and shawm music wakes you up in the morning.The property is cosy and shared spaces are big, but quite worn out and need more attention and better cleaning. A huge plus, though, for the wonderful shower cream which makes you happy if you like oriental scents. There's complimentary coffee and tea but no breakfast served which is bad. They would much increase the positive experience of the place by just serving kaya butter toast and eggs with the coffee, a local tradition.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you to Adler, very relaxing place with loads of personal space in a bustling city. Good beds, walking access to nearly anywhere in the city. Perfect distance from china town. Excellent air conditioning
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is one of the nicest hostel we have stayed in on our round the world trip. LocationThe hostel is situated right in the city centre. China town is across the road and is very clean and doesn’t smell from all the food etc like some other China towns I have been to in the passed. There is also a 7/11 located on the street too. Along with many restaurants and bars within 2 walking distance from the hostel. China point mall is a 3 minute walk from the hostel which has everything in it. MRTYou also have China town MRT station across the road which is on a great line for getting around Singapore. Use the directions on the ‘Adler Hostel’ page on hostelworld for getting from the airport to the hostel it costs less than £2 and it’s honestly so easy trust me. Marina bay is around 10 mins on the MRT or 20-30 minute walk. Use the MRT as it’s soooo unbelievable cheep use. Get a Flash card thing at any station for S$12 and you get S$7 credit to use on the MRT and you top it up. Your travel will be so much easier as you can just tag on and off instead of buy tickets all the time. It’s like London’s oysters card. Any money you have on it can take off when you leave Singapore. StaffAll the staff are so nice and friendly and always there too help you in anywhere you want to go. There are many young staff who work there but there is a lady which works there who was so nice and always so welcoming and interested in our trip and making us laugh. DormThe dorm was great and very clean. They have good quality curtains and very comfy beds. You have a good size locker in the wall next your bed which is great. Nice cosy duvet cover with two pillows too. The showers are hot and powerful and clean. The dorm has good aircon too. HostelThe common type of area is very nice and has comfy couches and chairs. They have a iMac computer which you can use if you need to surf the internet or print stuff out. You can also wash and dry you clothes here as they have there own machines I the 1st floor. There is also a water machine on the second floor next to the washer and dryers to fill your water bottle up. It’s also very secure in a safe location and has 24h staff. PriceFor all the people who are traveling and find the price a bit expensive honestly just pay it and be in the city centre where you can jump on the MRT or walk to all the sights and be in the middle of everything going on. This is probably the best places I have stayed on my whole trip. I would definitely come back. Well worth the money. ThanksAdler Hostel.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hostel in good location - within China town and a 20 minute walk to the marina. Clean and comfortable beds.Bathroom facilities ok.Overall I think very good value hostel for central location in Singapore.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hostel is very close to chinatown metro. Bout 5 mins for a 5ft asian female legs. About 2km walking distance to merlion 20-30mins normal/slow pace. Hawkers nearby about 10-15mins walking.separate shared toilet for females. No lifts though so youll have to take stairs.perfect for a short stay.not bad for igs price.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar

review_body: In Chinatown, 5 mns walk from MRT, 15 mns walk to Marina Bay, I stayed 3 nites in the female dorm. Confortable with curtain, electrical outlet, private locker.Two different lounges, free water, tea and coffee.I ll be back !
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They dont serve breaksfast anymore since 2018, so this listing in airbnb (and also here apparently)needs to be updated. I booked the queen bed in ladies only room/floor. ++the place is clean, room is very spacious (moslems can pray without blocking anyone’s way like in most hostel, there’s vanity to do make up)never queue for bathroom (also the bathroom on this level is ladies only). I appreciate the jet washer in the toilet also because it’s hard to find in SG- -Some of the minor cons are the blanket is not wide enough for 2, we have to sleep stuck together. Sometimes the water filter is empty so we cant get free water. On the last day, a male worker came into our room without warning :( good thing we’re all already properly clothed by then. But sometimes the girls are wearing only towel or underwear, so this could potentially be problem. Overall I feel like this is one of the best hostel i’ve ever stayed in, despite the minor problems
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good branding is everything! In my travel-magazin on the plain to Singapore I did reed an article about these new boutique-hostels- the Adler Hostel was featured in there as well. I was intrigued- nice design, more comfort, space and privacy in a modern setting, what's not to like. Booked.My first impression on arrival, yes everything what you saw previously on the website is there. But in detail it's a different story: The furniture in the lobby is kinda cheap and some stuff is worn down, you can tell that it is more of a setup for a good photo shoot then actual quality. Besides the fancy looks, the rest of the building is more functional. Same goes for the dorm. You get what you paid for, but just that and not more. Its still a hostel, luggage all over the place, bathroom cleanliness depends on the residents and the window that was promised in the room... it is more a hole in the wall. This sounds pretty bad, but that's not the goal of my review. It is just that you can adjust the expectations. There is a lot of good to report. Comfortable beds, good towels and soap is provided, free coffee and stable in-room internet. The staff is very helpful and friendly as well. It is a really good hostel with a nice design- but it's a hostel non the less.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice place to stay if you are solo traveller. Stay at this hostel for 2 night with my friends. Very peacefull enviroment & clean. Staft also very polite & friendly.Nearest to Chinatown Mrt & bus station. Nearest to food stall & have kedai mamak there. 7-eleven just infront of the hostel.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is really great - public transport stops are near, you can walk to many sightseeing around. This hostel provides free walking tours on certain days (in Chinatown and Little India), as well they have cheap tickets to Marina Sand bay and other places. The hostel interior really inspiring, fast free wi-fi everywhere. No breakfast included but you can buy coffee from a machine or just go across the street to "7eleven" and buy everything you need. They provide towel and in a bathroom, you can find shampoo and shower gel. I stayed in this hostel only 1 night in "Vault room". It's 6-bed female dorm room without a window on the first floor that has separate WC and shower room. However, when I arrived first of all in their system was shown that I booked a bed in mixed dormitory I explained and ask to check again. They changed to a room I booked. Like a room is without a window you feel a bit humid inside, even if there is a airco. You don't have too much space in the room as well if you stay in the bed that facing the wall with stairs to other rooms (for example bed no 2) you can hear quite loud sounds of the steps. I assume only people who use Vault room should use the toilet and bathroom but also people from other rooms come there (and those who stays in the lobby). You get 2 different pillows, warm blanket, my towel was with a big big hole but clean. Everything looks clean but for such price, I think it should be maintained better especially bathroom. The staff very helpful and friendly. If I would need to stay in that area again, I would search for a cheaper place, coz without unique interior I think the rest is like in most of the hostels.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed her for a few days whilst in Singapore. It’s location is very convenient, right next to China Town. The MTR is about 10 minutes walk away. The rooms are spacious and the bunk beds are three storeys high. If you have a preference for the bottom bunk and dislike climbing up and down, make sure you let them know at the time of booking. Each bed is self contained. It has a black out curtain giving you complete privacy, you own small lockable cupboard at the end of the bed, shelves, two lamps and two electrical sockets. It’s a really nice setup. The mattress is firm, just how I like it. The o lot downside is that the mattress gets a bit hot due to the waterproof type top layer meaning it does not breath as well. The showers and toilets are clean and the common areas on the group floor has plenty of chairs and sofas to relax on. The breakfast is very basic, some cereal and toast. However this is included in the price and since you’re right next to China Town with all the hawker food stands, it is very cheap to go out for breakfast. I was personally not able to login to the WiFi but I had my own internet with my phone provider so it was not an issue. I know if I really needed the WiFi, the staff would have assisted. The aircon the room is strong and keeps things cools as well as the air fresh. Some have complained on here about the room being freezing cold. It isn’t! It is fine. It is a mixed dorm. It is much easier to put on more clothes if you are cold than to strip off which would not be appropriate. Plus, there are blankets. The main downside of the place is that the showers are not very hot, just luke warm. There is also no air con in the bathrooms or hallways so it is very humid and stuffy outside your room. However, this isn’t such a bad thing and it is good for the environment. Perhaps fans might be a good compromise. All in all, a very good place. Not as good as the hostels I stayed in whilst in Japan but they do set a very high bar. I have yet to stay a hostels anywhere in the world to the standard of Japan. A solid four out of five for this place.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really nice and clean hostel! The beds have curtains so that you have privacy and there are quiet hours between 10pm-8am so that you can always get a good nights sleep!The bathrooms were nice although the showers weren't hot (even after turning the water heaters on).The wifi was excellent- really speedy.The breakfast was nice although finished really early at 9am which is extremely annoying!! Especially when you're on holiday so want a lie in. In my opinion this should be extended until 10:30/11am.The staff were really helpful and it is in a great location in China Town.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well... the staff and lobby were incredibly nice. Would not say the same about the sleeping chambre or the toilet/shower. Breakfast was simple and boring. But it was cheap and china town is lively part of the town, so I'd say give it a go.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is located in the heart of Chinatown and a mere 5 minute walk from the MRT Station. Its location is perfect for experiencing an older part of Singapore. But, I think the main strength of this unique hostel is that it is in a heritage building which has been re-purposed as a hostel. It has maintained the facade and a lot of the interior design. This creates the feel of the past.The main issue is that if your room is facing onto the main road, it could be noisy. Singapore is a city that never seems to sleep.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed twice here. First, we checked-in (mixed) for one night when we just arrived in Singapore. Then, we checked-in (ladies) again for 2 nights after our Malaysia trip. Our first stay was better than the second. It was located three doors away from the main reception. I think it was their new building. During our second stay, I asked for possible transfer of rooms but the reception girl said they were full and cannot accomodate requests (Grand Prix weekend).Old (above main reception): windowless; New: with windows Old: Pillows are thin; New: Pillows are big and soft.Old: Doors of bathroom have spaces. New: Doors can completely close.Comforters and towels were good for both. Aircon and water okay. But they dont change towels and sheets everyday (maybe only after guests check-out).Breakfast was served in the new bldg so if you are staying at the old one, you got to go out of the street and walk three doors more. Breakfast was simple; cereals, bread and jam, scrambled eggs, and coffee. That's it. No fruits, no sausage, no juice, as seen in previous pics. Maybe they changed menu.I asked for assistance in wifi with the reception guy, but he prioritized the guests checking-in who came AFTER me. I ended up on my own.But I commend the reception girl who booked our USS tickets. Very fast and friendly.:)Check-in was strictly 3pm. I arrived 2:40 but the reception guy said I still have to wait for 20mins more. I think pics posted in sites were from the new bldg.
hotelName:
17    Adler Hostel & Coffee Bar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Service is good room super staff so good staf is cooperative do thanks, breakfast was very delicious and the staff like mr Kazim was really helpful all the time , shopping malls nearby hotel , nice location...

review_body: Myself and my colleague stayed here for a night.My colleague’s room didn’t have a toothbrush kit and upon requesting for one, the answer given was,”sorry sir it is out of stock”.You don’t expect such answers after paying a bomb to stay! I requested for one and was given 2 sets for my use, but my colleague staying in the same floor ,with similar room & tariff gets a different answer.Didn’t expected it from Parkroyal!

review_body: Me and my wife stayed in this hotel for 2 nights it is an amazing hotel breakfast was very deliciius my room was upgrade into club room 19 floor by mr kazim , indian restaurant are nearby this hotel easy to get all Indian food ..

review_body: This is clearly an older hotel that is now undergoing some major renovations. But even so, the fundamentals are all there. Staff were helpful and courteous, rooms spacious and clean, the pool and gym were nice areas to relax. Unfortunately there are major building works next door and the noise outside is constant from 7am till 9pm. The renovation work being done inside was well managed and didn't affect guests at all. Some of the nicer perks in a hotel of this price are missing, such as a snack bar or free local calls. While I would be happy to stay here again, it was overpriced considering the location, renovations being done and the modest facilities.

review_body: I had visited this hotel from 21 june to 24 June 2019. I had booked superior deluxe room. When I check in hotel, there was very long que for checking in and only 3 person is on seat for check in. It took around 1.5 hour for checkin process. And secondly They don't know how to talk to customer. They only cheat and want to make money. There is small stain on bed sheet. They told that stain is not going after washing and they had tried all the things on stain. So we have to pay its price i.e. 116 SGD (6150.00 RS.). Then we told them that it is easily washable. They told us to clean it ourself and return. When we clean it, stain goes easily. They had not properly clean it. I told them that I have never seen this type of hotel who charge for bedsheet. Infact they have not even clean it. I didn't expect this type of cheating from 4 star hotel. I think that they even don't deserve a single star.

review_body: There are many good food attractions around the hotel, The staffs are really nice and reply in timely manner. I got some flight problem, they are willing to adjust the booking time, it's really nice of them. The communication went well although there are several staffs in charge. With Chinese background, I am pretty familiar with the little delights and cultural symbols in room deco, and I think these are pretty fun and attractive with unique style, especially for western visitors.”

review_body: This is a great boutique style hotel. The rooms are comfortable and quiet. The location is very good, close to the Tiong Bahru markets and local shops. It is very close to the buses and no more than 10 minutes walk from the MRT. The staff here are both friendly and very helpful.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Nostalgia is a converted shophouse furnished in the older European style favoured in pre-war Singapore. The staff are welcoming and speak English as well as Chinese. Super location in Tiong Bahru with an excellent seafood restaurant next door, bus stop just outside the hotel, and the famous Tiong Bahru Market just round the corner. Tiong Bahru market is a hawker centre with all kinds of delectable Asian specialities and fresh fruit juices. Breakfast was included and tasty. The hotel has a small rooftop pool with loungers and a dip in the pool makes for a nice end to the day! Good deals on happy hour at the bar, and on-site restaurant which mainly does Western food. By American standards, rooms can seem small. If you are a couple or family, it's a good idea to let them know that you would like a larger room. You pay a small deposit at the start of your stay (this is common in most Singapore hotels). You can walk to Tiong Bahru MRT (subway/metro) in 15 minutes and this MRT also has a shopping centre, pharmacy and some cafes. Outram MRT is a similar distance.Tiong Bahru is an historic district and an up and coming 'hipster' destination. It's a chance to see a part of Singapore which happily combines its history (as one of Singapore's first public housing estates) and Singapore cool. I would love to come back to this hotel
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I have always enjoyed a weekend getaway at Hotel Nostalgia because of its location, which is literally 5 mins away from home. After a couple of stays, there was a particular morning that I called front desk requesting for a late check out. The front desk Staff, a female, acknowledged my request. When I wanted to confirm the late check out, she responded "you've stayed here before right?". This was sarcasm that was not necessary but we let it slip. Moving on, just this previous afternoon, a staff, perhaps manager named Jeffrey had checked us in with the worst attitude I've ever experienced from a front desk staff. My husband and I felt really hurt and discriminated perhaps because we are singaporean Indians and were judged as a couple checkin in for fun. Jeffrey asked us for our Identity documents, which is a normal protocol but the manner in which he asked for it was too obvious to overlook. We still let it slip because we just wanted to have a good weekend. Right after he verified our identity cards and gave us a form to sign, he outright accused us of smoking in the room the previous time we checked in because he said the housekeeper had smelt it. I assured him that we have never done that because we've been checking in there since last year and we are well aware of the no-smoking policy. Despite me trying to explain to him, he brushed me off with a very cold shoulder and insisted that we will be fined if it happens again. At this point I told him to watch his tone because it was disgusting and rude, the way we were being treated. I will never go back here and I hope the staff can improve on how they speak to their customers in the future.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel a couple of kilometres from central Singapore with a more personal touch. The staff were very helpful. There is a small bar for a intimate drink inside and a small outside diner attached to the hotel for those not wishing to travel too far for a meal.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room just needed a bit more space so we could both get in and out of bed without having to climb across the bed. Also, they have a well stocked bar but not so good at mixing drinks and when we asked to sit inside for dinner, instead of out in the humidity, they were at first reluctant to use the dining room.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We liked the hotel. Clean, tidy and lovely décor. The staff were really nice and helped us out with maps, directions and cabs. There were many small restaurants close by but we really wanted to go into the central Chinatown market area. This was quite some distance away - around a 25 minute walk. We had thought we would be closer. The pipes were really noisy which was probably to be expected for an old style hotel. A little disturbing though. The hotel felt really safe and there was a restaurant attached so that was also a bonus.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great choice, also as a simple business hotel. Interior was recently refurbished and very clean. Staff super friendly. I would definitely come again and could recommend them. Great price for the value you are getting
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived after midnight, the check-in host was fantastic and we got offered 15% vouchers. We did not use the vouchers, the food market is close (across the road) and it is much cheaper.The hotel cleanliness was really good, the rooms were nice and tidy. I was disappointed to find we had a small room with a inside building view and that was really disappointing, the room felt dark and shutter wood slats that are faced so not enough light can come in.Let put it this way I wouldn’t want to stay again if I get a small “deluxe” room. It makes me wonder what a Standard room would look like?!The bar/ staff they give you a smile and turn on the fans for only people who order from the bar, not for people who want to just sit and relax outside in the bar area.Happy to say they allow drinks from the seven eleven shop next door.The old guy I believe known as Jeffery made us feel unwelcome he is absolutely rude, no smile, welcome or any sort of acknowledgement, he really is rude and does need some skills in Customer Service.The hotel seems fine otherwise, but be aware you cannot also leave a room card in the electricity slot because Jeffery will get angry like he did with us. I have to give two stars because of the room view & size, along with arrogant Jefferey and not putting the fans on constantly only when people order.I noticed the staff will really attend to you when you order from them. Thank you for the stay, but I would not come back.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia

The tiles below & around the pool were SO dangerous! We both slipped & fell at different times, despite taking slow steps. The tiles should be replaced immediately to avoid a really really serious accident.

19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this is heritage hotel but room is clean, size comfortable small but beautiful, even a bit far away from business activity but still hotel location nearby market and also some food culinary so it is good to stay
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love staying here. The service is exceptional and nothing is a bother. The room is always kept clean and the bed is comfortable. I love the small pool and always pleasant after a long day out around Singapore.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best boutique hotel in town. Room was clean and comfortable. Hotel owner and staffs are super kind and friendly. The hotel was in great location too. Dont forget to try their foods and the new menu...❤️
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
