review_body: My wife and I were on a 16 hr layover in Singapore, and I didn't want to spend too much on a hotel room due to the short time frame. I have elite statuses with various hotel collections, but they were not worth the price since we weren't even going to enjoy the amenities. So, I decided on this boutique hotel since this was close to Hawker Chan and Clarke Quay which we wanted to check out. I have to say that I was very impressed with the hotel location and style. Also, the service that we received from Siti, the front desk agent, was top-notch. She made us feel very welcome, she was very helpful, and she gave us one of the best rooms with a balcony in the hotel as an upgrade. The extra service meant a lot to us. We definitely will stay here again, and I recommend this hotel to everyone else.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here on three separate occasions in the last month whilst visiting family and on each occasion the Nostalgia came up trumps. Nothing fancy.....clean, comfortable beds,great showers. Breakfast on a busy street corner watching the world so by. Staff friendly, professional and attentive. Would happily stay here again.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for 3 nights at this hotel during my stay in Singapore. I found the hotel to be very suitable to my needs. The hotel itself was comfortable with the rooms being a decent size and quite clean. The staff was quite friendly and helpful. The hotel's location is pretty good for seeing Singapore. While it is not right near most of the tourist sites, it is close to public transit which can get you anywhere easily. It is also walk able to the riverfront area which is quite nice to walk along. I found there to be lots of good restaurant options in the vicinity. I would recommend staying here if you are looking for a reasonably priced option in Singapore.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice location, clean room and a variety of places to walk to. Didnt need the pool but wish i had. Breakfast is basic but with a four day stay the allowed me to have variations, rather than the standard. Would deffinatelly stay there again should i have business in the area. Reception were very attentive!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am totally satisfied and very happy with my stay at Hotel Nostalgia. The staff is friendly, very helpful and efficient. The place is clean and always smells fresh. The location is fantastic! The market is just next door to it. It sells great local food, fruits and sundry. There are restaurants nearby and a bakery too. The laundromat is only a stone's throw away. The bus-stop is in front of the hotel and it is only a few bus-stops from the (MRT) train-station and the big shopping centre. Everything is extremely convenient. The room is quiet. I've stayed there a few times already and always go back there. Kind regards, Niki
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located 10 minutes from the metro station. Very close to market and great restaurants. The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable about the surrounding area. I would recommend the hotel.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great staff, very friendly and helpful. A very nice experience, to live the urban life in a very elegant district of Singapore. The hotel has a cute rooftop pool.Well served by MRT (Tiong Bahru stop on green line). It is close to the Tiong Bahru Market where a foud court is available as well.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located between 2 MRT lines. Both takes 7-10 minutes walk to the hotels. A convenient store and food market nearby. Also, you can take the Airport Shuttle from the airport. It cost SGD9.00.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel and location with plenty of restaurants in the immediate vicinity.Only a short walk to the MTRWould have given Nostalgia five stars except that our room was very compact and struggled for space for our suitcases
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The employees were very friendly and helpful.I will certainly book this hotel again when i visit Singapore in the future.Absolutely advisable for persons who want to explore the city on their own.I have been walking to china town and back in the evenings without any problem.There are a few nice restaurants and a nice market in the surroundings.I will tell my friends about your hotel
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The neighborhood of Tiong Bahru is perfect. It's not crowded, there's a hawker center just around the corner, and many stores, cafes, and bars to wander into. It's a 10 min or so walk to the nearest MTR station. Staff was always helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed here in the past and it’s ok, rooms are tiny but the staff try to deliver a good service. This time I booked a room with breakfast included and when I saw their breakfast menu I decided to get eggs benedict. I was told that I had a set breakfast and couldn’t choose. I asked if I could pay a supplement since the option they offered and the thing I wanted were the same price but they did not want to accommodate. I do not see why it is so hard to accommodate a customers preference, especially when they are offering to pay extra for it.Singapore has lots of options and the small touches make a big difference
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel has a good location. It is situated within the Tiong Bahru housing estate, very near to Tiong Bahru market.The nearest public transport are bus stations, where there are buses from the hotel to Orchard, Chinatown and all tourist areas.As for the room, the size of the room is very small, it can just fit in two persons. But hotel is cleanStaff are friendly and accomodating
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed two nights location good for public transport and local market around the corner was absolutely fantastic. We arrived early and the manager had a room nearly available so we waited for it. Well it was very small and would not recommend it, hand basin in the shower was not ideal. Would go back again but not to that room.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the location in a heritage area and close to delicious hawker markets where there was always something new to try. Only problem at the hotel was the air - conditioner which blew cold air on to us as we tried to slept, if you turned it off the room got too hot and stuffy.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really liked the location. Tiong Bahru is a lovely neighbourhood and the hotel is really close to the food centre which is definite must-visit. The hotel is old but without the old-time charm unfortunately. Don't expect Maison Borella. Rooms are tiny but clean.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want to stay in the Tiong Bahru area then this small hotel is highly recommended. Hotel rooms are small but comfortable enough. It’s right next door to all the best cafes and restos as well as the Tiong Bahru market. Value for money!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Some of the most helpful people we have encountered on our travels. They run a friendly, efficient hotel and serve a great breakfast. The rooms are a little small but the staff more than make up for that. It's on the hippo bus route which makes it easy to explore, there's also a big market over the road where you can buy many varied meals. Without hesitation we recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First impression on arrival is professionalism, friendliness and courtesy of the staff. Rooms and bathrooms are squeaky-clean but small. As a guide to prospective guests, our superior room had a double bed with one side pressed against the wall and a narrow walkway the width of a bedside table on the other. There was little room for cases. If you are the sort of traveler who feels the need to spread out, this could be a consideration. For us, it was adequate. All appointments were first-class: excellent toiletries, toothbrushes, and facial tissues (often neglected by hotels). There is a room safe and security, in general, seems good.The area is excellent - a nice part of town with several good restaurants and just across the road from the Tiong Bahru food centre (a very clean, orderly hawker centre with an enormous choice of excellent food).If, as we do, you like to use public transport, the Singapore transport card is so convenient and there is a bus stop to town almost outside the hotel.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything as they promised. The room always clean, all the staff kind and nice. The pool was open almost all day and the breakfaste was delicius. The subway is not close, almost 15 minutes by walk, however, buses stop a block ahead.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonder little Hotel in a older area of Singapore. Much quite than the city. Only a short walk to MRT (train) and buses that go everywhere are just across the road. Fantastic local Hawkers food centre around the corner . All the staff were fantastic , Zul in the bar was very helpful and will do his best to answer any questions you have about the area. The rooms are small but very clean and when on holiday a room is for sleeping after you have had a great day out. I have stayed in a number of places in Singapore and I will definitely be staying at the Nostalgia Hotel again. Thank you to all the lovely staff for making our stay in Singapore very enjoyable.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love staying in this hotel whenever i go to Singapore. Ive been here 3 times already this year. The ambiance is really good, its cozy. Its near tiong bahru market, near the mrt and bus stop is in front of the hotel. Thank you!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Nostalgia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my second time staying in V Hotel, Bencoolen. I like the location of this hotel. Even though the room was little crampy for 3 of us but we enjoyed our stay here. The hotel staffs are very efficient and helpful. Sure will come back to stay here again.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you Henry for your great service to us when stay at V hotel Bencoolen. You make our stay easier woth your kind help. Keep up the great service to your guest. We will be back for sure. See you soon.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: -This hotel is easy to locate, right off the train station and other visiting places.-Hotel staff are so friendly and helpful.-The air can be better in the room I stayed in... It was stale, but the room was nice, clean, air conditioned, lots of light. -there is a pool and coin operated laundry. It was awesome.-you pay for what you get, this is great for what I paid for.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The cleaniess of the hotel is excellent and staff are friendly. The unique parking space makes me feel secured and confident on the property. Payment and checking in is speedy and no hassle. I definetly recommend stay here.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room is small but tidy. Room is sprayed with air freshener. The staff are not that friendly but helpful if you need directions. The Food Republic is the nearest food court option but is expensive. You can find cheaper options two blocks away near Bras Basah Complex.The hotel is just next to the MRT exit (don't cross the road). You can take the Downtown Line to Expo station and change once to reach the Airport.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is clean and air conditioner is good. Also, the staffs are so nice and friendly. The location is perfect since the hotel locates neat the stain station, taxi stand and food court. I will come back to stay when traveling in Singapore
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Henry, guest service officer, is the kindest person I have ever met..He is very polite, helpfull and friendly. My husband chose this hotel because of Henry. When I arrived for the second time, Im sure he forgets us. But his service is the same..full of smiling and tries to explain anything we want to know. Especially about places which we want to go. Thank you Henry.. thank you V Hotel
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable and good location. A good place to stay. Nice pool and room clean and. Friendly and helpful staff location close to places of interest. And close to places to eat. Safe carpark. Good idea to drive if you are from malaysia.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great location.The check in was very quick,and the room very neat and clean.the staff are very helpful and friendly.we requested for a upgrade which was done immediately.i would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just to let you know that I'm very happy with the service I received from the hotel. It was located in a heart of the city and really convinienve for us to stay and go around. Special thanks to Jason who is very helpful and he deserves a medal. Thanks
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is very near the mrt and a few minutes from town. The service of the staff here is excellent. They entertained our last minute request without any second thoughts. Definitely a hotel that I will stay with on my next vacation.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at V Hotel Bencoolen for my honeymoon. The location is great, with the Bencoolen MRT station just steps away. This is so convenient. The check in process was quick and the staff were friendly and courteous. I really enjoyed my stay here and would highly recommend it to others.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoy our stay very much! Great location and wonderful staff. I will stay again! Love Singapore , this hotel is convenient to the shopping mall and the street market. So easy to get food and money exchange. Staff here was so helpful. We book a studio room and my teenager daughter love the privacy she got upstairs. Room rate was very reasonable compare to other hotels in the same area.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had the chance to stay in this hotel for three days and it made my stay in Singapore very enjoyable. From the friendly staff, to the perfect location and comfortable bed, my stay was perfect. I highly recommend this place.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the check in process all the way up to the check out we were really pleased with our stay. Rooms were really tiny, there's not really any space to fit our luggages, but it was surprisingly clean. Special mention to the porter John for his helpfulness in ensuring that we were given the right directions as it was our first time in the city. Will definitely recommend our family and friends here for the good services.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in V Hotel for 3 nights with familyRooms were clean and new albeit compact.My family of 4 booked a triple room with 2 beds though pictures online seem to make the room look bigger.Point to note is hotel offer luggage storage when you have checked out at no additional costbut must collect on same dayUncle Henry was friendly and polite to my whole family and help us with sight seeing tours
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent the night with a 3 year old kid, and the place is pretty comfortable! Location is very good, directly beside the MRT station and Cheers is just on the left! Definitely a recommended place if you’re looking for an affordable good place :)
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is clean, but too small for two persons. But the staffs are very helpful, kind and friendly. This is the second time I stay at V Hotel. It’s very near the MRT and some foods culinary. Thank u. Especially for Henry we got the upgrade room! ✌
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Front desk people were efficient. The Hotel is in the middle of everything. It located closed to museum, temples, MRT stations, food courts. The door people , especially Henry, were friendly and helpful. Henry took us to the temples and good local desert place during his break , so thankful for his service mind.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stay for 4 days and 3 nights. Super fast check in and check out services. Supe friendly staff. We bring our 2 years old kid and they give extra pillow without asking. Extra refill bottle is free everyday. The room is clean, a little bit small but it is OK. Bencoolen MRT Station just next to the hotel. Another MRT Station, food court and Albert Hawker Centre is near the hotel too.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment i step in the hotel i feel something was wrong. Due to the lobby of the hotel is quite small. But what i didnt expect is their service to be this good.. They greeted me ever single time i walked pass the counter and direct me and my family to the places we want. When i need anything they will try their best help me. Always willing to give a helping hand to all guest in the hotel. Would totally bring my family back here!
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 4 nights and found it to be perfectly located right on top of the Bencoolen railway station and with a variety of restaurants to choose from. As long as you have the railway line handy it doesn't really matter where you choose to stay in Singapore and there are plenty of restaurants & shopping centres all over the place. The hotel is non-descript from the front but it's easy to spot from the street. You don't come here to stay in a large luxurious suite but rather for a clean & functional room suitable to sleep and shower when you're not sightseeing. We stayed in a superior double room and it was very tight with only minimal room to walk around the bed and no space for luggage. The pictures online are not an accurate reflection of the room size so if you are a larger person or have a few pieces of luggage you will struggle in this room. This being said, apart from the room size the room was very clean and tidy with daily service. Staff were very courteous and responded to requests quickly. If you purchased breakfast included this is served in a restaurant next door and your usual buffet. We didn't and had a starbucks around the corner and many local breakfast outlets at very reasonable prices. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for a short stay and a very reasonable price.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the minute we walked in to the minute we checked, we cannot stop praising the service and attitude of the staff at V Hotel. From the doorman, Henry, to the reception staff, we have been shown the utmost hospitality. All the staff are extremely friendly and incredibly helpful from finding cheaper attraction tickets to accommodating our every need through room service. We can neither be happier with our stay nor praise them enough. We will be back for our next trip and recommend the hotel to others. Thank you, V Hotel, you were amazing! You have elevated our experience.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very lucky to get a hotel like this one. The booking in and booking out was extremely smooth and quick. We found the staff to be very cheerful, pppolite and helpful. The location is also very central as placesl like little India, China town , orchid road are less than 15 e. walking distance. We got literally 5 star treatment her
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has the best staff. I'd like to especially thank Mr. Henry for his efforts in ensuring that we had a lovely stay. I recommend that you stay in this hotel for your future trip. You'll have lots of restaurant options nearby, bencoolen mrt just at the right, bus stop in front and you can leave your bags after check out if you still want to explore the city. If you do stay here (good choice), look for Mr Henry, he will take care of you.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was VERY basic. Their rooms were sooooo small, we could hardly fit our luggage in it. We stayed in a triple room and my word, we were so squashed in there. Good thing we only stayed two nights cause we hated every minute of it. The staff was very friendly though. Their rooms were dirty, we found old socks under our beds. I really would not recommend it. The good thing about this hotel was its location. It's close to Little India, we literally walked there. It's also close to some nice restaurants and to Orchard Road
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a wonderful stay for 4 night with my family. Hotel located near a taxi park and a mrt station 1 min walking.. rooms were very clean.. they gave us a scrumptious breakfast with a different choices everyday... friendly staff and we will definitely stay again in this place..
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly front desk, fine room service and superb location. Coming from India, we found the room size to be too small. But, that is the norm in Singapore. However, that is the only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 stars. Generally, we were all highly satisfied. Even the breakfast was decent.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited V hotel for 4nights stay for a business tripWas being upgraded to a room with a armchair at no additional cost after complain that website pictures varies against actual room sizes.nice gesture from the duty manager!Location itself was unbeatable and service from the hotel staff was excellent!Was greeted throughout my stay and rooms were always maintained cleanRooms i booked were around USD 100 per night which i found that to be a good dealCheckout timing was organised at 11am but feel free to approach the staff for possibility of 12pm:)
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed here a number of times. It was fine a couple of years ago but it is now in the bottom half of offerings available on Bencoolen. Try ibis or Mi Hotel over the road. Rooms here are getting tired, the service is not great. Slow check-in on my last trip (room not ready). And then received a twin room when specifically and obviously had booked a double.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly, this hotel is located at a very strategic location. From Changi airport, you just need to ride the MRT, change once at Expo station, then the downtown line will stop at Bencoolen station which is a short walking distance from the hotel. To reach the famous Orchard Road, just take the train at Bras Basah station which is just around the corner. A food court which has several food stalls is also very close.The lobby is small, so are the rooms but they are clean and quite comfortable. Considering that there are limited facilities, the room rate could be considered on the high sid
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mr&Mrs. S.A.Samaratunga, We are extremely comfortable & happy for the second time. We hope to come back & stay with you all again & again as a ritual. The staff was very friendly & efficient . As we step out from the hotel everything we need in the proximity to our liking . We will recommend this hotel to our friends or an one who wishes to come Singapore for holiday or business without any hesitation. Viva V Bencoolen Hotel.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly and helpful staff. Hotel is clean and good wifi. Would stay here again. Central location and next door to the MRT station which is a convenient way to get around the city. Breakfast is good in the next door restaurant.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: its ok hotel, near bus stop and mrt. short stay is definitly fine. as you wont stay in hotel whole day. room is very small and i dont like it. but sg is very expensive so this is fine. service is just ok.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at V Hotel Bencoolen several times earlier & would like to state that their level of service is simply extra ordinary very close to Bugis & Little India , also there is Mosque right across the street for my Muslim brothers
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Vhotel experience is a mid price hotel, it has a pool, rooms are not that big, not bad though, it has an electric kettle, small work table, you have to remove the kettle to be able to put laptop, aircon is good, wifi is stable, they have a blower, decent bathroom and shower room with hot and cold. Cable tv that is a smart tv too, room service can be challenging, One time i was surprised the roomboy just entered my room and ask i want the room cleaned, without knocking.when my room was cleaned, no towels and shampoo,soap were given, i had to call room service, they apologized though.overall, the location is nice, near train stn, walking distance to bugis area, hawkers nearby and nice coffee shops walking distance. getting a cab from area is eay
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Initially we were given a room that was small for us as we were staying for nine nights. The manager quickly changed our room to one a bit larger and without increase in fee. Their pool on 3rd floor was great and we were in it every day. So relaxing after hot temperatures. A laundry is there also plus showers and plenty of white fluffy towels after our swim. The location is excellent. Buses pass the front door and alongside is Bencoolen MRT. Fort Canning, National Museum and markets nearby plus Food Republic is a handy place to a quick meal. Staff are very obliging and Henry is always on hand to assist. As our flight departed at a late hour we were granted extra time in our room. A taxi was called for us and came to back lane making easy for us with luggage.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The ideal budget hotel. Super clean and very good staff. Check in was so fast and re room was available for early check in as requested.Very small but cosy room.ideal for a short trip Location is perfect. The yellow line and blue line stations are a minit walk away. The weather was bad during re visit however it didn’t affect us at all even though we didn’t have an umbrellas. As everything was perfectly suited for rainy weatherWill definitely stay in hotel V next time i visit Singapore.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best hotel to stay in Sg, close to everywhere. Staff are very nice and friendly, especially Henry, he’s so sweet and helpful. They have good court just right next door, 20mins walk to orchard Rd, will definitely stay here again when visit SG next time :)
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was comfy bed for the night . The rooms were excellent. I really like the we were looked after and got bottles of water refereshed daily. I would like to stay again if I planning on my next trip. I can’t say how helpful the staff were, really there a very friendly. Thank you v hotel Bencoolen and thank you aall staff.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. Location of this hotel is very good especially for business travel as Bencoolen MRT station is just few meters away. However for people on holidays, i dont recommend this area of Singapore as it is quiet place with no activities.Rooms are clean with all basic amenities (like hairdryer, toiletries, tea/coffee, fridge, locker, etc) available. Bathroom is basic but adequate with great water pressure on shower. A/C of the room is super quiet and does it job very effectively. Wifi is free and speed is also very good. Swimming pool is nice with no crowd. There is 7-11 nearby. Service of the hotel is also very good. The tour guide of the hotel was super informative.However, size of the room is very very small. We had to move a bed to make space available for our 2 luggage. It will be difficult for 2 people to move freely. We didnt take the breakfast of the hotel as it was expensive.In summary, you will feel the price of the hotel do not justify its worth. However, due to its location and sleep quality, this hotel can be considered average.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel during short visit in Singapore. + good location, near MRT stations+ clean rooms+ friendly and helpful staff- small rooms- horrible breakfast - we wanted to book room including breakfast, but it was so bad, that couldn’t find absolutely anything to eat. They had coffee and tea, cereals, toast and something fried. So if you appreciate nice breakfast, then definitely wouldn’t choose this hotel.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was not up to the expectation for the kind of price we pay. Too expensive. The room size is tooooooo small. It's only suitable for people who are on a business trip or a single occupant. The only benefit is that the hotel is right next to the metro station and the bus station is pretty close too.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Yes, the rooms are small but they are only for sleeping in!All the staff were courteous and helpful.Great central location, plenty of places to eat around and good access to transport links.We would use this place again.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this is my second time stay here. lovely staffs and new building. clean and good location right before bencoleen mrt and 2min walk to bras basah. near food repulbic onlt 1min walk. mr henry always welcome u with smile and her kindness touch our heart.. love this hotel so much...
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The money you pay is worth..specially the reception desk warmly welcomes guests.. I booked this hotels twice for 2 days and 5 days .. person named Lionel in the reception desk warmly greeted us and guided us .. the amenities provided were upto the mark.. the indian food is decent .. the room are small according to Singapore style but I must say you will get all things you need from house keeping.. friends.. it's worth the money .. the mrt is located nearby.. both bencoolen (blue colour) and bras basah ( yellow colour ).. from airport it's easy to come to hotel...so need not worry to reach hotel.. the ambience of the hotel is good.. will make you all feel good.. from Delhi to Singapore
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location, perfect staff, perfect stay. Next to an MRT station, close to National Museum and Art Gallery (although this is currently closed). You can walk to lots of sights from the hotel. The staff are great and you only have to ask for extra shampoo or pillows and they'll be delivered to your room. Rooms aren't big, but this is Singapore! Kettle and hairdryer plus a safe. There is a great little food market behind, in Waterloo Street called Chang Cheng Wee Wah, with several stalls selling a variety of foods. We enjoyed the first stall on the right where you could choose 1 meat 2 veg, 2 meat 1 veg etc! Also back in the corner look out for western food with a Chinese influence - the pork and chips is very good.Comfy bed. What more do you need?
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: jason and wani from the frontdest has been helping out with henry bellman never fail to open door in out everytime. with them should give them extra credit. as there willing to go extra mile to help me out. from guest hamkah and alysha
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hotel was near 2 underground stations, good location good local bars.Rooms were a bit small, but clean. Very helpfull staff, ideal for 2 people.Easy to get to all locations. The underground is called MRT it is very good and goes to all parts that you want to visit
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a bit outdated but it is clean.twin bed size is small but the location is good enough for travellers who like to use mrt to explore Singapore.Near Food Reublic food court which located the corner of the street.near 7-11.if u like cycling u can find rental bike in front hotel too.if u prefer walking to Bugis st. while sightseeing around the area ,i would recomended too .it's not too far.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 3 nights here. Rooms are small. Mini bar was an empty fridge but good for keeping wine cool)) Location great and staff polite. Don’t bother about the breakfast. Better options close by like Food Republic. Nice pool which seemed rarely used. After checking out we had late flight and were able to use pool and shower.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for the 1st time for 2 nights.I love the location of this hotel. It is close to MRT station Bencoolen and Brasbasah. Just a minute walking. And easy to find food too ! Because this hotel is next to Food Republic. If you want to find the cheapest food, it is just 2 or 3 minutes walking to Bugis junction.Hotel is not in my opinion just so so .. not so fantastic. Because the room is too small and the price is a bit higher. You can find more better room with the same price. The staff is very friendly and everything is so fast to be handled.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first visit in Singapore and I didn't know where to book our hotel but my brother suggested V hotel Bencoolen since he has already booked here twice before. I did not regret choosing this hotel because the train station is right beside this hotel and I do not have to walk that far. It is few stations away from Marina Bay Sands, Gardens by the Bay, ArtScience Museum, Chinatown and Clark Quay. Most of the tourist places are accessible which makes it more convenient. The National Museum of Singapore and National Gallery Singapore are also only few minutes walk from there. The best part is that this hotel is really affordable for its quality and location. The staffs are very friendly and accommodating too. I would definitely stay here again when I visit Singapore again.
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights, and it's in a great location. Close to 3 different MRT lines, so you can get to anywhere easily. It's also a short walk to Orchard Road and Plaza Singapura.The hotel room itself was small, but larger than most similar room types in Singapore. The wifi was excellent, water pressure very strong and water was almost instantly hot. The AC was also very strong and comfortable. The only issue I had was that the refrigerator didn't get very cold. Also, the hotel has a small pool and a coin-operated Washer and Dryer too for those who've been on an extended trip.I would definitely stay here again.I would de
hotelName:
20    V Hotel Bencoolen
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely experience at the Village Hotel Albert Court. We liked being close to Little India with lots of bargains and food options. Catching the MRT which was close by made getting around Singapore easy with our young kids. Felt very safe and liked the social buzz around the hotel.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best part of the property is its location. Everything is at a stone throw distance. Starting from restaurants, to bus stops everything is right in front of you. Rooms are nice. For smokers a advice. The entire hotel is a no smoking zone. So be careful. The make you sign a piece of paper that you will not smoke.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 2 nights here.Very relaxed and friendly hotel.Rooms are clean and tidy.If you spend a little more on a club room, it’s bigger, in the nicer side of the hotel and includes free drinks and nibbles at the bar late afternoon.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was brief but enjoyable tour of the city and pleasant stay at the hotel, After the initial delay in allocation of rooms for our tour group, we had a good time. Manager on Duty Kevin was smooth , efficient and courteous. Overall Staff was warm and helpful.They went the extra mile to assist, especially in the Albert Cafe. In Gurdeep Rana , we found someone who understood our needs and was very flexible and accomodating, Gian Carlo was very helpful during our stay. We did not feel away from home. Definitely recommended.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at one of the club rooms and we liked it! We celebrated there our son’s second birthday and the room was clean and neat, very comfortable and it was very spacious enough to accommodate all our guests. Though we stayed only for one night we are very satisfied from checking in to the services they gave to us and to checking out. Well deserved hotel!
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its nice, good value of money. Friendly and helpful staff. Good location, near MRT.My childern like it. However since the Jacuzzi time is only from 9 to 9, we dont get opportunity to try, since always come back around 10, better can use it until 11pm
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel location great walking distance from train. But service not great..!!First check in,i come upfront to a person Say Hi to the counter im checking in. No respond. Busy with whatever on him... i mean FRONT DESK. U suppose to greet & serve the customer. IF your on to something cant you reply back. Make a person standing infront of you. Till another staff came to the counter and attend to my checking into the hotel.Check in room,bedsheet not clean. Able to see clearly the dirty stain on the sheet. For just 1 night. I sleep only 1 side of the bed. Also Nosiy room,whenever the other room run the water. Felt like the hotel gonna rundown. Service No good, location not bad. But there are other hotels in that area.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 5 days. Best part of Hotel was its location. As MRT was close and as we were vegetarians so we had our dinner in Little India which was 15-20 minutes walking distance. The rooms are well maintained with a quick room service. You will not find anything missing or uncomfortable for you in the room.The breakfast Buffet has good variety of Veg- Non Veg only we felt that the space of the restaurant is small and conjusted.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the beginning this hotel was unimpressive. We had booked a room for four (myself and our two sons.. 11 & 10) yet they were only giving us 3 beds in our room... no sofa bed just a queen and a single. After I repeatedly asked where my second child would sleep they reluctantly wheeled in another single bed. The room was grotty and dated and stank like someone had spilled bleach on the floor. The lights by the bed were bent and nearly electrocuted my husband when we went to find the switch to turn it off... instead he blew a fuse. No apology when we informed reception. To turn out the lights you have to take the card out of the wall ... leaving no active light switch in the bathroom (or anywhere) if you need to use it during the night. Not ideal with children. They woke us and we had to use light from our phone.The breakfast room was small cramped and over crowded... food variety was dismal hardly any fruit variety.. not natural yogurt... coffee machine made cold coffee... one morning croissants were stale and hard as rocks...no one shows you to a table you just grab whatever you can. Our room was across the road on the quieter side... with a broken lift and it stank so bad of bleach in the corridor it was horrible.The location was fantastic but there was a nicer looking hotel two doors down that I wish we had booked instead. The man who cleaned our room everyday was lovely and friendly but I do not recommend this hotel.. the best part was when we left (and still no one helped us with our bags) !
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently I stayed here. The photos on the website are completely different from what you see when you get there. Room was old fashioned and the bathroom was mouldy and old. The service was good when we reached the hotel. Someone helped with the luggage etc. but when you leave the hotel, nobody helped with the luggage. I would say this is a 1-2 star hotel.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cute looking hotel close to shopping etc. Large air conditioned rooms.Clean and tidy. Bizarrely you could not turn the main ceiling light off without removing key card for all lights. Breakfast dining room very cramped in the buffet area, an accident waiting to happen. Food was ok ,but rather expensive.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had A Beautiful Stay Here From 31/6 To 3/7 We Booked Two Rooms Which Were Both More Than Perfect, Location is Excellent For Shopping And Near 7/11 For Quick Snacks, Special Thanks To Mr. Indra Putra Who Made The Check In And Out Easy For Us Other Than That He's Just A Great Man To Talk To In General, Rooms Were Spacious And Beds Were Really Comfortable Too, Recommended For Famillies Visiting Singapore , Definetly Coming Back In The Future
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I stayed for one night. We arrived late at night and had the room booked up to 3 pm. We had a taxi booked for 8pm.Indra and the team left us use the showers and jacuzzi and provided us with towel after our checkout time. It really was appreciated and set us up well for a long flight to Europe.Thanks so much from Anthony and family.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To be fair they were doing some upgrade works during our stay and with the constant noise they are exposed to perhaps they get distracted too. But then again it call comes down to speed of service and keeping one's promise if you have already committed to it. We checked in and specifically stated we wanted a double bed instead of twin bed, the staff apologised and said they only had twin bed but they will join the bed for us. We agreed to it and went out for a walk. 6 hours later, well, nothing was done yet so we called housekeeping AND front desk because no one attended to us for about a good 1 hour. Funnily they did not have a double bed quilt and placed the single bed quilt horizontally across the bed.The other down side of it is the stench of chlorine the moment we walk into the building across the lobby, where our room is. We asked one of the staff about it but he said "really? I think we've gotten used to it". Seems more like an occupational hazard to me...This place is about 3 or 4 blocks away from Bugis Junction and has a few bars downstairs to chill. Location wise it's pretty convenient but returning here? Maybe not.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was arrived at this hotel 29 June 2019 around 10 amI ask stay at counter name Indra Putra to request early check in.He’s really helpful with provide all information and he has a great service mind.Moreover, he give me a suggestion around this hotel, where should I o for eating something like that.In sum, I will be back fo this hotel again I have chance, I promised.JayExpat from Thailand
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing service and rooms are clean and spacious. Also the food from the Albert cafe is amazing. And the staff is always willing to help. It also has 24 hour gym facility and very relaxing Jacuzzi. the visit was simply amazing
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very wonderful stay with our friends at Village Hotel Albert Court! Room is spacious, cozy and amenities are perfect! Staff are accommodating and Manager Gian Castaneda is exceptional! What more could you ask for!? We will definitely come back again!!!
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently travelled from the UK to Australia to see my family and had a stopover both ways in Singapore. The Village Hotel was recommended as a suitable hotel and was a good choice. I want to especially praise the staff who were so friendly and helpful - Jason, Saiful and Siva couldn't be more pleasant and nice and nothing was too much trouble. The room was quiet, comfortable and clean, everything was provided. There was plenty of space to relax in the lounge and bar - very important while waiting for to leave for another flight and there was even a complimentary selection of snacks. The breakfasts were very good and the restaurant was open for meals later in the day. I appreciated the generally relaxed and informal atmosphere of the hotel.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spend 4 days with my husband at Village Hotel Albert Court and the location is super good, super close to the train station, close to restaurants and you can walk to the famous tourism point Little India Street. Two things that we didn't like it: One, was the smell in the room, not good. And the second thing was when the customer were at the reception, we could listen everything from our room and woke up us lots off times.But service is good, it is clean and the bedroom is amazing.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly, I had stayed at this hotel from 15 to 16 June 2019 and booked my hotel room through the official hotel website which allows me to enjoy special member rates which are lower than those rates being offered at other booking websites.Secondly, the staff member who had helped me with checking into my hotel room is very professional and friendly. He had kindly given me a free room upgrade from a superior room to a club room which is an extremely pleasant surprise for me. When another guest had shamelessly tried to cut into my queue, he had also kindly advised him to join in the queue behind me instead. As such, the check in process for me was fast and seamless without any precious time being wasted.Lastly, the hotel room which I had stayed in was specklessly clean and tidy and the bed was also very soft and comfortable to sleep in until I had spent most of my time in my hotel room. Everything from both the iron and ironing board especially for business travellers to the hair dryer and safe were being provided during my stay there. As such, I was able to pack light for my staycation and didn't have to worry about not having my necessities around with me.I will like to sincerely thank each and every one of the hotel's staff members for giving me such a memorable and relaxing staycation experience and I will definitely be back for another staycation soon =D
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed our stay in a Club room with the extra benefits, cocktails and snacks each evening. Great location, close to Little India, Bugis Street and Metro train station. Older style room but included everything needed, wifi, tea, coffee, iron etc. Definitely recommend and would come again.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was recommended by the conference organizer. The receiption was very good and food was okay ...It also have nice gym and other amenities. The place was located somewhat out of main attractions. Also it does not have direct MRT airport link nearby. But overall very good and value for money
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice clean large rooms.Lavish Buffet breakfast.Good air con and hot water shower with tub with toiletriesExtra amenities like Safe ,Iron with Board,hair dryer,gym,jacuzzi.Friendly and helpful room service staff(Lady first floor) who kept the room clean and very pleasant. Good location close to bugis an little india.Near to Bugis shopping market an Mustafa center.Two nearby walkable MRT stations make singapore entirely acessible.Close to food courts and all the restuarants of Bugis and little India.7/11 and atm close by.Shoping malls like OG, city square mall,Bugis st,Mustafa center and Electronic shopping Hub Sim Lim center at walking distance. Cons:no drinking water provided.some front end staff act gloomy.poor wifi in roomslot of noise and disturbance from the karoake bar in the night.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good assistance at the time of check in in the hotel. Nice hospitality. Soft spoken receptionists.Clean environment. Good location of hotel. Well connected to MRT and little India. Enjoyed our summer vacations.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived from a late night flight Frm Ahmadabad were tired & exhausted ...Reaching the hotel u/stand check In was @ 2pm . It was then Mr. Jason Leow came to our rescue as an angel and not only alloted us the room but also gave us a complimentery breakfast... I mean wow.... Thanks a Ton Jason... Stay Blessed...
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, booked 3 rooms. While the hotel is good, the staff at the front office seriously lack of customer service. The staff who serve me named Jona. We came in at 3.30pm to check -in just to be informed that the rooms is not ready though their check in time is 2.00pm. when I asked her why, the reply I got was so sarcastic, "we can't clean all the rooms at the same time" so I was told to wait . Even after informing that through email 1 week before coming. eventually we were given different rooms in different floor, so early notice did not make any difference to this people. At the end my kids were in different floor. Another staff Jason, do not know the meaning of being polite to customers as instead of saying," excusing me, when walking, he said Hello and show hand sign to move away so rudely" Not sure which school of hospitality they went to.Anyway, when we checked out the staff handled us was good, he name was Indra and he was very pleasant. The hotel is good, comfortable room, clean bathroom and located strategically as it is near to Little India and Rochor MRT about 3 min walk. However if the hotel don't hire proper staff, then people might just go else where.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Front desk jona , she is a filipina is very accomodating. The bartender named manian indian national i think is also approachable and friendly. It was nice staying there i give 5 stars my kids enjoy the stay in the hotel
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good behaive , good hotel , near by market emoloyee Indra Putra is good, came in at 9 morning, indra gave an early check in by 11, he gave me an priroty as i came with my child along with me. Good service by staff, good property to visit ,
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best Place to stay with family surrounded by good ambiencw, nice location,restaurant, market place.Having very supportive hotal staff Mr Indra Putra. Having very good quality of indian foods.overall experience is very good.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Village Hotel Albert Court is a very comfortable boutique hotel close to Little India, restaurants, shopping centres, the MRT. The staff are professional and friendly, especially Jocelyn and Jai who managex to get us an early check in after we'd travelled overnight. We keep coming back.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great weekend staycation. Excellent service overall. Room is very clean and big enough to accommodate my family. Had a sofa bed as well. Wonderful service from housekeeping staff jaenah. Very friendly and always smiling.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Conveniently located near little India, comfortable rooms and courteous staffs. The ambiance of the restaurants around the hotel area is rather appealing,laid back and relax, will return to stay at the hotel, but course when the rates are attractive.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed environment and really very professional service at hotel village. Mr. Indra helped us and greeted us very nicely . He also provided us all information to satisfaction. We are very happy with the welcome and property.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very good service from mr.indra putra and he is very cooperative ,we came early in the morning , he gave us early check in without and charges. location located perfectly according to what our expectations. especially its near to little india. i would certainly introduce albert court to my peers in the near future , thank you!!
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at many hotels in Singapore, but this hotel has quite good size rooms, decent breakfast (not much for indian vegetarian dishes). 10 mins walking distance from little india & bugis street for street shopping. Don't stay at their club rooms as it has terrible chlorine smell 24 hours. This hotel does not have swimming pool. Bathroom needs some renovation. Staff is good and helpful. If you arrive early, they will ask for the extra charges for early check-in, if u tell them that u r ready to wait till check-in hours, they will give the room early. Properly is well maintained.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was very welcoming and homey. The staff welcomed us and assisted us well throughout our stay. Special thanks and definitely recommend Ms. Jonah Gico, one of the staff in the check-in counter for making us feel at home and feel like such special guests. Our room was very big, clean and comfortable, plus the comfort room had a bathtub! Our building has a "lounge" area on the ground floor which was a great place to have breakfast and hang out with friends. The location of the hotel is very near several train stations such as Rochor and Bugis.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed in room 111 during the stay in May 2019 with my family. I would like to comment one of the staff from Housekeeping name -Sheng Qi, he is helpful and excellent staff.And i would also like to comment for the good and friendly staff at the reception, Jason , Steven, Jamal and jona for helping me during my stay at village hotel albert court.We definitely will come back again !
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is recentry renewal. My staying room is very clean & comfortable.Location was between little india and Bugis Arab street. And many foodcourt located near Hotel.Breakfast was very good which I payed 18$. But my opinion that was reasonable
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff can be more customer service oriented. They were just doing their job and had no focus on being welcoming or approachable to the guests. The breakfast buffet was ok but it could have been better.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent and Super location Excellent stayExcellent breakfastExcellent staffExcellent housekeeping Great value Extremely convenient Extremely comfortable Extremely satisfying experience Family friendly
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall good experience. Need to improve food variety and quality of breakfast. Also need improve approach of waiters working at same. Location best, room prices are ok, near by restaurants are plenty. Overall good hotel.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Jason Leon at the reception was very helpful and accommodating for my early checking this morning.Have stayed at other branches of this chain. Good to return here though for a central location.Thanks Jason
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice location , cramped space . Not so great Breakfast . Just you want to explore Singapore ,and you need the hotel for sleeping at late night ,and going early morning . I would recommend it . Overall its okay , for the location .
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a group of 6 family members. The staff at check in were very helpful. Mr Indra was particularly understanding. The are multiple restaurants just out side the hotel, belonging to the same management. The only disappointment I have, is the absence of a health faucet in the room. The main clientele seems to be Indian group tourists.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable hotel if on a budget, in a great area close to Little India. Check in was easy, but had to remind reception about all our vouchers and gifts we were entitled to as per our booking. Reasonably quiet hotel, with a small gym including modern equipment, and a nice cold spa available for cooling down. The best thing is the location, over the road from Little India and heaps of cheap delicious food markets. Close to Little India and Roche subway stations, 10min walk to either. Not far from the harbour, a long walk or a few subway stops.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Let me start by complimenting the staff especially "Mr Jason" at the reception, it's hard to find such people who offer such wonderful hospitality, Jason not only helped my family and kids to be at comfort as we had a long and tiring flight, he also managed stress free check-in. I recommend to stay in Albert court without any second thought. Five stars to Jason for his excellent service and hospitality. Thank you
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall goodTo modernise rooms, to offer better external view rooms for families, adding feel good factors.Breakfast included few indian items, family enjoyed it, quality of breads and cakes can be better.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best location with excellent amenities. Me and my family enjoy stay here. Sleep quality is excellent, Room cleanliness are very good, Food quality is very nice and tastey, Morning breakfast with wide choice, Special thanks to Cheff Mr. Raman for live breakfast.Kids loves jacuzzi. Steam bath and gym facilities are available. Hotel staff is very friendly and co-operative. Special thanks to Mr. Syed and guest service executive Mr. Ian Wood.Overall good experience and I recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had occasion to vist the Village Hotel Abert Court last year whilst on a family trip to Singapore. It was during an afternoon's exploration of the surrounds in Little India that I discovered and was drawn to the richly restored style and setting of this charmingly nestled cobbled street, boutique hotel. Venturing inside did not dissapoint - the ambiance and serenity that meets you is at once welcoming and it is hard to believe that you are surrounded by the hustle and bustle of the district vicinity. Even more impressive for me was the impeccable service I received from the GM who happened to be at the front desk as I was making my enquiries about a future hotel stay in Singaore. He took the time to show us around the premises and give us a little history of the archtecture and surrounds, even stopping to pick up a piece of paper off the floor as we were walking; this may seem insignificant but spoke volumes to me about the pride and care he took in the hotel. We will be travelling to Singapore in the near future and will definitely be booking to stay at the Village Hotel Albert Court.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited here in last week of April and this is my honeymoon trip for that i stay in this hotel . Its Good and will recommend to our colleagues for visit the same hotel in future.Good food , locality , environment .
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: there was a Fat man wear RED waiting at the door, but didn't help to carry our bags or calling some one to help us. Just tell us to carry our self to the reception counter to check in. This was not what we expect from far East group services.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family stayed here for 2 nights over the last 2 weekend and it was a pleasurable stay for us. The hotel is located in the city itself which is convenient, even more so with a few restaurants at the hotels ground floor for supper and drinker with Seven Eleven just at the corner.The breakfast spread was decent but of quality. Staffs were friendly though I must say a little cramp but guess that’s Singapore in general Will definitely return and highly recommended.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked Village Hotel Bugis, but was only told upon arrival that the room with double bed has some faulty part and cannot be used. Was offered to transfer to Village Hotel Albert Court at Little India with the promise of an upgrade to club suite. We were left with no choice since it was already 2+pm and we had a dinner to get to in the evening at Bugis (which is why I booked Bugis!!) - but alas, we were moved to Little India. Staff were curt and unfriendly, at the recep the lady didn't even look at me when I asked her questions. No greeting, welcome, just asked for my IC and proceeded to do check-in. No smiles, nothing. It was the worse hotel experience I had. Club suite REEKED of chlorine, reminded me of public pools. Room was an ok size but walls were thin and throughout the night and day we heard doors slamming, people talking outside our rooms. It was also on level 2 and we could hear vehicles and noises from ground floor even though windows were closed. Also when I made my booking on Booking.com for Village Hotel bugis, i informed them it is my bf's birthday and they said they will give complimentary chocolates. But there was totally none. Will never recommend this hotel to anyone, not even if it was $10 a night. Also, as a result of the transfer, we had to spend additional $ to cab to and fro our dinner place at Bugis, which would have been a 4min walk if we had remained at the bugis hotel. Would have been fine if the 'upgrade' was worth it, but it wasn't. Ruined the birthday experience I had planned for my partner.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great decor comfy room but service staff could be better. I did not feel as warmly greeted and assisted as I was at Village Bugis. Made me feel unwelcomed and had to be independant in my navigation around the hotel area. Staff rarely made eye contact.
hotelName:
21    Village Hotel Albert Court by Far East Hospita...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our daughter was unwell on arrival. We were allowed to book in early and the care they showed our daughter was exceptional. Customer care beats customer service everyday. Breakfast each morning set us up for a great day in an amazing city
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm really satisfied to stay at HI City Center. All the staffs were really friendly and helpful. This is my second stay at HI CC, will stay here again if I go to Sg. Thumbs up! Keep up the good works!
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotels in Singapore are generally pricey, what more around the Orchard Road area. If you should need to stay in this area, the Holiday Inn Orchard City Centre is your best best! Room rates are considerably reasonable compared to other properties in the same class along the shopping belt but the rooms are clean, well kept and in good shape. Staff are wonderful right from the doorman at arrival to check in and check out. They offered great direction when asked and made special effort to show us short cuts to reduce walking ourdoors uneccessarily.The hotel is surrounded by lots of eateries in the neighbouring Cuppage Plaza, with 7eleven and several 24 hour outlets within a 3 minute walk. The Centrepoint Shopping Centre is a 5 minute walk away and 95% of the trip is through a sheltered footpath, which is great! Just across this mall is the Somerset MRT station for easy access to the island-wide train lines.I highly recommend this property for those who are looking at staying in the Orchard area. You will not find another property which will offer you the same level of service and upkeep at this price nearby!
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location in the heart of Orchard Road, close to MRT and restaurants. The room was standard hotel type but comfortable. The pool area was great with a separate toddler pool, jacuzzi and good sized lap pool.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ->Area and Surroundings:The hotel is very well and centrally located. It’s just a 2 min walk from Orchard Road. People looking for good open-air bars and restraint can enjoy drinks and tapas at “Cuppage Terrace” just next to the hotel.The hotel reception was very inviting and they were quick to check us in. They also had a great bar with Live screen (as the Cricket World Cup was going on)->Room:We opted for a Premier King Room. The room was very well laid out with all things placed to comfort. The view was of the road (not of the other side hotel or back side at least). The bed was King size and we all has a comfortable sleep. The room also had a good size working desk, a sofa with footrest and table chair setup near the window to give the preferred kind of sitting experience.The room defiantly had all the basic amentias like Iron board, Safety Box, Minibar, Hot water kettle and cupboards.->Bathroom and Bathing experience:The bathroom was decent and had a glass enclosed shower area. The looking mirror was perfectly backlit to give a smooth feel to the eyes if one gets up at midnight.The water pressure and temperature was favorable for a pleasant bathing experience. The hotel provides all toiletries to the room and also has a blow dryer if one needs.->Hotel StaffThe hotel staff was always helpful and warm. The rooms have good fast wifi and its Free.->Breakfast:I did not opted for breakfast with the hotel, but I am pretty sure, it would have been good.->Swimming Pool / Gym / Spa:Not able to visit one or check, but they have a Gym and a Swimming pool in the hotel.Special mention:Wifi Speed was good during our stay. and we loved our stay in this hotel and city.We requested hotel to provide us with “Bottle Sterlizer” and “Baby Cot” , which they happily did before our arrival.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located nearby some of the best shopping in Singapore, as well as the MRT being close, this property doesn’t disappoint. All the team I came across were both friendly and efficient - even a 2am checkin. Was pleasantly upgraded to a junior suite, which was spacious and clean. Sure, a little aged, but well-appointed for this brand. I’ll be back!
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is excellent for food and shopping. Room slightly dated but adequate and comfortable. Reception and concierge are efficient and friendly. Lounge bar section is relaxing. Will stay there again.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The water glasses were not changed for 5 days of our stay. We had to often ask for removing used cups. Housekeeping staff didnt understand English. Buffet Breakfast had very few options for vegetarians. And menu is unchanged every day. Plumbing is below average.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this was our 3rd time in this hotelwe love the location on orchad Rd and near all the shopping centers and some nice restaurants/barsBreakfast is good but was to crowded in the morningcheck in and out was fast and we received our room on time
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is at on end of the orchard road and is reasonably okay. They have lots of eateries 10 steps from the hotel at cuppage plaza and that’s a plus.The hotel when you enter doesn’t scream Luxury but overall is a competent property. Rooms are nice and spacious and very clean.Check in was smooth and well handled by Jason .The Indian restaurant in the hotel spoiled our mood because of the snobbish attitude by their local staff. The pool area though small but is nice.Breakfast was also well provided with good service.Will I stay here again , only if I get a killer deal
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very good location.very near to orchard central.rooms were good, spacious.staff was courteous breakfast layout is good.overall very good hotel with great location, good ambience,good pool,good food.....
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located in a good location however I feel it’s outdated they need to modernize and refurbish their rooms and bathrooms they remind me the hotels of 1980s.  Other than that I had a credit balance with this hotel ie. Money was taken out of my account a year before on which they agreed to let me use their facilities but they let me down as they couldn’t refund me back. The spa they claim that is downstairs isn’t even owned by hotel hence I couldn’t even use my extra credit of 295 Dollars. I requested them if I could use their car service to take me to excursions etc and amount to be deducted from my credit balance they simply refused. I was very disgusted and disappointed. I asked for the manager he too couldn’t assist me in anything and refused completely to even give me a refund since I couldn’t use any of their facilities they kept forcing me to buy food. Being an IHG member, I had already purchased the club executive lounge package to which I would use their lounge and dine during late afternoon and evening snacks and cocktails ie. Pizzas, sandwiches, little pastries, biscuits , tea , coffee etc which normally fills one up. Even after trying to explain to them to allow me to use my money for their other facilities they wouldn’t agree in the end I had no choice but to order food from the Indian restaurant. He was very corporative and helpful we ordered the food and picked it up in the evening.  Their manager is pathetic and I feel he needs to present himself better to his customers even the way he dresses and talks isn’t like professional managers at all. Otherwise I would rate this place an average place yes if your an IHG member you do get to access their club executive lounge as well as breakfast is setup totally different but same buffet for IHG members only with good service totally in a different hall.  They are better holiday hotels with fair prices on clarke quay and other side next time I would definitely opt for those I will never come here again !
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am an Australian who visited Singapore to meet my relatives. I stayed at Holiday Inn City Centre Orchard. The hotel staff helped me to catch a taxi to 14 Jalan Kelempong. however the taxi took me 5 times around the house saying that the does n't know GPS or Google maps. The first time the taxi fare showed$18.20 but after making 5 rounds it came $30.70.He said no receipt. REGO SHC 5937.How can Singapore allow this type of scamming????
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Holiday Inn for 3 nights. The hotel is well located near Orchard street and about 100 m from Orchard Central Mall. The room had comfy beds. The mini bar is empty so you can restock it yourself, which is better as the hotel drinks are more expensive. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The breakfast had a decent selection and variety. Check in and check out was seamless. Thank you for a great stay.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good service & Great location...I am going to visit with my family again in February 2020..loved to stay there...Best of luck to all Staff especially Manpreet(Bar)of Holiday Inn Orchard city center, see u guys again
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel great pool areal, 2 minute wall to Orchard Road and next door to all the great restaurants at Cuppage Terrace. Large rooms and fantastic service from the staff. Only there for 1 night on our way home. Could have stayed forever
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a really good hotel at the very centre of Singapore and is a great place to stay for lots of reasons. I stayed in an executive room, which gave me access to the lounge for breakfast. The room was clean, comfortable, well equipped and everything worked as it should, the shower was perfect with instant hot water on demand and the beds were super comfortable.Breakfast in the executive lounge catered for almost all tastes and was of consistently high quality, the staff were polite and helpful at all times. I had room service on two occasions and the food was also of a very good standard.Checking in and out was fast and efficient and the staff were always pleasant and very professional during my stay. The hotel is located just off Orchard Road for those of you who are into shopping and is opposite Cuppage Road which has a very nice selection of restaurants and bars all in easy walking distance.All in all a really nice place to stay and if you are planning to visit Singapore for business or pleasure, I would highly recommend staying at the Orchard City Centre, you will not be disappointed.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Being here with family booked 2 club rooms with 2 double bed each. The experience here was not at all satisfying. We traveled with an infant and have already conveyed to hotel for an early check-in.
