When we reached hotel the staff offered us a lower category room for early check-in and told we can not change rooms and have to stay in lower category room for the complete period but when we told "no we want our booked rooms" he said to wait till 2 PM for check-in. After calling our travel agent and a long discussion they agreed to change our rooms to booked rooms on the next day if we take lower category room today or asked us to pay SGD 100 per room for getting our rooms on the same day itself. The Double Bed Room is a marketing gimmick as the beds are smaller than the queen size beds and also the club facilities provided are unusable if you are there as a tourist as during the period of free snacks and drinks you are usually out for some adventure. The front desk staff is less cooperative and lack basic hospitality. Would suggest to book other hotel whcih gives king size bed with extra bed.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked 2 rooms for 7 days and found the hotel to be perfectly located with excellent facilities.Orchard Rd is a 2 minute walk to the best shopping and restaurants in the world.The rooms were standard but exceptionally clean. Excellent value for a family stay.Highlights were the rooftop pool which was surrounded by sun lounges for relaxing in the afternoon and happy hour every evening in the bar.Staff were friendly and we were welcomed each time we returned from sightseeing.We would gladly return.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was convenience for those who intend to shop day & night. Walking less than 2 mins to shopping malls. Surrounded by eateries and 7-Eleven all around. The only setback was the room temperatures bit warm. We did tried to adjust the temperature but it does not reduce. It stays as it is. Apart from that, everything is superb!
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best hotel I stay in Singapore in term of friendly staff, easy access to shop and mrt, and variety of restaurant nearby. The room is a bit old, but nothing to complaint. Good place for client meeting in the lobby lounge.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had my wedding at Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City centre on 25 May 2019. It was a great experience and a memorable one. My husband and I would like to say a big thank you especially to Michelle Lim (Business Development Executive) who was attended to us, from planning to execution of our wedding. Holiday Inn staff from other departments (from AV, reception, housekeeping etc) were also polite and respectful to us. Bridal suite was also nicely decorated. 2 nights stay at Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City centre was a great one; accessible location; within walking distance from Somerset train station. Buffet breakfast was also delicious and had a wide variety of food selection. Thank you Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City centre! Keep up the good work!
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is close to shopping centres on Orchard Road and there are many restaurants & eateries nearby. Somerset MRT is 5-10 minutes walk from hotel. There is a supermarket less than 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Room is clean and bed is comfortable with choice of pillows. All the staff we dealt with were friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is located very centrally. Rooms very clean and convenient. Superb service and program of Executive Club. Swimming pool and fitness equipment of the highest standard. I very much enjoyed every second of my stay there.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent customer service and a beautiful locationLocation was good making it easily accessible to metro stations and taxis. Their Customer service was also very good and helpful. Surroundings were very clean .l
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everytime I visit Singapore I usually stay in this hotel. I'm so impress of the service and facilities of this hotel before.but unfortunately this time I've noticed of so many changes.The fresh orange juice that they used to serve during breakfast now comes with a price.You don't get a weighing scale in the bathroom.They don't give you extra laundry bags not unless you ask for it.They don't have much choices in their fresh fruits.The rooms don;t smell nice.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From now on when we travel to Singapore this is our hotel. The rooms are very very nice, spacious and clean and the beds and pillows you sink into. Breakfast was one of the best we came across, love the smoke salmon! A big thank you to the Duty Manager for accommodating our needs and a big thank you to the lovely Helena helping our daughter at breakfast. See you next time, Annette, Ken and MELANIE Jones
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for two nights after landing in Singapore after a 10.5 hour flight with our two young boys.Hotel were obliging with a slightly early checkin. Room was comfortable, albeit small (although this is Singapore so hotel rooms are never that large.Wifi was good.The rooftop pool was great, well kept, with plenty of towels. They had a small pool great for younger kids and a full size lap pool. It could do with some shade but this isn't a major..... Close to Somerset MRT and Dhoby Ghaut MRT which is a major interchange station.Orchard Rd and Orchard Central mall nearby.Only real complaint was that the sheets had blood spots on them which was gross. When advised they came immediately to fix..Would stay again.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very nice hotel, and overall I'd highly recommend it. The location is great, food is outstanding, and all of the staff were friendly, helpful, polite, and a real pleasure to deal with. The pool and exercise room are really nice. My only complaints were these: 1. The hotel room (#514) had a strong musty, mildewy smell. I know that's more common in a tropical climate, but I've stayed in two other Singapore hotels (including a much cheaper one on this same trip) that didn't have that problem. 2. The alarm clock in the room was terrible! First time I've ever met a clock I couldn't figure out how to use. And when it went off (earlier than desired) it sounded like a fire alarm--very loud and obnoxious. Bad way to start the day! I had to unplug it.3. Noise issues. The family next door with young kids would be yelling in the hallways up to midnight, every single night, though I can't necessarily blame the hotel for that. (Positive: The walls were very soundproof. I didn't hear any noise coming from the rooms on either side.) A colleague was on the third floor. He said he had to listen to the music from wedding receptions or other parties downstairs until 3:00 a.m. So he didn't sleep much.Having said those things, I still have to rate the hotel highly, and I'd be willing to stay there again. Hopefully not all rooms smell like 514 did.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's quite unpleasant experience! never try this hotel anymore. the staff quite unhonestly and unfriendly to the customer.  never feed back any your words and ignord your any request! the first night we complain the room arrangements and the staff's service attitude. the assistance manager Mr James Png promise us will feed back us at check out time next morning, but next morning when we at check out counter , He Completely ignore our existence as blank air! it's quite irony！非常一般的住宿体验，在处理顾客建议的流程方面非常脱节，甚至是完全无视！大堂经理装模作样到房间来了解情况，说是会给予回复，然后就没有然后了，纯属来取笑顾客！
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The were very lovely !The rooms were really nice and absolut clean!The hotel is in very good place in heart of Singapore in heart of Shopping center !If I come next time in Singapore I’ll be choose again this hotel! Thank you
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's great that it has two double beds in some rooms, very family friendly.The staff were all terrific.Our room smelt a little musty, but our friends room smelt fine, so it wasn't the aircon. Go and give your room a sniff before you unpack, incase there is an issue.Pool is terrific!!
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable room and great location. Walking distance to plaza singapura where we found many good places to eat. Walk in the opposite direction and you’re at the paragon and takashimaya. Hotel staff were very friendly too!
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have stayed here a few times for both business and leisure trips. A convenient central location just off Orchard Road. Good rooms, reasonable rates, good breakfast, clean pool and great staff. Many thanks.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed one week at the Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre taking advantage of the "Executive Club" rate that included an extensive, tasty breakfast buffet; a "snack" which was actually lunch, and "cocktail time" which was for me dinner with drinks. The room was spacious and beautiful with 2 doubles, on the 7th floor, small frig and safe, away from elevators but convenient enough to get to the rooftop pool. The pool is large (for doing laps) with lovely flowering plants and comfy lounges and chairs–plenty of room, not many guests. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. The hotel is a short walk to the closest MRT (clean, efficient subway) station (Somerset). This hotel contributed to an amazing visit to Singapore before I left on a 10-day cruise.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Always good to stay here as handy to shops, pubs and restaurants. Front end staff are very good, friendly and helpful. Rooms clean and pool a bit of a haven. Easy to get a taxi to other areas of Singapore or walk straight up the lane to orchard Road.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed three nights 23/4. This is an older hotel in a good position for MRT, although we used taxis everywhere as cheap. Lovely big reception area with very good bar. Pleasant decor. Friendly check in by Ais and very friendly checkout on Friday 26/4 6am by the overnight lady. Concierge are excellent, ready and willing to help, whipping out the map and showing you where to go, getting taxis and giving advice, great. A mention to Thiru and Hamzuh. They had good knowledge. No sooner had we arrived and opened doors of taxi, porter took our luggage. Given room 557. Two doubles as requested. More than large enough. View of street. Very comfortable beds. Spotlessly clean room. Furniture IS old and scratched but was fine, as expected as old hotel. All areas of hotel are spotless. Bathroom dated but super clean, plenty of towels and toiletries. Plenty of plugs. Cleaned really well every day. A mobile left in room for our use when out. Excellent breakfast all three mornings. Traditional English breakfast as well as lots of other choices for other nationalities for all their clients. Plenty of juices, coffees, pastries and all type of eggs available by the friendly omelette man. Good service and friendly welcome as you enter. Had buffet one night in same restaurant, very tasty. Very good rooftop pool, lots of beds and open late which was great for swim after sight seeing. Small negative jaquizzi nice but needs a good scrub. Plenty of towels by pool for use. Small gym.More than happy with our choice of this hotel. Decent rooms, good A/C, clean, helpful friendly staff, good position, nice food, nice bar, smartly dressed staff with good service skills. More than happy to recommend and would stay again
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are very helpful, everyone is willing to help. They have a jacuzi in the 8th floor, that was a plus too. The food for breakfast is also good. Have a lot of kind of it. Near from the hotel there are a lot of restaurant and shopping mall. Not too far from the sommerset mrt station. If you bring a children this hotel is a good choice.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a family room, two double beds, which was plenty of space for a short stay with two young children. The roof top pool was a welcome spot to cool off after a day in the city. Short walk to MRT or inexpensive taxis from the lobby. Friendly staff.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The TV is old and shows no clear pictures for almost all channels... imagine you work tired whole day and when you do not want to do anything but just to have some random movies or shows to kill the time and you found the shows are so blur with poor signal... this is very sad and disappointed.... The room light is dim and dark.... There is improvement on the breakfast served and this encouraging.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the hotel, and I really believe it was great value for money. Nice architecture, plush, and had all the facilities I required.Service was up to the mark, and it is very near(walking distance) to Orchard road, so you can roam around whenever you want to!
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Conveniently located at Orchard Road. Close to MRT and shopping malls. Rooms ok. Staff very nice. Ventilation so so. Forgot to provide some items at first, but upon request able to replenish. Buffet breakfast of good quality, but inadequate seating on Sunday.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located close to all the shops and restaurants in Singapore. We only stayed two nights but the location enabled us to spend time shopping and was a quick taxi ride to all other interesting sights. The staff were very helpful and welcoming.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After many stays i can say service consistently happy friendly and very efficient. food services a delight and room service always perfect. Much appreciation to all staff for an enjoyable stay. Staff in business lounge enable working ease, and very professional.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reasonable nice hotel in the mid area of Orchard roadNearby Cuppage Plaza food area offers many restaurants serving every kind of food in both an inside or outside environment .Breakfast is expensive in the hotel
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a Great stay fro my family. The kids enjoyed the swiming pool a lot. It is a very nice hotel, and is in a very good location, close to every major attraction. The htel has extremely friendly staff, provides great food, and is also very efficient
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has all comforts for who is traveling alone or with family. Fantastic breakfast buffet, nice swimming pool and gym. The most interesting thing is the position at the end of Orchard road, near MRT Station and with all the Orchard mall very near.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was there to attend conference and not really enjoying any facilities by the hotel. Two nights stay and we are most of the time out of the room. Room is spacious and amenities are decent. Access by walking to 313 shopping mall
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of four stayed for two nights on points. I am an IHG Spire Ambassador. The hotels location is right off of Orchard Road, an excellent location for shopping and food. Checkin frontdesk staff were very helpful and went out of their way to make sure we had connecting rooms and that our other requests were taken care of! The swimming pool and fitness facilities are lovely. Hotel rooms are clean and well taken care of. My only minor complaint is that the breakfast buffet isn’t particularly appealing. Most of the “hot” foods were served cold and the selection is heavily Asian/Indian focused. That aside I highly recommend this hotel for families and those looking for a location close to Orchard Road!
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1 is for very kind employee, second for location. All the other - worst. Terrible humidity level at the room. Bugs, crashed tile, old technics. EMPTY MINI-BAR for a 250$/night room number?! Seriously?
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for one night (stopover on the way from Australia to Europe) in a family room. The boys were very happy about the pool (kiddie pool available as well), and we were happy about the location and the closeness to everything around Orchard Rd. Staff were very friendly and granted us an extension to checkout time, which allowed our youngest one an extra nap - very much appreciated as our departure flight was late at night.Breakfast was great, would recommend.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the service from staff was very good at all times. Were allowed a late checkout which was appreciated. The room itself was good but there was issues with the lower Shower head. Maintenance can reasonably quickly to repair but there were still issues with it after this.The location of this hotel is excellent, being only a 2 minute walk from Orchard Road and mega shopping.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is clean with all basic amenities. Cannot write much as we were there only for 1 night . Dinner was not available as were late according to them . They serve only till 10:30 pm . So we had to go outside . Many food options are available outside the hotel .
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the most elegant Holiday Inn I have ever stayed at! The facility was clean and well kept, and the staff was courteous and eager to assist. The hotel's location was well-situated for walking and access to local Christian churches and public transportation.
hotelName:
22    Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for two nights and received a great welcome from the Reception Team who were very friendly and informative on arrival and throughout our stay. Our room was quite small, but modern and clean. The rooftop pool was our highlight from the hotel. Unfortunately we didn't enjoy the breakfast offered, but the hotel is just a 5 minute walk from Clarke Quay where we found a great range of restaurants and bars, which were perfect to unwind in come evening time. The river is beautiful to stroll along or catch a cruise if you were that way inclined. You will also find an MRT station at Clarke Quay which makes it very easy to connect with the other hotspots in Singapore. Would definitely do a short stay here again.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights before a cruise. The hotel is very conveniently located near the marina and a range of excellent restaurants and bars. Our room was small but spotlessly clean and comfortable with good toiletries. Breakfast is excellent. Staff, efficient, friendly and welcoming. We loved Singapore and hope to return for longer. If so, we would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was very well located within easy walking distance of 2 MRT stations. It was also straight across the road from Clarke Quay and all the bars and restaurants there. About a 15 minute stroll from her to the Merlion.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very conveniently located. Clean, efficient staff and very comfortable beds. The only critique I can offer is that the room we had was very small, but we managed to place both suitcases on elevated furniture...one on the desk and the other on the suitcase stool. We can't criticise anything else as we just loved both of our stays and will stay there again in the future. The included breakfast was diverse covering a wide range of cuisine. If you breakfast later it is a little hard to find somewhere to sit and eat so we chose earlier times. It's a 5 minute walk to Clarke Quay where we found THE VERY BEST BALINESE RESTAURANT. We ate there three times. The food tasted just like Rudi's mother's Indonesian dishes. Yummy.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely Hotel, stayed here 3 nights with breakfast. 5 mins walk to Clarke Quay. Small compact rooms but everything you need for a short stay. Even though we arrived before 10am in the morning we were given our room straight away which was great as we could freshen up and then get on with our day. Great swimming pool on the rooftop with two jacuzzis, gym and large terrace area with sunbeds and plenty of towels. No bar though :( but vending machines with cold drinks/snacks. There was plenty of choice for breakfast to suit everyone. The bar/eating area is lovely, half outside/half inside with a lovely breeze blowing through all the time. All the staff we encountered were friendly, polite and helpful. If in Singapore again I will definitely be staying here!
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights , thoroughly enjoyed our stay , the staff were very professional and helpful , breakfast was good , the room was a little small considering the baggage we had but still adequate for our needs , facilities in the room were all very good. Location was also close to most attractions. Would stay there again. The Hotel was very clean as well.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well,it was nice when I went in I felt at home nad the room is nice too! But the hallways smells like chlorine,but I understand cause there’s a swimming pool at the top of the building,but it’s really nice.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in a quiet area, 5 minutes walk from the riverside restaurants and 10 minutes from the mrt station. Rooms are small but clean, well maintained and modern. The rooftop swimming pool is really nice and transparent!:) Breakfast is tasty, fresh and offers plenty of veg/non-veg options.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel didn’t expect anything more, but the room was clean and they have a nice transparent infinity pool at the roof deck.The best part is when I forgot something at the hotel on our day of departure I was notified immediately and ensured that my things was safe, and they been so helpful for all the necessary things to do.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If your looking for a hotel within a 3 minute walk to the bars and restaurants in Clarke Quay at a reasonable cost then you will be happy with the Holiday Inn Express. It's not a four star in my books but more of a hotel you would stay at near the airport offering a fairly basic room but comfortable. Its a bit of rabbit warren but once you've worked out the corridors and lifts it's not to bad. The staff are helpful and it is close to most amenities. As with most hotels in Singapore there is a 7 eleven with meters of the hotel. A good hotel for a night or two's stopover. We didn't eat there so can't comment.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is ideal for your stay in Singapore! The rooms are adequate with a safe, TV, and free water every day! There’s a fantastic selection for breakfast and a lovely relaxing deck on the roof with a 30 meter pool and jacuzzi! Close by is Clarke Quay which has loads of place to eat and you are a 10 minute walk from Clarke Quay underground!
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express recently and found the location of the hotel great. Behind the hotel was the river and there was a bridge across to quite a few bars and restaurants. We paid just below RM500 per night or just under £100 per night which was not too bad. It was close enough to central and amenities and rooms were acceptable. Pillows were a bit soft. There was a small gym at the rooftop and a lap pool. I used the gym which was adequate but lacking in the weights and dumbbells section. Overall the experience was good given that hotels near Orchard Road were closer to the RM800 range pernight.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel doesn’t have the frills but it is clean, modern and close to everything you need. It is also perfect for staying in a busy city with a lot to do, we were barely in our room other than to sleep as we were out enjoying Singapore. It’s walking distance to all the restaurants near Clark quay, close to china town, close to transport. The breakfast was great for getting up, grabbing something to eat and heading out for the day.I would definitely recommend staying here to anyone who doesn’t want to spend loads of money and isn’t too bothered about luxuries. The rooftop also has nice views of the city and the pool is huge!
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was small, bathroom was small. I think this hotel is more fit for business purpose, not for couple or family. But the breakfast was good enough..we love the yogurt...(!!!)And the hotel staff at breakfast is friendly enough.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was really happy with this hotel. Its not the Ritz - but you get what you pay for and its good value for Singapore. The staff are a delight (especially the breakfast ladies). It is clean, comfortable and well located. To be fair the rooms are on the smallish side but are very functional and everything works well. The included breakfast is more than adequate to satisfy most people. Sure, there are probably other hotels that offer more services and dining options - but if you are happy to save a few dollars and forego a few of the luxuries you will be more than comfortable here. I was very satisfied for my five night business stay.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small but comfortable room. Clean and well maintained. Incredible buffet breakfast. Guest self service laundry available if needed. Brilliant location to walk around.Would definitely come here again. Some of the friendliest staff we’ve come across, and we travel full time.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just finished a short break here. Glad I picked this place. Feels new all over and the room was very comfortable albeit no view but then I was not in the room much! Staff were very friendly and happy to help. Breakfast was good and 7-elevens are nearby to stock up the fridge! Location is awesome and mrt stops are in a 5-10 min walk away. Pool was amazing and unique. The only downside was that there were not enough sun beds by the pool for demand. Bearing in mind how much space there was it seemed a bit stingy!. Recommend staying here.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well, hotel is located at the perfect location to us, all can be reached by foot steps. But, hotel service need to be better, i called twice for dental care set, but nobody give us, finally I went to the reception and picked up by myself. Wondering, why room doesn't have dental care in?
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I arrived here late into the night but I found the receptionist up and upbeat. I was received so well and I just loved the hotel from there going forward.The room I got, 557 was simple and yet so nice and comfy. It was in the quiet zone of the hotel and that meant I could sleep peacefully without any noise or other distractions. The breakfast served here is not your typical breakfast and it is evident the hotel goes an extra mile to give good food and a great start to the day.I had a great and memorable time at this hotel and in Singapore because I had good accommodation.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After two stays in this hotel in the past two weeks I have to say its an absolute beauty!Here’s what I like:1. The hotel looks & feels brand new with a ‘hotel in garden’ theme going on 2. The staff are well trained and really friendly 3. The rooftop pool & Gym is perfect for business travellers 4. The included Breakfast is amazing because it’s simple 5. The Rooms are small but well organised and really cleanHere’s what I don’t like: I only have one issue 1. The price of the beer is just ridiculous - $12 at happy hour is just not on. Surely a better deal could be done with the local brewer to get a pint under $10 and this place would be buzzing Back this week for another stay I like the place so much
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here 2 nights and were very happy with location. Hawker food markets a short distance away. Rooms were on the small side but modern and immaculate. Great bathroom. Breakfast which is included was cooked as well as continental. All staff were pleasant. Taxis outside front door.7 11 was a 5 minute walk. Coffee shop on site. Only thing missing were USB ports and no power point in bathroom although there was a hair dryer in there.All in all excellent value.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room wasn't too small as others seem to think! Nice decor, spotlessly clean, very comfortable bed with a choice of firm or soft pillows. Lovely shower. Amazing staff, nothing was too much trouble. Special mention of Ellen and Fong in the Great Room at breakfast time, so helpful and kind. Hotel in a good position for public transport.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights, efficient check in, small compact rooms but clean and well serviced. Good roof top pool, ideal for a quick chill out after busy day sight seeing.Breakfast very good, busy at peak times but all dishes, etc replaced regularly.About 10-15 minute walk to metro. Excellent value for money
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was very clean and well organised. Gorgeous pool and rooftop views. The Rooms are smallish but have everything you need including a kettle a small fridge and iron. I liked it here we walked to the bus stops and it is walking distance to many restaurants and bars. The breakfast was the usual buffet. Breakfast staff member Kim was a wealth of knowledge and her customer service brilliant. Km deserves a customer service award. She made sure I had Gluten Free bead each morning and she was welcoming and happy nothing was too much trouble for her even when it was extremely busy. If I had anything negative it would be that this hotel doesn’t have a chef/cook in the evening so anything ordered is pre packaged. Not good for my special dietary needs. There is a cafe in the hotel and it supplies gf bread but doesn’t make gf sandwiches. But does have cake. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a long flight this hotel was just perfect! We arrived early and they still gave us our room. We went straight up to unwind on the rooftop, just gorgeous, lovely pool, lots of loungers and a great view. Hotel is in a good location, short walk to Clarke Quay and easy access to everything. Breakfast the next morning was busy but the staff were superb helping us to find a table; great selection of food too. We only stayed one night, moving to Katong (an interesting area) the next night to be nearer the airport for an early flight & in Orchard Road when we came back to Singapore so felt like we stayed in a good mix of places - this was still one of our favourites!
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed the stay. Located in a nice spot and within walking distance to the train station. We also booked the hotel because it had self serve laundry facility. The local cuisine items at breakfast were also a nice touch. If you’re ok with smaller rooms this is a good pick.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked a room at this hotel for end of June 2019 for a few nights and had to pre-pay upfront. All Good. I got a message that my MRI had been moved forward right when I was having my break in Singapore, consequently I had to cancel the trip. Singapore Airlines were brilliant and refunded all of my airfare without question or hassle. This hotel on the other hand, has given me the run around beyond belief!!I called the hotel reservations line and the lady there was brilliant, she actually suggested that since this was a medical issue she would get approval to refund my total charges.....she put me on hold. A gentleman by the name of Shafiq came on the line, had to explain my situation all over a again to him. he said he would send me an email to confirm the conversation and the next steps......you guessed it...NOTHING in the last few days. I have called the hotel five times now, Shafiq is always busy and does not return calls.I have been an IHG member for more than 15 years, most of those years I have been SPIRE.....this hotel has no idea what loyalty means. Loyalty does not work one way!!!As you can no doubt imagine, this hotel will not be getting my or my company's custom anytime soon!!
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff were very efficient and pleasant on arrival and check in. The rooms were very clean and provided very comfortable beds, complimentary water and a complimentary mobile to use for local calls and it provides suggestions and maps for local eateries, buses and train stations. This hotel offered an amazing complimentary breakfast, with a good international selection to chose from and a great strong coffee to start the day. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights, B&B, as expected in a city, rooms are compact, but well fitted out & well maintained. Hotel is spotless & the breakfasts were excellent. Great hotel. Close to the one if the stops for the Open Top Bus, which is great fur getting around. Though the Clarke Quay area has lots of restaurants/ bars we preferred the vibe & atmosphere closer to the Bay Area.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Chose this hotel as the price is reasonable, based on its location. I was pleasantly surprised on its simplicity, yet warmth feeling exudes by the hotel. The breakfast spread has quite a variety. They provide a vending machine if we want to buy any food and drinks. I used it quite often and find it really convenient. I like the location of the hotel as It's in a quieter side. So, may need to walk a bit for public transportation. I used Grab so, not an issue for me.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved the location as it was so easy to get to Clarke Quay and the River Walk. Staff are friendly & pleasant.Breakfast is buffet style and they do vary the options.Loved the pillows Firm or Soft!Shower is good and small bar fridge in room. We struggled with the small space as we are away from home for a month so had 2 large suitcases! Overall I would recommend this hotel for location, cleanliness, decent breakfast, good beds, great pool (We never had time!)About 30 mins from airport.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Business trip for onePros:- Holiday Inn... You know what to expect and its better than UK Holiday Inn- Cheap and cheerful- Nice decent (free) breakfast- Did not have time for the pool but looked great- Close to Clarke Quay if that is what you are afterCons:- Nothing much really... Conclusion:Hard to give the place a five-star because its not five-star prices. I may not actually return to this specific HIE but the HIE on Orchard Road is much better given the location.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a relatively long holiday in the hotel. The location is the best we can imagine in Singapore. The rooms are comfortable and very clean. No A/C noise at all. The bed is the best. The breakfast is enjoyable with wide range of foods. The rooftop pool gave us great joy after a busy day in the city. Also have to mention the personal during breakfast, they are very kind and helpful even with good advice where to go and what to see. Thank you Holiday Inn Express.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 4 days in Holiday Inn Express in Clark Quay and we are glad that we choose the right hotel for us. This hotel is great located and it is very clean, cosy and safety. The continental breakfast was very delicious and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely come back to stay at Holiday Inn Express in Clark Quay :)
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is another good example of a quality Holiday Inn Express. Very sharp & elegant rooms and facilities incl. a large rooftop gym/pool/relax area. Welcoming staff, good breakfast options and a very good location. Easy 5 min flat walk to Clarke Quay. Walking distance (a little longer) to Marina Bay Sands and attractions around that area. Well done Holiday Inn Express, we will be returning on our next visit.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location in Clarke Quay! Hotel is big and clean. Excellent rooms, presented very well. Friendly helpfull staff, who organised late check out free of charge and to hold our bags. Huge rooftop pool definitely worth checking out! Breakfast was great, huge selection! Will be my go to stay now for Singapore!
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for six nights. Brilliant location - 5 minute walk to Clarke Quay. Spectacular view from the roof. Rooftop pool with glass side was perfect. It was clean and refreshing. Breakfast was included and it was delicious and plentiful. The breakfast staff were beautiful people. So polite and friendly without being intrusive. Rooms were a little smallish but it wasn't a big problem. Heard noises in the hallway at night so the rooms weren't soundproof. Had trouble getting used to the pillows even though we had a couple of options. Only real complaint was the smoking area, which we had to walk through each day, was a bit much to handle. The smoking area should be on the Havelock St end of the Hotel where pedestrians do not go.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel for 5 nights and have lots of nice things to say.All the staff at the hotel are very lovely and obviously are very customer focused. Always happy to assist. Free breakfast was good, enough choice everyday though can get every busy during ‘peak’ times, one of our mornings it was very very busy and meant the staff were unable to replace the food quick enough. Lots of juices, self serve coffees and hot choices as well as fruits and cold options.Location is fantastic, less than 10 mins walk to Chinatown MRT and Clarke Quay MRT. Lots of dining choices near either station and 7/11 round the corner. (Also a friends themed cafe opposite the hotel) The rooms although are small should be more than enough and the showers were lovely. Had a fridge in the room and a mini safe.The best feature was the in room phone/tablet which is free for use of your stay. It’s hooked up to 4G for you to use out and about, used constantly for maps and MRT times while we were out and it allowed for free calls in lots of destinations.Loved the rooftop, the pool was great but could almost do with the jacuzzi being a little warmer as felt too cold after the heat of the sun. Maybe even a few more chairs/loungers would be good as often had to wait for others to leave before being able to get one.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well priced for Singapore’s standard and good position at the Quay. The rooms were very nice, clean and well designed for the space. Unfortunately, the door isn’t made to keep sound out, we were woken about 6 times throughout the early hours by groups of people talking normally outside as they walked passed. Our friends in another room had the same experience. Very frustrating as we had an early flight and I’d say not very practical if you’re on a business trip. Also, breakfast buffet was very disappointing. Very limited selection for westerners. In terms of hot savoury, they only had eggs, tiny sausages, and a bowl of corned beef that looked like dog food. The widest array was Indian food and sweet pastries, which doesn’t take my fancy for breakfast.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived to a warm and friendly welcome, we were allocated our room on the 7th Floor with good views of some of the city skyline. The room was modern compact and comfortable, the roof has s see through swimming pool with free towels. Would we visit again and recommend? Definitely
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is perfectly placed to give easy access to many of the main sights in Singapore. We stayed for three nights and were impressed by the standard of the rooms which were very comfortable with all necessary accessories. The breakfasts were excellent with a large selection to choose from. The public areas were comfortable, there was free access to Computer terminals and Internet so that we were able to check into flights and print boarding passes. The hotel staff were all friendly and very helpful. We would use this hotel again.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very convenient situation close to Clarke Quay. A no fuss functioning hotel with excellent breakfast buffet. Rooms are well appointed and clean. Bed comfortable and quiet. Staff helpful and well informed about the area.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel because of their flexible last minute cancellation policy. Hotel was beautiful with friendly staff, cant fault their service at all! even allowed to have a late 2pm check out.The room were cosy and clean, however I recommend avoiding any rooms near the lifts and some guests don't have the courtesy of being quiet.The only down side for me is the awkward distance to both chinatownMRT or Clark QuayMRT. If you prefer the area and have a little more budget for accomodation, i would recommend swissotel merchant court as it is connected to the MRT station.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights on the way home from Australia. The location very good.. near the Quay and easy reach of the metro and shops. The rooms are small but I understand most of them are in the city and the breakfast was fine and plenty of it. Main thing was good air con in the room!!!The reception was very helpful when our cab was late.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights over Easter. Super comfortable beds, small bathroom but loved the rainhead shower. The bathroom is not very soundproof! The included breakfast was handy but not much choice for vegetarians and a bit more variety would have been welcome. There were queues for the coffee machine, but good local cafes about 10-15 minutes walk away. The best thing about the hotel is Kim who was working the breakfast shift. Was a great source of information and very very helpful! We did everything she suggested and we were not disappointed. A great asset to the hotel!
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very safe bet in Singapore. No hanging gardens of Babylon here, but still has pleasant outside spaces and a rooftop pool with a view. It’s not opulent, but it’s very slick and stylish. The inclusions are very good, including breakfast. The bar meals are simple but tasty, and the bakery / coffee shop is spot on. Rooms are terrific. Small, because it’s Singapore! But very effective and tastefully set up. Great location too. Very handy. For all of this you pay in the mid-lower mid range. It’s a busy place, and I can’t find anything to moan about here. It’s a very safe bet. Highly recommended and my go-to choice in Singapore. If you can afford a night in Marina Bay, please do! It’s amazing. But to save my $$ for other treats, this hotel is the one I’ll use again.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely loved this hotel, while the rooms are small they have everything you need, the bed is comfy you have two pillows one soft and one firm.Bathroom is super compact but the shower is the best we have come across in our travels.The breakfast supplies all your needs however does get super busy, we didn’t have any problems with getting a table but there were lots of people around.Location is good with a large shopping centre within walking distance. There is a taxi spot out the front and you don’t have to wait too long.The roof top pool and lounge area is great and the views are to die for.Would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Holiday Inn at Clarke Key turned out to be the perfect hotel for our four stay in Singapore! It’s fantastic value when compare to some of the hotels located closer to the Marina. It’s in the perfect location for access to all the places to eat and drink in the vibrant Clarke Keys area, but the Marina area is accessible via a short walk along the river or by a eater taxi. The rooms were clean and quiet and included breakfast was OK! We didn’t even get to use the rooftop pool! Maybe next time, because we’ll definitely use this hotel on our next visit to Singapore!
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed two nights in this lovely hotel in a Fabulous location. Rooms are small but clean and well appointed. You have everything you need Staff friendly and efficient. Breakfast and roof top pool was the highlight. Definitely best value accommodation in Singapore.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. Hotel was spotlessly clean and staff very very friendly, helpful. Rooms are a good size but remember you are probably not in it for very long. Breakfasts were excellent all buffet, we found that we didn’t have any lunch because we were still full from breakfast. I would definitely stay in this hotel again but I thought Clarke key was expensive to eat and drink in.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located in close proximity to Clarke Quay's main attractions. The hotel is modern, clean and affordable. The room was comfortable, and whilst not large, had everything you need. The breakfast was very good. I will stay here again.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed her for a business trip. Enough has been said about the size of the rooms. They are very small but you can put up with them. The bathroom had one of those soap/shampoo dispenser on the wall. Don’t like the idea of washing hair and body with the same stuff. Bring your own. The big thing for me was dinner choices whilst eating on your own. Clarke quay is a very lively place with heaps of places to eat. Whilst I did it once, eating out by yourself in such a lively area is a bit uncomfortable. Unfortunately, eating at the hotel isn’t that much better. You have to go down to the bar and order from a limited menu. Did this twice and had Butter Chicken and Singapore Chicken Rice. Should get over my feeling of being uncomfortable about eating on my own and went out more. Ok but not great.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property is very near / almost bang in the middle of action hub for Singapore...Clarke Quay!Swimming pool is one of its kind with glass wall along the entire length ! A quirky photo opp with water adding funny feature ! Breakfast was quick not an elaborate fare, but very utilitarian! Full marks for proximity to Clarke quay!
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved, loved, loved this hotel. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, the breakfast buffet was perfect and had plenty of choices, and the rooftop pool area was amazing. The hotel is located within walking distance to Chinatown, hawker markets and Clarke Quay where you can find some amazing places to eat whilst enjoying the views of the river. But the best part of this hotel would have to be the staff, they were very friendly and helpful, especially the breakfast service staff and I can not recommend this hotel enough to anyone who is thinking of staying here.
hotelName:
23    Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Dorsett for 3 nights in early July, business trip. The hotel is fine for the price bracket - the pool is very nice, although there could be a few more amenities and protection from the view and noise of traffic; the restaurant to be avoided. The hotel is on the edge of Chinatown - not the sterile Singapore I had expected, but rather a messy, vibrant and trendy network of streets and alleyways, with some delicious food. But the best thing by far was the hotel staff, who are the friendliest and most helpful I have ever come across. On arrival, I was allowed to check in and given a room hours before the due time; after a long o/n flight from London that was wonderful. During my stay, I found helpful and friendly advice whenever required. And on the day I left, I was allowed to check out two hours later, and then given that I had to work and my flight was late, I was offered the staff office for 3 hours. So I could work and relax before the next 13hr flight to Australia. The star that day was Yadi, who made it all easy and fun. Thank you very much, I’ll be coming back.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travelled with 2 kids and spent 3 nights.Staffs are helpful and ver good responses on handling issues.Too bad i had no chance to enjoy swimmi g pool and upper garden.Location are very strategic.. MRT Outram is exactly next door..also bus station..I did not include breakfast but food I ordered by room service was great base on my Indonesia taste scale.Easy to find alternative foods around the hotel, specially people like me who enjoyed chinesse food, (there's also halal food closed by hotel)Overall I enjoyed the stay
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at Dorsett very early due to our flight and were not disappointed with the level of customer service at the hotel. Although there were no rooms available for early check in, Rachel (Duty Manager) did her best to give us access to facility in the hotel for shower and changes.She was very knowledgeable of the place and helping us with best transport to get around the city and the airport.The rooms were spacious, clean, tidy, and quiet. However, there was a little smell of mould in the room.The gym was adequate and spacious for my work out but it needs a bit of attention.The hotel is a walking distance to Maxwell Road Hawker Centre.Would come back again.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I are a regular guest at this hotel. The location is very good and close to china town and clark quay hence many choices of restaurants and hawker center. It is also easy to travel as outram park MRT station is next door. The front desk staff is very friendly and professional especially Onnah and Yadi. They were really helpful and Make our stay easier. The marketing staff, Nadya, also informative and friendly too. Thanks so much for wonderful service.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Oonah and shah excellent representatives of the hotel eager to help, very professional and did everything they could to make our stay pleasant. Went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable and welcome in your facility. Definitely will tell others!
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived after a late night flight and the check-in process was extremely smooth and friendly even for the early hours of the morning. My partner and I were celebrating a special occasion and the staff couldn't have been more friendly and accommodating. The location was perfect for those who don't want the hustle and bustle of Orchard but still want the convenience of easy MRT access to Santosa & Marina Bay. The proximity to local hawkers/ Chinatown made the trip all that more authentic.Working in the Hospitality industry myself & having been to Singapore many times I would have no hesitation recommending Dorsett to my friends and family for their future travel. Please commend the whole team for an overall amazing experience. Looking forward to staying here again. - Yohan
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So my sister made the booking for me under her Agoda account. I came to the front desk and showed the booking confirmation and passport. The front-desk staff requested that I or my sister must contact Agoda to confirm my name in the booking request. Ok, so my sister messaged Agoda under the booking reference section on Agoda website. I showed that to the front-desk (I had to queue again behind other guests who came after me) but they said a web message is not acceptable and demanded my sister directly call Agoda. Ok, so I had to step aside again to call my sister, she called Agoda and after several attempts Agoda picked up the phone and did sort it out, said that they will send an email to the hotel immediately. I asked the front-desk, but was instructed to wait until further notice. After another 25 minutes I could not stand anymore and go ask them again, they told me they received the email from Agoda just now, but when I insisted to see the email receiving time, it was actually 20 minutes ago. I came to the hotel at 1.30 pm. And after all this bureaucratic front-desk process of Dorsett, I checked in to my room at 2.45 pm. That's 1h and 15 minutes I will never get back and a lot of nuisances. So much for a 4-star hotel.I don't know whether this is merely bad process, or differentiated treatments for 3rd-party booking guests and walk-in guests. Whatever it is, I'll never ever choose this hotel again.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Greetings ! As old Singaporeans from North America Dorsett Hotel is well located in the People Park 's Centre neighborhood of eateries shops etc in fact we had a Friends Dinning Together at very expensive Spring Court Cuisine Eatery nearby it has Deem Brunch !Dorsett is MRT accessible for light luggage Travellers like us, being near Outram ,Tanjong Pagar revived good aide memoirs for me including Kereta Ayer Chinatown ! Although we did have family help on transport to Changi and from being nearby to MRT Outram is comforting ! We are at Room 308 , your multi lingual staff at Reception is welcoming and superb Majullah Singapoora Jika Tak Mahjong masa ini ! Dorsett 's swimming is too small and too shallow for lap swimmers like me ! Dorsett might do very well with a Chinese Deem Sum Brunch Eatery , guests needn't walk to People's Park or Chinatown ! We of course hope & pray for affordable cost effective hotel rates ! Gerald Heng Sr. Washington DC
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my husband and 13 y.o daughter. The staff is quite friendly and helpful.Specially for Mr. Yadi. He’s the duty manager when we stayed there. He explained things and gave directions to the place we want to go etc like we’re his old friends. And one of the things I like about this hotel location is that chinatown is on a walking distance. The hotel also surrounded with beautiful buildings, small enchanting cafe, bookstore. MRT? They have special lift that goes there directly in front of the hotel.Accessible, Affordable, and Hospitable. Need I say more ? I definitely coming back to Dorsett.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Singapore is modern, friendly people, easy transportation and lots of shopping! This hotel is comfortable, accommodating, and bed is superb. Staff exceptional, patient, and friendly. Michelle, Pravin, Rachel to name a few.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect- location wise, front desk staff, the needless to ask but automatically refilled toiletries. The rooms are a decent size, the bathrooms better than most in terms of space.. I wish they had a fairly ok priced breakfast. But then there are several options (and rated ones at that) around that you can go pick up a good breakfast.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I stayed in this hotel during my visit to the Singapore General Hospital. The proximity to the SGH and MRT station was the consideration to choose the hotel. When you exit Outram Park MRT station towards Dorsett hotel using an elevator you will come right at in front of the hotel.It has a decent size room, nice mattress and pillows. The room equipped with iron and ironing board, kettle.Definitely will stay here again.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 3 nights in the standard Dorsett room. 'Compact' room but good value given the price. Location terrific above Outram station and lots of choices of bars, restaurants and cafes walking distance. Special mention to the staff and in particular, Dana. Always smiling, always thoughtful. Thanks
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Dorsett for a business trip.They are very responsive from the booking, check in and all other requests. Located near Chinatown and VivoCity. Many restaurants to choose from.Breakfast selection is few but can fill you up.Room is ok, but there are some dust inside the cabinet. Not a big deal though.Will definitely stay here again ;)
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i was visited dorsett early april. the room very clean i got room upgrade because of staff compliment about their mistake. the location is great very near outram park MRT station. very near to chinatown and many food,resto,and bar around there.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very close to China town and all the restaurants, hawkers and bars. The price is quite good for value (according to Singapore market price). If you are a fan of Crazy Rich Asians, this area will remind you some good memories. Cozy hotel with small rooms.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is conveniently located next to Outram train station so easy to access. I arrived at 1:00pm and was lucky enough to get my room straight away. Thanks to Michelle. Room was small but well equipped. Bed was comfortable, and bathroom was clean. Only comment would the carpet which was very filthy. I didnt dare walk bare foot. I left at 5:00am the next day and the 2 ladies at the front desk were very helpful in getting me a taxi. Overall this place is not bad for the price you pay. I would stay here again for a short trip like this.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I chose this hotel as it was our first trip to Singapore and we needed a hotel in a good position to go sightseeing. We were staying for 3 nights.The hotel exceeded expectations, It was beautiful and clean and the staff were fabulous. ( The bathroom was a little small causing difficulty in moving about- but really nothing to worry about)Our thanks go to May who went out of her way to help us find our way about, arranging taxis when needed and explaining the MRT routes which turned out to be right next to the hotel - perfect!We had breakfast included in our stay and the choice was excellent and of a high standard. Omelettes cooked to order.We were within walking distance of China Town which is lovely and provides numerous places to eat and shop in the evening ( we didn't see it in daytime).Also on the doorstep of the hotel were wine bars and restaurants - much cheaper than hotel dining.We used the pool in the afternoon which was perfect after a busy day rushing around.Happy hour at the bar was also a great start to the evening.A brilliant trip enhanced by May who extended our checkout time to fit in with our next stop - this allowed for more sightseeing.We would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose the hotel as I had a layover of 24 hours and wanted somewhere to rest and to get a quick glimpse of Singapore before my midnight departure. This hotel provided. The rooms themselves I found were basic and didn't really impress, but it was sufficient. The check in was good as the reception offered a 1pm check out which was much appreciated as I was a late night arrival. The location was great. Only a few minutes from Chinatown, which consumed my entire day, and I also noticed transport was close by. Overall it was good without being great and was sufficient.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were really pleasant and helpful, especially Dana who was happy/enthusiastic and knowledgeable, nothing was any problem. The room was clean and spacious. The bed was really comfortable. The en suite was large and well equipped. Pool towels were provided in the room, together with bathrobes and slippers. The pool area had sunbeds/tables/chairs and the pool was very clean. Our afternoon swim was thoroughly appreciated. We did not eat in the hotel but enjoyed the happy hour drinks.The hotel has direct access to the Outram MRT so great situation for Chinatown and Little India and the purchase of the Tourist Travel Pass is a must at 30SD with 10SD refund is a must!We had a great stay and would definitely book this hotel again should we return to Singapore in the future.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 2 nights on holiday. Lovely hotel which met all our needs. Attractive lobby and nice pool area. Room was spacious clean and comfortable. The bathroom was roomy and clean. Pool towels were provided. The staff were outstanding and couldn’t do enough to help us with anything we needed. Location at the south of Chinatown was ok if you don’t mind walking but it is a bit out from the main drag.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked in here for 3 nights prior to joint our cruise to Hong Kong. We were given a complimentary upgrade to a higher room with a better view, which was nice.The room was good, and the bed was very comfortable.The staff were uniformly friendly and polite.The breakfast was also very good with a wide variety of dishes.For us however, one of the main attractions was the proximity of the MTR subway - just round the corner from the front door.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Awesome front desk staff. Courteous and went out of their way to be helpful. Concierge was on hand to welcome us whenever we returned from our outings. Great location-above MRT Station and walking distance to food court.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 6 wonderful nights at the Dorsett Singapore during our kids half term break. As this was our first time to Singapore and with the abundance of hotels to choose from I was initially a little apprehensive but this quickly disappeared on arrival at the Dorsett. Despite our early arrival (11 am) we were afforded an early check-in, which was a nice touch considering we had an overnight journey. The hotel itself is well maintained, clean and the location was excellent. The nearest MRT station was a 3 minute walk from the hotel and 1 stop thereafter to Sentosa island. China town with an abundance of eateries/ shop / market was only 10 minutes walk from the hotel. The staff are friendly and welcoming, all were well informed about the surrounding amenities and a special thanks to Michelle who was fantastic in providing detailed guidance in navigating the city. We will be returning without a doubt.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is modern, clean, centrally located and close ot everything a tourist might want to see. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Next to subway station, Chinatown, and Hop On Hop Off bus stop. Will stay again next time in Singapore.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel based on the reviews on travel websites but the room that was given to us didn't reflect the good reviews we had read at all. The room smelled really bad upon entering and I had to leave air con running constantly to keep it bearable. The carpet had pretty bad stains all over the room and I was scared to walk around bare feet. The wallpaper had some old glue residue (or some kind of repair, see pictures) and was very old and showed its age. The shower cubicle had mould on rubber sealing and floor tiles, again, I couldn't use the shower bare feet. The toilet paper holder was rusted badly and broken. The management was informed and they were swift to come up to inspect the room. They agreed that the room was not fit for purpose, but they were still unable to offer any compensation that was acceptable considering the state of the room and what I had paid for it. They did fix the toilet paper holder and clean the mould etc. but too little too late. This hotel was probably very good in the past but it seems not enough is being done in terms of maintenance. I was able to find better hotel around Clarke Quays area for less money that I paid for this hotel, avoid at all costs and go some where else if possible. The location is good as the hotel is right next to the MRT and close to the Singapore downtown and china town area. Staff was friendly too. Shower pressure was adequate and the air con worked brilliantly.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed for a couple of nights before taking a cruise, having found a good offer online. The hotel was very clean and modern, on the edge of Chinatown, next to one of the main Police Stations, so felt very safe.Good breakfast buffet, covering not just Western staples, but South East Asian Fare too, which allowed us to try something new and tasty.Hotel above a subway station, 40 minutes direct from Changi Airport. Did not try hotel restaurant, crazy to do that with the fantastic food courts only a few hundred meters away in Chinatown. Good swimming pool, with plenty of space to relax in the shade. If you have been to Singapore you will know why you need shade!Not top price, because not in central area, but worth every penny.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in Chinatown, the hotel has an impressive lobby. Check in was smooth. Our room on the 10th floor was small but had all the facilities for our short stay. The bathroom on the other hand was big , no bath but a lovely shower.I was having difficulty finding a few cigars, and asking st the desk the staff went the extra mile and found me an excellent store, Old Cuba, within easy walking distance. The store was hard to find and I would not have succeeded without their sterling work. We were going to have breakfast at the hotel, but found it was badly over priced The air conditioning was noisy
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pleasantly decorated rooms which are a lttle on the small side, but well appointed, with quiet A/C and good shower. Good wi-fi and ditto breakfast make this an easy stay. Not a very homey bar, but then bustling Chinatown is just staggering distance from the hotel where there are many to be found.The hotel is on top of Outram subway station, which the gateway to everywhere in Singapore.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely 2 night stay here on route to Thailand. Very convenient for transportation getting around. Easy checkin and room clean. Would stay here again, however, was not so keen on the loft room. Stairs to bed, with bathroom downstairs. Hard getting in and out of bed if you slept on the “other side” of the bed. Couldn’t walk around the bed.As has been said in earlier review. Could not blow dry your hair looking in a mirror, asked for an extension cord but didn’t have one. Couldn’t open safe at 5am the morning of departure, the hotel sent someone out, got it open and changed batteries without delay. Thank you
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I accidentally hurt my finger when closing safety box at night. It bleed a little bit and made some staining on bed sheet and my pillow during sleep (I tried to clean those stains but still quite remarkable). The next day afternoon I got a letter form the hotel service concerning and asking if there's anything they can help. My wife also got a call from custum service, not for compansation, just for concerning. I wrote a letter for appology and hope to make compensation for the stains. The custum service was so kind and concerned my wound again, and I didn't have to pay for it.Sincerely thanks for the kindness and warmth of the hotel survice!
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great stay at Dorsett, in. Deluxe room. Super comfortable, nice pillows, clean and neat room. Extremely convenient location near the MRT and buses. Close to Tiong Bahru, and China Town. Close to food and amenities. Well done!
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here with 4 other friends prior to our travels to Thailand. Lovely hotel with a couple of little considerations. Firstly we were all given an upgrade to a loft room which was very nice. The beds are so comfortable. 2 considerations for the bedrooms, there is no plug anywhere near a mirror if you need to use the hairdryer or a plug to charge your phone up near the bed where you can reach your phone. Other than that it was a very nice hotel. Clean, friendly, right next to Outram MRT. We were there during Chinese Lunar New Year and it was crazy busy in Chinatown. The bar closes early which was a bit strange for modern hotel so don’t come back thinking you’ll have a nightcap before bed.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visting Singapore fro the first time as a family we wanted a hotel to have a good location and this is the best thing about this hotel. It's next to the subway station, one stop from the Sentosa station and 3-4 to Marina bay so from this point of view is great! But there are are many things that are not as great. Firstly the rooms quality, The first room was given to us was in a floor that smelled paint thinner and the room was really terrible with wallpaper teared apart in many places and very dirty carpet, After I went back to the reception to complain they changed the room to a better one but nothing special, just better condition. Another weird thing is that after 8pm if you need a coffee or anything to eat you can't! I never met this in this kind of hotel level before. And the nearest coffee shop or 7/11 is in Chinatown!The situation is being saved a bit by the Korean hotel manager that she is really nice and kind and she will try her best to help as much as she can. But the hotel needs a refreshment for sure!
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just completed a 6 night stay.This hotel is convenient for Chinatown, and very close to Outram Park MRT station. That’s about all the good I can say about it.Restaurant food is not very good at all. The one evening meal I ate their was served very, very quickly. Far too fast for it to have been freshly prepared. It was bland and uninteresting (guests from UK, think cheap and bad chinese takeaway quality). The restaurant plays terrible covers of international pop music on repeat. After one night, I switched to Deliveroo or GrabFood deliveries when eating in.Breakfast is standard buffet food. No yoghurt (if that’s your thing).The hotel bar shuts at about 9:30, and room service stops about 10. Don’t expect service after a long day in the office or sightseeing. After that time your options are a vending machine.There is a an outside pool good for a swim, but don’t expect to sit their to relax with a nice view - it overlooks a building site. There is a gym, but the equipment is tired and in need of repair in places. There isn’t much equipment: 1 bench, dumbbells up to 10kg, two bikes, two treadmills, a cross trainer and a pulley frame. There is bland ‘lift music’ piped into the gym - bring your own music if you want any motivation!The rooms themselves are fine, though quite small by Singapore standards and have quite noisy aircon.I think there is much better for a very similar price, and won’t stay there again.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was our 4th time with this hotel. We always love the hotel for its location. But the hotel is getting worse by each year we came back to visit Spore. Rooms were so dated. The worse thing was, the room was so freaking dusty! Till i have to do my own house keeping. I was told they had their management changed. Saving cost i assume? Hey, your price ain't cheap for a small room with a 4 star rating. And you made the house keeping people for each of them work for 30 over rooms!! Insane! I Don know how true this could be, but i rather trust my own experience. The proof of a very obvious dust on the radio. It was near to my bed for haven sake! I'm breathing in dust during my sleep. I had nose allergies and when i got home, i was down with a flu! Worst still! You even provided me with a very old torned bath towel!!!!! Goodness gracious. I wonder what is your hotel's standard! Speechless. The structure of the rooms were ridiculous. Water was flowing out from the shower door till i need to ask for extra floor mats! Water pressure was slow. Hot water was inconsistent. One minute i was bathing in warm the next i was shivering. Oh dear. We were happy on our last two trips. Wasn't happy on our 3rd visit and we thought to give another chance. So this 4th will be the last.So good luck! If you can't stand dust, drop this hotel. You will suffer your whole trip. Fyi i did not make a fuss at the reception because they aren't at fault. Because if complaints aren't taken seriously, come on.. why need your customer's feedback?
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For a 10 day trip we were looking for a place that would have been central in location, unobtrusive yet warm and friendly in service, have most amenities of a five star hotel and we found all this and more at the Dorsett Singapore.
