The whole experience from the booking stage where Rose from reservations and Peter Chua the Rooms division manager ensured the initial part was smooth giving the right advise. We arrived on an early flight and at arrival Oonah was a pleasure to talk to, she organised an early checkin which was such a blessing as we had hardly any sleep on the flight and escorted us to our room making sure everything was explained as well as offering any assistance to ensure we settled in well on the first day as well as ensured we had the right amount of amenities inpmmediately. The housekeeping staff who cleaned our room 1013 daily during our stay organised our room the way we had liked it to be, making our daily return to the room feel like entering home. The pool was a great place to relax a fantastic size. All in all a very memorable experience and we surely had some great memories to take back from this trip which was made possible by the all the staff at Dorsett. After being the service industry for more than 25years myself I could help but notice the genuineness of service all across the board from the porter, all the team at the reception, the restaurant staff, the cleaning staff and “Luke”. I’d recommend Dorsett to anyone wanting to stay in Singapore and would surely come back.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked the Dorsett as a last minute replacement for accommodation that fell through. Staff were excellent, on check in we were advised that we had been given complementary breakfast for the 4days of our stay which was excellent with young children. The room was well represented on website, pool has a lovely view and easy access to the MRT station under the building.Short 5min walk to Chinatown.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was there for staycation. Location is great, few steps a away from Outram park MRT and a short walking distance to China Town which have great choice of food options. Room size is fairly big compare to other hotels in Singapore. Fair enough. Aircond is superb for a polar bear like me, enjoyed the freezing cold aircond and had a good hibernation for my Christmas holiday. Please take note that if you are driving, there are limited car parks for guests.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had an enjoyable and relaxed stay at Dorsett Singapore hotel over the weekend with my parents. The staffs are friendly and extremely attentive towards my aged parents . We are extremely impressed with the hotel’s facilities- sleeping rooms are well equipped with basic requirements. Excellent wifi facility, spacious room with high ceiling! Hotel is conveniently located near to MRT station and within closed walking proximity to the famous and good eateries (restaurants and bars). Thank you to Dorsett Singapore for a great, memorable experience!
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for three nights at the start of our holiday to Asia. It was the perfect place to acclimatise and adjust to the time difference. The hotel was around $24 dollars from the airport and took about 20 minutes. Check in process took less than 5 minutes. The desk staff were friendly, welcoming, professional and efficient. Our deluxe room on the 8th floor was spacious, clean, comfortable and well equipped with robes, slippers, kettle, water, tea and coffee, lots of toiletries (including razor, toothbrushes, cotton wool etc.) The shower was hot and powerful. TV had a good mix of channels. The in-room safe was nice and big. Big enough to hold a large laptop and several other valuable devices. Air conditioning was functional and quiet. Black out curtains were fab. WiFi was great and free of charge. I emailed reception to ask if they would mind printing out our boarding passes for our flight to Thailand. Within an hour, the boarding passes were printed out and posted under our door. May, the director of rooms organised this for us and was so very helpful and accommodating. She even recognised my name at check out and remember our email correspondence and introduced herself. A lovely personal touch in a busy hotel. Check out took less than 5 minutes a 9:45 am. The door staff organised us a taxi instantly. The location was an approximate 5 minute walk from Smith Street in Chinatown (one of the main entrances into Chinatown). We went each night for tea and a foot massage.  There is a hotel lift for direct access to the MRT station (underground train). A one way ticket didn’t cost us more than $1.70 at any time. Little India was 4 stops away, Clarke Quay 1 stop away and Orchard Road about 4 stops with one change. The MRT is really easy to use. This hotel was the perfect place for us to stay. We slept so well in the King Size super comfy bed and the room was really silent. Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel to any type of traveller. Will definitely stay again.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easy access via the MRT with the station exit just twenty steps from the hotel lobby. Also clear signs at the MRT station itself. Right in the corner of busy Chinatown (Singapore) its a great retreat for some peace and quiet while still within walking distance to a wide variety of food - and being truly spoil for choice! And within walking distance to explore neighbourhoods like Tanjong Pagar, Chinatown and Tiong Bahru And more food. The room was lovely and the shower area relaxing. The pool was good for soaking in the sun and long enough for a few decent laps. My only issue was allthe edges and corners in the pool - not fully safefor children. The hotel was thoughtful to send up some cake as aBirthday gift. it was a treat!!
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There are two styles of room (two-story loft and one-story standard room) that could accommodate 3 people. I stayed in a loft room that was quite cramped and had the main bed upstairs (the stairs lead directly to the bed platform, so there is nothing upstairs other than the bed). I personally slept on the pull out couch. With the couch pulled out on the bottom level, the room became very difficult to navigate.We had to awkwardly scoot to get to anywhere on the bottom floor. In fact, you could not get into the bathroom without walking over the bed and stepping down into it. We found that one of the closet panels went through to the bathroom so we actually ended up ducking through the closet to get into the bathroom while the couch was pulled out. This was very awkward and uncomfortable. The bathroom sink had no counter space. This was very frustrating as somebody who uses contacts. Just generally, if you are used to placing things down near the sink, this lack of space will be pretty annoying. Also, the placement of the toilet paper is almost behind you when sitting on the toilet, so trying to reach it was awkward. I would frequently knock the toilet paper down when trying to grab some because of how it was placed. However, our experience at the hotel was mostly positive. We had some mixups where the cleaning staff didn't come even when we specifically asked them to. Also, their shampoo/conditioner and body gel bottles were visually similar, so sometimes the cleaning person would give us all of one and none of the other. This just meant we had to call house cleaning to bring us some shampoo. Not terrible, but a weird thing to miss. This all being said, the hotel was very clean and the staff were all friendly. Perhaps if 2 people were assigned to this room (as opposed to three), many of the cramped feelings would be alleviated. The location was only a few minutes walk from Chinatown and using the Grab app made navigating to other places easy. The interior decor is also quite clean in the lobby, and rooms are nice looking (even if not the most practical). The "rooftop garden" is some turf and trees and I wouldn't even say it's worth going up there to check it out. However, the pool area is very pretty and serves the same purpose. The gym is decent with a few machines and some weights which is perfectly fine for a quick workout.Lastly, the breakfast food was just okay. I ate breakfast at this hotel twice and they have some pretty standard options. Dinner one night was okay as well. Perfectly acceptable, but nothing special.In conclusion, if you're looking for a nice and clean hotel that's near Chinatown, this is a nice option. I would recommend it if you are not planning on spending too much time in your hotel room. I would always choose a clean but poorly laid out room over a dirty large room. If you're okay with looking past the bathroom sink/toilet paper layout, the shower was very nice with great water pressure. Overall, it was an otherwise great hotel with some frustrating issues.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Short walk from Chinatown and has the really nice ManMan restaurant just behind it. Construction work is still going on across the road but they usually can fit you in overlooking the houses on the other side.Staff are friendly and helpful. They have done away with the portable hotel phones.Conveniently located at the Outram MRT station.

review_body: The twin beded room is quite small. I do not like the pillow, it kinda of of feather pillow and everytime I lay on it the pillow is flat and make it uncomfortable.The location is good near MRT and walking distance to Chinatown.

review_body: Our group of 28 persons stayed at Dorsett for 2 days before boarding Princess Cruise ship. Ms. Jaimay, one of the receptionist, helped us to purchase the tickets at the MRT station. We enjoyed our visit at Dorsett and love to come back. The location is the best, very close to Chinatown .Thanks to Ms. Low. She helped us for transfer arrangement from airport to hotel and to the ship.

review_body: This establishment is modern and classy. The rooms are quite spacious and clean. The receptionists were very helpful in providing information as to where we could eat like locals and how to get around the city. The hotel is situated in walking distance to a metro station and is a few stops away from the main attractions of Clarke Quay and Marina Bay.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you to Michelle for all her help with the lost passport including walking my daughter to the police station when she made her report for the embassy. (Note: We found the passport and boarded our cruise on time!) All the staff were wonderful throughout our stay at the lovely hotel, from restaurant staff to housekeepers. Compact rooms but comfortable beds, many amenities, air conditioning works well, big swimming pool, location on the Edgar of Chinatown just a few feet from MRT station, 4 blocks from Chinatown Food Strreet, a few blocks from Hop Off Hop On stop. So helpful with giving directions, etc.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Some construction in area/opposite one side of hotel to be aware of as at 2018/11 but hotel is great. Front desk Staff great. cleaning staff great. Good amenities. Nice rooms. Nice view from the one side facing the city. Next to Outram MRT. Close to get to Chinatown and other areas.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked the room through Booking.com (18 November 2018) for my wife and daughter for their vacation in Singapore. The next day after I made the booking, I was contacted by one of the hotel staff (Nur Sakeenah) that they could not charge my credit card. They sent me a form to fill up my credit card details to be returned back to them. I did and also send the front copy of my credit card. They then proceeded to charge my card for the total amount (S$188.32) of the room and I received a confirmation from them and from my bank (that my card has been charged). On the day of arrival (23 November 2018), the hotel front desk personnel asked for my wife's credit card and proceeded to charge it again for the room charges. She confronted them and said the payment for the room has been made, but they said she was supposed to produce the credit card that was used in the payment of the room. This is ridiculous. Is my wife supposed to carry my personal credit card with her on her trip only to be shown to the front desk ?!!!! Next, my wife asked what happened to the amount that I have been charged earlier. Initially they told my wife, the room rate that I have paid will be refunded in cash. Then later, they said it will be refunded back to my credit card within 30 days! Why was my credit card charged for the amount when all the hotel could do is to withhold the room charges as the guarantee that the room will be purchased? In other words, the room rate had to be paid twice, and one of the amounts will only be refunded back within 30 days. How ridiculous!
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Conveniently located near Chinatown, 15 min walk from the river. Friendly staff. Took ages to get the confirmation through Agoda. Lots of problems because they apparently can’t charge your credit card directly, so I might as well have booked it directly at Dorsetts own website, especially when the final price after fees and taxes ends up being the same. Good location for business and sightseeing. Room a little oldish looking, not bad but could need a facelift. It’s a feeling that it once was very push when carpet tapestry etc was new. They have a grand piano in the lobby that plays it self from a USB key. The strange thing is that it would have been so easy to make it cozy, just download a playlist that would have done the job, and people could get sit and enjoy a song while waiting in the lobby. Instead some programmers child had recorded some random notes that kept playing in an endless loop and it played the same 9 notes when we came back for dinner. I asked if I could play a tune. The answer was surprisingly NO, it’s only for display they said. As a pro professional pianist that kind of felt very disrespectful to both a person offering to play a song and to the piano as well. Hotel is fairly priced.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reception: I booked under agoda, it took them not long enough to find my booking, and handed my room key.Room: Found the rooms table top & cabinets dusty.. I right away call for housekeeping and the staff came few mins and in less than 3minsthe staff left already, literally for show only that she wiped..I didn’t bother anymore to asked again.. I do the wiping myself..For the room size average for 2 adults not too small for a family of 3.. Location: Very good location.Mrt station next to the hotel and bus stops to bring you to the attractions..
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm from Hong Kong to Singapore for a business trip for one week. When I arrived the hotel at evening Nov 12th, I realized that my hotel booking was made for Dec 12th mistakenly. The booking is neither cancelled nor refundable. Unluckily I was told that all hotel rooms for Nov 12th were fully booked. At that helpless moment, Madam May Kwan of the hotel come to helped me a lot. She concerned with my situation, then handed me her name card for future contact then call a cab for me to another hotel. Later she helped me to asked the hotel to assessed my situation and finally made me a waiver on the wrong date reservation without any penalty. l here thank you May Kwan for her helpful and hospitality and the discretion as well. Even thought I didn't stayed at Dorsett this time. I definitely had a good experience and good impression to this hotel. This hotel absolutely is my first choice in my future business trip and will recommend it to my friends. Compliment to May Kwan for her initiative to customer and her prompt assistance to this matter.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 2 nights with my daughter for vacation. Conveniently located near Chinatown in a strategic location, Dorsett Singapore hotel is great for both business and sightseeing. FYI, it took only 33 mins from Changi airport to Outram Park MRT station. Room was well organized and neat. Pool was lovely. 차이나타운 인근 MRT 아우트램파크역과 붙어있어 접근성이 좋다. 위치가 편리하여 비즈니스나 관광에 적합함. 방은 작으나 깨끗하고 풀장이 깔끔하여 매우 마음에 들었다.
hotelName:
24    Dorsett Singapore
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first trip to Singapore and it will always be remembered! We arrived rather late in the evening, we got checked in quickly and arrived in our slightly outdated room on the 17th floor to a smell of cigarettes, after a trip back down to reception at our request they relocated us to a more modern, smoke free room on the 25th floor with much better views of the city! The bar closed at 10:30PM which was too early for us however Clarke’s Quay is only a 20-25 minute walk by the river front or a 10 minute taxi journey, this place is filled with bars and clubs, strongly recommend if you’re travelling as a couple/friends. Take your room’s travel buddy with you everywhere, this device was a life saver for us!Breakfast was delicious, they offer a massive variety of food both western and Asian cuisines. The pancakes with chocolate and maple syrup were thee best. Each night we would have our first drink at the hotel bar prior to going out, if you’re stuck for choice go for The Devil’s Blend, you can’t go wrong. The only issue we had was that for the first 3 nights we got charged full price for our drinks at the bar, on the last night we were told that as guests we should receive a 20% discount, we fed this back to reception and spoke with the general manager who apologised for the inconvenience and invited us for a round on the house. All of the staff in the hotel were extremely polite and very helpful. They went above and beyond to ensure that our stay was unique and up to their high standard. When we return to Singapore we will definitely be coming back to the Grand Copthorne!
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you for taking care of me and my guests.. your team is awesome... You make me feel so welcome!! Shirley, Meredith, Owen, Ted, Yingwei, Yani all of you are great!! Thank You for making this trip memorable.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for 7 nights in a club deluxe room (room 2604). This is my 4th stay at Grand Copthorne and I love it more each time. Pro's: -easy check in and check out -very spacious room -great view of the city, river and Marina Bay- Privileges of club room include free soft drinks from the minibar, 2 free bottles of water daily, 2 complimentary items of laundry daily. -Access to executive club lounge on 29th floor, including daily breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails (the Singapore Sling was my personal favouirte). Staff here were so helpful and couldn't do enough for you, they didn't even mind when some people turned up 2 minutes before the end of afternoon tea they still served them. Nash, Yingwei, Yani, Owen and Shirley are just the names i can remember but all the staff were amazing. I loved how Nash remembered my breakfast order. Yingwei was also very friendly, I really enjoyed chatting to her. -The room was cleaned to a very high standard. -Location is good, plenty of taxis available outside and if it's early morning the staff will call a taxi for you if there's none available. Buses stop outside and opposite the Holiday Inn (across the road), MRT station is a 15 minute walk away, it's a bit of a trek in the heat but the buses go to certain MRT stations as well. The concierge recommended I buy an ez link card to use on public transport, this was a great buy!-The king size bed was very comfy. -Pool was nice, refreshing on a hot day, not busy either considering the amount of people staying at the hotel. -Staff were really honest with me when i wanted to exchange money, telling me i would get a better rate if i went elsewhere.-Robertson Quay restaurants 5 minute walk away. Cons: -The walls in my room had lots of dirty marks on, they could do with a paint. -One of the dressing gowns had hair on from a previous person, this hadn't been cleaned. I'm sure staff would've sorted this out if I had complained but I didn't feel the need since there was another clean dressing gown. -The aircon was really confusing to work - this could do with being updated. -Jacuzzi is quite cold and doesn't bubble that much - this was disappointing. Overall I had a fantastic stay, this is my go to hotel in Sinagpore, I can't recommend enough. Will defintley be returning in the future.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here from 24-27 June 2019. We had asked for a room for three adults as we didn't want our 25 year old sleeping on a camp bed. We were advised that we had booked a 'triple room' which 'contain double beds and accommodates 3-4 adults respectively.When we were shown to our room there were twin beds, with a camp bed. When we advised that this was not what we booked, we had to wait three hours and were then shown to a kingsize double, with another camp bed, and advised that this is their triple/quad room. The room was clearly not set up for more than two people as there were only towels and toiletries for two and the only place for the camp bed was alongside of the sofa squashed inbetween the sofa and the drawers and TV!The location is not very central with the nearest underground station to get anywhere a good 15 minutes walk away.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was pleasantly surprised by the geniune hospitality and service by the staff at the hotel,our room had such a lovely view and we all felt so comfortable.the lounge was a great area to rest and relax during tea time! The staff at the club lounge were so friendly and enjoyable to have chatty conversations with. A few names to mention were Queena, Yingwei, owen & Yani during my one night's stay. Thank you for such a lovely experience during our stay and we hope to stay with you again really soon :)
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel

review_body: Excellent service in the Club Lounge on 29th floor, fantastic view and exceptional service from Queena, Yani, Shirley, Ted, Ying and especially Owen.A very enjoyable evening, with the great staff at the Club Lounge at the Grand Copthorne...Don and Mimi

review_body: The hotel is well improved since the last time I came. me and my wife is very happy with the service in the club lounge. Ying is taking good care of us with the red wine bottle. Along with team ted Shirley Owen Yani! The service and attitude of the staff is excellent! We will definitely visit here to with Ying and Meredith !

review_body: The staff at The Grand Copthrone Waterfront Hotel went above and beyond and were true professionals in every sense of the word. The service was flawless. One of the best experiences that I have ever had on a vacation. They are a true 5 star Hotel.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a nice stay in the hotel, the rooms are big and it has a good location for a walk along the canal. But its not 5 Star more of a tired 4 star business persons hotel. Although we upgraded to club lounge we ended up in the ground floor breakfast room as the club level breakfast wasn't the best. The breakfast room directly off reception is a bit strange and its so busy, it was more of a cafe than a restaurant. It immediately makes the customer experience of entering a 5 star hotel less appealing.This hotel was the middle hotel of three 5 star hotels on our vacation and by far the least deserving of 5 star standard. Don't bother with club level if you intend to be out all day. Only benefit is the 2 hour drinks from 6pm. It's an ok hotel but when you have 5 stars you expect the best and its not the best. Plenty more choice in singapore.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in Singapore from Hong Kong for a long weekend and thought the hotel's location was great. The room was modern and large with good views. The hotel staff were really friendly and helpful - Shirley Ching's team took great care of us when we stayed.The hotel organises a number of activities for their guests - we joined a cultural tour of one of the nearby areas which was great.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Large bright rooms with comfy beds and pillows. Excellent wi-fi, super-quick lifts and lovely attentive staff. One small complaint - lack of storage space for 2 people staying 4 nights! Gym is OK and pool area is fine if you just want a dip to cool down. We had the advantage of a club room and the view from the club on floor 29 is stunning. The staff in the club are absolutely brilliant and there is an excellent choice of food and drink at breakfast, afternoon tea and in the evening.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Checked in with another family smoothly at 2am due to a delayed flight , went down for breakfast the next day at 10:15am with my two young kids , 10:31am the breakfast had been taken away without anyone coming to our table informing us of the same, 10:55am a grumpy old Indian waitress asked us to leave the table since it was cleaning time?? Really??? I have never encountered such nonsense before in my life especially since we were still feeding our 2yr old daughter breakfast ! They started mopping the floor below us while we sat there and gave our jet lagged kids their breakfast! We asked for a glass of water for the kids and they refused! Ridiculous Checked out after 4 nights and asked for a late check out by 4pm since I was taking a 7pm flight out of Singapore and my 2 yr old daughter had fever and I wanted her to rest before we left at 4pm. They refused and allowed a checkout only till 1pm. Checked out by 12pm in disgust and checked into the intercontinental hotel for 4hours, they even gave us a free ride to the airport since they figured our child was sick. Avoid this hotel at all costs if you are traveling with family ! what’s the point of calling them a 5star when they do not know how to cater to families with kids, the club room was nice but what’s the pointPay little more and go stay at the intercontinental !
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are staying at this hotel 3 nights and we were expecting a bit of luxury, but sadly we are rather disappointed. The rooms are very tired, curtains are dirty, the inside of the windows are marked, lamp covers torn, and the bathroom is dirty, there was even someone else’s hair in the shower recess, and hasn’t been cleaned over the last couple of days. When walking around the passages you can’t help but notice large stains on the carpets. In saying this the staff at the front counter are very helpful and the location suites us.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good Stay, well designed construction, very courteous staff members, I was looking for some picture postcards and in roof shop has it, was closed due to Ramdan as per notice, Saw beautiful artifacts in common areas which are interesting to see some times. what bit uneasy for me was the break fast Restaurant , Felt too little space allocated for guests seating, and even so many delicacies of international variety are not clearly pull you to it, all were placed in very next to each other.. as a individual you feel some times hard to find your favorite delicacies..Despite this shortcoming, i prefer to stay again in future too.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was booked as part of a package by a cruise specialist, so we hadn't chosen it ourselves, but were assured we would like it, and it would meet our needs!!!. First impression on arrival WOW have we arrived at the right place. The hotel enterance was lovely and so cool in that hot Singapore heat. Luggage whisked away and taken to our room, whilst we checked in. Staff were wonderful so friendly and helpful. Room Very large and very luxuriously all the mod cons. IF YOU ARE NOT ON B & B and want it TAKE IT AT CHECK IN IT IS A LOT CHEAPER THAN LATER< AS WE FOUND OUT. The back of the hotel backs right onto the river so we were able to sit out with a drink watching the little boats go by. walk to the first bridge cross it and there is an abundance of cafes bars and restaurants (Singapore is expensive mind) Just round the corner is the Hop on hop off bus stop, tickets bookable in the hotel. This hotel was fabulous in every way and suited all our needs for geeting around. would definately reccommend, and stay there again
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hotel for a week, and was impressed with the hotel.The staff were amazing, and the service from them was the best I have had in any hotel. Everyone from the concierge through to reception and restaurant staff went out of their way to help.The restaurant was a decent size, and over the course of 8 days I never had a problem finding a seat for breakfast at around 830am each day. I paid to have breakfast included each day, but I did go across the river to a great coffee shop for breakfast one 1 of these days (head over to Botany, amazing breakfasts, and is only around 3 minutes walk).The swimming pool was a little small, but on the 3 days I used it, it was never busy, so a small-ish pool was never a problem,The downside to this hotel though is that it is 0.9 miles from the nearest metro station, and in the Singapore heat, this is an uncomfortable walk. That being said, there is always a regular stream of taxis outside the hotel.The rooms are getting a little tired now, and are beginning to show their age. I used 2 rooms during my stay (1415 & 1301) and both were tired and in need of refurbishment. The rooms were always clean, but just quite tired.Overall, this is a great hotel, with clean rooms and friendly staff, I will stay here again during my next visit to Singapore, and I can recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First impressions of this hotel were the same when we left Fantastic.We had 4 nights in this hotel exploring the amazing sites of Singapore.Special thanks to Duty Manager Mark Yo and Koi, who both made us feel so welcome. Aura the hotel robot was a very unexpected addition to our stay, delivering water to our room.The hotel is well situated to all the sites and would definitely stay again and recommend.Thank you Grand Copthorne for adding to our stay in Singapore.
hotelName:

review_body: Great hotel, good location , right on the river , brill views.We used the executive lounge superb staff, Yingwei, Yani,, Queena,Shirley , good atmosphere , lovely view , wonderful service , lots of Singapore slings for all

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The location on the river was beautiful and close to some great bars and restaurants. Our room included access to their executive lounge, which was just a wonderful, luxurious experience. I’d like especially to thank Shirley, who remembered our name and room number each day... an impressive feat given the number of guests she must interact with each day.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel

review_body: We had a very welcoming, considerate hostess named Shirley. She welcomed us to breakfast each morning with a smile and attended to any needs we had. She, along with all the other employees we encountered during our stay, were gracious and accommodating. They all made our stay very enjoyable. We would certainly come again!
hotelName:

review_body: We have enjoyed our stay at the grand copthorne waterfront hotel which is a modern hotels and very vibrant. Shout out to Afiq and John from reception for assisting us during our stay. We really love the view from our room

review_body: Great Hotel and great staff especially the concierge and bellman. The room was so big and clean, very comfortable bed. The food and the view at the club lounge is perfect combination. Upgrading to suite room is highly recommend for the family.

review_body: 2 or 3 business trips to Singapore every year. Waterfront is my favorite. Nice food, beautiful lounge and great crew! It is always great experience to have a walk along the river after a long day in office.

review_body: Had a good weekend staycation on the club room floor. Room is decent, clean but has fantastic unblock view. Decent high-tea and fantastic cocktail drinks. Great breakfast selection at the main restaurant.Very accommodating to funny requests when I order Vodka with anything. Shirley, Ted, Yingwei, Queena and Yani has been helpful and attentive during our stay. Definitely enjoyed our short stay.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I highly recommend grand copthorne water front hotel Singapore. Excellent hospitality! Feels like home especially when I'm in the executive club. Big thanks to Shirley,Owen,Ted & Yingwei.Will will definitely go back here soon!
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was fairly disappointing. Very worn looking, carpet heavily stained, paint peeling in various locations, chipping and peeling in bathroom. View was very good from room.Rest of the hotel was lovely. Lobby, bar and restaurants were modern, well decorated and provided good food and drinks.Staff were consistently excellent.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my Family we stayed at the Grand Copthorne Waterfront. The Concierge staff and Bellboy very helpful and Friendly, The breakfast at food capital and the dinner at Grissini was awesome. Definitely we will come back again. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quickest check in.. kind enough to provide early check in at no additional cost.. Thanks Lim Lay Gin at Reception for your warm hospitality and making my arrival and check in most comfortable..
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my go to hotel in Singapore, the rooms are of a good size for Singapore, buffet breakfast is absolutely superb, with a great variety of choice, India, Chinese, western .Good size gym, with exercise bikes, running machine, cross trainer and free weights.Hotel is located adjacent to Robertson quay with a great selection of restaurants and bars.Service is always good, would recommend
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arriving from a long flight from US and upon arrival at the lobby, we were warm greeted by Kelvin who assisted with our check in. All was done less then 3mins and we were given a complimentary roo. Uograde to the highest floor. Breakfast was so so as it was really packed and everyone was fighting for food. I suggest that the hostess can lead us to the table as we have difficulties looking for an empty seat.All in all, good location and service was excellent.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved this hotel everything about it was great from checkin to checkout checkin was easy and seamless the room was lovely and very big had a beautiful bed and bathroom was great.Also given a mobile phone to use with your stay filled with attraction and discount tickets.The location is central to Clarke quay and plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. Has a fully stocked minibar staff were lovely and the gym and pool was great.Aircon was perfect especially after a long day of walking in the humidity. The view was good I’d definitely recommend only thing that knocks back a star is you can’t ipen the windows but apart from that it was fantastic.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a short stay at Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel. We booked for a club room and stayed for 4 nights. The club lounge is nice. The view is lovely. The room is good. The food for cocktail reception were delicious. Service is good from Ted, Yani, Ying Wei and Owen.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dear Shirley (Executive Club Manager)A very personal thank you from my daughter and I for all your wonderful help and care during our week long visit with you. The amazing Steven (whose Barista skills are ) and the very caring and sweet Ying Wei, we thank you.Our first room on floor 26 had a shocking damp smell, but Shirley quickly moved us the next morning when alerted. (Probably caused by a bathroom flood @ some stage) nothing was too much trouble. I had a fall in the street and the care by Shirley, Ying Wei and the duty Manager Mark Yu was fantastic The hotel is situated at the top end of the river, slightly out of the main tourist area but you soon realise that the bars and restaurants this end are the area around Tiong Bahru, a very short walk away is fabulous. Not touristy. Fabulous bakery, French bar, great Thai restaurant set in Art Deco buildings. Thank you Shirley, Steven, Ying Wei, Owen, Meredith and Mark. Highly recommended, particularly if you include the executive club in your stay. Kind regards to you all.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time at this hotel and wasnt sure what to expect but pleasantly surprised. Beautiful location by the river in a hip neighbourhood. Funky and unique wine bars and restaurants over the footbridge where you can sit amongst the fairy lights and enjoy the peaceful surrounds. Metro stations are a 10 min walk or cpl of stops on any bus that stops right outside the hotel. The hotel was great and the staff were amazing. Hema the nightshift manager was especially lovely and helpful, making every effort to ensure I was looked after in the early morning hours as I kept waking up way too early for breakfast service, she didn’t hesitate to ask me if I wanted a coffee as I sat by the river at dawn. It’s the little things like this that would make me stay here again :)
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the hotel for a week in May, 2019 for a conference at the hotel. I had access to the Executive Club and I had breakfast there every morning. I found that the staff (Shirley and Nash) there was both friendly and professional in its relationship. After the first morning, not only did they remember your name, but also remembered your favourite drink and food. I also tried the breakfast buffet downstairs but quickly retreated to the peace and quiet of the club. The executive Club was never over-crowded and made our stay most enjoyable.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at this great hotel for nine nights from the end of May to early June 2019. From the moment we checked in the attention to detail was noticeable. Everything happened quickly, we were given our room access keys, and hotel information very efficiently. The lifts are large and plentiful and efficiently programmed to take us to our 24th floor room. The room was large, clean and modern overlooking the river. We were provided complimentary mobile phone and call costs, dry cleaning, soft drinks and access to the club lounge free for breakfast, high tea and afternoon canapés. The Executive Club staff were excellent. Shirley met us on the first day and remembered our names from then on as soon as we visited the Executive Lounge which was daily. She even knew how we liked our coffees. Owen and Ted waited on us courteously and efficiently and were extremely friendly as were Yani, Queens and Meredith. As for Yingwei, you are the best. Cheerful, happy, humorous and a great maker of iced coffee. Thankyou to all of you. The concierge was excellent too and never kept us waiting when we needed a taxi, which was often. We won't even look elsewhere when next we visit Singapore. Grand Copthorne you've won us. Peter and Julie from Adelaide Sth Australia.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the third time we have visited the Copthorne Grand Waterfront hotel. The visit once again lived up to expectation. The staff in the executive lounge, Shirley, Rheena,Yani, Yingwei and Steven are all very friendly and professional with nothing too much trouble. Would definitely recommend. It is also worth upgrading to an executive room.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel and good location , well serviced team (koi and Anil) and front desk . enjoy my stay here and will come back to stay. a lot of places to visit with family . overall it's a good experience. Excellent food and thank you for taking care of us during our short stay here.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very pleasant stay. First time to grand copthorne and great hotel. Excellent Breakfast I had ever with lot of various to choose. Hema was very friendly to talk to and thank you so much for your hospitality. Will definitely come back again.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went in April 2018It was a good hotel with good breakfast and big rooms with comfortable bed and a good bathroom However, location was off. But Singapore is a small city so did not matter much.Would stay here again for my next official trip.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have been member of the Millinium for several years ,we coming to staycation at Copthorn Waterfront yearly .We enjoy the sumptious food,and the staff (Shirley, Mark, Yingwei,Ted,Owen) here are friendly . I really appreciate the great service
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Superb Room , Great River View from Window , Big Spacious room , Hotel location is good near Clark Quay Area , Best part was a MINI ROBOT giving room service , Robo was very quick to deliver us water bottles in room , one more attraction was ROBO making Omlettes for breakfast.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent experience hosting our wedding banquet at the Grand Copthorne Hotel. Staff was very friendly and did their best to ensure that we were comfortable and happy throughout the entire day. The actual wedding was very well organised with precise timing, while allowing for some flexibility. Food was delicious - Chef took into consideration our feedback during food tasting. Guests were happy. Only negative is that the bridal suite was a bit outdated, though the superior room was excellent. Perhaps its time to upgrade the suites. Thank you Quenna, Andy, Jed, Serene, and Chef for making our big day a memorable one!Mark & Ivy
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent services from everyone Anil, Sheryl and Darren ,koi was more helpful n professional,excellent room services more ambience. Thank you all for making out stay such a wonderful we surely be back
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I will come back soon. It was a great stay with best service. The upgrade for the club is a must. Everyone will like it. The hotel is very good located only a few minutes away from the Clark Quay. Best Choice!
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 1 week to celebrate special occasion. Excellent hotel. Great location, great staff.Had contacted hotel prior to stay, Mary Jeow and Ted from Hospitality were in touch. Gave us river view room on high floor, also surprised us with lovely fruit basket, cake and bottle of wine!Misplaced my Ralph Polo sunglasses in Men’s washroom, Mr Singh, Asst Manager was on desk, got onto this immediately and retrieved sunglasses in few minutes.Our special thanks to above staff and all staff for making our say so memorable - thank you!!
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed a 4 day break at the Copthorne Waterfront. From check in to check out we received fantastic service from the whole team. To all in the executive lounge (Owen Ted, Yani, Ying, Shirley & Meredith) just fantastic professionalism, service & fun. We hope to be back soon!!
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel. Our room is fabulous, the staff are very helpful and friendly, the breakfast options are amazing. We are thoroughly enjoying our stay. The open space is very much appreciated, and the cleanliness is excellent. Hema has been extremely helpful with information and service.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The environment is great, with tons of smile in the reception. The facilties are great and the room are nice and comfortable. The service provided by the staff are great. Expecially two of the staff, Shirley and Joshua was really helpful! Would come back again!
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at the hotel, we asked to sign on for breakfast for our girst morning at the lager restaurant.,The female at the desk sdked us tomsign on an Ipad left for breakfast bookings. The next morning, we wete having our bkfst the restaurant Manger (Juliette) rushes over irately adking us why ee sat fown to eat without sigining in ! Needless to say, we requested that she speak to the desk and check our entry as valid. Juliette continued tomharsngue us, asking us to leave our meal, as we may "be embarrassed " complaint to the young lady at the desk, she regyse6d to provide the name of Mngr, also regused to let us speak to the Hotel Manager. .thus was in Jan another American friend visited the same hotel a few weeks later, She too was accosted and berated. It seems that Juliette did not want to check the intetnal communication between the front desk sigantures , of guests requesting meals and her own job. Or shes mentally not capable of staying away from hasseling guests. The rest of our service was average. As there were two families experienced bullying falsly, within a few weeks, we would blame the reception and management for attempting to block a formal complaint.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A hotel that is busy but gives you the personal touch. Club floor staff go beyond and benefits are certainly worth it. Staff including Hema in reception and the very impressive club staff leave a lasting impression. Great place to stay.
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are holidaying again at our favourite place and hotel, the Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel in Singapore. We were last here in May 2017 and looked forward to returning. We weren’t disappointed, this has been our best stay ever. We booked an Executive Club room and the staff in the Executive lounge have been simply wonderful. Their friendliness and service made it a joy to be here. We cannot praise the manager, Shirley and her staff highly enough. Thanks to all for a great time ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
hotelName:
25    Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well this is my 4 th visit to Singapore and I’ve findlly found an apartment that suits families. I have done the hotel thing and spent a fortune on 2 -3rooms interconnecting. Stayed in an AirBNB which was a disaster 2 years ago and found they are not for me. Might as well have been at home as had to clean it , buy toilet paper ect & put up with things not working in the apartment. The grove is amazing and cheaper. It’s serviced everyday, free wifi, Fox movies for the kids, 4 tvs in each 2 bedroom apartment & 2 in one bedrooms. Great continental breaky included on weekdays only with lots of choice. Bring the vegimite thou.Free shuttle into town hourly to orchid road but also only a $7 cab fare or 15 minute walk .The pool is fabulous with a spa attached , sun chairs & shaded areas. Very quite considering it’s school hols which is nice.tennis court and gym add to this property . My kids are 14.14 ,15,17 so they love the room in this apartment . Th property is very clean and reception is helpful if you need anything. Really can’t fault this property and will definitely stay in the future.Found a little gem.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We (two adults and two kids) stayed in a family room for five days. It was nice, clean and the standard was good. There was a washing machine in the apartment, which was very convenient.The pool was nice and our kids liked it a lot. :)There was a complimentary breakfast Monday - Friday and it was actually quite all right. Too bad they didn’t serve it on the weekend as well. The most negative part with this hotel was the location. It was quite far to the nearest subway. On the plus side the hotel had a free shuttle service once an hour.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a 1-bedroom apartment with our 3-year old son. We were pleasantly surprised that the apartment also had a small study room where we could put the babybed (provided by Le Grove) so that our son also had his own room to sleep. The apartment is very clean and tidy. The interior is of high quality and the lighting is very comfortable. The kitchen is well-equiped. The swimming pool is very nice, the staff is friendly. Continental breakfast only on weekdays, it is basic but nice. 2 remarks: the reception did not inform us (and any other guests) about a public holiday when we were staying there so we found the dining area closed for breakfast. There is a shuttlebus bringing you too some places in the city however the bus only runs 1x per hour. Walking to the MRT at Orchard is approx. 15 minutes however considering the weather condition and having a 3-year old with us, we just ordered Grab everytime.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here as a family 2 adults 2 young children, it was a good sized apartment with all the amenities required including a washer/dryer which they provide powder for. Approximately 1km from Orchard Road so not too far to walk but if you don’t want to they have a complimentary shuttle bus with various drop off points which runs hourly. Continental breakfast provided but only on weekdays which would probably be better if it was Friday though Tuesday when travellers are more likely to be there. There is no onsite restaurant for lunch or dinner which after long days out sightseeing when you don’t want to cook or go out, would have been good to have. Good price for what we got & would stay there again.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apt staff are very uncaring and inattentiveThey did not inform us in advance that PH and Sunday will not have housekeeping, and when I called the reception (ended by 10pm btw) they simply said “the housekeeper is coming over just request then”, the fact is we wait for 1.5 hr and nb came at all, we left 2 notes to request extra towel for the coming sundayAfterall the housekeeper did not leave us ANY towels, we need to bath elsewhere at the end of the dayThe room cards also malfunctioned, as the reception was closed at 10, we could only ask for guard’s help and end up the card is “too sensitive” to be put in wallet with other cards, and nb warned us abt that beforeWhen we informed all unpleasant and unfortunate experience to the staff at the counter, all they replied was “oh okay” without any apologies or seemed to be bothered at allI feel truly disappointed during the stay in this highly rated apt
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: These serviced apartments are located near Orchard Road behind The Shangri La hotel. Orchard MRT is a good 15 mins away and Stevens MRT on the other side of the apartments is also the same distance. They do have a shuttle service but only till 7pm so most of the nights we had to walk back which is quite a toll with kids. We stayed here for 1 week the apartments are amazing they've been recently renovated we booked a 1 bedroom apartment which had a Queen Bed and a Sofa Bed in the living area. The kitchen appliances are also new the washer/dryer was really helpful, the bathroom was very Clean. The pool area is lovely there is a small kids pool too, breakfast is not fancy but sufficient. The staff are polite and helpful if you don't mind a little walking the apartments are excellent.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've had a one bedroom apartment and it had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. The rooms are clean and elegant. The location is good but not walking distance to MRT however the hotel does provide a shuttle bus. The breakfast could be improved with some hot or healthier options but overall we liked our stay there.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very comfortable well located serviced apartment off the Orchard Road. Small, but has everything you need. Bed is comfortable, good shower, although "recesses" in shower cubicle not deep enough for toiletries and the bottles keep fallng out. Fast free wifi and handphone which allows you international calls to certain countries.The integrated washer and dryer was so useful as we were travelling but be warned - it takes absolutely hours and so does the dryer which isn't very effectual. It would have been nice to have some coffee and tea sachets in the cupboard as most serviced apartments do - we wrongly assumed we would have basic having flown in quite late at night.Lovely pool and possibly a small jacuzzi (though never figured out how it worked). Very helpful receptionists and free shuttle bus.Complimentary generous cold breakfast weekdays - juice, muesli, pastries, bread, fruit. Was a little surprised to see one woman loading up two tupperware boxes to take away half a loaf of bread and a large amount of watermelon slices!
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable & clean are the first points i like to stay here.Very close by Orchard ( just 6 minutes by cab) is the other point. There were enough furnitures and stuffs for a group holiday, specially nice kitchen where you can cook if you are in long vacation.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here twice on a recent visit to Southeast Asia. Both apartments were comfortable and quiet, and I had everything I needed. I had some trouble mastering the small washer/dryer unit; it is VERY slow. I understand that they have similar machines in the basement; I would have happy to pay for coin-operated machines that were standard size with greater capacity and speed. Other than that, I liked the simple breakfast options, which included fruit and yogurt, and found the shuttle service to be useful.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for five days and had a wonderful time. The 1-bedroom had everything we needed and a washer/dryer available was a bonus. Housekeeping did a fantastic job and towels are changed daily and the room is always spotless.The hourly shuttle is available esp. if you don’t wish to walk 20-minutes in the heat to the Orchard MRT. If the location is closer to Orchard Road, this will be perfect.Overall, I’ll highly recommend this place and will definitely come back again.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked a 2 bedroom super deluxe room and got two interconnecting studio rooms - not the family apartment we booked. Staffs response - although we paid $50 per day for the upgrade was that “the photo of the two bedroom on their website is not actually the two bedroom”. The room we booked had a dinner table big enough to seat us all. Instead now we have two tables with two chairs in seperate rooms - and no lounge area for the family to spend time together. But hey - we can sit at two different tables in two different rooms and eat dinner apart. Furthermore told us they are booked out so have to keep what we’ve got but they will check to see if we can upgrade tomorrow! Gasp. Also supposed to be a welcome pack with tea coffee etc. no such welcome back made it to our connecting studio rooms. Not a good start to our stay here. Rooms are clean and tidy but wishing we’d booked somewhere else now - and we paid upfront two weeks before we got hereOnly giving three stars because the place is actually nice - although I feel totally ripped.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 5 days, situated at the top end of Orchard area, a quite location with great facilities, the pool was very welcome after a day touring the sights, close to botanical gardens.Clean and comfortable, with daily housekeeping, friendly staff.Was able to leave luggage as we had a very late flight out.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a week, the apartment is great value. This apartment has house keeping services, they also provide free breakfast coffee, teas, breads, pastries, fruit. There is also a free shuttle from mon-sun which stops at most city centres where you can catch the train. The rooms are well equipped with washing machine dryer, clothing line, kitchen and your given a welcome basket of teas, coffee, sugar and biscuits which was a really nice! Rooms were cleaned and towels were changed every day. Staff at reception are very helpful and polite. The pool area was fantastic for a afternoon swim! This apartment was a great find, I will be staying here again!
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Le Grove Apartments was amazing! I stayed there for five nights. The pool was great. We swam at least once everyday. Breakfast was great to. We had a two bedroom apartment. It was really spacious. I wouldn't hesitate to go back. ;)
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and comfortable place. Handy location. Bonus of free shuttle running during the daytime to the city centre. Would suit a longer stay too as great facilities and spacious. We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had been here in two opportunities. And both for a one week stay. The place is very cozy, clean and well maintained. They even have a free shuttle bus which takes you up to Suntec City with few stops in Orchard Rd. Must say I hardly heard any noise from outside, which for me is a plus. The breakfast they serve from Monday to Friday is very good. And staff are very helpful. Will come back for sure.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nicely renovated service apartment but the master bathroom of the 2 bedrooms apartment has been designed like a nursing home's bath. I felt like staying in a hospital throughout my one week stay. Asked to change to another apartment but it was fully booked. Bobby the shuttle bus driver has been helpful and friendly. Breakfast are very basic with toasts, pastry and fruits and are served only from Monday to Friday.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are booked for 5 days and we enjoyed every minute of our stay. The 2-bedroom unit at M Block is perfect for a group of 5 to 6 adults. Very clean. Spacious. The breakfast is modest but good enough to start up a busy day of either work or leisure. Will definitely choose staying here again in future visits.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently renovated place, very clean spacious and just within 5 - 10 minutes walk from Orchard Road. Situated just outside Orchard Road for the peace and quiet, prices are very reasonable for the location!
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for a week while visiting for my wife's treatment. The facilities were nice and recently renovated. The staff were helpful. Rooms were spacious, clean and well equipped. The other residents were also families mostly. The children can have a nice time in the pool.Singapore as it is is expensive and this place also does not come cheap. This is good value for money given the environment and facilities. From the negavites, the rooms being recently renovated give out some kind of gas which can be difficult for smell sensitive People. I never felt it but my wife used to and few others said who came visiting us there. The breakfast can be a bit better and stay for longer given the price they charge. Pools have too much chlorine. My nave blue shorts turned purple after dipping once. The connectivity is not the best. Nearest bus stand is a bit of a walk. Some might find this to be good but if you have a patient with you, it might be difficult unless you are willing to spend more on taxis or Grab.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely apartments very close to Orchard road, this was a gem of a find. The apartments were spacious for Singapore standards where space is a luxury and had excellent amenities. On weekdays the apartment serves up Continental breakfast (coffee, croissants, toast and fruit) but we only managed to wake up in time for it on one of the days which was a pity. Location wise, the apartments were very close to the MRT stations, as well as the Newton Hawker centre which serves delicious local cuisine.There's also a pool that's open 24/7. We ended up sightseeing in the morning, stuffing our faces at night and then having a midnight swim in the pool almost every night!!! This will definitely be the place I will stay in future when I go to Singapore.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Being just almost the same price as staying in a one bedroom hotel, this apartment is definitely better. The apartment was very spacious and had complete amenities. It was very modern looking and the staff were very friendly. This apartment is also very well located. It just takes 5-7 minutes walk to get to Orchard road, or you can take their free shuttle going to Orchard. This is perfect for families since they also have a pool you can make use of. Will definitely consider staying here again when I go back to Singapore.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was clean and staff were friendly. Well located. They have a shuttle bus to and from orchard road. The complementary breakfast was sustaining and had a good variety. Would recommend. There is a lounge where one can relax.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this serviced apartment/hotel before it re-opened after the renovation and we are so glad that we did. It was a perfect stay for a family of four. The staff are very friendly. It felt like home as it was not too big or too small but it was just right. The breakfast was also very good and we were pleased to see shuttle bus services to the main attractions.The smartphone devices in the rooms for guests to use is a brilliant consideration which we utilised fully.It is near the botanic gardens and Shagri-La hotel but a little bit far from the city centre and can feel a bit secluded within a quiet residential location so that's an important factor to note when travelling late at night.I will definitely return again with family.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Le grove for approx 2 weeks in a 1 bedroom apartment. We had our grandson with us, the room was very nice, clean and tidy. The staff are very courteous. Everything was included, a stove, fridge & microwave, along with cutlery & crockery.Room can be cleaned everyday if we wished. House keeping & front desk staff are great. Very comfortable whether you're staying with a family or alone. The bus shuttle is available 7 days to give lifts to nearby shopping. The apartments are central to everything, Wifi is very good. The only thing is continental breakfast is till 9.30am, Mon-Fri . I think if the breakfast availability could be extended to the weekend, that would make the stay even more appealing. Thankyou Le Grove for a very pleasant stay.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this was perfect for our family of four. (kids ages 9 and 14) We have 5 nights in Singapore and the apartments were large so plenty of space to relax. Two large bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a big lounge and kitchen. All in good condition and clean. Our apartment was higher up and had a good view - I asked for both of these requirements. The pool was great. We didn't have the breakfast as we are all Gluten free and our time zone was so out we were not awake in time most days! The walk down to Orchard road is easy but equally you could order a taxi or use the hotel shuttle. After a big days walking around Singapore the walk home was a bit hard/hot some days but perfectly manageable. I recommend getting the Singapore Tourist pass so you can use the MRT and buses freely. Staff on the front desk were very helpful and accommodating.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights on our way to Japan. The apartment was plenty roomy enough with comfortable beds and furniture.The walk to Orchard Rd/shops was fine, we have a 4 & 6 yr old and they didn't mind the easy walk, and if you could time the shuttle bus in you could get a way with walking one way. It is also within walking distance to the Botanical Gardens which the kids managed easily as well.No breakfast on weekends is a pain, as it requires either stocking up on groceries or going out. The room was stocked with 2 coffee and 2 tea sachets, and when I asked for more I was told that they don't supply any more. I found this very disappointing as I couldn't have a coffee while my kids slept on the weekends.There is a cafe in the building next door that was doing a buffet breakfast for $12SD but I didn't try it. Also, they had a coffee vending machine there but it was out of cups!There was some work going on at the apartments on the last day causing a bit of noise, I think they were getting ready to do some bigger renovations.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great place to stay in Singapore, particularly if yiu are visiting with family, for business or pleasure. It has most of the facilities a hotel would offer, except room service or restaurant, but has the feel of a home. The bedrooms are adequate size and the there is housekeeping service everyday except Sunday. The property is very well located and you can call for taxis by house phone at the desk at anytime. The breakfast ( included, six days/week) is light and sufficient.i have been staying here every time I visit Singapore with family for the last 15 years.The staff are very helpful. I have recommended Le Grove to many friends and to date everyone has been positive in their feedback to me.Two suggestions:1. Arrange coffee/drinks/snacks vending machine in the seating area.  2. Include breakfast on Sundays too.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this apartment and paid almost £200 a night for a two bedroom apartment thinking it,s nearby Orchard Road, yes it is as stated on the website, however Km shown on the website are to the end of orchard road.Rooms were not as big as we expected and breakfast? It's probably the worst breakfast I ever had in a hotel or apartment. It includes some water melon, pine apple, oranges, orange juice ( not fresh ) cereals , only one type of bread, butter, tea and coffee. Do NOT ASK FOR FRIED EGG OR OMELATE because they do not provide that.We were 4 in total ( Two disabled on wheel chair ) we took one wheel chair with us thinking hotel might have a wheel chair. Hotel did have only one wheel chair and told us, when ever we need, we will get it back from our room, so kindly don't take it outside. In the end we hired one from the local shop.Coming back to the breakfast, because we had two disable ladies and one career, I was the only one who could have breakfast in the restaurant so I requested if I could have disabled and career breakfast in the room. Answer was, NoI asked if I could take breakfast in the room myself, Elsie said, yes so I asked for a tray, answer was, No We don't have any tray although I could see all trays in kitchen myself.There were very small serving plates so I just took some fruit ( Mainly water Mellon ) in two plates and asked my carer to take some savouries in two plates, no bread, cereals, tea or cofee.Following day when when I came downstairs to have breakfast, I was stoped by Elsie and she told me, I took too much yesterday therefore am not allowed to take that much.That was really embarrassing for me some one accusing me over food. It wasn't too much, water Mellon takes lot of space on a very small plate and I could fit only 5 pcs of water Mellon in a plate, that was disgusting of her saying some thing like that and I felt really embarrassed. What the hell was she thinking, we were greedy over food? If we could afford nearly £800 to book a apartment, we could afford having decent breakfast some where else rather than a labeled breakfast le grove provide.We were there for 4 days, we didn't bother having breakfast for remaining two days.If that is sort of service Le Grove provide, I would rather stay away next time.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I must say that for it's pricing Le Grove Serviced Apartments are just right. The location in my view is ideal, in a leafy neighbourhood on the outskirts of the City itself. All the facilities are at hand however I must say my preference is for Apartments over Hotels when travelling for work. When travelling with my family when the children were younger, also it would get top marks. The pool & surrounding area is ideal to relax.The front office staff are most helpful.Sorry, no pictures to add as it was a busy stay.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You should really try this accomodation if looking for a service appartments in singapore. Well maintained rooms and awsome breakfast options. Shuttle service is provided to land into city for all your shopping needs.Prices are a bit high however it an awsm place to stay.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good size apartment close to Orchard Road (about 10 minutes walk).Hotel offers free shuttle. Well equipped with TVs, kitchen and washing machine with dryer. Free breakfast on weekdays which was good. Nice swimming pool. Good for families.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great spot to stay, close to orchard road. Good pool and ammenities. Room is well equipped and has washer-dryer. Reception is manned and has a direct phone for calling a taxi. Surprised by the amount of space for Singapore. Not cheap but better than two hotel rooms, and this is Singapore. Totally recommend this.Doesn't do free breakfast on weekends!
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decided to stay here than a hotel as it provided better space on this family visit. Certainly a two-bedroom in a good hotel would have seen at least 30% more expensive. They make up for a poor website with an efficient booking system.Check-in was efficient and the room quite spacious. All went well except our disappointment with a not so effective dryer and a front office that lacked creativity and took time to realise they could dry out clothes in another room. The washer dryer was of a really old design for an apartment in this area.Apartment far from MRT but they have an hourly shuttle service during the day but not always convenient for coming back.Do not expect much if the breakfast, it's a basic continental one with lots if pastries.Despite the one mishap, I still would consider staying here again, but more than likely would opt for an apartment much closer to an MRT. The savings in expensive Singapore are worth that.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a 10 days holidays in Singapore and we chose legrove again. With the 2 bedrooms 100sq metres we stayed in the Rm 203, our stay was comfortable and our 2 daughters loved it. They were so independent and felt so at ease that fatigue was not an issue after 1 day activities around the island. But when it is packed, breakfast space is a major issue and we need to improvise. Value added choice when you think of all options offered. I would recommend breakfast to extend to 10am. I gave a 4 because of the waiting time for bfast. Makarios.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 3 nights in a 2 bedroom apartment.It was great to have extra room for 5 passengers , instead of a hotel room.Breakfast on week days was great. Bread, pastry, muffins, fruit, cereal, juice and coffee machine. Shuttle to Orchard Rd was good. (note first in first serve as only carry's about 12 pax)Only cost $7 for taxi to Orchard Road if you miss shuttle.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights with family in a two-bedroom apartment. Easily accessible by all means (15 mins walk from nearby MRT). Lot of space, fully equipped kitchen, dishwasher and other necessities. Limited TV channels, have not used pool, gym and sauna, so no comments.Le Grove is an excellent Service apartment, close enough to Orchard where you can enjoy shopping. The staff is very helpful. Don't expect too much from the breakfast (limited option, can skip), and is served only on weekdays.Just one note: They do not replenish the coffee/ tea basket - so in case you plan a long stay, please bring your own/ or buy them. To buy you should come to Orchard road as nothing nearby. They also do not service the room on Sundays, but you will find enough towels.They have an hourly shuttle to main tourist places via Orchard Road. We used Grab Car as we were 5 pax and needed a big car, and was cheap.Stayed July 2016, travelled with family. Definitely would visit again and also recommend to friends.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the apartment is far from mrt, food outlets and supermarket, so it is not really convenient for us. Room is clean, but its facilities and building seem old and need to be upgraded. Staff is quite friendly.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really spacious and well located! The breakfast is really very very basic with supposed warm pastries stone cold!Great to have my own kitchen to enjoy holiday cooking experiments. Only thing missing is a Tele in the bedroom that has all channels. Tough sitting in the lounge when holiday mood wishes to watch in bed!
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying in Le Grove was a good experience. As it is staying in a serviced apartment was never a first choice, but then once we entered the apartment it gave us a good feel. We were 2 families in total 7 pax so 3 bedroom apartment was a good option given to us by our travel agent. Not very far from the airport (30 min drive). 10 min walk from the Orchard road (Prime shopping place). Don't expect too much from the breakfast (Just english breakfast,, only bakery items, fruit and tea coffee). Only one drawback was replenishment in the room for tea coffee was poor, I understand you have to ask for it, nothing comes by its own like in a hotel. Otherwise nice apartment with all the required things in kitchen and a washing machine. Overall for somebody coming to Singapore get your own Whiskey/Beer from India duty free (it is very expensive here)
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Le Grove is an excellent Service apartment, close enough to Orchard. The staff is very helpful. Just one note: They do not replenish the coffee/ tea basket and the toiletries- so in case you plan a long stay, please bring your own/ or buy them. They also do not service the room on Sundays- but the housekeeping staff happily gave us extra towels the previous day.They have an hourly shuttle to main tourist places. Alternately, they would also call you a cab.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have two kids, aged 12 and 9 and some of us also have specific food requirements due to allergies. Having a two bedroom apartment with cooking facilities that is clean and with a pool and also free internet is exactly what we need. It's cheaper then getting two hotel rooms on or nearby to Orchard. What more can I say? Recommended.
hotelName:
26    Le Grove Serviced Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Got the 2-bedroom apartment and was definitely impressed (and we were lucky we were on the top floor). It was really large, the living room was incredibly comfortable and the beds were nice. Pillows lacked a bit of fluffiness but nevertheless good. Downsides were that the location was quite isolated and cabbies don't really know where the place is.
